FILE: D:\qflush\.azure-pipelines\workflows\azure-publish.yml
============================

     1: trigger:
     2:   - none
     3: 
     4: pr:
     5:   - none
     6: 
     7: name: $(Build.BuildId)
     8: 
     9: stages:
    10:   - stage: BuildAndPublish
    11:     displayName: Build and publish QFlush extension
    12:     jobs:
    13:       - job: build
    14:         displayName: Build
    15:         pool:
    16:           # Use self-hosted pool similarly to the publish job
    17:           name: '$(AGENT_POOL)'
    18:         steps:
    19:           - checkout: self
    20:           - task: NodeTool@0
    21:             inputs:
    22:               versionSpec: '20.x'
    23: 
    24:           - script: |
    25:               npm install --no-audit --no-fund
    26:               npm run build
    27:             displayName: 'Install and build'
    28: 
    29:       - job: publish
    30:         displayName: Publish to Azure DevOps Marketplace
    31:         dependsOn: build
    32:         pool:
    33:           # Use a self-hosted agent pool name provided via the pipeline variable AGENT_POOL.
    34:           # Example: set AGENT_POOL=self-hosted in Pipeline variables after creating an agent pool.
    35:           name: '$(AGENT_POOL)'
    36:         steps:
    37:           - checkout: self
    38:           - task: NodeTool@0
    39:             inputs:
    40:               versionSpec: '20.x'
    41:           - script: |
    42:               echo "Validating required variables..."
    43:               if [ -z "${PUBLISHER_ID}" ]; then echo "PUBLISHER_ID pipeline variable is required"; exit 1; fi
    44:               if [ -z "${AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT}" ]; then echo "AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT pipeline variable is required"; exit 1; fi
    45:             displayName: 'Validate variables'
    46:           - script: |
    47:               npm install -g tfx-cli@0.7.0
    48:             displayName: 'Install tfx-cli'
    49:           - script: |
    50:               # package the extension into a .vsix (assumes vss-extension.json in extensions/vscode-npz)
    51:               cd extensions/vscode-npz || exit 0
    52:               if [ ! -f vss-extension.json ]; then echo "vss-extension.json not found in extensions/vscode-npz"; exit 1; fi
    53:               # create vsix using tfx
    54:               tfx extension create --manifest-globs vss-extension.json --output-path ../ || true
    55:             displayName: 'Create VSIX package'
    56:           - script: |
    57:               cd extensions/vscode-npz || exit 0
    58:               # find vsix file
    59:               VSIX_FILE=$(ls ../*.vsix | head -n 1)
    60:               if [ -z "$VSIX_FILE" ]; then echo "VSIX file not found"; exit 1; fi
    61:               echo "Publishing $VSIX_FILE to Azure DevOps Marketplace with publisher ${PUBLISHER_ID}"
    62:               # publish using tfx and PAT
    63:               tfx extension publish --manifest-globs vss-extension.json --publisher ${PUBLISHER_ID} --token ${AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT} --service-url https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/
    64:             displayName: 'Publish to Azure DevOps Marketplace'
    65:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\README-open-vsx.md
============================
============================
     1: Open VSX publish setup
     2: 
     3: 1. In the Open VSX website sign the Publisher Agreement and create a Personal Access Token.
     4: 2. In your GitHub repository go to Settings  Secrets  Actions and add a new secret named `OPEN_VSX_TOKEN` with the token value.
     5: 3. Tag a release (e.g. `v3.0.1`) or push a tag matching `v*` to trigger the workflow.
     6: 
     7: Notes:
     8: - The workflow will build the extension and attempt to publish using `npx ovsx publish`.
     9: - If publishing fails, the package `.vsix` remains available in the workflow artifacts (you can modify the workflow to upload artifacts).
    10: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\ci-no-supervisor.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: CI (no supervisor)
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:   workflow_dispatch:
     6: 
     7: jobs:
     8:   build-and-test:
     9:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    10: 
    11:     env:
    12:       # Pas de superviseur (ou bien il est ignor)
    13:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
    14:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
    15:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
    16:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
    17: 
    18:     steps:
    19:       - name: Checkout repo
    20:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    21: 
    22:       - name: Install dependencies
    23:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    24: 
    25:       - name: Build dist
    26:         run: npm run build
    27: 
    28:       - name: Start qflush daemon
    29:         run: |
    30:           node dist/daemon/qflushd.js &
    31:           echo "Daemon started on port ${QFLUSHD_PORT:-4500}"
    32: 
    33:       # Optional: wait for daemon readiness (uncomment if you want polling)
    34:       # - name: Wait for daemon
    35:       #   run: |
    36:       #     for i in {1..30}; do
    37:       #       if curl -fsS "http://127.0.0.1:${QFLUSHD_PORT:-4500}/npz/rome-index" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    38:       #         echo "Daemon is ready"
    39:       #         exit 0
    40:       #       fi
    41:       #       echo "Waiting daemon..."
    42:       #       sleep 2
    43:       #     done
    44:       #     echo "Daemon did not become ready in time"
    45:       #     exit 1
    46: 
    47:       - name: Run tests
    48:         run: npm test
    49:

FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\ci-safe.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: CI (safe embedded services)
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:   workflow_dispatch:
     6: 
     7: jobs:
     8:   build-and-test:
     9:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    10: 
    11:     env:
    12:       QFLUSH_EMBED_SERVICES: '1'
    13:       QFLUSH_SAFE_CI: '1'
    14:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
    15:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
    16:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
    17:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
    18: 
    19:     steps:
    20:       - name: Checkout repo
    21:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    22: 
    23:       - name: Install dependencies
    24:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    25: 
    26:       - name: Build dist
    27:         run: npm run build
    28: 
    29:       - name: Start embedded services (plomberie de test)
    30:         run: |
    31:           node dist/index.js start \
    32:             --services "bat,spyder,nezlephant,freeland" \
    33:             --verbose
    34: 
    35:       - name: Run tests
    36:         run: npm test
    37:

FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\ci-with-supervisor.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: CI (with supervisor)
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:   workflow_dispatch:
     6: 
     7: jobs:
     8:   build-test-and-start-services:
     9:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    10: 
    11:     env:
    12:       # Superviseur ACTIV
    13:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '0'
    14:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
    15:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
    16:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
    17: 
    18:     steps:
    19:       - name: Checkout repo
    20:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    21: 
    22:       - name: Install dependencies
    23:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    24: 
    25:       - name: Build dist
    26:         run: npm run build
    27: 
    28:       - name: Start qflush daemon
    29:         run: |
    30:           node dist/daemon/qflushd.js &
    31:           echo "Daemon started on port ${QFLUSHD_PORT:-4500}"
    32: 
    33:       - name: Start selected QFLUSH services
    34:         run: |
    35:           # Use canonical service names: 'bat' and 'spyder'
    36:           node dist/index.js start \
    37:             --services "bat,spyder,nezlephant,freeland" \
    38:             --verbose
    39: 
    40:       - name: Run tests
    41:         run: npm test
    42: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\ci.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: CI
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5:     inputs:
     6:       enable_supervisor:
     7:         description: "Set to '0' to enable supervisor in CI run, '1' to disable. Default disables supervisor."
     8:         default: '1'
     9:   push:
    10:     branches: [ master, main, 'fix/*' ]
    11:   pull_request:
    12:     branches: [ master, main ]
    13: 
    14: permissions:
    15:   contents: write
    16: 
    17: jobs:
    18:   build-and-test:
    19:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    20:     env:
    21:       QFLUSH_SKIP_GLOBAL_INSTALLS: '1'
    22:       # Enable embedded service manager and safe CI mode for plumbing tests
    23:       QFLUSH_EMBED_SERVICES: '1'
    24:       QFLUSH_SAFE_CI: '1'
    25:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
    26:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
    27:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
    28:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
    29:     steps:
    30:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    31:         with:
    32:           fetch-depth: 0
    33:           persist-credentials: true
    34:       - name: Configure git
    35:         run: |
    36:           git config --global user.email "actions@github.com"
    37:           git config --global user.name "github-actions"
    38:           git config --global --add safe.directory "${{ github.workspace }}"
    39:       - name: Use Node.js 20
    40:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    41:         with:
    42:           node-version: '20'
    43:       - name: Install dependencies
    44:         run: |
    45:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    46:       - name: Fix alias imports (convert @utils/*  relative)
    47:         run: |
    48:           node tools/fix-utils-imports.js src/utils src/commands || true
    49:       - name: Build (tsc) and capture logs
    50:         run: |
    51:           npx tsc -p . --pretty false > tsc-output.log 2>&1 || (echo "tsc failed, printing log:" && sed -n '1,200p' tsc-output.log && exit 1)
    52:           echo "tsc succeeded"
    53:       - name: Build optional spyder
    54:         run: |
    55:           if [ -f spyder/package.json ]; then
    56:             echo "Building spyder (optional)..."
    57:             npm --prefix spyder run build || echo "spyder build failed or not present, continuing"
    58:           else
    59:             echo "No spyder package, skipping build"
    60:           fi
    61:       - name: Show dist contents (diagnostic)
    62:         run: |
    63:           echo "dist tree:" && ls -la dist || echo "dist directory not present"
    64:       - name: Ensure .qflush config exists
    65:         run: |
    66:           mkdir -p .qflush
    67:           if [ ! -f .qflush/logic-config.json ]; then echo '{}' > .qflush/logic-config.json; fi
    68:           if [ ! -f .qflush/logic-vars.json ]; then echo '{}' > .qflush/logic-vars.json; fi
    69:       - name: Start qflush daemon (background)
    70:         env:
    71:           QFLUSHD_PORT: '43421'
    72:         run: |
    73:           nohup node ./dist/daemon/qflushd.js > qflushd.log 2>&1 & echo $! > qflushd.pid
    74:           npx wait-on -t 30000 http://localhost:${QFLUSHD_PORT}/npz/rome-index || true
    75:       - name: Start embedded services (test plumbing)
    76:         run: |
    77:           # start services via embedded service manager; SAFE_CI will skip actual starts but exercise plumbing
    78:           node dist/index.js start --services "bat,spyder,nezlephant,freeland" --verbose || true
    79:       - name: Run tests
    80:         env:
    81:           VITEST: "1"
    82:           QFLUSHD_PORT: '43421'
    83:           QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
    84:           QFLUSH_SKIP_GLOBAL_INSTALLS: '1'
    85:         run: |
    86:           npm test
    87:       - name: Teardown qflush daemon
    88:         if: always()
    89:         run: |
    90:           if [ -f qflushd.pid ]; then kill $(cat qflushd.pid) || true; fi
    91:           tail -n 200 qflushd.log || true
    92: 
    93:   integration-dry-run:
    94:     needs: build-and-test
    95:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    96:     timeout-minutes: 60
    97:     env:
    98:       REDIS_URL: ''
    99:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
   100:     steps:
   101:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
   102:         with:
   103:           fetch-depth: 0
   104:           persist-credentials: true
   105:       - name: Use Node.js 20
   106:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
   107:         with:
   108:           node-version: '20'
   109:       - name: Install dependencies
   110:         run: |
   111:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
   112:       - name: Build
   113:         run: |
   114:           npm run build
   115:       - name: Integration dry-run
   116:         run: |
   117:           node dist/index.js start --verbose --dry-run
   118: 
   119:   engine-dry-run:
   120:     needs: build-and-test
   121:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
   122:     timeout-minutes: 20
   123:     env:
   124:       REDIS_URL: ''
   125:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
   126:     steps:
   127:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
   128:         with:
   129:           fetch-depth: 0
   130:           persist-credentials: true
   131:       - name: Use Node.js
   132:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
   133:         with:
   134:           node-version: '20'
   135:       - name: Install
   136:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
   137:       - name: Build
   138:         run: npm run build
   139:       - name: Engine dry-run (validate rules)
   140:         run: |
   141:           node dist/index.js engine --dry-run
   142:         timeout-minutes: 10
   143: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\create-pr-from-branch.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Create PR from branch
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5:     inputs:
     6:       head_branch:
     7:         description: 'Branch name to create PR from'
     8:         required: true
     9:         default: 'feat/tools-encoders'
    10:       base_branch:
    11:         description: 'Target base branch'
    12:         required: true
    13:         default: 'main'
    14:       title:
    15:         description: 'PR title'
    16:         required: true
    17:         default: 'feat(tools): add encoders and css encoder/decoder'
    18:       body:
    19:         description: 'PR body'
    20:         required: false
    21:         default: 'Add tools: tools/rgba_brotli_oc8.py, tools/css_encode.js, tools/css_decode.js.'
    22: 
    23: jobs:
    24:   create-pr:
    25:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    26:     steps:
    27:       - name: Create PR via REST API
    28:         env:
    29:           GH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.ACTIONS_TOKEN }}
    30:           GITHUB_API_URL: https://api.github.com
    31:         run: |
    32:           if [ -z "$GH_TOKEN" ]; then
    33:             echo "ERROR: ACTIONS_TOKEN secret is not set in repository secrets." >&2
    34:             exit 1
    35:           fi
    36:           echo "Creating PR from '${{ github.event.inputs.head_branch }}' -> '${{ github.event.inputs.base_branch }}'"
    37:           payload=$(jq -n --arg title "${{ github.event.inputs.title }}" --arg head "${{ github.event.inputs.head_branch }}" --arg base "${{ github.event.inputs.base_branch }}" --arg body "${{ github.event.inputs.body }}" '{title:$title,head:$head,base:$base,body:$body}')
    38:           echo "$payload" | jq .
    39:           resp=$(curl -s -H "Authorization: Bearer $GH_TOKEN" -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" -H "User-Agent: qflush-bot" "$GITHUB_API_URL/repos/${{ github.repository }}/pulls" -d @-)
    40:           echo "$resp" | jq .
    41:           url=$(echo "$resp" | jq -r .html_url)
    42:           if [ "$url" = "null" ] || [ -z "$url" ]; then
    43:             echo "Failed to create PR; response above." >&2
    44:             exit 1
    45:           fi
    46:           echo "PR created: $url"
    47: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\get-installation-token.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Get GitHub App Installation Token
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5: 
     6: permissions:
     7:   contents: read
     8: 
     9: jobs:
    10:   get-token:
    11:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    12:     steps:
    13:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    14:         with:
    15:           fetch-depth: 0
    16: 
    17:       - name: Use Node.js 20
    18:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    19:         with:
    20:           node-version: '20'
    21: 
    22:       - name: Install @octokit/auth-app
    23:         run: |
    24:           npm install @octokit/auth-app --no-audit --no-fund
    25: 
    26:       - name: Write private key to file (from secret)
    27:         env:
    28:           PRIVATE_KEY_PEM: ${{ secrets.PRIVATE_KEY_PEM }}
    29:         run: |
    30:           set -euo pipefail
    31:           printf '%s' "$PRIVATE_KEY_PEM" > private.pem
    32:           # trim surrounding quotes if any
    33:           sed -i "1s/^['\"]//;\$s/['\"]$//" private.pem || true
    34:           echo "Private key head:"; sed -n '1,5p' private.pem || true
    35: 
    36:           # If OpenSSH format, convert to PEM
    37:           if grep -q "BEGIN OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY" private.pem; then
    38:             echo "Detected OpenSSH private key  converting to PEM"
    39:             ssh-keygen -p -f private.pem -m PEM -N "" || true
    40:           fi
    41: 
    42:           # Fail if encrypted
    43:           if grep -q "ENCRYPTED" private.pem || grep -q "Proc-Type: 4,ENCRYPTED" private.pem; then
    44:             echo "ERROR: provided private key appears to be encrypted. Provide an unencrypted PEM or convert locally."
    45:             exit 1
    46:           fi
    47: 
    48:           # export path for helper
    49:           echo "GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE=$(pwd)/private.pem" >> $GITHUB_ENV
    50: 
    51:       - name: Obtain installation token
    52:         id: get_token
    53:         env:
    54:           APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
    55:           INSTALLATION_ID: ${{ secrets.INSTALLATION_ID }}
    56:           GITHUB_APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
    57:           GITHUB_INSTALLATION_ID: ${{ secrets.INSTALLATION_ID }}
    58:           GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE: ${{ env.GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE }}
    59:         run: |
    60:           node tools/get-installation-token.js > token.txt
    61:           echo "::add-mask::$(cat token.txt)"
    62:           echo "token=$(cat token.txt)" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    63: 
    64:       - name: Use installation token (list installation repositories)
    65:         if: success()
    66:         env:
    67:           INSTALL_TOKEN: ${{ steps.get_token.outputs.token }}
    68:         run: |
    69:           set -euo pipefail
    70:           # mask token in logs
    71:           echo "::add-mask::$INSTALL_TOKEN"
    72:           echo "Calling GitHub API with installation token..."
    73:           curl -s -H "Authorization: Bearer $INSTALL_TOKEN" -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" https://api.github.com/installation/repositories > installation-repos.json || true
    74:           echo "Wrote installation-repos.json (masked token)."
    75: 
    76:       - name: Upload token artifact
    77:         if: success()
    78:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
    79:         with:
    80:           name: installation-token
    81:           path: |
    82:             token.txt
    83:             installation-repos.json
    84: 
    85:       - name: Show success
    86:         run: |
    87:           echo "Installation token obtained, API result and token uploaded as artifact (masked)."
    88: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\netlify-deploy.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Deploy to Netlify
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5: 
     6: jobs:
     7:   build-and-deploy:
     8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     9:     steps:
    10:       - name: Checkout
    11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    12:         with:
    13:           submodules: 'false'
    14: 
    15:       - name: Setup Node
    16:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    17:         with:
    18:           node-version: '18'
    19: 
    20:       - name: Install dependencies
    21:         run: |
    22:           npm ci
    23: 
    24:       - name: Build
    25:         run: |
    26:           npm run prebuild || true
    27:           npm run build
    28: 
    29:       - name: Install Netlify CLI
    30:         run: |
    31:           npm i -g netlify-cli
    32: 
    33:       - name: Deploy to Netlify
    34:         env:
    35:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    36:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: '"qflash-funesterie"  # suggested site name, will be adjusted'
    37:           NETLIFY_DEPLOY_DIR: "dist"
    38:         run: |
    39:           set -e
    40:           netlify sites:create --name "$NETLIFY_SITE_NAME" --json || true
    41:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"$NETLIFY_SITE_NAME\") | .id")
    42:           echo "SITE_ID=$SITE_ID"
    43:           netlify deploy --dir="$NETLIFY_DEPLOY_DIR" --prod --site=$SITE_ID
    44:           echo "Deployed to site $SITE_ID"
    45: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\netlify-enable-https.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Netlify Enable HTTPS
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5: 
     6: jobs:
     7:   enable-https:
     8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     9:     steps:
    10:       - name: Checkout
    11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    12: 
    13:       - name: Setup tools
    14:         run: |
    15:           sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y jq curl
    16:           npm i -g netlify-cli
    17: 
    18:       - name: Enable HTTPS (force SSL)
    19:         env:
    20:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    21:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
    22:         run: |
    23:           set -e
    24:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id")
    25:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ] || [ "$SITE_ID" = "null" ]; then
    26:             echo "Site not found: ${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}"
    27:             exit 1
    28:           fi
    29:           echo "Found site: $SITE_ID"
    30:           # enable force_ssl via Netlify API
    31:           echo "Enabling force_ssl for site $SITE_ID"
    32:           curl -s -X PATCH "https://api.netlify.com/api/v1/sites/$SITE_ID" \
    33:             -H "Authorization: Bearer $NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN" \
    34:             -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    35:             -d '{"force_ssl":true}' | jq .
    36:           echo "HTTPS (force SSL) enabled (request sent)."
    37: 
    38:       - name: Ensure domain alias
    39:         env:
    40:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    41:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
    42:         run: |
    43:           set -e
    44:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id")
    45:           DOMAIN="qflash.funesterie.pro"
    46:           # add domain alias if not present
    47:           EXISTS=$(netlify domains:list --site $SITE_ID --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.hostname==\"$DOMAIN\") | .id" || true)
    48:           if [ -z "$EXISTS" ]; then
    49:             echo "Adding domain $DOMAIN to site $SITE_ID"
    50:             netlify domains:add $DOMAIN --site $SITE_ID || true
    51:           else
    52:             echo "Domain $DOMAIN already added"
    53:           fi
    54:           # show domain status
    55:           netlify domains:list --site $SITE_ID --json | jq .
    56: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\netlify-set-env.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Configure Netlify Site Env
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5: 
     6: jobs:
     7:   set-env:
     8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     9:     steps:
    10:       - name: Checkout
    11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    12: 
    13:       - name: Setup tools
    14:         run: |
    15:           sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y jq
    16:           npm i -g netlify-cli
    17: 
    18:       - name: Find or create site
    19:         env:
    20:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    21:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
    22:         run: |
    23:           set -e
    24:           # attempt to find site id by name
    25:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id" )
    26:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ] || [ "$SITE_ID" = "null" ]; then
    27:             echo "site not found, creating"
    28:             netlify sites:create --name "${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}" --json
    29:             SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id" )
    30:           fi
    31:           echo "SITE_ID=$SITE_ID"
    32:           echo "SITE_ID=$SITE_ID" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    33: 
    34:       - name: Set Netlify env vars
    35:         env:
    36:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    37:           SITE_ID: ${{ steps.find_or_create_site.outputs.SITE_ID || '' }}
    38:           APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
    39:           APP_SECRET: ${{ secrets.APP_SECRET }}
    40:           GUMROAD_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}
    41:           GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID }}
    42:           DAEMON_URL: "https://qflash.funesterie.pro"
    43:         run: |
    44:           set -e
    45:           # fallback: read site id via name
    46:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ]; then
    47:             SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"qflash-funesterie\") | .id" )
    48:           fi
    49:           echo "Using site: $SITE_ID"
    50:           # helper to set if value exists
    51:           set_env_if() {
    52:             KEY=$1; VAL=$2; if [ -n "$VAL" ] && [ "$VAL" != "null" ]; then netlify env:set $KEY "$VAL" --site $SITE_ID; fi
    53:           }
    54:           set_env_if "APP_ID" "$APP_ID"
    55:           set_env_if "APP_SECRET" "$APP_SECRET"
    56:           set_env_if "GUMROAD_TOKEN" "$GUMROAD_TOKEN"
    57:           set_env_if "GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID" "$GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID"
    58:           set_env_if "DAEMON_URL" "$DAEMON_URL"
    59:           echo "Env vars set"
    60: 
    61:       - name: Output site info
    62:         env:
    63:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
    64:         run: |
    65:           netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"qflash-funesterie\") | {name:.name,id:.id,ssl:.ssl,custom_domain: .custom_domain,default_domain:.default_domain}" || true
    66: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\publish-gumroad.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish VSIX to Gumroad
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5:   release:
     6:     types: [published]
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish-gumroad:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     steps:
    12:       - name: Checkout
    13:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    14: 
    15:       - name: Setup Node
    16:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    17:         with:
    18:           node-version: '18'
    19: 
    20:       - name: Build extension
    21:         run: |
    22:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    23:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    24:           npm run build
    25:           npx vsce package --no-dependencies
    26: 
    27:       - name: Upload VSIX to Release
    28:         if: github.event_name == 'release'
    29:         run: |
    30:           gh release upload ${{ github.event.release.tag_name }} extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix --clobber
    31: 
    32:       - name: Upload to Gumroad
    33:         env:
    34:           GUMROAD_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}
    35:           GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID }}
    36:         run: |
    37:           VSIX=$(ls extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix | head -n 1)
    38:           if [ -z "$VSIX" ]; then echo "No VSIX found"; exit 1; fi
    39:           echo "Uploading $VSIX to Gumroad product $GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID"
    40:           # Use curl to upload file to Gumroad (replace endpoint as needed)
    41:           curl -s -X POST "https://api.gumroad.com/v2/products/$GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID/attachments" \
    42:             -F "access_token=$GUMROAD_TOKEN" \
    43:             -F "file=@${VSIX}" \
    44:             -F "name=qflash-vsix" \
    45:             -F "description=VSIX for release ${{ github.ref }}" \
    46:             -o /tmp/gumroad-upload.json
    47:           cat /tmp/gumroad-upload.json
    48:

FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\publish-on-release.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish on Release
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch: {}
     5:   release:
     6:     types: [published]
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   CI:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     steps:
    12:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    13:         with:
    14:           submodules: false
    15:       - run: echo "CI check placeholder"
    16: 
    17:   publish:
    18:     needs: [CI]
    19:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    20:     steps:
    21:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    22:         with:
    23:           submodules: false
    24:       - name: Use Node.js
    25:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    26:         with:
    27:           node-version: '20.18.1'
    28:           registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'
    29:       - name: Publish to npm
    30:         env:
    31:           NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
    32:         run: |
    33:           npm install --no-audit --no-fund
    34:           npm run build
    35:           npm publish --access public
    36:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\publish-open-vsx.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish to Open VSX
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch: {}
     5:   release:
     6:     types: [published]
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish-open-vsx:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     env:
    12:       OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
    13:       NODE_OPTIONS: "-r ${{ github.workspace }}/extensions/vscode-npz/src/polyfill-file.js"
    14:     steps:
    15:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    16:         with:
    17:           submodules: false
    18:       - name: Setup Node
    19:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    20:         with:
    21:           node-version: '20.18.1'
    22:       - name: Validate token (warning only)
    23:         run: |
    24:           if [ -z "${OPEN_VSX_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN is not set - Open VSX publish will be skipped"; else echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN is set"; fi
    25:       - name: Install dependencies
    26:         run: |
    27:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    28:           if [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; else npm install --no-audit --no-fund; fi
    29:       - name: Package .vsix
    30:         run: |
    31:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    32:           npx @vscode/vsce package
    33:       - name: Upload VSIX artifact for debugging
    34:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
    35:         with:
    36:           name: qflush-vsix
    37:           path: extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix
    38:       - name: Publish to Open VSX (runtime)
    39:         run: |
    40:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    41:           if [ -z "${OPEN_VSX_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN missing - skip"; exit 0; fi
    42:           npx ovsx publish *.vsix --pat $OPEN_VSX_TOKEN || echo 'Open VSX publish failed'
    43:

FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\publish-vs-marketplace.yml

     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch: {}
     5:   release:
     6:     types: [published]
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish-vs-marketplace:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     env:
    12:       AZURE_PAT: ${{ secrets.AZURE_PAT }}
    13:       NODE_OPTIONS: "-r ${{ github.workspace }}/extensions/vscode-npz/src/polyfill-file.js"
    14:     steps:
    15:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    16:         with:
    17:           submodules: false
    18:       - name: Setup Node
    19:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    20:         with:
    21:           node-version: '20.18.1'
    22:       - name: Validate AZURE_PAT (warning)
    23:         run: |
    24:           if [ -z "${AZURE_PAT}" ]; then echo "AZURE_PAT is missing - Marketplace publish will be skipped"; else echo "AZURE_PAT is set"; fi
    25:       - name: Install deps and build extension
    26:         run: |
    27:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    28:           if [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; else npm install --no-audit --no-fund; fi
    29:           npm run build || true
    30:       - name: Package VSIX
    31:         run: |
    32:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    33:           npx @vscode/vsce package
    34:       - name: Upload VSIX artifact
    35:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
    36:         with:
    37:           name: qflush-vsix
    38:           path: extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix
    39:       - name: Publish to Visual Studio Marketplace (runtime)
    40:         run: |
    41:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    42:           if [ -z "${AZURE_PAT}" ]; then echo "AZURE_PAT missing - skip"; exit 0; fi
    43:           npx @vscode/vsce publish --pat $AZURE_PAT || echo 'VSCE publish failed'

FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\publish-vscode-extension.yml
============================

     1: name: Publish VS Code Extension
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:     tags:
     6:       - 'v*'
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    13:       - name: Setup Node
    14:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    15:         with:

    17:       - name: Validate tokens
    18:         run: |
    19:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi
    20:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi
    21:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "Warning: GUMROAD_TOKEN is not set"; fi
    22:       - name: Install dependencies
    23:         run: |
    24:           cd extensions/vscode-npz

    26:       - name: Build extension

    29:           npm run build

    31:         env:
    32:           VSCE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}
    33:         run: |
    34:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    35:           npx vsce publish --pat $VSCE_TOKEN || npx vsce package

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\publish-vscode.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish VS Code extension
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5:   push:
     6:     tags:
     7:       - 'v*'
     8: 
     9: jobs:
    10:   build:
    11:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    12:     env:
    13:       OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
    14:       VSCE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}
    15:       NODE_OPTIONS: "-r ${{ github.workspace }}/extensions/vscode-npz/src/polyfill-file.js"
    16:     steps:
    17:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    18:       - name: Use Node.js
    19:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    20:         with:
    21:           node-version: '20'
    22:       - name: Install dependencies
    23:         run: |
    24:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    25:           if [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; else npm install --no-audit --no-fund; fi
    26:       - name: Build extension
    27:         run: |
    28:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    29:           npm run build
    30:       - name: Package .vsix
    31:         run: |
    32:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    33:           npx @vscode/vsce package
    34:       - name: Publish to Open VSX (runtime check)
    35:         run: |
    36:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    37:           if [ -z "${OPEN_VSX_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN not set - skipping Open VSX publish"; exit 0; fi
    38:           npx ovsx publish --pat "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN" || echo 'Open VSX publish failed'
    39:       - name: Publish to VS Marketplace (runtime check)
    40:         run: |
    41:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
    42:           if [ -z "${VSCE_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN not set - skipping VS Marketplace publish"; exit 0; fi
    43:           npx @vscode/vsce publish --pat "$VSCE_TOKEN" || echo 'VSCE publish failed'
    44:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\publish.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Publish Package
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   push:
     5:     tags:
     6:       - 'v*.*.*'
     7: 
     8: jobs:
     9:   publish:
    10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    11:     steps:
    12:       - uses: actions/checkout@v3
    13:       - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    14:         with:
    15:           node-version: '18'
    16:           registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'
    17:       - name: Validate tokens
    18:         run: |
    19:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi
    20:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "Warning: GUMROAD_TOKEN is not set"; fi
    21:       - name: Install dependencies
    22:         run: |
    23:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    24:       - name: Build
    25:         run: |
    26:           npm run build --if-present
    27:       - name: Publish
    28:         env:
    29:           NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
    30:         run: |
    31:           echo "//registry.npmjs.org/:_authToken=${NODE_AUTH_TOKEN}" > ~/.npmrc
    32:           npm publish --access public
    33:

FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\run-bridge.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Run qflush bridge
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch:
     5: 
     6: jobs:
     7:   run-bridge:
     8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     9:     steps:
    10:       - name: Checkout
    11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    12: 
    13:       - name: Setup Node
    14:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    15:         with:
    16:           node-version: '20'
    17: 
    18:       - name: Install deps
    19:         run: npm install
    20: 
    21:       - name: Run bridge
    22:         env:
    23:           OPENAI_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.OPENAI_API_KEY }}
    24:         run: |
    25:           npm run qflush:bridge
    26: 
    27:       - name: Upload bridge-out

    29:         with:
    30:           name: bridge-out
    31:           path: qflush/bridge-out.md
    32: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\upload-audit-on-failure.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Upload audit log on failure
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_run:
     5:     workflows: ["Publish to Open VSX", "CI", "Publish Package"]
     6:     types:
     7:       - completed
     8: 
     9: jobs:
    10:   upload-audit:
    11:     if: ${{ github.event.workflow_run.conclusion == 'failure' }}
    12:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    13:     steps:
    14:       - name: Checkout
    15:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    16:       - name: Upload license audit log
    17:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
    18:         with:
    19:           name: license-audit-log
    20:           path: './.qflash/license-activations.log'
    21:           if-no-files-found: 'ignore'
    22: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\verify-secrets.yml
============================
============================
     1: name: Verify Action Secrets
     2: 
     3: on:
     4:   workflow_dispatch: {}
     5: 
     6: jobs:
     7:   verify-secrets:
     8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     9:     steps:
    10:       - name: Checkout
    11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
    12: 
    13:       - name: Setup Node
    14:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
    15:         with:
    16:           node-version: '18'
    17: 
    18:       - name: Verify AZURE_PAT
    19:         env:
    20:           AZURE_PAT: ${{ secrets.AZURE_PAT }}
    21:         run: |
    22:           if [ -z "$AZURE_PAT" ]; then echo "AZURE_PAT: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
    23:           echo "AZURE_PAT: set"
    24:           echo "Testing Azure DevOps connectivity..."
    25:           curl -sS -u :"$AZURE_PAT" https://dev.azure.com/funesterie/_apis/connectionData -o /tmp/az.json || true
    26:           if grep -q "authenticatedUser" /tmp/az.json; then echo "AZURE_PAT: OK"; else echo "AZURE_PAT: FAILED (check scopes)"; fi
    27: 
    28:       - name: Verify VSCE_TOKEN
    29:         env:
    30:           VSCE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}
    31:         run: |
    32:           if [ -z "$VSCE_TOKEN" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
    33:           echo "VSCE_TOKEN: set"
    34:           # basic check: call Azure DevOps REST with token
    35:           curl -sS -u :"$VSCE_TOKEN" https://dev.azure.com/funesterie/_apis/connectionData -o /tmp/vsce.json || true
    36:           if grep -q "authenticatedUser" /tmp/vsce.json; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "VSCE_TOKEN: FAILED (check token/scopes)"; fi
    37: 
    38:       - name: Verify NPM_TOKEN
    39:         env:
    40:           NPM_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
    41:         run: |
    42:           if [ -z "$NPM_TOKEN" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
    43:           echo "NPM_TOKEN: set"
    44:           curl -sS -H "Authorization: Bearer $NPM_TOKEN" https://registry.npmjs.org/-/whoami -o /tmp/npm.json || true
    45:           if grep -q "username" /tmp/npm.json; then echo "NPM_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "NPM_TOKEN: FAILED"; fi
    46: 
    47:       - name: Verify OPEN_VSX_TOKEN
    48:         env:
    49:           OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
    50:         run: |
    51:           if [ -z "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
    52:           echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: set"
    53:           npm i -g @open-vsx/ovsx@1.0.3 >/dev/null 2>&1 || true
    54:           if npx @open-vsx/ovsx whoami --pat "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN" >/tmp/ovsx.out 2>&1; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: FAILED"; cat /tmp/ovsx.out || true; fi
    55: 
    56:       - name: Summary
    57:         run: |
    58:           echo "Verification complete. Check above step outputs for each token status."
    59:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\bin\npz.ps1
============================
============================
     1: param([string[]]$Args)
     2: # Lightweight PowerShell launcher to run the qflush NPZ daemon without npm
     3: $here = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition
     4: Set-Location (Join-Path $here '..')
     5: $node = $env:NODEJS_PATH -or 'node'
     6: $exe = Get-Command $node -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
     7: if (-not $exe) {
     8:   Write-Error "node executable not found. Update PATH or set NODEJS_PATH env var to the node binary."
     9:   exit 1
    10: }
    11: 
    12: # helper to run command in cwd
    13: function Run-InCwd([string]$cwd, [string[]]$cmd) {
    14:   Push-Location $cwd
    15:   try { & $cmd } finally { Pop-Location }
    16: }
    17: 
    18: if ($Args.Count -gt 0 -and $Args[0] -eq 'run' -and $Args[1] -eq 'qflush') {
    19:   $cli = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'dist/cli.js'
    20:   if (Test-Path $cli) {
    21:     & $node $cli 'run' 'qflush' @($Args[2..($Args.Count-1)])
    22:     exit $LASTEXITCODE
    23:   } else {
    24:     $script = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'dist/daemon/qflushd.js'
    25:     & $node $script @($Args[2..($Args.Count-1)])
    26:     exit $LASTEXITCODE
    27:   }
    28: }
    29: 
    30: # proxy commands: ci, install, build, test, package
    31: $cmd = $Args[0]
    32: if ($cmd -in @('ci','install','build','test','package')) {
    33:   $target = Get-Location
    34:   $remaining = $Args[1..($Args.Count-1)]
    35:   for ($i=0;$i -lt $remaining.Count; $i++) {
    36:     if ($remaining[$i] -like '--cwd*') {
    37:       if ($remaining[$i] -like '--cwd=*') { $target = $remaining[$i].Split('=')[1] } else { $target = $remaining[$i+1]; $i++ }
    38:     }
    39:   }
    40:   switch ($cmd) {
    41:     'ci' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','ci') }
    42:     'install' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','install','--no-audit','--no-fund') }
    43:     'build' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','run','build') }
    44:     'test' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','test') }
    45:     'package' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','run','package') }
    46:   }
    47:   exit $LASTEXITCODE
    48: }
    49: 
    50: # default: run daemon
    51: $script = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'dist/daemon/qflushd.js'
    52: if (-not (Test-Path $script)) { Write-Error "Daemon script not found: $script"; exit 2 }
    53: & $node $script @Args
    54:

FILE: D:\qflush\CHANGELOG.md

     1: # Changelog
     2: 
     3: ## v3.0.3  Release (2025-11-18)
     4: 
     5: Highlights:
     6: 
     7: - Rome Tag v1: shared module `src/rome/rome-tag.ts` and canonical tag algorithm (type|path  FNV-1a 24-bit)
     8: - Pourparler UI: compute & persist Rome tags from VS Code webview
     9: - VS Code extension: persist canonical records to `.qflush/rome-index.json`
    10: - Linter: `tools/rome-lint.js` enforces `// ROME-TAG: 0xXXXXXX` with `--fix`
    11: - Daemon: `GET /npz/rome-index` endpoint and index loader cache
    12: - Tests: reliable integration tests for checksums and rome-index
    13: - Docs: Rome index diagram, README and publishing guidance
    14: 
    15: Checksums
    16: 
    17: - funeste38-qflush-3.0.3.tgz  SHA256: AAB940267E13C613EB30564613EE40FBA31729DCF2BE01AE897C03C33DD079F8
    18: 
    19: Migration notes:
    20: - The Rome tag algorithm is stable (v1) and computed from `type|path`. Existing tags inserted by the linter or extension will match.
    21: - To adopt in CI, add `npm run lint:rome` as a workflow step to ensure tags remain consistent.
    22: 
    23: Security & CI:
    24: - The release pipeline can publish to npm using `NPM_TOKEN` stored in repository secrets.
    25: 
    26:

     1: QFLUSH / FUNESTERIE  Copilot Context (short)
     2: 
     3: - Project: @funeste38/qflush
     4: - Version: 3.1.2
     5: - Purpose: Orchestrator for Funesterie (start/stop/purge/inspect) + daemon exposing NPZ & ROME endpoints
     6: - Key commands: `qflush start|kill|purge|inspect|config|rome:links`
     7: - Daemon endpoints: `/npz/checksum/*`, `/npz/rome-index`, `/npz/rome-links*`
     8: - Dev: `npm run build`, `npm test` (vitest)
     9: - Notes: Redis optional; disable in dev via `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS=0`.
    10:

FILE: D:\qflush\docs\admin-deploy.md
============================
============================
     1: Admin deployment steps for setting up a self-hosted agent and publishing the VS Code extension.
     2: 
     3: Prerequisites:
     4: - Windows machine with admin rights and PowerShell (run as Administrator).
     5: - Personal Access Token (PAT) with Marketplace publish and Agent Pools permissions.
     6: 
     7: Steps (copy/paste in an Administrator PowerShell):
     8: 
     9: # 1) Configure execution policy for the session
    10: Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned
    11: 
    12: # 2) Create agent directory and download agent package (replace URL if newer)
    13: $installDir = 'C:\azagent'
    14: New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $installDir
    15: cd $installDir
    16: $agentUrl = 'https://vstsagentpackage.azureedge.net/agent/2.220.1/vsts-agent-win-x64-2.220.1.zip'
    17: Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $agentUrl -OutFile agent.zip
    18: Expand-Archive agent.zip -DestinationPath . -Force
    19: Remove-Item agent.zip -Force
    20: 
    21: # 3) Configure the agent (replace <PAT> and pool name)
    22: $pat = Read-Host -AsSecureString "Enter PAT (will not echo)"
    23: $plain = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR([System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($pat))
    24: .\config.cmd --unattended --url "https://dev.azure.com/funesterie" --auth pat --token $plain --pool "self-hosted" --agent "qflush-agent" --acceptTeeEula
    25: 
    26: # 4) Install as a service
    27: .\svc.sh install
    28: .\svc.sh start
    29: 
    30: # 5) Verify agent online in Azure DevOps
    31: # Go to Project settings -> Pipelines -> Agent pools -> self-hosted
    32: 
    33: # 6) Package and publish the VSIX (optional manual publish)
    34: cd 'D:\qflush\extensions\vscode-npz'
    35: npm install --no-audit --no-fund
    36: npm run build
    37: npx @vscode/vsce package
    38: # publish (runs locally, PAT prompted)
    39: $npat = Read-Host -AsSecureString "Enter PAT for publish"
    40: $plainPublish = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR([System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($npat))
    41: npx tfx extension publish --manifest-globs vss-extension.json --publisher funesterie --token $plainPublish --service-url https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/
    42: 
    43: Notes:
    44: - Keep your PAT secret. Do not paste it in chats.
    45: - If you prefer CI publishing, ensure repository secrets `AZURE_PAT` or `VSCE_TOKEN` are set in GitHub.
    46:

FILE: D:\qflush\docs\architecture-ascii.txt
============================
============================
     1: FUNESTERIE ARCHITECTURE (ASCII Diagram)
     2: 
     3: +-------------------------------------------------------------+
     4: |                           QFLUSH                             |
     5: |  - CLI orchestration                                          |
     6: |  - daemon (qflushd)                                           |
     7: |  - starts/stops modules via BAT                                |
     8: |  - exposes /npz/* and /rome-* endpoints                       |
     9: +-------------+----------------+----------------+--------------+
    10:               |                |                |
    11:               v                v                v
    12:    +----------+---+   +--------+----+   +--------+-----+
    13:    |    BAT        |   |   ROME       |   |    NPZ       |
    14:    | process mgr   |   | index/engine |   | router/admin |
    15:    +---------------+   +--------------+   +--------------+
    16:            |                   |                 |
    17:            v                   v                 v
    18:    +---------------+   +--------------+   +----------------+
    19:    |  Services     |   | .qflush/rome |   |  Checksums,    |
    20:    |  (rome, env,  |   | index/links  |   |  links, scores |
    21:    |   nezlephant) |   |              |   |                |
    22:    +---------------+   +--------------+   +----------------+
    23:                     \            |             /
    24:                      \           |            /
    25:                       \          v           /
    26:                        +-----------------------+
    27:                        |   Copilot Bridge /    |
    28:                        |   Telemetry / IDE     |
    29:                        +-----------------------+
    30:                                 |
    31:                                 v
    32:                            +-----------+
    33:                            |  A11 /    |
    34:                            |  SPYDER   |
    35:                            +-----------+
    36: 
    37: Notes:
    38:  - Redis optional backend for NPZ checksums
    39:  - Nezlephant provides OC8/PNG storage
    40:  - Linker resolves [[token]] -> files and writes .qflush/rome-links.json
    41: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\docs\azure-publish-secrets.md
============================
============================
     1: Azure DevOps Marketplace publish requires:
     2: 
     3: - `PUBLISHER_ID` (pipeline variable)  your publisher ID in Visual Studio Marketplace (the publisher name), e.g. `funesterie`.
     4: - `AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT` (pipeline secret)  a Personal Access Token with Marketplace publish scope.
     5: - `AGENT_POOL` (pipeline variable)  name of a self-hosted agent pool to use for the publish job. If not set, the job will fail when there is no hosted parallelism.
     6: 
     7: How to create a self-hosted agent pool and agent
     8: 
     9: 1. In Azure DevOps project -> Project settings -> Pipelines -> Agent pools -> New agent pool. Name it e.g. `self-hosted`.
    10: 2. Click the pool -> New agent -> choose the OS of the machine where you'll run the agent (Linux/Windows).
    11: 3. Follow the provided instructions to download and configure the agent on your machine. Example for Linux:
    12:    - mkdir myagent && cd myagent
    13:    - curl -O https://vstsagentpackage.azureedge.net/agent/2.218.1/vsts-agent-linux-x64-2.218.1.tar.gz
    14:    - tar zxvf vsts-agent-*.tar.gz
    15:    - ./config.sh --unattended --url https://dev.azure.com/<your_org> --auth pat --token <YOUR_PAT> --pool self-hosted --agent qflush-agent
    16:    - sudo ./svc.sh install && sudo ./svc.sh start
    17: 4. In the pipeline variables (Pipeline -> Edit -> Variables) add `AGENT_POOL=self-hosted` and mark `AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT` as secret.
    18: 
    19: Once the self-hosted agent is online, rerun the pipeline and the publish job will use the specified pool and avoid the hosted parallelism error.
    20: 
    21: The pipeline `.azure-pipelines/workflows/azure-publish.yml` expects `extensions/vscode-npz/vss-extension.json` to exist and `tfx-cli` to create and publish the VSIX.
    22: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\docs\copilot-bridge.md
============================
============================
     1: # Copilot Bridge  Telemetry & Security
     2: 
     3: This document describes the Copilot Bridge transport options, HMAC signing, and secure setup.
     4: 
     5: ## Config
     6: Place `.qflush/copilot.json` with the following minimal keys:
     7: 
     8: ```json
     9: {
    10:   "enabled": true,
    11:   "transports": ["file","webhook"],
    12:   "webhookUrl": "https://copilot.example/api/telemetry",
    13:   "hmacSecretEnv": "COPILOT_HMAC",
    14:   "filePath": ".qflush/telemetry.json"
    15: }
    16: ```
    17: 
    18: ## HMAC signing
    19: - Set a secret value in repository/host environment variable referenced by `hmacSecretEnv` (e.g. `COPILOT_HMAC`).
    20: - The bridge will sign webhook payloads with `X-Copilot-Signature: sha256=<hex>` header.
    21: 
    22: Example verification (Node):
    23: 
    24: ```js
    25: const crypto = require('crypto');
    26: function verify(payload, headerSig, secret) {
    27:   const expected = crypto.createHmac('sha256', secret).update(payload).digest('hex');
    28:   return headerSig === `sha256=${expected}`;
    29: }
    30: ```
    31: 
    32: ## Endpoint auth
    33: - Protect `/copilot/*` and `/npz/engine/*` endpoints by setting `QFLUSH_TOKEN` env var on the daemon.
    34: - Include header `x-qflush-token: <TOKEN>` when calling these endpoints (CLI or extension).
    35: 
    36: ## Telemetry retention
    37: - Telemetry is written to `.qflush/telemetry.json` and persisted into `.qflush/qflush.db` if sqlite is available.
    38: - Rotate telemetry files daily in your ops scripts or configure archival.
    39: 
    40: ## Privacy
    41: - Telemetry redacts environment variables and long file contents >4KB.
    42: - Only enable telemetry for trusted networks or when webhook targets are under your control.
    43: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\docs\COPILOT-CLI.md
============================
============================
     1: GitHub Copilot CLI - quick start
     2: 
     3: Official page:
     4: https://github.com/github/copilot-cli
     5: 
     6: What this doc does
     7: - Points you to the official Copilot CLI repository for latest installers and docs.
     8: - Provides a few safe, minimal next steps you can run locally to try Copilot CLI.
     9: 
    10: Install (official instructions may change)
    11: 1. Open the official repo releases page and follow the installer for your platform:
    12:    - https://github.com/github/copilot-cli/releases
    13: 
    14: 2. After installing the `copilot` binary, verify installation:
    15: 
    16:    copilot --version
    17:    copilot --help
    18: 
    19: Authenticate
    20: - Follow the interactive login command the CLI provides. Example (the actual subcommand may vary by release):
    21: 
    22:   copilot auth login
    23: 
    24: - If that specific subcommand doesn't exist for your version, run `copilot --help` and follow the authentication instructions shown by the tool or the README on the official repo.
    25: 
    26: Basic usage
    27: - Once installed and authenticated you can try the interactive mode or run code generation commands. Example (replace with the exact commands for your release):
    28: 
    29:   copilot chat
    30:   copilot code "write a function that reverses a string in JavaScript"
    31: 
    32: Security notes
    33: - The Copilot CLI will open a browser window for OAuth; do not paste tokens into code or the repo.
    34: - Use the official releases page to download installers; verify checksums if provided.
    35: 
    36: Integration ideas for this repository
    37: - Use Copilot CLI locally to help prototype small code snippets or tests.
    38: - Do NOT add your copilot auth token to repository files. Store any tokens in your OS credential manager or GitHub secrets when used in CI.
    39: 
    40: If you want, I can:
    41: - add a helper script to open the official Copilot CLI repo page from this workspace, or
    42: - add a short sample command file that demonstrates a few copilot-cli commands (non-authenticated examples).
    43: 
    44: Refer to the official repo for up-to-date, authoritative installation and usage instructions.
    45: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\docs\FCL_README.md
============================
============================
     1: Funesterie Config Language (FCL) - README
     2: 
     3: FCL is a small, human-friendly format to declare projects, services and pipelines for Funesterie.
     4: 
     5: Sections:
     6: - `@project` global metadata (name, owner, defaultEnv)
     7: - `@env <name>` environment variables and URLs
     8: - `@service <name>` description of a launchable service (path, start command, port)
     9: - `@pipeline <name>` ordered list of services to run together
    10: 
    11: Examples:
    12: 
    13: @project
    14:   name = my-stack
    15:   owner = alice
    16: 
    17: @env dev
    18:   url = http://localhost:3000
    19: 
    20: @service api
    21:   type = node
    22:   path = apps/api
    23:   start = pnpm dev:api
    24:   port = 3000
    25: 
    26: @pipeline dev-all
    27:   steps = ["api"]
    28: 
    29: Usage:
    30: - Place `funesterie.fcl` in the repo root.
    31: - `qflush compose up` will read `funesterie.fcl` if present and bring up declared services.
    32: 
    33: This README is minimal and the spec is intentionally small to keep portability.
    34: 
    35: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\docs\FCL_SPEC.md
============================
============================
     1: Funesterie Config Language (FCL) - Short Spec
     2: 
     3: 1. File name: `funesterie.fcl`
     4: 2. Sections start with `@section` optionally followed by a name: `@service api` or `@env dev`.
     5: 3. Key-value syntax: `key = value` (strings or numbers).
     6: 4. Lists use `[]` with comma-separated values: `steps = ["api", "web"]`.
     7: 5. Comments start with `#` or `//` and extend to end-of-line.
     8: 6. Supported sections: `@project`, `@env`, `@service`, `@pipeline`.
     9: 7. `@service <name>` supports keys: `type`, `path`, `start`, `port`, `env`, `token`.
    10: 8. `@pipeline <name>` supports keys: `description`, `steps` (list of service names).
    11: 9. Values can be quoted strings or unquoted tokens (no complex expressions).
    12: 10. FCL is intentionally minimal and designed to be parsed without heavy dependencies.
    13: 
    14: Example:
    15: 
    16: @service api
    17:   type = node
    18:   path = apps/api
    19:   start = npm run dev
    20:   port = 3000
    21: 
    22: @pipeline dev-all
    23:   steps = ["api", "web"]
    24:

FILE: D:\qflush\docs\github-publish-secrets.md
============================
============================
     1: GitHub Actions publish workflow requires these secrets in the repository settings:
     2: 
     3: - `VSCE_TOKEN`  Personal Access Token for Visual Studio Marketplace (used by `@vscode/vsce publish`) 
     4: - `OPEN_VSX_TOKEN`  API token for Open VSX (optional)
     5: 
     6: To add secrets:
     7: 1. Go to your GitHub repository  Settings  Secrets and variables  Actions  New repository secret.
     8: 2. Add `VSCE_TOKEN` and `OPEN_VSX_TOKEN` values.
     9: 
    10: Trigger the workflow manually under Actions  Publish VS Code extension  Run workflow or push a tag `v*` to automatically run.
    11: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\docs\LICENSING.md
============================
============================
     1: qflush Licensing (Gumroad)
     2: 
     3: Overview
     4: 
     5: This project integrates with Gumroad for license sales and verification. You can sell monthly or yearly licenses and validate keys using Gumroad's license API.
     6: 
     7: Recommended products on Gumroad:
     8: - qflush Monthly - 5/month
     9: - qflush Yearly - 39/year
    10: 
    11: Steps to configure
    12: 
    13: 1. Create products on Gumroad and enable license keys.
    14: 2. Obtain your Gumroad account token (Personal access token) or use public product id for verification.
    15: 3. Add token to your daemon or CI as environment variable `GUMROAD_TOKEN` (for server-side verify) or store securely in a file and set `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE`.
    16: 
    17: Daemon setup
    18: 
    19: - Run the daemon (recommended):
    20:   - Set `GUMROAD_TOKEN` and optionally `GUMROAD_PRODUCT_YEARLY` / `GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY`.
    21:   - Start: `qflush daemon` or `node dist/daemon/qflushd.js`.
    22:   - The daemon exposes endpoints:
    23:     - `POST /license/activate` { key, product_id? }
    24:     - `GET /license/status` -> { license, valid }
    25: 
    26: VS Code extension flow
    27: 
    28: - The VS Code extension UI includes a License section in the panel:
    29:   - Paste the key in the License Key field and press Activate.
    30:   - The extension will call the daemon `POST /license/activate` and display the result.
    31:   - Use Show License Status to query `GET /license/status`.
    32: 
    33: CLI flow
    34: 
    35: - You can also activate using the CLI (suitable for headless installs):
    36:   - `GUMROAD_TOKEN=... qflush license activate <key>`
    37:   - `qflush license status` to view the saved local license
    38: 
    39: Audit and metrics
    40: 
    41: - The daemon writes a simple audit log by default to `./.qflush/license-activations.log` and exposes Prometheus counters:
    42:   - `qflush_license_activation_total`
    43:   - `qflush_license_activation_success_total`
    44:   - `qflush_license_activation_failure_total`
    45: 
    46: Local license storage
    47: 
    48: The CLI/daemon stores a local license record in `./.qflush/license.json`. You can override with `GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH`.
    49: 
    50: Security
    51: 
    52: Do not hardcode your Gumroad token in client-side code. Use the daemon to keep tokens private. The extension communicates with the local daemon only.
    53: 
    54: ---
    55: 
    56: qflush licensing (local Gumroad verification)
    57: 
    58: Overview
    59: 
    60: qflush uses Gumroad to sell license keys. The recommended flow is local verification: the user pastes a license key into the app/extension which calls the local daemon to verify the key directly with Gumroad.
    61: 
    62: Simple local flow (recommended)
    63: 
    64: 1. User purchases a license on Gumroad and receives a license key.
    65: 2. User opens qflush (or the VS Code extension) and enters the license key.
    66: 3. The client calls the local daemon endpoint `POST /license/activate` with `{ key }`.
    67: 4. The daemon calls Gumroad's verify API, saves the license locally on success, and returns the result.
    68: 
    69: Why this is sufficient
    70: 
    71: - No public URL, tunnel, or webhook required for normal activation and verification.
    72: - Works fully offline for the app running on the user's machine (daemon contacts Gumroad to verify).
    73: 
    74: Daemon configuration
    75: 
    76: - Set `GUMROAD_TOKEN` and product IDs in the daemon environment (or `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE` and `GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH` if preferred).
    77: - Default local license path: `./.qflush/license.json`.
    78: 
    79: Commands
    80: 
    81: - Activate (HTTP):
    82:   POST http://localhost:4500/license/activate
    83:   Body: { "key": "XXXX-XXXX-XXXX" }
    84: 
    85: - Status (HTTP):
    86:   GET http://localhost:4500/license/status
    87: 
    88: Notes about webhooks
    89: 
    90: - Webhooks are optional. They are useful to automatically revoke licenses on refunds or subscription cancellations.
    91: - This repository supports webhook handling, but it can be removed. The default simple flow does not require a webhook or public endpoint.
    92: 
    93: Security
    94: 
    95: - Do not commit `GUMROAD_TOKEN` to the repo. Use `.env`, environment variables, or a token file referenced by `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE`.
    96: - Audit log (activations) is at `./.qflush/license-activations.log`.
    97: 
    98: If you want the fully automated server-driven flow (webhooks + auto-disable), use a public endpoint (ngrok, domain, or server) and enable webhooks in Gumroad. Otherwise the local flow above is safest and simplest.
    99: 
   100:

FILE: D:\qflush\docs\publish-secrets.md
============================
============================
     1: This repository's release publish workflow requires the following GitHub secrets to be set in the repository settings:
     2: 
     3: - `NPM_TOKEN`  npm auth token for publishing the package (if publishing to npm)
     4: - `VSCE_TOKEN`  Personal access token for Visual Studio Marketplace (optional, if using `vsce`)
     5: - `OPENVSX_TOKEN`  token for publishing to Open VSX (optional)
     6: - `AZURE_CREDENTIALS`  Azure service principal JSON if publishing to Azure DevOps (optional)
     7: 
     8: To set a secret:
     9: 1. Go to your GitHub repository -> Settings -> Secrets and variables -> Actions -> New repository secret.
    10: 2. Enter the secret name and value and save.
    11: 
    12: The provided workflow `.github/workflows/publish-on-release.yml` will run on GitHub `release` published events and will build and publish to npm. If you want marketplace or Open VSX publish, adapt the workflow to call `vsce` or `open-vsx-publisher` with the appropriate tokens.

     1: QFLUSH  Repository Analysis
     2: 
     3: Status summary
     4: - Repository: `D:\qflush` (branch `release/3.1.0`)
     5: - Build: `npm run build` succeeded (TypeScript compile)
     6: - Tests: `npm test` (vitest) succeeded (12 tests passed)
     7: - Recent commit: `docs: add architecture,diagrams,copilot context` (created docs and copilot context)
     8: 
     9: Key components and locations
    10: - CLI / entry
    11:   - `src/index.ts`  CLI dispatcher, commands
    12:   - `bin/qflush` / `qflush.cmd` wrappers
    13: - Daemon
    14:   - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts`  express daemon, NPZ endpoints, Rome linker, optional Redis
    15:   - `dist/index.js` (built artifact)
    16: - Supervisor / process manager
    17:   - `@funeste38/bat` (dependency) used via `src/supervisor` and `tools` (BAT orchestrates processes)
    18: - Rome (index + engine + linker)
    19:   - `src/rome/*`  index-loader, engine, linker, events, executor
    20:   - Output stored in `.qflush/rome-index.json` and `.qflush/rome-links.json`
    21: - NPZ (router/admin)
    22:   - `src/utils/npz-*` and endpoints in `src/daemon/qflushd.ts`
    23:   - checksum endpoints: `/npz/checksum/*`
    24: - Nezlephant / envaptex / freeland
    25:   - External packages: `@funeste38/nezlephant`, `@funeste38/envaptex`, `@funeste38/freeland`
    26: - Optional Redis
    27:   - `ioredis` is a dependency; feature flag `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS` controls usage in `src/daemon/qflushd.ts` (currently forced disabled in local edit)
    28: - Mapping feature
    29:   - `QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING` and internal `FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING` control automatic mapping; current build sets `FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING = true` in `qflushd.ts` which disables mapping by default
    30: 
    31: Important files
    32: - `package.json`  scripts, dependencies, bin `qflush`
    33: - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts`  HTTP API, checksum store, rome endpoints, SSE
    34: - `src/index.ts`  CLI entry
    35: - `.qflush/*`  runtime state, logs, indexes, telemetry
    36: - `tools/installer.js` and `installers/`  local install and artifacts
    37: 
    38: Observations & recommendations
    39: 1. Optional services (Redis, mapping) are feature-flagged. Ensure CI and README document how to enable them. Local dev should keep Redis disabled.
    40: 2. Many large untracked or workspace files exist (VS snapshots, `.qflush` runtime data). Add or verify `.gitignore` to avoid committing volatile files.
    41: 3. Tests pass locally  good baseline for further changes. Run tests after any change to `src/rome/*` or `src/daemon/*`.
    42: 4. Consider centralizing feature flags and default config in a single module (e.g., `src/config.ts`) to avoid duplicated checks in code.
    43: 5. Keep `ioredis` optional at runtime by lazy-require and clear logging when disabled (current approach acceptable).
    44: 
    45: Next steps I can take
    46: - Generate a concise module dependency map (visual or textual).
    47: - Create a README section documenting feature flags and local dev setup.
    48: - Search for TODOs and FIXME comments to prioritize tech debt.
    49: 
    50:

     1: # QFLUSH  PLAN CONCRET  EXCUTER
     2: 
     3: Objectif : stabiliser QFLUSH v3.1, intgrer le linker ROME, prparer le terrain A11/SPYDER.
     4:

     7: - Remplacer usages de `node` / `env` nus par process.env (ex: process.env.NODE_ENV).
     8: - S'assurer que tous les shebangs `#!/usr/bin/env node` sont en ligne 1 des fichiers .ts concerns.
     9: - Supprimer ou corriger les `declare module './...'` en noms non-relatifs (ex: 'src/rome/storage').
    10: - Laisser `// @ts-nocheck` sur les polyfills JS et exclure extensions/**/out/** dans tsconfig.
    11: - Vrifier que `npx tsc -p . --noEmit` ne renvoie aucune erreur.
    12: 
    13: tape 2  Intgration du linker ROME
    14: - Crer src/rome/linker.ts avec computeRomeLinks(...) et writeRomeLinks(...), utilisant loadRomeIndexFromDisk() et dtectant les tokens [[token]] dans src/**.
    15: - Ajouter une commande src/commands/rome-links.ts qui appelle computeRomeLinks + writeRomeLinks et log le nombre de refs.
    16: - Brancher rome-links dans le router CLI (qflush rome:links).
    17: - Optionnel : sur onRomeIndexUpdated, relancer computeRomeLinks pour rafrachir .qflush/rome-links.json.
    18: 
    19: tape 3  Pr-release 3.1
    20: - Mettre  jour README pour dcrire QFLUSH v3.x (orchestrateur, daemon, NPZ, checksum, Copilot bridge, Rome linker).
    21: - Vrifier package.json (name, version, bin.qflush).
    22: - Gnrer un .tgz, tester une installation globale locale, puis tagguer v3.1.0.
    23: 
    24: tape 4  Hooks pour A11 / SPYDER (prparation)
    25: - Ajouter des cls A11 / SPYDER dans SERVICE_MAP (mme si les modules ne sont pas encore publis).
    26: - Ajouter des commandes placeholders qflush a11:status et qflush spyder:status qui renvoient un message "coming soon".
    27: - Documenter dans README la roadmap A11 (interface IA) et SPYDER (internet interne).
    28: 
    29: // Fin du plan QFLUSH.

FILE: D:\qflush\docs\quick-start.md
============================
============================
     1: Quick start checklist  QFLUSH (local, NO-REDIS / NO-COPILOT)
     2: 
     3: This file contains a short checklist and copy-paste commands to get QFLUSH running locally in the "NO-REDIS / NO-COPILOT" safe mode used by this repo.
     4: 
     5: 1) Prepare environment
     6: - Copy example env and edit if needed:
     7:   - PowerShell:
     8:     Copy-Item .env.example .env; notepad .env
     9:   - Bash:
    10:     cp .env.example .env && ${EDITOR:-nano} .env
    11: 
    12: - Confirm the following variables are set to disable external services (recommended for dev):
    13:   QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS=1
    14:   QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT=1
    15:   QFLUSH_TELEMETRY=0
    16: 
    17: 2) Install dependencies
    18: - npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    19: 
    20: 3) Build
    21: - npm run build
    22: 
    23: 4) Run tests
    24: - npm test
    25: 
    26: 5) Start daemon (detached recommended)
    27: - Using CLI (detached by default):
    28:   qflush daemon
    29: - Using safe-run (detached):
    30:   qflush safe-run --detach daemon
    31: - Using the detach script via npm:
    32:   npm run detach -- node dist/index.js daemon --detached
    33: 
    34: 6) Quick API checks (after daemon started)
    35: - Store checksum:
    36:   curl -sS -X POST http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/store -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc"}'
    37: - Verify checksum:
    38:   curl -sS -X POST http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/verify -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc"}'
    39: - List checksums:
    40:   curl -sS http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/list
    41: 
    42: 7) Useful scripts
    43: - Detach helper (Node): ./scripts/detach.js
    44: - POSIX watchdog: ./scripts/run-with-timeout.sh
    45: - PowerShell watchdog: ./scripts/run-with-timeout.ps1
    46: 
    47: 8) Re-enable Redis / Copilot (production)
    48: - To re-enable Redis, set REDIS_URL and remove/clear QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS.
    49: - To re-enable Copilot, provide `.qflush/copilot.json` with `enabled:true` and set HMAC/webhook envs.
    50: 
    51: 9) Cleanup helpers
    52: - If you need to force-reset the repo's runtime state:
    53:   - qflush purge
    54:   - npm run run:timeout -- 5 node dist/index.js purge
    55: 
    56: If you want, I can add these entries to `README.md` too.  
    57:
