     1: import * as vscode from 'vscode';
     2: import * as path from 'path';
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as http from 'http';
     5: import * as https from 'https';
     6: 
     7: // import Rome tag utilities
     8: import { makeRomeTagRecord, RomeIndex, normalizeRomePath } from '@rome/rome-tag';
     9: 
    10: const TRIAL_DAYS = 14;
    11: 
    12: function isTrialExpired(context: vscode.ExtensionContext): boolean {
    13:   const started = context.globalState.get<number>('qflush.trialStarted');
    14:   if (!started) return false; // start on first use
    15:   const now = Date.now();
    16:   return now - started > TRIAL_DAYS * 24 * 3600 * 1000;
    17: }
    18: 
    19: function ensureTrialStarted(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
    20:   const started = context.globalState.get<number>('qflush.trialStarted');
    21:   if (!started) context.globalState.update('qflush.trialStarted', Date.now());
    22: }
    23: 
    24: function postJson(urlStr: string, body: any): Promise<any> {
    25:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    26:     try {
    27:       const url = new URL(urlStr);
    28:       const data = JSON.stringify(body || {});
    29:       const opts: any = {
    30:         hostname: url.hostname,
    31:         port: url.port || (url.protocol === 'https:' ? 443 : 80),
    32:         path: url.pathname + (url.search || ''),
    33:         method: 'POST',
    34:         headers: {
    35:           'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    36:           'Content-Length': Buffer.byteLength(data),
    37:         },
    38:       };
    39:       const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
    40:       const req = lib.request(opts, (res) => {
    41:         let raw = '';
    42:         res.setEncoding('utf8');
    43:         res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
    44:         res.on('end', () => {
    45:           try {
    46:             const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
    47:             if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300) resolve(parsed);
    48:             else reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
    49:           } catch (e) {
    50:             reject(e);
    51:           }
    52:         });
    53:       });
    54:       req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
    55:       req.write(data);
    56:       req.end();
    57:     } catch (e) {
    58:       reject(e);
    59:     }
    60:   });
    61: }
    62: 
    63: function getJson(urlStr: string): Promise<any> {
    64:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    65:     try {
    66:       const url = new URL(urlStr);
    67:       const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
    68:       const req = lib.get(urlStr, (res) => {
    69:         let raw = '';
    70:         res.setEncoding('utf8');
    71:         res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
    72:         res.on('end', () => {
    73:           try {
    74:             const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
    75:             if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300) resolve(parsed);
    76:             else reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
    77:           } catch (e) {
    78:             reject(e);
    79:           }
    80:         });
    81:       });
    82:       req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
    83:     } catch (e) {
    84:       reject(e);
    85:     }
    86:   });
    87: }
    88: 
    89: async function saveRomeIndexRecord(record: { path: string; type: string; tag?: string }) {
    90:   try {
    91:     const root = process.cwd();
    92:     const dir = path.join(root, '.qflush');
    93:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    94:     const idxFile = path.join(dir, 'rome-index.json');
    95:     let idx: RomeIndex = {};
    96:     if (fs.existsSync(idxFile)) {
    97:       try { idx = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxFile, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch { idx = {}; }
    98:     }
    99: 
   100:     // normalize path and build canonical record using shared module
   101:     const relPath = normalizeRomePath(record.path);
   102:     const rec = makeRomeTagRecord({ type: record.type, path: relPath });
   103:     idx[rec.path] = rec;
   104: 
   105:     fs.writeFileSync(idxFile, JSON.stringify(idx, null, 2), 'utf8');
   106:     return { success: true, record: idx[rec.path] };
   107:   } catch (e) {
   108:     return { success: false, error: String(e) };
   109:   }
   110: }
   111: 
   112: export function activate(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
   113:   ensureTrialStarted(context);
   114: 
   115:   const openDisposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPanel', () => {
   116:     if (isTrialExpired(context)) {
   117:       vscode.window.showInformationMessage('QFlush trial expired. Click to purchase a license.', 'Purchase', 'Enter Key').then((v) => {
   118:         if (v === 'Purchase') vscode.env.openExternal(vscode.Uri.parse('https://gumroad.com/l/your-product'));
   119:         if (v === 'Enter Key') vscode.commands.executeCommand('qflush.enterLicense');
   120:       });
   121:       return;
   122:     }
   123: 
   124:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel(
   125:       'qflushPanel',
   126:       'QFlush',
   127:       vscode.ViewColumn.One,
   128:       {
   129:         enableScripts: true,
   130:         localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))],
   131:       }
   132:     );
   133: 
   134:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'panel.html');
   135:     let html = '';
   136:     try {
   137:       html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
   138:     } catch (e) {
   139:       html = `<html><body><pre>panel.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
   140:     }
   141: 
   142:     panel.webview.html = html;
   143: 
   144:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   145:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   146:     const token = cfg.get<string>('adminToken') || '';
   147: 
   148:     // Send config to webview securely via postMessage
   149:     panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'config', daemonUrl, token });
   150: 
   151:     // Handle messages from the webview
   152:     panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(
   153:       async (message) => {
   154:         if (message && message.type === 'saveConfig') {
   155:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   156:           await cfg.update('daemonUrl', message.daemonUrl, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   157:           await cfg.update('adminToken', message.token, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
   158:           panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'saved', info: 'Configuration saved' });
   159:         }
   160:       },
   161:       undefined,
   162:       context.subscriptions
   163:     );
   164:   });
   165: 
   166:   const openPourparler = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPourparler', () => {
   167:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPourparler', 'Pourparler', vscode.ViewColumn.One, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   168:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'pourparler-web.html');
   169:     let html = '';
   170:     try { html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8'); } catch (e) { html = `<html><body><pre>pourparler-web.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`; }
   171:     panel.webview.html = html;
   172: 
   173:     panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (msg) => {
   174:       try {
   175:         if (msg && msg.type === 'export') {
   176:           const destUri = await vscode.window.showSaveDialog({ defaultUri: vscode.Uri.file(path.join(process.cwd(), msg.filename)), filters: { 'Images': ['png','svg'] } });
   177:           if (!destUri) return;
   178:           if (msg.format === 'svg') {
   179:             fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, msg.data, 'utf8');
   180:           } else if (msg.format === 'png') {
   181:             // data url -> binary
   182:             const base64 = msg.data.split(',')[1];
   183:             const buf = Buffer.from(base64, 'base64');
   184:             fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, buf);
   185:           }
   186:           vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`Exported ${msg.filename}`);
   187:         }
   188: 
   189:         // new messages from pourparler webview
   190:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzList') {
   191:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   192:           const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   193:           try {
   194:             const data = await getJson(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
   195:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data });
   196:           } catch (e) {
   197:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   198:           }
   199:         }
   200: 
   201:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzClear') {
   202:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   203:           const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   204:           try {
   205:             const resp = await fetch(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
   206:             const j = await resp.json();
   207:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: j });
   208:           } catch (e) {
   209:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
   210:           }
   211:         }
   212: 
   213:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzIndexTag') {
   214:           const rec = msg.payload;
   215:           const r = await saveRomeIndexRecord({ path: rec.path, type: rec.type, tag: rec.tag });
   216:           panel.webview.postMessage(Object.assign({ type: 'npzIndexTagResult' }, r));
   217:         }
   218:       } catch (e) {
   219:         vscode.window.showErrorMessage('Extension message handler failed: ' + String(e));
   220:       }
   221:     }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
   222:   });
   223: 
   224:   const enterLicense = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.enterLicense', async () => {
   225:     const key = await vscode.window.showInputBox({ prompt: 'Enter your QFlush license key' });
   226:     if (!key) return;
   227: 
   228:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   229:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   230:     const activateUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/activate`;
   231: 
   232:     const progressOptions: vscode.ProgressOptions = { location: vscode.ProgressLocation.Notification, title: 'Activating QFlush license...', cancellable: false };
   233:     try {
   234:       await vscode.window.withProgress(progressOptions, async () => {
   235:         const res = await postJson(activateUrl, { key });
   236:         // store license info locally in extension globalState
   237:         await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseKey', key);
   238:         await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseInfo', res.license || res);
   239:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('License activated successfully. Thanks!');
   240:       });
   241:     } catch (err: any) {
   242:         vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`License activation failed: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   243:     }
   244:   });
   245: 
   246:   const showStatus = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.showLicenseStatus', async () => {
   247:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
   248:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
   249:     const statusUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/status`;
   250:     try {
   251:       const res = await getJson(statusUrl);
   252:       if (!res || !res.success) {
   253:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No license information available');
   254:         return;
   255:       }
   256:       const lic = res.license;
   257:       if (!lic) {
   258:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No local license installed');
   259:         return;
   260:       }
   261:       const exp = lic.expiresAt ? new Date(lic.expiresAt).toLocaleString() : 'never (subscription)';
   262:       vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`License: ${lic.key} product=${lic.product_id} expires=${exp} valid=${res.valid}`);
   263:     } catch (err: any) {
   264:       vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`Failed to fetch status: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
   265:     }
   266:   });
   267: 
   268:   const openTelemetry = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openTelemetry', () => {
   269:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushTelemetry', 'QFlush Telemetry', vscode.ViewColumn.Two, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
   270:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'telemetry-view.html');
   271:     let html = '';
   272:     try { html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8'); } catch (e) { html = `<html><body><pre>telemetry-view.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`; }
   273:     panel.webview.html = html;
   274:   });
   275: 
   276:   context.subscriptions.push(openDisposable, openPourparler, enterLicense, showStatus, openTelemetry);
   277: }
   278: 
   279: export function deactivate() {}
   280:

FILE: D:\qflush\extensions\vscode-npz\src\polyfill-file.js
============================
============================
     1: // Polyfill minimal File/Blob for Node environments when libraries expect browser globals
     2: if (typeof globalThis.File === 'undefined') {
     3:   globalThis.File = class File extends Uint8Array {
     4:     constructor(parts = [], name = 'file', options = {}) {
     5:       // naive implementation: store data as concatenated string/Uint8Array
     6:       const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
     7:       const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
     8:       super(buf);
     9:       this.name = name;
    10:       this.lastModified = options.lastModified || Date.now();
    11:       this.size = buf.length;
    12:       this.type = options.type || '';
    13:     }
    14:     text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
    15:     arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
    16:     stream() { throw new Error('stream() not implemented'); }
    17:   };
    18: }
    19: if (typeof globalThis.Blob === 'undefined') {
    20:   globalThis.Blob = class Blob extends Uint8Array {
    21:     constructor(parts = [], options = {}) {
    22:       const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
    23:       const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
    24:       super(buf);
    25:       this.size = buf.length;
    26:       this.type = options.type || '';
    27:     }
    28:     text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
    29:     arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
    30:   };
    31: }
    32:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\FUNESTERIE-ARCHITECTURE.md
============================
============================
     1: FUNESTERIE  Architecture & Vision
     2: 
     3: Objectif
     4: --------
     5: Crer un cosystme modulaire et volutif o chaque couche a une responsabilit unique et communique via interfaces claires : QFLUSH (orchestrateur), ROME (moteur logique / indexeur), NPZ (router / admin), BAT (process manager), Nezlephant/OC8 (stockage cach), A11 (interface IA), SPYDER (futur moteur neuronal).
     6: 
     7: Sommaire des composants
     8: -----------------------
     9: 
    10: 1) QFLUSH  Orchestrateur
    11: - CLI + daemon HTTP.
    12: - Commandes principales : `start`, `kill`, `purge`, `inspect`, `config`, `daemon`.
    13: - Supervise les modules, expose NPZ/Rome endpoints, centralise la config et le SmartChain pipeline.
    14: 
    15: 2) BAT  Process Manager
    16: - Spawn / stop / restart / status.
    17: - Dtache les services (non bloquant), persiste tat dans `.qflush/services.json`, logs dans `.qflush/logs/`.
    18: - Strictement process management  pas de router ni logique.
    19: 
    20: 3) NPZ (Joker)  Router & Admin
    21: - Router et diagnostics pour les modules.
    22: - Endpoints exposs par le daemon : checksums, rome-index, rome-links, resolve, SSE stream.
    23: - CLI : `qflush npz:inspect`, `qflush npz:scores`.
    24: - Stockage : fallback mmoire/fichiers; Redis optionnel (optin via `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS`).
    25: 
    26: 4) ROME  Index, Engine, Logic, Linker
    27: - Indexation des sources annotes (`ROME-TAG`)  `.qflush/rome-index.json`.
    28: - Engine value lindex et met des actions (computeEngineActionsSafe).
    29: - Logic rules (dclaratives) dclenchent actions  la change.
    30: - Linker (v3.1): scan `[[token]]`, rsout cibles, gnre `.qflush/rome-links.json`, fournit rsolution HTTP et SSE.
    31: 
    32: 5) Nezlephant / OC8  Stockage cach RGBA
    33: - Encodage/dcodage de blobs (PNG / RGBA / OC8).
    34: - Usage pour secrets (`nez:<file>`), configs, payloads.
    35: - Intgration via `envapt-nezlephant`.
    36: 
    37: 6) A11  Interface IA (prvu)
    38: - Proxy/local LLM connector (Ollama/OpenAI/Gemini).
    39: - Orchestration dappels IA pour augmentation des rgles NPZ/ROME.
    40: 
    41: 7) SPYDER  Futur moteur neuronal
    42: - Architecture envisage : graph de  neurones  (.ner), snapshots, routage dtat  rponses.
    43: - Intgration future avec A11 et NPZ.
    44: 
    45: Le Mapping (principes)
    46: ----------------------
    47: - Ordre de priorit strict pour la rsolution des chemins :
    48:   1. Chemin explicite fourni
    49:   2. Chemin dtect (detectModules)
    50:   3. Chemin local candidate
    51:   4. Rsolution via node_modules/package
    52:   5. Fallback NPZ (optionnel)
    53: - Early-exit : si un chemin est valide  ne pas r-interprter.
    54: 
    55: Daemon (qflushd)
    56: -----------------
    57: - Expose les endpoints NPZ et Rome.
    58: - Supervise engineHistory et telemetry (Copilot Bridge).
    59: - SSE stream pour rome-links & telemetry.
    60: - Audit log, option Redis.
    61: 
    62: Copilot Bridge
    63: --------------
    64: - Envoie vnements/rgles/tlmetry vers lextension VS et services IA.
    65: - Fournit un canal bidirectionnel (notifications  actions).
    66: 
    67: Principes dexploitation & Dev
    68: ------------------------------
    69: - En dev : garder Redis dsactiv (fallback mmoire).
    70: - Activer mapping uniquement quand ncessaire (`QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING=1`).
    71: - Dmarrer le daemon dtach pour viter douvrir fichiers dans lIDE (`qflush daemon --detached`).
    72: 
    73: Fichiers utiles
    74: ---------------
    75: - `.qflush/rome-index.json`  Rome index
    76: - `.qflush/rome-links.json`  linker output
    77: - `.qflush/services.json` & `.qflush/logs/`  BAT state & logs
    78: 
    79: Next steps recommands
    80: ----------------------
    81: - Ajouter ce doc au README (done).
    82: - Gnrer un diagramme SVG/PNG et lajouter dans `docs/`.
    83: - Crer `copilot-context.md` (trs court) pour fournir le rsum  Copilot.
    84: - Intgrer tests unitaires pour NPZ encoder / checksum / linker.
    85: 
    86: Notes
    87: -----
    88: - SPYDER et A11 sont des objectifs long terme. Pour linstant conserver les noms est acceptable ; implmentations futures clarifieront les responsabilits.
    89: 
    90: 
    91:

     1: To push your changes to a remote repository:
     2: 
     3: 1) Create a remote (GitHub) repository.
     4: 2) Add remote locally:
     5:    git remote add origin git@github.com:<user>/<repo>.git
     6: 3) Push branch:
     7:    git push -u origin master
     8: 
     9: If you need an HTTPS remote:
    10:    git remote add origin https://github.com/<user>/<repo>.git
    11:    git push -u origin master
    12:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\installers\install-qflush.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: PowerShell installer for QFLUSH
     3: Supports:
     4:  - user install (default): copies package to %APPDATA% and adds to PATH for current user
     5:  - system install: copies package to C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush and adds to system PATH (requires elevation)
     6:  - npm global install: runs `npm install -g @funeste38/qflush` if package is published
     7: 
     8: Usage:
     9:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode user
    10:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode system
    11:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm
    12: #>
    13: param(
    14:     [ValidateSet('user','system','npm')]
    15:     [string]$Mode = 'user'
    16: )
    17: 
    18: function Add-PathUser {
    19:     param([string]$dir)
    20:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'User')
    21:     if ($current -notlike "*${dir}*") {
    22:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'User')
    23:         Write-Host "Added $dir to user PATH"
    24:     } else {
    25:         Write-Host "$dir already in user PATH"
    26:     }
    27: }
    28: 
    29: function Add-PathMachine {
    30:     param([string]$dir)
    31:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'Machine')
    32:     if ($current -notlike "*${dir}*") {
    33:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'Machine')
    34:         Write-Host "Added $dir to machine PATH"
    35:     } else {
    36:         Write-Host "$dir already in machine PATH"
    37:     }
    38: }
    39: 
    40: if ($Mode -eq 'npm') {
    41:     Write-Host "Installing via npm global..."
    42:     npm install -g @funeste38/qflush
    43:     exit $?
    44: }
    45: 
    46: # assume script run from repo root or from extracted package
    47: $scriptDir = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition
    48: $source = Join-Path $scriptDir '..' 'dist'
    49: 
    50: if ($Mode -eq 'user') {
    51:     $dest = Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'Funeste38\QFlush'
    52:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
    53:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
    54:     Add-PathUser -dir $dest
    55:     Write-Host "Installed QFLUSH to $dest (user)"
    56:     exit 0
    57: }
    58: 
    59: if ($Mode -eq 'system') {
    60:     if (-not ([Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal][Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()).IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) {
    61:         Write-Error "System install requires elevation. Run PowerShell as Administrator."
    62:         exit 1
    63:     }
    64:     $dest = 'C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush'
    65:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
    66:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
    67:     Add-PathMachine -dir $dest
    68:     Write-Host "Installed QFLUSH to $dest (system)"
    69:     exit 0
    70: }
    71: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\installers\install-qflushd.ps1
============================
============================
     1: # PowerShell installer for qflushd (Windows service wrapper)
     2: # This is an example; for production use consider NSSM or sc.exe wrapper.
     3: 
     4: Write-Host "This script downloads qflush and registers qflushd as a scheduled task or service."
     5: Write-Host "Manual step: create a Windows service pointing to 'node dist/daemon/qflushd.js' using nssm or sc.exe."
     6: 
     7: # Example using nssm (assuming nssm.exe is available):
     8: # nssm install qflushd "C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe" "C:\path\to\qflush\dist\daemon\qflushd.js"
     9: 
    10: Write-Host "Install instructions provided."


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\installers\NE-LINER.txt
============================
============================
     1: NE-LINER  Corrected oneliner & notes (FR)
     2: 
     3: But / Purpose
     4: -----------
     5: Court rappel et oneliner corrig pour installer / dmarrer `qflush` sans confusion avec `qflush`.
     6: 
     7: Oneliner PowerShell (installe et excute l'installateur officiel pour `qflush`):
     8: 
     9:   iwr -useb https://funeste38.org/install-qflush.ps1 | iex
    10: 
    11: Remarques importantes
    12: ---------------------
    13: - Nom correct du binaire : `qflush` (pas `qflush`).
    14: - Le shim `%APPDATA%\\npm\\qflush.cmd` / `qflush.ps1` doit appeler le wrapper JS ou `dist/index.js`.
    15:   - Pour la version, le shim doit appeler de faon sre :
    16:     node "<path-to-package>/package.json" via un petit wrapper JS ou `node -e "try{console.log(require('...').version)}catch(e){console.log('unknown')}"`.
    17:   - Prfrence: utiliser un `qflush-cli.js` wrapper (vite les problmes d'chappement avec `node -e`).
    18: 
    19: Vrifications aprs installation
    20: --------------------------------
    21: 1. Vrifier que le package global existe :
    22:    npm root -g
    23:    (cherchez `@funeste38/qflush` sous ce chemin)
    24: 
    25: 2. Vrifier que les shims sont prsents dans :
    26:    %APPDATA%\\npm
    27:    - qflush.cmd
    28:    - qflush.ps1
    29:    - qflush-cli.js (wrapper recommand)
    30: 
    31: 3. Vrifier le PATH utilisateur inclut `%APPDATA%\\npm` :
    32:    [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH','User')
    33:    Si absent : setx PATH "$([Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH','User'));%APPDATA%\\npm" puis fermer/rouvrir le shell.
    34: 
    35: 4. Tester :
    36:    & "%APPDATA%\\npm\\qflush.cmd" --version
    37:    qflush --version   (aprs rouverture du terminal)
    38: 
    39: Index / fichiers crits
    40: -----------------------
    41: - L'index Rome est lu depuis `.qflush/rome-index.json` dans la racine du workspace.
    42: - S'assurer que rien d'autre n'ouvre l'index automatiquement (mapping guarded by QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING or FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING).
    43: 
    44: Modifications appliques
    45: -----------------------
    46: J'ai corrig les scripts et docs suivants pour utiliser le nom `qflush` et chemins cohrents :
    47: - `installers/ONE-LINER.txt` (one-liner now references `install-qflush.ps1`)
    48: - `installers/install-all.ps1` (uses `QFlush` naming, destination folder `Funeste38\QFlush`)
    49: - `installers/install-qflush.ps1` (messages updated to `qflush`, package name `@funeste38/qflush`)
    50: - `installers/install-qflushd.ps1` (messages updated to `qflushd`)
    51: - Created wrapper/shims: `%APPDATA%\\npm\\qflush-cli.js`, `qflush.cmd`, `qflush.ps1` when repairing installation.
    52: 
    53: Notes pour devs
    54: ---------------
    55: - viter d'utiliser `node -e` avec des chemins Windows bruts dans les shims ; prfrer un wrapper JS.
    56: - Si un autre binaire `qflush` existe, dsinstallez le pour viter collision :
    57:   npm uninstall -g @funeste38/qflush
    58: 
    59: Si tu veux que je renomme physiquement les scripts `install-qflush.ps1`  `install-qflush.ps1` et `install-qflushd.ps1`  `install-qflushd.ps1`, disle et je le ferai (cela crera de nouveaux files and update references).
    60: 
    61: 
    62:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\installers\README-install.md
============================
============================
     1: # QFLUSH Installer
     2: 
     3: This folder contains a PowerShell installer `install-qflush.ps1` that can:
     4: 
     5: - Install QFLUSH for the current user (default) by copying compiled `dist` files to `%APPDATA%\Funeste38\QFlush` and adding the folder to user PATH.
     6: - Install QFLUSH system-wide (requires Administrator) by copying to `C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush` and adding to machine PATH.
     7: - Install via npm global if the package is published: `install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm`.
     8: 
     9: Usage examples:
    10: 
    11: PowerShell (current user):
    12: PS> .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode user
    13: 
    14: PowerShell (system/admin):
    15: PS> Start-Process powershell -Verb runAs -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File "install-qflush.ps1" -Mode system'
    16: 
    17: NPM global install (requires published package):
    18: PS> .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm
    19: 
    20: ## Notes
    21: 
    22: Use `qflush --help` after installation to list available commands.
    23:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\netlify\functions\gumroad-webhook.js
============================
============================
     1: const fetch = require('node-fetch');
     2: 
     3: exports.handler = async function(event, context) {
     4:   try {
     5:     const body = event.body ? JSON.parse(event.body) : {};
     6:     // optional: verify signature if you have one
     7:     // forward to the local daemon if DAEMON_URL is set, otherwise process here
     8:     const daemonUrl = process.env.DAEMON_URL || '';
     9:     if (daemonUrl) {
    10:       const url = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/qflush/license/webhook`;
    11:       await fetch(url, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(body) });
    12:       return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: true, forwarded: url }) };
    13:     }
    14:     // example local processing: check refund
    15:     const purchase = body.purchase || body.data || null;
    16:     let action = 'noop';
    17:     if (purchase) {
    18:       if (purchase.refunded || purchase.chargebacked) action = 'clear_license';
    19:       if (purchase.subscription_cancelled_at) action = 'cancel_subscription';
    20:     }
    21:     return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: true, action }) };
    22:   } catch (err) {
    23:     return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: false, error: String(err) }) };
    24:   }
    25: };
    26: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\netlify\functions\token-exchange.js
============================
============================
     1: const fetch = require('node-fetch');
     2: 
     3: exports.handler = async function(event, context) {
     4:   try {
     5:     const tokenUrl = process.env.TOKEN_URL;
     6:     const clientId = process.env.APP_ID;
     7:     const clientSecret = process.env.APP_SECRET;
     8:     if (!tokenUrl || !clientId || !clientSecret) return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:false, error:'missing config' }) };
     9: 
    10:     // perform client_credentials exchange
    11:     const params = new URLSearchParams();
    12:     params.append('grant_type', 'client_credentials');
    13: 
    14:     const res = await fetch(tokenUrl, {
    15:       method: 'POST',
    16:       headers: {
    17:         'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded',
    18:         'Authorization': 'Basic ' + Buffer.from(clientId + ':' + clientSecret).toString('base64')
    19:       },
    20:       body: params.toString()
    21:     });
    22:     const json = await res.json();
    23:     // optionally store token in Netlify env (not possible from function), so return it to caller
    24:     return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:true, token: json }) };
    25:   } catch (err) {
    26:     return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:false, error:String(err) }) };
    27:   }
    28: };
    29:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\PUBLISH.md
============================
============================
     1: # Publishing @qflush/qflush
     2: 
     3: This document explains how to publish the `@qflush/qflush` package to npm and includes recommended `package.json` fields.
     4: 
     5: NOTE: The public npm listing (package page) is currently under reconstruction. The package can still be published and installed via `npm install @qflush/qflush`, but the npm website display may be incomplete until the rebuild is finished.
     6: 
     7: Checklist before publishing:
     8: 
     9: - Bump `version` in `package.json` if republishing.
    10: - Ensure `dist/index.js` exists and starts with `#!/usr/bin/env node`.
    11: - Run `npm run build` and verify `dist` contains compiled JS and `.d.ts` files.
    12: - Run `node dist/index.js --help` to verify CLI runs.
    13: - Run `npm pack` to inspect the tarball contents before publishing.
    14: - Ensure `package.json` `bin` points to `dist/index.js`.
    15: - If using `.npmignore`, ensure it does not exclude `dist`.
    16: - Confirm `prepare` script in `package.json` is present to auto-build on publish.
    17: 
    18: Recommended package.json fields:
    19: 
    20: ```json
    21: {
    22:   "name": "@qflush/qflush",
    23:   "version": "0.0.0",
    24:   "description": "QFLUSH  The Funesterie Runtime System",
    25:   "main": "dist/index.js",
    26:   "bin": { "qflush": "dist/index.js" },
    27:   "files": ["dist", "README.md"],
    28:   "publishConfig": { "access": "public" }
    29: }
    30: ```
    31: 
    32: Publish steps:
    33: 
    34: 1. Login to npm: `npm login` (use account that owns `@qflush` scope)
    35: 2. From project root `cd qflush`
    36: 3. Build: `npm run build`
    37: 4. Publish: `npm publish --access public`
    38: 
    39: Testing globally without publishing:
    40: 
    41: - Link locally: `cd qflush && npm link`
    42: - Test: `qflush --help` or `qflush start` or `qflush checksum list`
    43: - Remove link: `npm unlink -g @qflush/qflush`
    44: 
    45: Notes on 2FA:
    46: 
    47: - If your npm account requires 2FA for publishing, you'll be prompted for the OTP.
    48: 
    49: Troubleshooting:
    50: 
    51: - If publish fails due to package name, ensure the scope `@qflush` exists and you have permission to publish under it.
    52: - If `dist` missing on publish, `prepare` should build, but check logs for errors.
    53: 
    54:

  2347: 
  2348: ============================
  2349: FILE: D:\qflush\.github\README-open-vsx.md
  2350: ============================
  2351: ============================
  2352:      1: Open VSX publish setup
  2353:      2: 
  2354:      3: 1. In the Open VSX website sign the Publisher Agreement and create a Personal Access Token.
  2355:      4: 2. In your GitHub repository go to Settings  Secrets  Actions and add a new secret named `OPEN_VSX_TOKEN` with the token value.
  2356:      5: 3. Tag a release (e.g. `v3.0.1`) or push a tag matching `v*` to trigger the workflow.
  2357:      6: 
  2358:      7: Notes:
  2359:      8: - The workflow will build the extension and attempt to publish using `npx ovsx publish`.
  2360:      9: - If publishing fails, the package `.vsix` remains available in the workflow artifacts (you can modify the workflow to upload artifacts).
  2361:     10: 
  2362: 
  2363: 
  2364: ============================
  2365: FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\ci-no-supervisor.yml
  2366: ============================
  2367: ============================
  2368:      1: name: CI (no supervisor)
  2369:      2: 
  2370:      3: on:
  2371:      4:   push:
  2372:      5:   workflow_dispatch:
  2373:      6: 
  2374:      7: jobs:
  2375:      8:   build-and-test:
  2376:      9:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  2377:     10: 
  2378:     11:     env:
  2379:     12:       # Pas de superviseur (ou bien il est ignor)
  2380:     13:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
  2381:     14:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
  2382:     15:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
  2383:     16:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
  2384:     17: 
  2385:     18:     steps:
  2386:     19:       - name: Checkout repo
  2387:     20:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
  2388:     21: 
  2389:     22:       - name: Install dependencies
  2390:     23:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
  2391:     24: 
  2392:     25:       - name: Build dist
  2393:     26:         run: npm run build
  2394:     27: 
  2395:     28:       - name: Start qflush daemon
  2396:     29:         run: |
  2397:     30:           node dist/daemon/qflushd.js &
  2398:     31:           echo "Daemon started on port ${QFLUSHD_PORT:-4500}"
  2399:     32: 
  2400:     33:       # Optional: wait for daemon readiness (uncomment if you want polling)
  2401:     34:       # - name: Wait for daemon
  2402:     35:       #   run: |
  2403:     36:       #     for i in {1..30}; do
  2404:     37:       #       if curl -fsS "http://127.0.0.1:${QFLUSHD_PORT:-4500}/npz/rome-index" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  2405:     38:       #         echo "Daemon is ready"
  2406:     39:       #         exit 0
  2407:     40:       #       fi
  2408:     41:       #       echo "Waiting daemon..."
  2409:     42:       #       sleep 2
  2410:     43:       #     done
  2411:     44:       #     echo "Daemon did not become ready in time"
  2412:     45:       #     exit 1
  2413:     46: 
  2414:     47:       - name: Run tests
  2415:     48:         run: npm test
  2416:     49: 
  2417:

  2435:     13:       QFLUSH_SAFE_CI: '1'
  2436:     14:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
  2437:     15:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
  2438:     16:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'

  2443:     21:         uses: actions/checkout@v4

  2446:     24:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
  2447:     25:

  2479:     14:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
  2480:     15:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'

  2482:     17: 
  2483:     18:     steps:

  2485:     20:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
  2486:     21:

  2499:     34:         run: |
  2500:     35:           # Use canonical service names: 'bat' and 'spyder'

  2502:     37:             --services "bat,spyder,nezlephant,freeland" \
  2503:     38:             --verbose

  2510: ============================
  2511: FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\ci.yml
  2512: ============================
  2513: ============================
  2514:      1: name: CI
  2515:      2: 
  2516:      3: on:
  2517:      4:   workflow_dispatch:
  2518:      5:     inputs:
  2519:      6:       enable_supervisor:
  2520:      7:         description: "Set to '0' to enable supervisor in CI run, '1' to disable. Default disables supervisor."
  2521:      8:         default: '1'
  2522:      9:   push:
  2523:     10:     branches: [ master, main, 'fix/*' ]
  2524:     11:   pull_request:
  2525:     12:     branches: [ master, main ]
  2526:     13: 
  2527:     14: permissions:
  2528:     15:   contents: write
  2529:     16: 
  2530:     17: jobs:
  2531:     18:   build-and-test:
  2532:     19:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  2533:     20:     env:
  2534:     21:       QFLUSH_SKIP_GLOBAL_INSTALLS: '1'
  2535:     22:       # Enable embedded service manager and safe CI mode for plumbing tests
  2536:     23:       QFLUSH_EMBED_SERVICES: '1'
  2537:     24:       QFLUSH_SAFE_CI: '1'
  2538:     25:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
  2539:     26:       QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
  2540:     27:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT: '1'
  2541:     28:       QFLUSH_TELEMETRY: '0'
  2542:     29:     steps:
  2543:     30:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  2544:     31:         with:
  2545:     32:           fetch-depth: 0
  2546:     33:           persist-credentials: true
  2547:     34:       - name: Configure git
  2548:     35:         run: |
  2549:     36:           git config --global user.email "actions@github.com"
  2550:     37:           git config --global user.name "github-actions"
  2551:     38:           git config --global --add safe.directory "${{ github.workspace }}"
  2552:     39:       - name: Use Node.js 20
  2553:     40:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  2554:     41:         with:
  2555:     42:           node-version: '20'
  2556:     43:       - name: Install dependencies
  2557:     44:         run: |
  2558:     45:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
  2559:     46:       - name: Fix alias imports (convert @utils/*  relative)
  2560:     47:         run: |
  2561:     48:           node tools/fix-utils-imports.js src/utils src/commands || true
  2562:     49:       - name: Build (tsc) and capture logs
  2563:     50:         run: |
  2564:     51:           npx tsc -p . --pretty false > tsc-output.log 2>&1 || (echo "tsc failed, printing log:" && sed -n '1,200p' tsc-output.log && exit 1)
  2565:     52:           echo "tsc succeeded"
  2566:     53:       - name: Build optional spyder
  2567:     54:         run: |
  2568:     55:           if [ -f spyder/package.json ]; then
  2569:     56:             echo "Building spyder (optional)..."
  2570:     57:             npm --prefix spyder run build || echo "spyder build failed or not present, continuing"
  2571:     58:           else
  2572:     59:             echo "No spyder package, skipping build"
  2573:     60:           fi
  2574:     61:       - name: Show dist contents (diagnostic)
  2575:     62:         run: |
  2576:     63:           echo "dist tree:" && ls -la dist || echo "dist directory not present"
  2577:     64:       - name: Ensure .qflush config exists
  2578:     65:         run: |
  2579:     66:           mkdir -p .qflush
  2580:     67:           if [ ! -f .qflush/logic-config.json ]; then echo '{}' > .qflush/logic-config.json; fi
  2581:     68:           if [ ! -f .qflush/logic-vars.json ]; then echo '{}' > .qflush/logic-vars.json; fi
  2582:     69:       - name: Start qflush daemon (background)
  2583:     70:         env:
  2584:     71:           QFLUSHD_PORT: '43421'
  2585:     72:         run: |
  2586:     73:           nohup node ./dist/daemon/qflushd.js > qflushd.log 2>&1 & echo $! > qflushd.pid
  2587:     74:           npx wait-on -t 30000 http://localhost:${QFLUSHD_PORT}/npz/rome-index || true
  2588:     75:       - name: Start embedded services (test plumbing)
  2589:     76:         run: |
  2590:     77:           # start services via embedded service manager; SAFE_CI will skip actual starts but exercise plumbing
  2591:     78:           node dist/index.js start --services "bat,spyder,nezlephant,freeland" --verbose || true
  2592:     79:       - name: Run tests
  2593:     80:         env:
  2594:     81:           VITEST: "1"
  2595:     82:           QFLUSHD_PORT: '43421'
  2596:     83:           QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS: '0'
  2597:     84:           QFLUSH_SKIP_GLOBAL_INSTALLS: '1'
  2598:     85:         run: |
  2599:     86:           npm test
  2600:     87:       - name: Teardown qflush daemon
  2601:     88:         if: always()
  2602:     89:         run: |
  2603:     90:           if [ -f qflushd.pid ]; then kill $(cat qflushd.pid) || true; fi
  2604:     91:           tail -n 200 qflushd.log || true
  2605:     92: 
  2606:     93:   integration-dry-run:
  2607:     94:     needs: build-and-test
  2608:     95:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  2609:     96:     timeout-minutes: 60
  2610:     97:     env:
  2611:     98:       REDIS_URL: ''
  2612:     99:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
  2613:    100:     steps:
  2614:    101:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  2615:    102:         with:
  2616:    103:           fetch-depth: 0
  2617:    104:           persist-credentials: true
  2618:    105:       - name: Use Node.js 20
  2619:    106:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  2620:    107:         with:
  2621:    108:           node-version: '20'
  2622:    109:       - name: Install dependencies
  2623:    110:         run: |
  2624:    111:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
  2625:    112:       - name: Build
  2626:    113:         run: |
  2627:    114:           npm run build
  2628:    115:       - name: Integration dry-run
  2629:    116:         run: |
  2630:    117:           node dist/index.js start --verbose --dry-run
  2631:    118: 
  2632:    119:   engine-dry-run:
  2633:    120:     needs: build-and-test
  2634:    121:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  2635:    122:     timeout-minutes: 20
  2636:    123:     env:
  2637:    124:       REDIS_URL: ''
  2638:    125:       QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR: '1'
  2639:    126:     steps:
  2640:    127:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  2641:    128:         with:
  2642:    129:           fetch-depth: 0
  2643:    130:           persist-credentials: true
  2644:    131:       - name: Use Node.js
  2645:    132:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  2646:    133:         with:
  2647:    134:           node-version: '20'
  2648:    135:       - name: Install
  2649:    136:         run: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
  2650:    137:       - name: Build
  2651:    138:         run: npm run build
  2652:    139:       - name: Engine dry-run (validate rules)
  2653:    140:         run: |
  2654:    141:           node dist/index.js engine --dry-run
  2655:    142:         timeout-minutes: 10

  2658: 
  2659: ============================
  2660: FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\create-pr-from-branch.yml
  2661: ============================
  2662: ============================
  2663:      1: name: Create PR from branch
  2664:      2: 
  2665:      3: on:
  2666:      4:   workflow_dispatch:
  2667:      5:     inputs:
  2668:      6:       head_branch:
  2669:      7:         description: 'Branch name to create PR from'
  2670:      8:         required: true
  2671:      9:         default: 'feat/tools-encoders'
  2672:     10:       base_branch:
  2673:     11:         description: 'Target base branch'
  2674:     12:         required: true
  2675:     13:         default: 'main'
  2676:     14:       title:
  2677:     15:         description: 'PR title'
  2678:     16:         required: true
  2679:     17:         default: 'feat(tools): add encoders and css encoder/decoder'
  2680:     18:       body:
  2681:     19:         description: 'PR body'
  2682:     20:         required: false
  2683:     21:         default: 'Add tools: tools/rgba_brotli_oc8.py, tools/css_encode.js, tools/css_decode.js.'
  2684:     22: 
  2685:     23: jobs:
  2686:     24:   create-pr:
  2687:     25:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  2688:     26:     steps:
  2689:     27:       - name: Create PR via REST API
  2690:     28:         env:
  2691:     29:           GH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.ACTIONS_TOKEN }}
  2692:     30:           GITHUB_API_URL: https://api.github.com
  2693:     31:         run: |
  2694:     32:           if [ -z "$GH_TOKEN" ]; then
  2695:     33:             echo "ERROR: ACTIONS_TOKEN secret is not set in repository secrets." >&2
  2696:     34:             exit 1
  2697:     35:           fi
  2698:     36:           echo "Creating PR from '${{ github.event.inputs.head_branch }}' -> '${{ github.event.inputs.base_branch }}'"
  2699:     37:           payload=$(jq -n --arg title "${{ github.event.inputs.title }}" --arg head "${{ github.event.inputs.head_branch }}" --arg base "${{ github.event.inputs.base_branch }}" --arg body "${{ github.event.inputs.body }}" '{title:$title,head:$head,base:$base,body:$body}')
  2700:     38:           echo "$payload" | jq .
  2701:     39:           resp=$(curl -s -H "Authorization: Bearer $GH_TOKEN" -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" -H "User-Agent: qflush-bot" "$GITHUB_API_URL/repos/${{ github.repository }}/pulls" -d @-)
  2702:     40:           echo "$resp" | jq .
  2703:     41:           url=$(echo "$resp" | jq -r .html_url)
  2704:     42:           if [ "$url" = "null" ] || [ -z "$url" ]; then
  2705:     43:             echo "Failed to create PR; response above." >&2
  2706:     44:             exit 1
  2707:     45:           fi
  2708:     46:           echo "PR created: $url"
  2709:     47: 
  2710: 
  2711: 
  2712: ============================
  2713: FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\get-installation-token.yml
  2714: ============================
  2715: ============================
  2716:      1: name: Get GitHub App Installation Token
  2717:      2: 
  2718:      3: on:
  2719:      4:   workflow_dispatch:
  2720:      5: 
  2721:      6: permissions:
  2722:      7:   contents: read
  2723:      8: 
  2724:      9: jobs:
  2725:     10:   get-token:
  2726:     11:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  2727:     12:     steps:
  2728:     13:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  2729:     14:         with:
  2730:     15:           fetch-depth: 0
  2731:     16: 
  2732:     17:       - name: Use Node.js 20
  2733:     18:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  2734:     19:         with:
  2735:     20:           node-version: '20'
  2736:     21: 
  2737:     22:       - name: Install @octokit/auth-app
  2738:     23:         run: |
  2739:     24:           npm install @octokit/auth-app --no-audit --no-fund
  2740:     25: 
  2741:     26:       - name: Write private key to file (from secret)
  2742:     27:         env:
  2743:     28:           PRIVATE_KEY_PEM: ${{ secrets.PRIVATE_KEY_PEM }}
  2744:     29:         run: |
  2745:     30:           set -euo pipefail
  2746:     31:           printf '%s' "$PRIVATE_KEY_PEM" > private.pem
  2747:     32:           # trim surrounding quotes if any
  2748:     33:           sed -i "1s/^['\"]//;\$s/['\"]$//" private.pem || true
  2749:     34:           echo "Private key head:"; sed -n '1,5p' private.pem || true
  2750:     35: 
  2751:     36:           # If OpenSSH format, convert to PEM
  2752:     37:           if grep -q "BEGIN OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY" private.pem; then
  2753:     38:             echo "Detected OpenSSH private key  converting to PEM"
  2754:     39:             ssh-keygen -p -f private.pem -m PEM -N "" || true
  2755:     40:           fi
  2756:     41: 
  2757:     42:           # Fail if encrypted
  2758:     43:           if grep -q "ENCRYPTED" private.pem || grep -q "Proc-Type: 4,ENCRYPTED" private.pem; then
  2759:     44:             echo "ERROR: provided private key appears to be encrypted. Provide an unencrypted PEM or convert locally."
  2760:     45:             exit 1
  2761:     46:           fi
  2762:     47: 
  2763:     48:           # export path for helper
  2764:     49:           echo "GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE=$(pwd)/private.pem" >> $GITHUB_ENV
  2765:     50: 
  2766:     51:       - name: Obtain installation token
  2767:     52:         id: get_token
  2768:     53:         env:
  2769:     54:           APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
  2770:     55:           INSTALLATION_ID: ${{ secrets.INSTALLATION_ID }}
  2771:     56:           GITHUB_APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
  2772:     57:           GITHUB_INSTALLATION_ID: ${{ secrets.INSTALLATION_ID }}
  2773:     58:           GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE: ${{ env.GITHUB_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE }}
  2774:     59:         run: |
  2775:     60:           node tools/get-installation-token.js > token.txt
  2776:     61:           echo "::add-mask::$(cat token.txt)"
  2777:     62:           echo "token=$(cat token.txt)" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
  2778:     63: 
  2779:     64:       - name: Use installation token (list installation repositories)
  2780:     65:         if: success()
  2781:     66:         env:
  2782:     67:           INSTALL_TOKEN: ${{ steps.get_token.outputs.token }}
  2783:     68:         run: |
  2784:     69:           set -euo pipefail
  2785:     70:           # mask token in logs
  2786:     71:           echo "::add-mask::$INSTALL_TOKEN"
  2787:     72:           echo "Calling GitHub API with installation token..."
  2788:     73:           curl -s -H "Authorization: Bearer $INSTALL_TOKEN" -H "Accept: application/vnd.github+json" https://api.github.com/installation/repositories > installation-repos.json || true
  2789:     74:           echo "Wrote installation-repos.json (masked token)."
  2790:     75: 
  2791:     76:       - name: Upload token artifact
  2792:     77:         if: success()
  2793:     78:         uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  2794:     79:         with:
  2795:     80:           name: installation-token
  2796:     81:           path: |
  2797:     82:             token.txt
  2798:     83:             installation-repos.json
  2799:     84: 
  2800:     85:       - name: Show success
  2801:     86:         run: |
  2802:     87:           echo "Installation token obtained, API result and token uploaded as artifact (masked)."
  2803:     88: 
  2804: 
  2805:

  2848:     39:           set -e

  2852:     43:           netlify deploy --dir="$NETLIFY_DEPLOY_DIR" --prod --site=$SITE_ID
  2853:     44:           echo "Deployed to site $SITE_ID"

  2857: ============================
  2858: FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\netlify-enable-https.yml
  2859: ============================
  2860: ============================
  2861:      1: name: Netlify Enable HTTPS
  2862:      2: 
  2863:      3: on:
  2864:      4:   workflow_dispatch:
  2865:      5: 
  2866:      6: jobs:
  2867:      7:   enable-https:
  2868:      8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  2869:      9:     steps:
  2870:     10:       - name: Checkout
  2871:     11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
  2872:     12: 
  2873:     13:       - name: Setup tools
  2874:     14:         run: |
  2875:     15:           sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y jq curl
  2876:     16:           npm i -g netlify-cli
  2877:     17: 
  2878:     18:       - name: Enable HTTPS (force SSL)
  2879:     19:         env:
  2880:     20:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
  2881:     21:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
  2882:     22:         run: |
  2883:     23:           set -e
  2884:     24:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id")
  2885:     25:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ] || [ "$SITE_ID" = "null" ]; then
  2886:     26:             echo "Site not found: ${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}"
  2887:     27:             exit 1
  2888:     28:           fi
  2889:     29:           echo "Found site: $SITE_ID"
  2890:     30:           # enable force_ssl via Netlify API
  2891:     31:           echo "Enabling force_ssl for site $SITE_ID"
  2892:     32:           curl -s -X PATCH "https://api.netlify.com/api/v1/sites/$SITE_ID" \
  2893:     33:             -H "Authorization: Bearer $NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN" \
  2894:     34:             -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  2895:     35:             -d '{"force_ssl":true}' | jq .
  2896:     36:           echo "HTTPS (force SSL) enabled (request sent)."
  2897:     37: 
  2898:     38:       - name: Ensure domain alias
  2899:     39:         env:
  2900:     40:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
  2901:     41:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
  2902:     42:         run: |
  2903:     43:           set -e
  2904:     44:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id")
  2905:     45:           DOMAIN="qflash.funesterie.pro"
  2906:     46:           # add domain alias if not present
  2907:     47:           EXISTS=$(netlify domains:list --site $SITE_ID --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.hostname==\"$DOMAIN\") | .id" || true)
  2908:     48:           if [ -z "$EXISTS" ]; then
  2909:     49:             echo "Adding domain $DOMAIN to site $SITE_ID"
  2910:     50:             netlify domains:add $DOMAIN --site $SITE_ID || true
  2911:     51:           else
  2912:     52:             echo "Domain $DOMAIN already added"
  2913:     53:           fi
  2914:     54:           # show domain status
  2915:     55:           netlify domains:list --site $SITE_ID --json | jq .
  2916:     56: 
  2917: 
  2918: 
  2919: ============================
  2920: FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\netlify-set-env.yml
  2921: ============================
  2922: ============================
  2923:      1: name: Configure Netlify Site Env
  2924:      2: 
  2925:      3: on:
  2926:      4:   workflow_dispatch:
  2927:      5: 
  2928:      6: jobs:
  2929:      7:   set-env:
  2930:      8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  2931:      9:     steps:
  2932:     10:       - name: Checkout
  2933:     11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
  2934:     12: 
  2935:     13:       - name: Setup tools
  2936:     14:         run: |
  2937:     15:           sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y jq
  2938:     16:           npm i -g netlify-cli
  2939:     17: 
  2940:     18:       - name: Find or create site
  2941:     19:         env:
  2942:     20:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
  2943:     21:           NETLIFY_SITE_NAME: "qflash-funesterie"
  2944:     22:         run: |
  2945:     23:           set -e
  2946:     24:           # attempt to find site id by name
  2947:     25:           SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id" )
  2948:     26:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ] || [ "$SITE_ID" = "null" ]; then
  2949:     27:             echo "site not found, creating"
  2950:     28:             netlify sites:create --name "${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}" --json
  2951:     29:             SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"${NETLIFY_SITE_NAME}\") | .id" )
  2952:     30:           fi
  2953:     31:           echo "SITE_ID=$SITE_ID"
  2954:     32:           echo "SITE_ID=$SITE_ID" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
  2955:     33: 
  2956:     34:       - name: Set Netlify env vars
  2957:     35:         env:
  2958:     36:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
  2959:     37:           SITE_ID: ${{ steps.find_or_create_site.outputs.SITE_ID || '' }}
  2960:     38:           APP_ID: ${{ secrets.APP_ID }}
  2961:     39:           APP_SECRET: ${{ secrets.APP_SECRET }}
  2962:     40:           GUMROAD_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}
  2963:     41:           GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID }}
  2964:     42:           DAEMON_URL: "https://qflash.funesterie.pro"
  2965:     43:         run: |
  2966:     44:           set -e
  2967:     45:           # fallback: read site id via name
  2968:     46:           if [ -z "$SITE_ID" ]; then
  2969:     47:             SITE_ID=$(netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"qflash-funesterie\") | .id" )
  2970:     48:           fi
  2971:     49:           echo "Using site: $SITE_ID"
  2972:     50:           # helper to set if value exists
  2973:     51:           set_env_if() {
  2974:     52:             KEY=$1; VAL=$2; if [ -n "$VAL" ] && [ "$VAL" != "null" ]; then netlify env:set $KEY "$VAL" --site $SITE_ID; fi
  2975:     53:           }
  2976:     54:           set_env_if "APP_ID" "$APP_ID"
  2977:     55:           set_env_if "APP_SECRET" "$APP_SECRET"
  2978:     56:           set_env_if "GUMROAD_TOKEN" "$GUMROAD_TOKEN"
  2979:     57:           set_env_if "GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID" "$GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID"
  2980:     58:           set_env_if "DAEMON_URL" "$DAEMON_URL"
  2981:     59:           echo "Env vars set"
  2982:     60: 
  2983:     61:       - name: Output site info
  2984:     62:         env:
  2985:     63:           NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN }}
  2986:     64:         run: |
  2987:     65:           netlify sites:list --json | jq -r ".[] | select(.name==\"qflash-funesterie\") | {name:.name,id:.id,ssl:.ssl,custom_domain: .custom_domain,default_domain:.default_domain}" || true
  2988:     66:

  2991: ============================
  2992: FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\publish-gumroad.yml
  2993: ============================
  2994: ============================
  2995:      1: name: Publish VSIX to Gumroad
  2996:      2: 
  2997:      3: on:
  2998:      4:   workflow_dispatch:
  2999:      5:   release:
  3000:      6:     types: [published]
  3001:      7: 
  3002:      8: jobs:
  3003:      9:   publish-gumroad:
  3004:     10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  3005:     11:     steps:
  3006:     12:       - name: Checkout
  3007:     13:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
  3008:     14: 
  3009:     15:       - name: Setup Node
  3010:     16:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  3011:     17:         with:
  3012:     18:           node-version: '18'
  3013:     19: 
  3014:     20:       - name: Build extension
  3015:     21:         run: |
  3016:     22:           cd extensions/vscode-npz
  3017:     23:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
  3018:     24:           npm run build
  3019:     25:           npx vsce package --no-dependencies
  3020:     26: 
  3021:     27:       - name: Upload VSIX to Release
  3022:     28:         if: github.event_name == 'release'
  3023:     29:         run: |
  3024:     30:           gh release upload ${{ github.event.release.tag_name }} extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix --clobber
  3025:     31: 
  3026:     32:       - name: Upload to Gumroad
  3027:     33:         env:
  3028:     34:           GUMROAD_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}
  3029:     35:           GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID: ${{ secrets.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID }}
  3030:     36:         run: |
  3031:     37:           VSIX=$(ls extensions/vscode-npz/*.vsix | head -n 1)
  3032:     38:           if [ -z "$VSIX" ]; then echo "No VSIX found"; exit 1; fi
  3033:     39:           echo "Uploading $VSIX to Gumroad product $GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID"
  3034:     40:           # Use curl to upload file to Gumroad (replace endpoint as needed)
  3035:     41:           curl -s -X POST "https://api.gumroad.com/v2/products/$GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID/attachments" \
  3036:     42:             -F "access_token=$GUMROAD_TOKEN" \
  3037:     43:             -F "file=@${VSIX}" \
  3038:     44:             -F "name=qflash-vsix" \
  3039:     45:             -F "description=VSIX for release ${{ github.ref }}" \
  3040:     46:             -o /tmp/gumroad-upload.json
  3041:     47:           cat /tmp/gumroad-upload.json
  3042:     48: 
  3043: 
  3044: 
  3045: ============================
  3046: FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\publish-on-release.yml
  3047: ============================
  3048: ============================
  3049:      1: name: Publish on Release
  3050:      2: 
  3051:      3: on:
  3052:      4:   workflow_dispatch: {}
  3053:      5:   release:
  3054:      6:     types: [published]
  3055:      7: 
  3056:      8: jobs:
  3057:      9:   CI:
  3058:     10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  3059:     11:     steps:
  3060:     12:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  3061:     13:         with:
  3062:     14:           submodules: false
  3063:     15:       - run: echo "CI check placeholder"
  3064:     16: 
  3065:     17:   publish:
  3066:     18:     needs: [CI]
  3067:     19:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  3068:     20:     steps:
  3069:     21:       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  3070:     22:         with:
  3071:     23:           submodules: false
  3072:     24:       - name: Use Node.js
  3073:     25:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  3074:     26:         with:
  3075:     27:           node-version: '20.18.1'
  3076:     28:           registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'
  3077:     29:       - name: Publish to npm
  3078:     30:         env:
  3079:     31:           NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
  3080:     32:         run: |
  3081:     33:           npm install --no-audit --no-fund
  3082:     34:           npm run build
  3083:     35:           npm publish --access public

  3152:     20:         with:
  3153:     21:           node-version: '20.18.1'
  3154:     22:       - name: Validate token (warning only)
  3155:     23:         run: |
  3156:     24:           if [ -z "${OPEN_VSX_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN is not set - Open VSX publish will be skipped"; else echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN is set"; fi

  3158:     26:         run: |

  3173:     41:           if [ -z "${OPEN_VSX_TOKEN}" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN missing - skip"; exit 0; fi
  3174:     42:           npx ovsx publish *.vsix --pat $OPEN_VSX_TOKEN || echo 'Open VSX publish failed'

  3240:     42:           if [ -z "${AZURE_PAT}" ]; then echo "AZURE_PAT missing - skip"; exit 0; fi

  3399: ============================
  3400: FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\publish.yml
  3401: ============================
  3402: ============================
  3403:      1: name: Publish Package
  3404:      2: 
  3405:      3: on:
  3406:      4:   push:
  3407:      5:     tags:
  3408:      6:       - 'v*.*.*'
  3409:      7: 
  3410:      8: jobs:
  3411:      9:   publish:
  3412:     10:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  3413:     11:     steps:
  3414:     12:       - uses: actions/checkout@v3
  3415:     13:       - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  3416:     14:         with:
  3417:     15:           node-version: '18'
  3418:     16:           registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'
  3419:     17:       - name: Validate tokens
  3420:     18:         run: |
  3421:     19:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN is missing"; exit 1; fi
  3422:     20:           if [ -z "${{ secrets.GUMROAD_TOKEN }}" ]; then echo "Warning: GUMROAD_TOKEN is not set"; fi
  3423:     21:       - name: Install dependencies
  3424:     22:         run: |
  3425:     23:           npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
  3426:     24:       - name: Build
  3427:     25:         run: |
  3428:     26:           npm run build --if-present
  3429:     27:       - name: Publish
  3430:     28:         env:
  3431:     29:           NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
  3432:     30:         run: |
  3433:     31:           echo "//registry.npmjs.org/:_authToken=${NODE_AUTH_TOKEN}" > ~/.npmrc
  3434:     32:           npm publish --access public
  3435:     33: 
  3436:

  3503: 
  3504: ============================
  3505: FILE: D:\qflush\.github\workflows\verify-secrets.yml
  3506: ============================
  3507: ============================
  3508:      1: name: Verify Action Secrets
  3509:      2: 
  3510:      3: on:
  3511:      4:   workflow_dispatch: {}
  3512:      5: 
  3513:      6: jobs:
  3514:      7:   verify-secrets:
  3515:      8:     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  3516:      9:     steps:
  3517:     10:       - name: Checkout
  3518:     11:         uses: actions/checkout@v4
  3519:     12: 
  3520:     13:       - name: Setup Node
  3521:     14:         uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  3522:     15:         with:
  3523:     16:           node-version: '18'
  3524:     17: 
  3525:     18:       - name: Verify AZURE_PAT
  3526:     19:         env:
  3527:     20:           AZURE_PAT: ${{ secrets.AZURE_PAT }}
  3528:     21:         run: |
  3529:     22:           if [ -z "$AZURE_PAT" ]; then echo "AZURE_PAT: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
  3530:     23:           echo "AZURE_PAT: set"
  3531:     24:           echo "Testing Azure DevOps connectivity..."
  3532:     25:           curl -sS -u :"$AZURE_PAT" https://dev.azure.com/funesterie/_apis/connectionData -o /tmp/az.json || true
  3533:     26:           if grep -q "authenticatedUser" /tmp/az.json; then echo "AZURE_PAT: OK"; else echo "AZURE_PAT: FAILED (check scopes)"; fi
  3534:     27: 
  3535:     28:       - name: Verify VSCE_TOKEN
  3536:     29:         env:
  3537:     30:           VSCE_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.VSCE_TOKEN }}
  3538:     31:         run: |
  3539:     32:           if [ -z "$VSCE_TOKEN" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
  3540:     33:           echo "VSCE_TOKEN: set"
  3541:     34:           # basic check: call Azure DevOps REST with token
  3542:     35:           curl -sS -u :"$VSCE_TOKEN" https://dev.azure.com/funesterie/_apis/connectionData -o /tmp/vsce.json || true
  3543:     36:           if grep -q "authenticatedUser" /tmp/vsce.json; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "VSCE_TOKEN: FAILED (check token/scopes)"; fi
  3544:     37: 
  3545:     38:       - name: Verify NPM_TOKEN
  3546:     39:         env:
  3547:     40:           NPM_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
  3548:     41:         run: |
  3549:     42:           if [ -z "$NPM_TOKEN" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
  3550:     43:           echo "NPM_TOKEN: set"
  3551:     44:           curl -sS -H "Authorization: Bearer $NPM_TOKEN" https://registry.npmjs.org/-/whoami -o /tmp/npm.json || true
  3552:     45:           if grep -q "username" /tmp/npm.json; then echo "NPM_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "NPM_TOKEN: FAILED"; fi
  3553:     46: 
  3554:     47:       - name: Verify OPEN_VSX_TOKEN
  3555:     48:         env:
  3556:     49:           OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.OPEN_VSX_TOKEN }}
  3557:     50:         run: |
  3558:     51:           if [ -z "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN" ]; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: MISSING"; exit 1; fi
  3559:     52:           echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: set"
  3560:     53:           npm i -g @open-vsx/ovsx@1.0.3 >/dev/null 2>&1 || true
  3561:     54:           if npx @open-vsx/ovsx whoami --pat "$OPEN_VSX_TOKEN" >/tmp/ovsx.out 2>&1; then echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: OK"; else echo "OPEN_VSX_TOKEN: FAILED"; cat /tmp/ovsx.out || true; fi
  3562:     55: 
  3563:     56:       - name: Summary
  3564:     57:         run: |
  3565:     58:           echo "Verification complete. Check above step outputs for each token status."
  3566:     59: 
  3567: 
  3568: 
  3569: ============================
  3570: FILE: D:\qflush\.gitignore

  7299: ============================
  7300: FILE: D:\qflush\bin\npz
  7301: ============================
  7302: ============================
  7303: [BINARY CONTENT - 4819 bytes]
  7304: [ERROR] Failed to include file: D:\qflush\bin\npz
  7305: Reason: Error formatting a string: Index (zero based) must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the size of the argument list..
  7306: 
  7307: 
  7308: ============================
  7309: FILE: D:\qflush\bin\npz.ps1
  7310: ============================
  7311: ============================
  7312:      1: param([string[]]$Args)
  7313:      2: # Lightweight PowerShell launcher to run the qflush NPZ daemon without npm
  7314:      3: $here = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition
  7315:      4: Set-Location (Join-Path $here '..')
  7316:      5: $node = $env:NODEJS_PATH -or 'node'
  7317:      6: $exe = Get-Command $node -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
  7318:      7: if (-not $exe) {
  7319:      8:   Write-Error "node executable not found. Update PATH or set NODEJS_PATH env var to the node binary."
  7320:      9:   exit 1
  7321:     10: }
  7322:     11: 
  7323:     12: # helper to run command in cwd
  7324:     13: function Run-InCwd([string]$cwd, [string[]]$cmd) {
  7325:     14:   Push-Location $cwd
  7326:     15:   try { & $cmd } finally { Pop-Location }
  7327:     16: }
  7328:     17: 
  7329:     18: if ($Args.Count -gt 0 -and $Args[0] -eq 'run' -and $Args[1] -eq 'qflush') {
  7330:     19:   $cli = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'dist/cli.js'
  7331:     20:   if (Test-Path $cli) {
  7332:     21:     & $node $cli 'run' 'qflush' @($Args[2..($Args.Count-1)])
  7333:     22:     exit $LASTEXITCODE
  7334:     23:   } else {
  7335:     24:     $script = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'dist/daemon/qflushd.js'
  7336:     25:     & $node $script @($Args[2..($Args.Count-1)])
  7337:     26:     exit $LASTEXITCODE
  7338:     27:   }
  7339:     28: }
  7340:     29: 
  7341:     30: # proxy commands: ci, install, build, test, package
  7342:     31: $cmd = $Args[0]
  7343:     32: if ($cmd -in @('ci','install','build','test','package')) {
  7344:     33:   $target = Get-Location
  7345:     34:   $remaining = $Args[1..($Args.Count-1)]
  7346:     35:   for ($i=0;$i -lt $remaining.Count; $i++) {
  7347:     36:     if ($remaining[$i] -like '--cwd*') {
  7348:     37:       if ($remaining[$i] -like '--cwd=*') { $target = $remaining[$i].Split('=')[1] } else { $target = $remaining[$i+1]; $i++ }
  7349:     38:     }
  7350:     39:   }
  7351:     40:   switch ($cmd) {
  7352:     41:     'ci' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','ci') }
  7353:     42:     'install' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','install','--no-audit','--no-fund') }
  7354:     43:     'build' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','run','build') }
  7355:     44:     'test' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','test') }
  7356:     45:     'package' { Run-InCwd $target @('npm','run','package') }
  7357:     46:   }
  7358:     47:   exit $LASTEXITCODE
  7359:     48: }
  7360:     49: 
  7361:     50: # default: run daemon
  7362:     51: $script = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'dist/daemon/qflushd.js'
  7363:     52: if (-not (Test-Path $script)) { Write-Error "Daemon script not found: $script"; exit 2 }
  7364:     53: & $node $script @Args
  7365:     54: 
  7366: 
  7367:

  7376: 
  7377: ============================
  7378: FILE: D:\qflush\CHANGELOG.md
  7379: ============================
  7380: ============================
  7381:      1: # Changelog
  7382:      2: 
  7383:      3: ## v3.0.3  Release (2025-11-18)
  7384:      4: 
  7385:      5: Highlights:
  7386:      6: 
  7387:      7: - Rome Tag v1: shared module `src/rome/rome-tag.ts` and canonical tag algorithm (type|path  FNV-1a 24-bit)
  7388:      8: - Pourparler UI: compute & persist Rome tags from VS Code webview
  7389:      9: - VS Code extension: persist canonical records to `.qflush/rome-index.json`
  7390:     10: - Linter: `tools/rome-lint.js` enforces `// ROME-TAG: 0xXXXXXX` with `--fix`
  7391:     11: - Daemon: `GET /npz/rome-index` endpoint and index loader cache
  7392:     12: - Tests: reliable integration tests for checksums and rome-index
  7393:     13: - Docs: Rome index diagram, README and publishing guidance
  7394:     14: 
  7395:     15: Checksums
  7396:     16: 
  7397:     17: - funeste38-qflush-3.0.3.tgz  SHA256: AAB940267E13C613EB30564613EE40FBA31729DCF2BE01AE897C03C33DD079F8
  7398:     18: 
  7399:     19: Migration notes:
  7400:     20: - The Rome tag algorithm is stable (v1) and computed from `type|path`. Existing tags inserted by the linter or extension will match.
  7401:     21: - To adopt in CI, add `npm run lint:rome` as a workflow step to ensure tags remain consistent.
  7402:     22: 
  7403:     23: Security & CI:
  7404:     24: - The release pipeline can publish to npm using `NPM_TOKEN` stored in repository secrets.
  7405:     25: 
  7406:     26: 
  7407:
