  7436: ============================
  7437: FILE: D:\qflush\copilot-context.md
  7438: ============================
  7439: ============================
  7440:      1: QFLUSH / FUNESTERIE  Copilot Context (short)
  7441:      2: 
  7442:      3: - Project: @funeste38/qflush
  7443:      4: - Version: 3.1.2
  7444:      5: - Purpose: Orchestrator for Funesterie (start/stop/purge/inspect) + daemon exposing NPZ & ROME endpoints
  7445:      6: - Key commands: `qflush start|kill|purge|inspect|config|rome:links`
  7446:      7: - Daemon endpoints: `/npz/checksum/*`, `/npz/rome-index`, `/npz/rome-links*`
  7447:      8: - Dev: `npm run build`, `npm test` (vitest)
  7448:      9: - Notes: Redis optional; disable in dev via `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS=0`.
  7449:     10: 
  7450: 
  7451: 
  7452: ============================
  7453: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\admin-deploy.md
  7454: ============================
  7455: ============================
  7456:      1: Admin deployment steps for setting up a self-hosted agent and publishing the VS Code extension.
  7457:      2: 
  7458:      3: Prerequisites:
  7459:      4: - Windows machine with admin rights and PowerShell (run as Administrator).
  7460:      5: - Personal Access Token (PAT) with Marketplace publish and Agent Pools permissions.
  7461:      6: 
  7462:      7: Steps (copy/paste in an Administrator PowerShell):
  7463:      8: 
  7464:      9: # 1) Configure execution policy for the session
  7465:     10: Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned
  7466:     11: 
  7467:     12: # 2) Create agent directory and download agent package (replace URL if newer)
  7468:     13: $installDir = 'C:\azagent'
  7469:     14: New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $installDir
  7470:     15: cd $installDir
  7471:     16: $agentUrl = 'https://vstsagentpackage.azureedge.net/agent/2.220.1/vsts-agent-win-x64-2.220.1.zip'
  7472:     17: Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $agentUrl -OutFile agent.zip
  7473:     18: Expand-Archive agent.zip -DestinationPath . -Force
  7474:     19: Remove-Item agent.zip -Force
  7475:     20: 
  7476:     21: # 3) Configure the agent (replace <PAT> and pool name)
  7477:     22: $pat = Read-Host -AsSecureString "Enter PAT (will not echo)"
  7478:     23: $plain = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR([System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($pat))
  7479:     24: .\config.cmd --unattended --url "https://dev.azure.com/funesterie" --auth pat --token $plain --pool "self-hosted" --agent "qflush-agent" --acceptTeeEula
  7480:     25: 
  7481:     26: # 4) Install as a service
  7482:     27: .\svc.sh install
  7483:     28: .\svc.sh start
  7484:     29: 
  7485:     30: # 5) Verify agent online in Azure DevOps
  7486:     31: # Go to Project settings -> Pipelines -> Agent pools -> self-hosted
  7487:     32: 
  7488:     33: # 6) Package and publish the VSIX (optional manual publish)
  7489:     34: cd 'D:\qflush\extensions\vscode-npz'
  7490:     35: npm install --no-audit --no-fund
  7491:     36: npm run build
  7492:     37: npx @vscode/vsce package
  7493:     38: # publish (runs locally, PAT prompted)
  7494:     39: $npat = Read-Host -AsSecureString "Enter PAT for publish"
  7495:     40: $plainPublish = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR([System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($npat))
  7496:     41: npx tfx extension publish --manifest-globs vss-extension.json --publisher funesterie --token $plainPublish --service-url https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/
  7497:     42: 
  7498:     43: Notes:
  7499:     44: - Keep your PAT secret. Do not paste it in chats.
  7500:     45: - If you prefer CI publishing, ensure repository secrets `AZURE_PAT` or `VSCE_TOKEN` are set in GitHub.
  7501:     46: 
  7502: 
  7503: 
  7504: ============================
  7505: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\architecture-ascii.txt
  7506: ============================
  7507: ============================
  7508:      1: FUNESTERIE ARCHITECTURE (ASCII Diagram)
  7509:      2: 
  7510:      3: +-------------------------------------------------------------+
  7511:      4: |                           QFLUSH                             |
  7512:      5: |  - CLI orchestration                                          |
  7513:      6: |  - daemon (qflushd)                                           |
  7514:      7: |  - starts/stops modules via BAT                                |
  7515:      8: |  - exposes /npz/* and /rome-* endpoints                       |
  7516:      9: +-------------+----------------+----------------+--------------+
  7517:     10:               |                |                |
  7518:     11:               v                v                v
  7519:     12:    +----------+---+   +--------+----+   +--------+-----+
  7520:     13:    |    BAT        |   |   ROME       |   |    NPZ       |
  7521:     14:    | process mgr   |   | index/engine |   | router/admin |
  7522:     15:    +---------------+   +--------------+   +--------------+
  7523:     16:            |                   |                 |
  7524:     17:            v                   v                 v
  7525:     18:    +---------------+   +--------------+   +----------------+
  7526:     19:    |  Services     |   | .qflush/rome |   |  Checksums,    |
  7527:     20:    |  (rome, env,  |   | index/links  |   |  links, scores |
  7528:     21:    |   nezlephant) |   |              |   |                |
  7529:     22:    +---------------+   +--------------+   +----------------+
  7530:     23:                     \            |             /
  7531:     24:                      \           |            /
  7532:     25:                       \          v           /
  7533:     26:                        +-----------------------+
  7534:     27:                        |   Copilot Bridge /    |
  7535:     28:                        |   Telemetry / IDE     |
  7536:     29:                        +-----------------------+
  7537:     30:                                 |
  7538:     31:                                 v
  7539:     32:                            +-----------+
  7540:     33:                            |  A11 /    |
  7541:     34:                            |  SPYDER   |
  7542:     35:                            +-----------+
  7543:     36: 
  7544:     37: Notes:
  7545:     38:  - Redis optional backend for NPZ checksums
  7546:     39:  - Nezlephant provides OC8/PNG storage
  7547:     40:  - Linker resolves [[token]] -> files and writes .qflush/rome-links.json
  7548:     41: 
  7549: 
  7550: 
  7551: ============================
  7552: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\azure-publish-secrets.md
  7553: ============================
  7554: ============================
  7555:      1: Azure DevOps Marketplace publish requires:
  7556:      2: 
  7557:      3: - `PUBLISHER_ID` (pipeline variable)  your publisher ID in Visual Studio Marketplace (the publisher name), e.g. `funesterie`.
  7558:      4: - `AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT` (pipeline secret)  a Personal Access Token with Marketplace publish scope.
  7559:      5: - `AGENT_POOL` (pipeline variable)  name of a self-hosted agent pool to use for the publish job. If not set, the job will fail when there is no hosted parallelism.
  7560:      6: 
  7561:      7: How to create a self-hosted agent pool and agent
  7562:      8: 
  7563:      9: 1. In Azure DevOps project -> Project settings -> Pipelines -> Agent pools -> New agent pool. Name it e.g. `self-hosted`.
  7564:     10: 2. Click the pool -> New agent -> choose the OS of the machine where you'll run the agent (Linux/Windows).
  7565:     11: 3. Follow the provided instructions to download and configure the agent on your machine. Example for Linux:
  7566:     12:    - mkdir myagent && cd myagent
  7567:     13:    - curl -O https://vstsagentpackage.azureedge.net/agent/2.218.1/vsts-agent-linux-x64-2.218.1.tar.gz
  7568:     14:    - tar zxvf vsts-agent-*.tar.gz
  7569:     15:    - ./config.sh --unattended --url https://dev.azure.com/<your_org> --auth pat --token <YOUR_PAT> --pool self-hosted --agent qflush-agent
  7570:     16:    - sudo ./svc.sh install && sudo ./svc.sh start
  7571:     17: 4. In the pipeline variables (Pipeline -> Edit -> Variables) add `AGENT_POOL=self-hosted` and mark `AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT` as secret.
  7572:     18: 
  7573:     19: Once the self-hosted agent is online, rerun the pipeline and the publish job will use the specified pool and avoid the hosted parallelism error.
  7574:     20: 
  7575:     21: The pipeline `.azure-pipelines/workflows/azure-publish.yml` expects `extensions/vscode-npz/vss-extension.json` to exist and `tfx-cli` to create and publish the VSIX.
  7576:     22: 
  7577: 
  7578: 
  7579: ============================
  7580: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\copilot-bridge.md
  7581: ============================
  7582: ============================
  7583:      1: # Copilot Bridge  Telemetry & Security
  7584:      2: 
  7585:      3: This document describes the Copilot Bridge transport options, HMAC signing, and secure setup.
  7586:      4: 
  7587:      5: ## Config
  7588:      6: Place `.qflush/copilot.json` with the following minimal keys:
  7589:      7: 
  7590:      8: ```json
  7591:      9: {
  7592:     10:   "enabled": true,
  7593:     11:   "transports": ["file","webhook"],
  7594:     12:   "webhookUrl": "https://copilot.example/api/telemetry",
  7595:     13:   "hmacSecretEnv": "COPILOT_HMAC",
  7596:     14:   "filePath": ".qflush/telemetry.json"
  7597:     15: }
  7598:     16: ```
  7599:     17: 
  7600:     18: ## HMAC signing
  7601:     19: - Set a secret value in repository/host environment variable referenced by `hmacSecretEnv` (e.g. `COPILOT_HMAC`).
  7602:     20: - The bridge will sign webhook payloads with `X-Copilot-Signature: sha256=<hex>` header.
  7603:     21: 
  7604:     22: Example verification (Node):
  7605:     23: 
  7606:     24: ```js
  7607:     25: const crypto = require('crypto');
  7608:     26: function verify(payload, headerSig, secret) {
  7609:     27:   const expected = crypto.createHmac('sha256', secret).update(payload).digest('hex');
  7610:     28:   return headerSig === `sha256=${expected}`;
  7611:     29: }
  7612:     30: ```
  7613:     31: 
  7614:     32: ## Endpoint auth
  7615:     33: - Protect `/copilot/*` and `/npz/engine/*` endpoints by setting `QFLUSH_TOKEN` env var on the daemon.
  7616:     34: - Include header `x-qflush-token: <TOKEN>` when calling these endpoints (CLI or extension).
  7617:     35: 
  7618:     36: ## Telemetry retention
  7619:     37: - Telemetry is written to `.qflush/telemetry.json` and persisted into `.qflush/qflush.db` if sqlite is available.
  7620:     38: - Rotate telemetry files daily in your ops scripts or configure archival.
  7621:     39: 
  7622:     40: ## Privacy
  7623:     41: - Telemetry redacts environment variables and long file contents >4KB.
  7624:     42: - Only enable telemetry for trusted networks or when webhook targets are under your control.
  7625:     43: 
  7626: 
  7627: 
  7628: ============================
  7629: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\COPILOT-CLI.md
  7630: ============================
  7631: ============================
  7632:      1: GitHub Copilot CLI - quick start
  7633:      2: 
  7634:      3: Official page:
  7635:      4: https://github.com/github/copilot-cli
  7636:      5: 
  7637:      6: What this doc does
  7638:      7: - Points you to the official Copilot CLI repository for latest installers and docs.
  7639:      8: - Provides a few safe, minimal next steps you can run locally to try Copilot CLI.
  7640:      9: 
  7641:     10: Install (official instructions may change)
  7642:     11: 1. Open the official repo releases page and follow the installer for your platform:
  7643:     12:    - https://github.com/github/copilot-cli/releases
  7644:     13: 
  7645:     14: 2. After installing the `copilot` binary, verify installation:
  7646:     15: 
  7647:     16:    copilot --version
  7648:     17:    copilot --help
  7649:     18: 
  7650:     19: Authenticate
  7651:     20: - Follow the interactive login command the CLI provides. Example (the actual subcommand may vary by release):
  7652:     21: 
  7653:     22:   copilot auth login
  7654:     23: 
  7655:     24: - If that specific subcommand doesn't exist for your version, run `copilot --help` and follow the authentication instructions shown by the tool or the README on the official repo.
  7656:     25: 
  7657:     26: Basic usage
  7658:     27: - Once installed and authenticated you can try the interactive mode or run code generation commands. Example (replace with the exact commands for your release):
  7659:     28: 
  7660:     29:   copilot chat
  7661:     30:   copilot code "write a function that reverses a string in JavaScript"
  7662:     31: 
  7663:     32: Security notes
  7664:     33: - The Copilot CLI will open a browser window for OAuth; do not paste tokens into code or the repo.
  7665:     34: - Use the official releases page to download installers; verify checksums if provided.
  7666:     35: 
  7667:     36: Integration ideas for this repository
  7668:     37: - Use Copilot CLI locally to help prototype small code snippets or tests.
  7669:     38: - Do NOT add your copilot auth token to repository files. Store any tokens in your OS credential manager or GitHub secrets when used in CI.
  7670:     39: 
  7671:     40: If you want, I can:
  7672:     41: - add a helper script to open the official Copilot CLI repo page from this workspace, or
  7673:     42: - add a short sample command file that demonstrates a few copilot-cli commands (non-authenticated examples).
  7674:     43: 
  7675:     44: Refer to the official repo for up-to-date, authoritative installation and usage instructions.
  7676:     45: 
  7677: 
  7678: 
  7679: ============================
  7680: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\FCL_README.md
  7681: ============================
  7682: ============================
  7683:      1: Funesterie Config Language (FCL) - README
  7684:      2: 
  7685:      3: FCL is a small, human-friendly format to declare projects, services and pipelines for Funesterie.
  7686:      4: 
  7687:      5: Sections:
  7688:      6: - `@project` global metadata (name, owner, defaultEnv)
  7689:      7: - `@env <name>` environment variables and URLs
  7690:      8: - `@service <name>` description of a launchable service (path, start command, port)
  7691:      9: - `@pipeline <name>` ordered list of services to run together
  7692:     10: 
  7693:     11: Examples:
  7694:     12: 
  7695:     13: @project
  7696:     14:   name = my-stack
  7697:     15:   owner = alice
  7698:     16: 
  7699:     17: @env dev
  7700:     18:   url = http://localhost:3000
  7701:     19: 
  7702:     20: @service api
  7703:     21:   type = node
  7704:     22:   path = apps/api
  7705:     23:   start = pnpm dev:api
  7706:     24:   port = 3000
  7707:     25: 
  7708:     26: @pipeline dev-all
  7709:     27:   steps = ["api"]
  7710:     28: 
  7711:     29: Usage:
  7712:     30: - Place `funesterie.fcl` in the repo root.
  7713:     31: - `qflush compose up` will read `funesterie.fcl` if present and bring up declared services.
  7714:     32: 
  7715:     33: This README is minimal and the spec is intentionally small to keep portability.
  7716:     34: 
  7717:     35: 
  7718: 
  7719: 
  7720: ============================
  7721: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\FCL_SPEC.md
  7722: ============================
  7723: ============================
  7724:      1: Funesterie Config Language (FCL) - Short Spec
  7725:      2: 
  7726:      3: 1. File name: `funesterie.fcl`
  7727:      4: 2. Sections start with `@section` optionally followed by a name: `@service api` or `@env dev`.
  7728:      5: 3. Key-value syntax: `key = value` (strings or numbers).
  7729:      6: 4. Lists use `[]` with comma-separated values: `steps = ["api", "web"]`.
  7730:      7: 5. Comments start with `#` or `//` and extend to end-of-line.
  7731:      8: 6. Supported sections: `@project`, `@env`, `@service`, `@pipeline`.
  7732:      9: 7. `@service <name>` supports keys: `type`, `path`, `start`, `port`, `env`, `token`.
  7733:     10: 8. `@pipeline <name>` supports keys: `description`, `steps` (list of service names).
  7734:     11: 9. Values can be quoted strings or unquoted tokens (no complex expressions).
  7735:     12: 10. FCL is intentionally minimal and designed to be parsed without heavy dependencies.
  7736:     13: 
  7737:     14: Example:
  7738:     15: 
  7739:     16: @service api
  7740:     17:   type = node
  7741:     18:   path = apps/api
  7742:     19:   start = npm run dev
  7743:     20:   port = 3000
  7744:     21: 
  7745:     22: @pipeline dev-all
  7746:     23:   steps = ["api", "web"]
  7747:     24: 
  7748: 
  7749: 
  7750: ============================
  7751: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\funesterie-cortex.svg
  7752: ============================
  7753: ============================
  7754: [BINARY CONTENT - 2817 bytes]
  7755: [ERROR] Failed to include file: D:\qflush\docs\funesterie-cortex.svg
  7756: Reason: Error formatting a string: Index (zero based) must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the size of the argument list..
  7757: 
  7758: 
  7759: ============================
  7760: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\github-publish-secrets.md
  7761: ============================
  7762: ============================
  7763:      1: GitHub Actions publish workflow requires these secrets in the repository settings:
  7764:      2: 
  7765:      3: - `VSCE_TOKEN`  Personal Access Token for Visual Studio Marketplace (used by `@vscode/vsce publish`) 
  7766:      4: - `OPEN_VSX_TOKEN`  API token for Open VSX (optional)
  7767:      5: 
  7768:      6: To add secrets:
  7769:      7: 1. Go to your GitHub repository  Settings  Secrets and variables  Actions  New repository secret.
  7770:      8: 2. Add `VSCE_TOKEN` and `OPEN_VSX_TOKEN` values.
  7771:      9: 
  7772:     10: Trigger the workflow manually under Actions  Publish VS Code extension  Run workflow or push a tag `v*` to automatically run.
  7773:     11: 
  7774: 
  7775: 
  7776: ============================
  7777: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\LICENSING.md
  7778: ============================
  7779: ============================
  7780:      1: qflush Licensing (Gumroad)
  7781:      2: 
  7782:      3: Overview
  7783:      4: 
  7784:      5: This project integrates with Gumroad for license sales and verification. You can sell monthly or yearly licenses and validate keys using Gumroad's license API.
  7785:      6: 
  7786:      7: Recommended products on Gumroad:
  7787:      8: - qflush Monthly - 5/month
  7788:      9: - qflush Yearly - 39/year
  7789:     10: 
  7790:     11: Steps to configure
  7791:     12: 
  7792:     13: 1. Create products on Gumroad and enable license keys.
  7793:     14: 2. Obtain your Gumroad account token (Personal access token) or use public product id for verification.
  7794:     15: 3. Add token to your daemon or CI as environment variable `GUMROAD_TOKEN` (for server-side verify) or store securely in a file and set `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE`.
  7795:     16: 
  7796:     17: Daemon setup
  7797:     18: 
  7798:     19: - Run the daemon (recommended):
  7799:     20:   - Set `GUMROAD_TOKEN` and optionally `GUMROAD_PRODUCT_YEARLY` / `GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY`.
  7800:     21:   - Start: `qflush daemon` or `node dist/daemon/qflushd.js`.
  7801:     22:   - The daemon exposes endpoints:
  7802:     23:     - `POST /license/activate` { key, product_id? }
  7803:     24:     - `GET /license/status` -> { license, valid }
  7804:     25: 
  7805:     26: VS Code extension flow
  7806:     27: 
  7807:     28: - The VS Code extension UI includes a License section in the panel:
  7808:     29:   - Paste the key in the License Key field and press Activate.
  7809:     30:   - The extension will call the daemon `POST /license/activate` and display the result.
  7810:     31:   - Use Show License Status to query `GET /license/status`.
  7811:     32: 
  7812:     33: CLI flow
  7813:     34: 
  7814:     35: - You can also activate using the CLI (suitable for headless installs):
  7815:     36:   - `GUMROAD_TOKEN=... qflush license activate <key>`
  7816:     37:   - `qflush license status` to view the saved local license
  7817:     38: 
  7818:     39: Audit and metrics
  7819:     40: 
  7820:     41: - The daemon writes a simple audit log by default to `./.qflush/license-activations.log` and exposes Prometheus counters:
  7821:     42:   - `qflush_license_activation_total`
  7822:     43:   - `qflush_license_activation_success_total`
  7823:     44:   - `qflush_license_activation_failure_total`
  7824:     45: 
  7825:     46: Local license storage
  7826:     47: 
  7827:     48: The CLI/daemon stores a local license record in `./.qflush/license.json`. You can override with `GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH`.
  7828:     49: 
  7829:     50: Security
  7830:     51: 
  7831:     52: Do not hardcode your Gumroad token in client-side code. Use the daemon to keep tokens private. The extension communicates with the local daemon only.
  7832:     53: 
  7833:     54: ---
  7834:     55: 
  7835:     56: qflush licensing (local Gumroad verification)
  7836:     57: 
  7837:     58: Overview
  7838:     59: 
  7839:     60: qflush uses Gumroad to sell license keys. The recommended flow is local verification: the user pastes a license key into the app/extension which calls the local daemon to verify the key directly with Gumroad.
  7840:     61: 
  7841:     62: Simple local flow (recommended)
  7842:     63: 
  7843:     64: 1. User purchases a license on Gumroad and receives a license key.
  7844:     65: 2. User opens qflush (or the VS Code extension) and enters the license key.
  7845:     66: 3. The client calls the local daemon endpoint `POST /license/activate` with `{ key }`.
  7846:     67: 4. The daemon calls Gumroad's verify API, saves the license locally on success, and returns the result.
  7847:     68: 
  7848:     69: Why this is sufficient
  7849:     70: 
  7850:     71: - No public URL, tunnel, or webhook required for normal activation and verification.
  7851:     72: - Works fully offline for the app running on the user's machine (daemon contacts Gumroad to verify).
  7852:     73: 
  7853:     74: Daemon configuration
  7854:     75: 
  7855:     76: - Set `GUMROAD_TOKEN` and product IDs in the daemon environment (or `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE` and `GUMROAD_LICENSE_PATH` if preferred).
  7856:     77: - Default local license path: `./.qflush/license.json`.
  7857:     78: 
  7858:     79: Commands
  7859:     80: 
  7860:     81: - Activate (HTTP):
  7861:     82:   POST http://localhost:4500/license/activate
  7862:     83:   Body: { "key": "XXXX-XXXX-XXXX" }
  7863:     84: 
  7864:     85: - Status (HTTP):
  7865:     86:   GET http://localhost:4500/license/status
  7866:     87: 
  7867:     88: Notes about webhooks
  7868:     89: 
  7869:     90: - Webhooks are optional. They are useful to automatically revoke licenses on refunds or subscription cancellations.
  7870:     91: - This repository supports webhook handling, but it can be removed. The default simple flow does not require a webhook or public endpoint.
  7871:     92: 
  7872:     93: Security
  7873:     94: 
  7874:     95: - Do not commit `GUMROAD_TOKEN` to the repo. Use `.env`, environment variables, or a token file referenced by `GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE`.
  7875:     96: - Audit log (activations) is at `./.qflush/license-activations.log`.
  7876:     97: 
  7877:     98: If you want the fully automated server-driven flow (webhooks + auto-disable), use a public endpoint (ngrok, domain, or server) and enable webhooks in Gumroad. Otherwise the local flow above is safest and simplest.
  7878:     99: 
  7879:    100: 
  7880: 
  7881: 
  7882: ============================
  7883: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\publish-secrets.md
  7884: ============================
  7885: ============================
  7886:      1: This repository's release publish workflow requires the following GitHub secrets to be set in the repository settings:
  7887:      2: 
  7888:      3: - `NPM_TOKEN`  npm auth token for publishing the package (if publishing to npm)
  7889:      4: - `VSCE_TOKEN`  Personal access token for Visual Studio Marketplace (optional, if using `vsce`)
  7890:      5: - `OPENVSX_TOKEN`  token for publishing to Open VSX (optional)
  7891:      6: - `AZURE_CREDENTIALS`  Azure service principal JSON if publishing to Azure DevOps (optional)
  7892:      7: 
  7893:      8: To set a secret:
  7894:      9: 1. Go to your GitHub repository -> Settings -> Secrets and variables -> Actions -> New repository secret.
  7895:     10: 2. Enter the secret name and value and save.
  7896:     11: 
  7897:     12: The provided workflow `.github/workflows/publish-on-release.yml` will run on GitHub `release` published events and will build and publish to npm. If you want marketplace or Open VSX publish, adapt the workflow to call `vsce` or `open-vsx-publisher` with the appropriate tokens.
  7898:     13: 
  7899: 
  7900: 
  7901: ============================
  7902: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\qflush-analysis.md
  7903: ============================
  7904: ============================
  7905:      1: QFLUSH  Repository Analysis
  7906:      2: 
  7907:      3: Status summary
  7908:      4: - Repository: `D:\qflush` (branch `release/3.1.0`)
  7909:      5: - Build: `npm run build` succeeded (TypeScript compile)
  7910:      6: - Tests: `npm test` (vitest) succeeded (12 tests passed)
  7911:      7: - Recent commit: `docs: add architecture,diagrams,copilot context` (created docs and copilot context)
  7912:      8: 
  7913:      9: Key components and locations
  7914:     10: - CLI / entry
  7915:     11:   - `src/index.ts`  CLI dispatcher, commands
  7916:     12:   - `bin/qflush` / `qflush.cmd` wrappers
  7917:     13: - Daemon
  7918:     14:   - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts`  express daemon, NPZ endpoints, Rome linker, optional Redis
  7919:     15:   - `dist/index.js` (built artifact)
  7920:     16: - Supervisor / process manager
  7921:     17:   - `@funeste38/bat` (dependency) used via `src/supervisor` and `tools` (BAT orchestrates processes)
  7922:     18: - Rome (index + engine + linker)
  7923:     19:   - `src/rome/*`  index-loader, engine, linker, events, executor
  7924:     20:   - Output stored in `.qflush/rome-index.json` and `.qflush/rome-links.json`
  7925:     21: - NPZ (router/admin)
  7926:     22:   - `src/utils/npz-*` and endpoints in `src/daemon/qflushd.ts`
  7927:     23:   - checksum endpoints: `/npz/checksum/*`
  7928:     24: - Nezlephant / envaptex / freeland
  7929:     25:   - External packages: `@funeste38/nezlephant`, `@funeste38/envaptex`, `@funeste38/freeland`
  7930:     26: - Optional Redis
  7931:     27:   - `ioredis` is a dependency; feature flag `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS` controls usage in `src/daemon/qflushd.ts` (currently forced disabled in local edit)
  7932:     28: - Mapping feature
  7933:     29:   - `QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING` and internal `FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING` control automatic mapping; current build sets `FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING = true` in `qflushd.ts` which disables mapping by default
  7934:     30: 
  7935:     31: Important files
  7936:     32: - `package.json`  scripts, dependencies, bin `qflush`
  7937:     33: - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts`  HTTP API, checksum store, rome endpoints, SSE
  7938:     34: - `src/index.ts`  CLI entry
  7939:     35: - `.qflush/*`  runtime state, logs, indexes, telemetry
  7940:     36: - `tools/installer.js` and `installers/`  local install and artifacts
  7941:     37: 
  7942:     38: Observations & recommendations
  7943:     39: 1. Optional services (Redis, mapping) are feature-flagged. Ensure CI and README document how to enable them. Local dev should keep Redis disabled.
  7944:     40: 2. Many large untracked or workspace files exist (VS snapshots, `.qflush` runtime data). Add or verify `.gitignore` to avoid committing volatile files.
  7945:     41: 3. Tests pass locally  good baseline for further changes. Run tests after any change to `src/rome/*` or `src/daemon/*`.
  7946:     42: 4. Consider centralizing feature flags and default config in a single module (e.g., `src/config.ts`) to avoid duplicated checks in code.
  7947:     43: 5. Keep `ioredis` optional at runtime by lazy-require and clear logging when disabled (current approach acceptable).
  7948:     44: 
  7949:     45: Next steps I can take
  7950:     46: - Generate a concise module dependency map (visual or textual).
  7951:     47: - Create a README section documenting feature flags and local dev setup.
  7952:     48: - Search for TODOs and FIXME comments to prioritize tech debt.
  7953:     49: 
  7954:     50:

  7958: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\qflush-plan.md
  7959: ============================
  7960: ============================
  7961:      1: # QFLUSH  PLAN CONCRET  EXCUTER
  7962:      2: 
  7963:      3: Objectif : stabiliser QFLUSH v3.1, intgrer le linker ROME, prparer le terrain A11/SPYDER.
  7964:      4: 
  7965:      5: tape 1  Stabilisation build / TS
  7966:      6: - Corriger imports casss : ./chain/smartChain, ./daemon/qflushd(.js), ./commands/doctor, ./commands/compose, ./cli/help, ../utils/fetch.
  7967:      7: - Remplacer usages de `node` / `env` nus par process.env (ex: process.env.NODE_ENV).
  7968:      8: - S'assurer que tous les shebangs `#!/usr/bin/env node` sont en ligne 1 des fichiers .ts concerns.
  7969:      9: - Supprimer ou corriger les `declare module './...'` en noms non-relatifs (ex: 'src/rome/storage').
  7970:     10: - Laisser `// @ts-nocheck` sur les polyfills JS et exclure extensions/**/out/** dans tsconfig.
  7971:     11: - Vrifier que `npx tsc -p . --noEmit` ne renvoie aucune erreur.
  7972:     12: 
  7973:     13: tape 2  Intgration du linker ROME
  7974:     14: - Crer src/rome/linker.ts avec computeRomeLinks(...) et writeRomeLinks(...), utilisant loadRomeIndexFromDisk() et dtectant les tokens [[token]] dans src/**.
  7975:     15: - Ajouter une commande src/commands/rome-links.ts qui appelle computeRomeLinks + writeRomeLinks et log le nombre de refs.
  7976:     16: - Brancher rome-links dans le router CLI (qflush rome:links).
  7977:     17: - Optionnel : sur onRomeIndexUpdated, relancer computeRomeLinks pour rafrachir .qflush/rome-links.json.
  7978:     18: 
  7979:     19: tape 3  Pr-release 3.1
  7980:     20: - Mettre  jour README pour dcrire QFLUSH v3.x (orchestrateur, daemon, NPZ, checksum, Copilot bridge, Rome linker).
  7981:     21: - Vrifier package.json (name, version, bin.qflush).
  7982:     22: - Gnrer un .tgz, tester une installation globale locale, puis tagguer v3.1.0.
  7983:     23: 
  7984:     24: tape 4  Hooks pour A11 / SPYDER (prparation)
  7985:     25: - Ajouter des cls A11 / SPYDER dans SERVICE_MAP (mme si les modules ne sont pas encore publis).
  7986:     26: - Ajouter des commandes placeholders qflush a11:status et qflush spyder:status qui renvoient un message "coming soon".
  7987:     27: - Documenter dans README la roadmap A11 (interface IA) et SPYDER (internet interne).
  7988:     28: 
  7989:     29: // Fin du plan QFLUSH.
  7990:     30:

  7992: 
  7993: ============================
  7994: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\quick-start.md
  7995: ============================
  7996: ============================
  7997:      1: Quick start checklist  QFLUSH (local, NO-REDIS / NO-COPILOT)
  7998:      2: 
  7999:      3: This file contains a short checklist and copy-paste commands to get QFLUSH running locally in the "NO-REDIS / NO-COPILOT" safe mode used by this repo.
  8000:      4: 
  8001:      5: 1) Prepare environment
  8002:      6: - Copy example env and edit if needed:
  8003:      7:   - PowerShell:
  8004:      8:     Copy-Item .env.example .env; notepad .env
  8005:      9:   - Bash:
  8006:     10:     cp .env.example .env && ${EDITOR:-nano} .env
  8007:     11: 
  8008:     12: - Confirm the following variables are set to disable external services (recommended for dev):
  8009:     13:   QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS=1
  8010:     14:   QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT=1
  8011:     15:   QFLUSH_TELEMETRY=0
  8012:     16: 
  8013:     17: 2) Install dependencies
  8014:     18: - npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
  8015:     19: 
  8016:     20: 3) Build
  8017:     21: - npm run build
  8018:     22: 
  8019:     23: 4) Run tests
  8020:     24: - npm test
  8021:     25: 
  8022:     26: 5) Start daemon (detached recommended)
  8023:     27: - Using CLI (detached by default):
  8024:     28:   qflush daemon
  8025:     29: - Using safe-run (detached):
  8026:     30:   qflush safe-run --detach daemon
  8027:     31: - Using the detach script via npm:
  8028:     32:   npm run detach -- node dist/index.js daemon --detached
  8029:     33: 
  8030:     34: 6) Quick API checks (after daemon started)
  8031:     35: - Store checksum:
  8032:     36:   curl -sS -X POST http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/store -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc"}'
  8033:     37: - Verify checksum:
  8034:     38:   curl -sS -X POST http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/verify -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc"}'
  8035:     39: - List checksums:
  8036:     40:   curl -sS http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/list
  8037:     41: 
  8038:     42: 7) Useful scripts
  8039:     43: - Detach helper (Node): ./scripts/detach.js
  8040:     44: - POSIX watchdog: ./scripts/run-with-timeout.sh
  8041:     45: - PowerShell watchdog: ./scripts/run-with-timeout.ps1
  8042:     46: 
  8043:     47: 8) Re-enable Redis / Copilot (production)
  8044:     48: - To re-enable Redis, set REDIS_URL and remove/clear QFLUSH_DISABLE_REDIS.
  8045:     49: - To re-enable Copilot, provide `.qflush/copilot.json` with `enabled:true` and set HMAC/webhook envs.
  8046:     50: 
  8047:     51: 9) Cleanup helpers
  8048:     52: - If you need to force-reset the repo's runtime state:
  8049:     53:   - qflush purge
  8050:     54:   - npm run run:timeout -- 5 node dist/index.js purge
  8051:     55: 
  8052:     56: If you want, I can add these entries to `README.md` too.  
  8053:     57: 
  8054: 
  8055: 
  8056: ============================
  8057: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\rome-index-diagram.svg
  8058: ============================
  8059: ============================
  8060: [BINARY CONTENT - 3276 bytes]
  8061: [ERROR] Failed to include file: D:\qflush\docs\rome-index-diagram.svg
  8062: Reason: Error formatting a string: Index (zero based) must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the size of the argument list..

  8064: 
  8065: ============================
  8066: FILE: D:\qflush\docs\sysinternals.md
  8067: ============================
  8068: ============================
  8069:      1: # Utilitaires Sysinternals (PsSuspend) pour QFLUSH
  8070:      2: 
  8071:      3: Ce document explique comment installer PsSuspend (Sysinternals) et comment l'utiliser de faon scurise avec QFLUSH. Ne commite jamais de binaires dans le dpt  prfre installer localement et rfrencer le chemin via une variable d'environnement.
  8072:      4: 
  8073:      5: ## Pourquoi PsSuspend ?
  8074:      6: - Permet de *suspendre* un processus sous Windows sans le tuer (utile pour "freezeAll").
  8075:      7: - QFLUSH essaie d'utiliser PsSuspend si disponible, sinon retombe sur `taskkill` (terminaison force).
  8076:      8: 
  8077:      9: ## Installation recommande
  8078:     10: 1. Tlcharge la suite Sysinternals depuis Microsoft :
  8079:     11:    - https://learn.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/sysinternals-suite
  8080:     12: 2. Extrait `PsSuspend.exe` dans un dossier sur ta machine, par exemple `C:\tools\sysinternals`.
  8081:     13: 3. (Optionnel) Ajoute ce dossier  ton `PATH`, ou dfinis la variable d'environnement spcifique :
  8082:     14:    - PowerShell : `$env:QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH = 'C:\tools\sysinternals\PsSuspend.exe'`
  8083:     15:    - Bash : `export QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH='/c/tools/sysinternals/PsSuspend.exe'`
  8084:     16: 
  8085:     17: ## Utilisation avec QFLUSH
  8086:     18: - Si `QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH` est dfini, QFLUSH l'utilisera pour suspendre/reprendre les processus.
  8087:     19: - Sinon QFLUSH cherchera `pssuspend` dans le `PATH`.
  8088:     20: - Si PsSuspend est indisponible, QFLUSH utilise `taskkill /F` en dernier recours.
  8089:     21: 
  8090:     22: ## Commandes de test (PowerShell)
  8091:     23: - Lancer Notepad : `Start-Process notepad`
  8092:     24: - Trouver son PID : `Get-Process notepad`
  8093:     25: - Suspendre manuellement (si PsSuspend install) : `& 'C:\tools\sysinternals\PsSuspend.exe' <PID>`
  8094:     26: - Reprendre : `& 'C:\tools\sysinternals\PsSuspend.exe' -r <PID>`
  8095:     27: 
  8096:     28: ## Intgration dans QFLUSH
  8097:     29: - QFLUSH lit `QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH` si dfini ; sinon `pssuspend` depuis le `PATH` est essay.
  8098:     30: - Le code de `freezeAll` fait une tentative non bloquante et tombe sur `taskkill` si ncessaire.
  8099:     31: 
  8100:     32: ## Scurit et bonnes pratiques
  8101:     33: - Ne commite jamais `PsSuspend.exe` ni d'autres binaires Sysinternals dans le dpt.
  8102:     34: - Place les utilitaires dans un rpertoire systme (`C:\tools\sysinternals`) et documente leur chemin.
  8103:     35: - Excute les commandes en tant qu'administrateur si tu as besoin de suspendre/reprendre des processus systmes.
  8104:     36: 
  8105:     37: ## Si besoin d'aide
  8106:     38: Si tu veux, je peux :
  8107:     39: - ajouter un script de vrification qui signale si `QFLUSH_PSSUSPEND_PATH` est valide, ou
  8108:     40: - ajouter un exemple de configuration dans `README.md`.
  8109:     41: 
  8110:     42: 
  8111: 
  8112: 
  8113: ============================
  8114: FILE: D:\qflush\dump-all-and-rgba.ps1
  8115: ============================
  8116: ============================
  8117:      1: param(
  8118:      2:   [string]$Root = 'D:\qflush',
  8119:      3:   [string]$OutText = 'D:\qflush-code-dump.txt',
  8120:      4:   [string]$OutRaw = 'D:\qflush-code-dump.raw',
  8121:      5:   [string]$OutPng = 'D:\qflush-code-dump.png',
  8122:      6:   [int]$ImageWidth = 1024
  8123:      7: )
  8124:      8: 
  8125:      9: Write-Host "=== QFLUSH DUMP START ==="
  8126:     10: Write-Host "Root          : $Root"
  8127:     11: Write-Host "OutText       : $OutText"
  8128:     12: Write-Host "OutRaw        : $OutRaw"
  8129:     13: Write-Host "OutPng        : $OutPng"
  8130:     14: Write-Host "ImageWidth    : $ImageWidth"
  8131:     15: Write-Host ""
  8132:     16: 
  8133:     17: # 1) Validation du root
  8134:     18: if (-not (Test-Path -Path $Root)) {
  8135:     19:   Write-Error "Root path '$Root' not found."
  8136:     20:   exit 2
  8137:     21: }
  8138:     22: 
  8139:     23: # 2) Nettoyage des sorties prcdentes
  8140:     24: foreach ($p in @($OutText, $OutRaw, $OutPng)) {
  8141:     25:   if (Test-Path $p) {
  8142:     26:     Write-Host "Removing previous output: $p"
  8143:     27:     Remove-Item $p -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
  8144:     28:   }
  8145:     29: }
  8146:     30: 
  8147:     31: # 3) Prparation writer UTF-8 sans BOM
  8148:     32: $utf8NoBOM = New-Object System.Text.UTF8Encoding($false)
  8149:     33: $fs = [System.IO.File]::Open(
  8150:     34:   $OutText,
  8151:     35:   [System.IO.FileMode]::Create,
  8152:     36:   [System.IO.FileAccess]::Write,
  8153:     37:   [System.IO.FileShare]::Read
  8154:     38: )
  8155:     39: $sw = New-Object System.IO.StreamWriter($fs, $utf8NoBOM)
  8156:     40: 
  8157:     41: # Extensions considres comme "texte"
  8158:     42: $textExtensions = @(
  8159:     43:   '.ts', '.tsx', '.js', '.cjs', '.mjs',
  8160:     44:   '.json', '.yml', '.yaml', '.md',
  8161:     45:   '.ps1', '.psm1', '.psd1',
  8162:     46:   '.xml', '.txt', '.sh', '.bat',
  8163:     47:   '.c', '.cpp', '.h', '.hpp'
  8164:     48: )
  8165:     49: 
  8166:     50: # Dossiers  exclure
  8167:     51: $excludePatterns = @(
  8168:     52:   '\node_modules\',
  8169:     53:   '\dist\',
  8170:     54:   '\out\',
  8171:     55:   '\.git\',
  8172:     56:   '\coverage\',
  8173:     57:   '\.vscode\',
  8174:     58:   '\.idea\',
  8175:     59:   '\.vs\',
  8176:     60:   '\.qflush\cache\'
  8177:     61: )
  8178:     62: 
  8179:     63: function Test-ExcludedPath([string]$fullPath) {
  8180:     64:   foreach ($pat in $excludePatterns) {
  8181:     65:     if ($fullPath -like "*$pat*") { return $true }
  8182:     66:   }
  8183:     67:   return $false
  8184:     68: }
  8185:     69: 
  8186:     70: try {
  8187:     71:   # En-tte du dump
  8188:     72:   $now = (Get-Date).ToString("o")
  8189:     73:   $sw.WriteLine("qflush code dump generated: $now")
  8190:     74:   $sw.WriteLine()
  8191:     75: 
  8192:     76:   Write-Host "Scanning files under: $Root"
  8193:     77:   $files = Get-ChildItem -Path $Root -Recurse -File -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue |
  8194:     78:     Where-Object { -not (Test-ExcludedPath $_.FullName) } |
  8195:     79:     Sort-Object FullName
  8196:     80: 
  8197:     81:   Write-Host ("Found {0} files after exclusions." -f $files.Count)
  8198:     82:   Write-Host ""
  8199:     83: 
  8200:     84:   foreach ($f in $files) {
  8201:     85:     try {
  8202:     86:       # Chemin relatif
  8203:     87:       $rel = $f.FullName
  8204:     88:       if ($rel.StartsWith($Root, [System.StringComparison]::InvariantCultureIgnoreCase)) {
  8205:     89:         $rel = $rel.Substring($Root.Length).TrimStart('\','/')
  8206:     90:       }
  8207:     91: 
  8208:     92:       Write-Host "Dumping file: $rel"
  8209:     93: 
  8210:     94:       $sep = '=' * 28
  8211:     95:       $sw.WriteLine($sep)
  8212:     96:       $sw.WriteLine("FILE: $rel")
  8213:     97:       $sw.WriteLine($sep)
  8214:     98:       $sw.WriteLine($sep)
  8215:     99: 
  8216:    100:       $ext = [System.IO.Path]::GetExtension($f.FullName).ToLowerInvariant()
  8217:    101:       $isTextExt = $textExtensions -contains $ext
  8218:    102: 
  8219:    103:       if ($isTextExt) {
  8220:    104:         # Lecture texte
  8221:    105:         $raw = $null
  8222:    106:         try {
  8223:    107:           $raw = Get-Content -LiteralPath $f.FullName -Raw -Encoding UTF8 -ErrorAction Stop
  8224:    108:         } catch {
  8225:    109:           $raw = $null
  8226:    110:         }
  8227:    111: 
  8228:    112:         if ($null -ne $raw) {
  8229:    113:           # Dcouper en lignes, crire sans utiliser -f sur le contenu
  8230:    114:           $lines = $raw -split "`r?`n"
  8231:    115:           $ln = 1
  8232:    116:           foreach ($line in $lines) {
  8233:    117:             $prefix = "{0,6}: " -f $ln
  8234:    118:             $sw.WriteLine($prefix + $line)
  8235:    119:             $ln++
  8236:    120:           }
  8237:    121:         } else {
  8238:    122:           # Fallback binaire
  8239:    123:           $bytes = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($f.FullName)
  8240:    124:           $sw.WriteLine("[BINARY CONTENT - {0} bytes] (text read failed)" -f $bytes.Length)
  8241:    125:           for ($i = 0; $i -lt $bytes.Length; $i += 16) {
  8242:    126:             $end = [Math]::Min($i + 15, $bytes.Length - 1)
  8243:    127:             $slice = $bytes[$i..$end]
  8244:    128:             $hex = ($slice | ForEach-Object { $_.ToString('x2') }) -join ' '
  8245:    129:             $sw.WriteLine('{0,6}: {1}' -f (($i / 16) + 1), $hex)
  8246:    130:           }
  8247:    131:         }
  8248:    132:       } else {
  8249:    133:         # Lecture binaire pure
  8250:    134:         $bytes = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($f.FullName)
  8251:    135:         $sw.WriteLine("[BINARY CONTENT - {0} bytes]" -f $bytes.Length)
  8252:    136:         for ($i = 0; $i -lt $bytes.Length; $i += 16) {
  8253:    137:           $end = [Math]::Min($i + 15, $bytes.Length - 1)
  8254:    138:           $slice = $bytes[$i..$end]
  8255:    139:           $hex = ($slice | ForEach-Object { $_.ToString('x2') }) -join ' '
  8256:    140:           $sw.WriteLine('{0,6}: {1}' -f (($i / 16) + 1), $hex)
  8257:    141:         }
  8258:    142:       }
  8259:    143: 
  8260:    144:       $sw.WriteLine()
  8261:    145:       $sw.WriteLine()
  8262:    146:       $sw.Flush()
  8263:    147:     } catch {
  8264:    148:       # IMPORTANT : ne pas utiliser -f avec le message d'exception
  8265:    149:       $sw.WriteLine("[ERROR] Failed to include file: " + $f.FullName)
  8266:    150:       $sw.WriteLine("Reason: " + $_.Exception.Message)
  8267:    151:       $sw.WriteLine()
  8268:    152:       $sw.WriteLine()
  8269:    153:       $sw.Flush()
  8270:    154: 
  8271:    155:       Write-Warning "Failed to dump file: $($f.FullName) -> $($_.Exception.Message)"
  8272:    156:     }
  8273:    157:   }
  8274:    158: 
  8275:    159:   $completed = (Get-Date -Format o)
  8276:    160:   $sw.WriteLine("Completed: $completed")
  8277:    161:   $sw.Flush()
  8278:    162:   Write-Host "Text dump completed at: $completed"
  8279:    163: }
  8280:    164: finally {
  8281:    165:   $sw.Close()
  8282:    166:   $fs.Close()
  8283:    167: }
  8284:    168: 
  8285:    169: # 5) Conversion du texte  RAW RGBA  PNG (ImageMagick)
  8286:    170: Write-Host ""
  8287:    171: Write-Host "=== Building RAW / PNG from text dump ==="
  8288:    172: 
  8289:    173: try {
  8290:    174:   if (-not (Test-Path $OutText)) {
  8291:    175:     Write-Warning "Text dump not found at $OutText, aborting RAW/PNG generation."
  8292:    176:     return
  8293:    177:   }
  8294:    178: 
  8295:    179:   $textBytes = [System.IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($OutText)
  8296:    180:   $len = $textBytes.Length
  8297:    181:   Write-Host ("Text dump size: {0} bytes" -f $len)
  8298:    182: 
  8299:    183:   # Padding  multiple de 4 (RGBA)
  8300:    184:   $pad = (4 - ($len % 4)) % 4
  8301:    185:   if ($pad -gt 0) {
  8302:    186:     Write-Host ("Applying padding of {0} bytes to align to RGBA." -f $pad)
  8303:    187:     $new = New-Object byte[] ($len + $pad)
  8304:    188:     [System.Array]::Copy($textBytes, 0, $new, 0, $len)
  8305:    189:     $textBytes = $new
  8306:    190:     $len = $textBytes.Length
  8307:    191:   }
  8308:    192: 
  8309:    193:   [System.IO.File]::WriteAllBytes($OutRaw, $textBytes)
  8310:    194:   Write-Host "RAW RGBA bytes written to: $OutRaw (length=${len})"
  8311:    195: 
  8312:    196:   $pixels = [int]($len / 4)
  8313:    197:   $width = [int]$ImageWidth
  8314:    198:   if ($width -le 0) { $width = 1024 }
  8315:    199:   $height = [int][Math]::Ceiling($pixels / $width)
  8316:    200: 
  8317:    201:   Write-Host ("Image logical size: {0}x{1} pixels (pixels={2})" -f $width, $height, $pixels)
  8318:    202: 
  8319:    203:   # Ensure raw length matches width*height*4 by padding with zeros if necessary
  8320:    204:   $requiredBytes = $width * $height * 4
  8321:    205:   if ($len -lt $requiredBytes) {
  8322:    206:     $padNeeded = $requiredBytes - $len
  8323:    207:     Write-Host ("Padding raw file to {0} bytes (adding {1} zeros) to match image size" -f $requiredBytes, $padNeeded)
  8324:    208:     $newArr = New-Object byte[] $requiredBytes
  8325:    209:     [System.Array]::Copy($textBytes, 0, $newArr, 0, $len)
  8326:    210:     [System.IO.File]::WriteAllBytes($OutRaw, $newArr)
  8327:    211:     $len = $newArr.Length
  8328:    212:   }
  8329:    213: 
  8330:    214:   # Detect ImageMagick executable reliably
  8331:    215:   $magickExe = $null
  8332:    216:   try { $magickExe = (Get-Command magick -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue).Source } catch {}
  8333:    217:   if (-not $magickExe) {
  8334:    218:     try { $magickExe = (Get-Command convert -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue).Source } catch {}
  8335:    219:   }
  8336:    220: 
  8337:    221:   $useMagick = $false
  8338:    222:   $useConvert = $false
  8339:    223:   if ($magickExe) {
  8340:    224:     $exeName = (Split-Path $magickExe -Leaf).ToLower()
  8341:    225:     if ($exeName -eq 'magick' -or $exeName -eq 'magick.exe') {
  8342:    226:       $useMagick = $true
  8343:    227:     } else {
  8344:    228:       # candidate 'convert' found - ensure it's ImageMagick, not Windows convert
  8345:    229:       try {
  8346:    230:         $ver = & $magickExe -version 2>&1
  8347:    231:         if ($ver -and ($ver -join "`n") -match 'ImageMagick') { $useConvert = $true }
  8348:    232:       } catch {
  8349:    233:         $useConvert = $false
  8350:    234:       }
  8351:    235:     }
  8352:    236:   }
  8353:    237: 
  8354:    238:   if ($useMagick -or $useConvert) {
  8355:    239:     if ($useMagick) {
  8356:    240:       Write-Host "Using ImageMagick (magick) at: $magickExe"
  8357:    241:       # magick v7: magick -size WxH -depth 8 rgba:in.raw out.png
  8358:    242:       & $magickExe '-size' "${width}x${height}" '-depth' '8' ('rgba:' + $OutRaw) $OutPng
  8359:    243:     } else {
  8360:    244:       Write-Host "Using ImageMagick (convert) at: $magickExe"
  8361:    245:       & $magickExe '-size' "${width}x${height}" '-depth' '8' ('rgba:' + $OutRaw) $OutPng
  8362:    246:     }
  8363:    247: 
  8364:    248:     if (Test-Path $OutPng) {
  8365:    249:       Write-Host " RGBA image written to: $OutPng (size=${width}x${height})"
  8366:    250:     } else {
  8367:    251:       Write-Warning "ImageMagick executed but $OutPng not found. Check logs above."
  8368:    252:     }
  8369:    253:   } else {
  8370:    254:     Write-Warning "ImageMagick not found in PATH or 'convert' is the Windows tool. Skipping PNG generation."
  8371:    255:     Write-Host "RAW RGBA written to $OutRaw."
  8372:    256:     Write-Host "Install ImageMagick and run manually:"
  8373:    257:     Write-Host "  magick -size ${width}x${height} -depth 8 rgba:`"$OutRaw`" `"$OutPng`""
  8374:    258:   }
  8375:    259: } catch {
  8376:    260:   Write-Warning "Failed to create RGBA raw/png: $($_.Exception.Message)"
  8377:    261: }
  8378:    262: 
  8379:    263: Write-Host "Text dump written to: $OutText"
  8380:    264: Write-Host "=== QFLUSH DUMP END ==="
  8381:    265: 
  8382: 
  8383: 
  8384: ============================
  8385: FILE: D:\qflush\dump-qflush-code.ps1
  8386: ============================
  8387: ============================
  8388:      1: $OutFile = Join-Path (Get-Location) 'qflush-code-dump.txt'
  8389:      2: 
  8390:      3: # Overwrite if exists
  8391:      4: if (Test-Path $OutFile) {
  8392:      5:     Remove-Item $OutFile -Force
  8393:      6: }
  8394:      7: 
  8395:      8: # Extensions to include (lowercase)
  8396:      9: $includeExts = @('.ts', '.tsx', '.js', '.cjs', '.mjs', '.json', '.yml', '.yaml', '.md', '.ps1')
  8397:     10: 
  8398:     11: # Directory name segments to exclude
  8399:     12: $excludeDirs = @('node_modules','dist','out','.git','.vscode','coverage')
  8400:     13: 
  8401:     14: # Special exclude path fragments
  8402:     15: $excludePathFragments = @('\.qflush\\cache','/.qflush/cache')
  8403:     16: 
  8404:     17: # Separator lines
  8405:     18: $sep = '=' * 28
  8406:     19: 
  8407:     20: # Helper: check if path contains any excluded directory segment
  8408:     21: function IsPathExcluded($fullPath) {
  8409:     22:     $norm = $fullPath -replace '/', '\\'  # normalize to backslashes
  8410:     23:     # quick fragment check
  8411:     24:     foreach ($frag in $excludePathFragments) {
  8412:     25:         $fragNorm = $frag -replace '/', '\\'
  8413:     26:         if ($norm -like "*$fragNorm*") { return $true }
  8414:     27:     }
  8415:     28:     # split into segments and check
  8416:     29:     $segments = $norm -split '\\+' | Where-Object { $_ -ne '' }
  8417:     30:     foreach ($seg in $segments) {
  8418:     31:         foreach ($d in $excludeDirs) {
  8419:     32:             if ($seg -ieq $d) { return $true }
  8420:     33:         }
  8421:     34:     }
  8422:     35:     return $false
  8423:     36: }
  8424:     37: 
  8425:     38: # Collect files
  8426:     39: $allFiles = Get-ChildItem -Recurse -File -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object {
  8427:     40:     try {
  8428:     41:         $ext = ([IO.Path]::GetExtension($_.FullName) ?? '').ToLower()
  8429:     42:         if ($ext -eq '') { return $false }
  8430:     43:         if ($ext -eq '.log') { return $false }
  8431:     44:         if (-not ($includeExts -contains $ext)) { return $false }
  8432:     45:         if (IsPathExcluded($_.FullName)) { return $false }
  8433:     46:         return $true
  8434:     47:     } catch {
  8435:     48:         return $false
  8436:     49:     }
  8437:     50: }
  8438:     51: 
  8439:     52: # Sort for deterministic order
  8440:     53: $files = $allFiles | Sort-Object FullName
  8441:     54: 
  8442:     55: # Write header
  8443:     56: "qflush code dump generated: $(Get-Date -Format o)" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8
  8444:     57: "" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
  8445:     58: 
  8446:     59: $cwd = (Get-Location).ProviderPath
  8447:     60: 
  8448:     61: foreach ($f in $files) {
  8449:     62:     try {
  8450:     63:         # compute relative path
  8451:     64:         $full = $f.FullName
  8452:     65:         if ($full.StartsWith($cwd, [System.StringComparison]::InvariantCultureIgnoreCase)) {
  8453:     66:             $rel = $full.Substring($cwd.Length)
  8454:     67:             # strip leading slashes/backslashes robustly
  8455:     68:             $rel = $rel -replace '^[\\/]+',''
  8456:     69:         } else {
  8457:     70:             $rel = $full
  8458:     71:         }
  8459:     72: 
  8460:     73:         # write separators and file header
  8461:     74:         $header1 = $sep
  8462:     75:         $header2 = "FILE: $rel"
  8463:     76:         $header3 = $sep
  8464:     77:         $header4 = $sep
  8465:     78:         $header1 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
  8466:     79:         $header2 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
  8467:     80:         $header3 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
  8468:     81:         $header4 | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
  8469:     82: 
  8470:     83:         # read file content (try utf8 then fallback)
  8471:     84:         $content = $null
  8472:     85:         try {
  8473:     86:             $content = Get-Content -Raw -Encoding utf8 -ErrorAction Stop -LiteralPath $full
  8474:     87:         } catch {
  8475:     88:             try {
  8476:     89:                 $content = Get-Content -Raw -Encoding Default -ErrorAction Stop -LiteralPath $full
  8477:     90:             } catch {
  8478:     91:                 $content = Get-Content -Raw -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue -LiteralPath $full
  8479:     92:             }
  8480:     93:         }
  8481:     94: 
  8482:     95:         if ($null -eq $content) { $content = "" }
  8483:     96: 
  8484:     97:         # write raw content
  8485:     98:         Add-Content -LiteralPath $OutFile -Value $content -Encoding utf8
  8486:     99: 
  8487:    100:         # trailing newline for readability
  8488:    101:         "" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
  8489:    102:         "" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
  8490:    103:     } catch {
  8491:    104:         # continue on errors, but log minimal info to dump file
  8492:    105:         $errLine = "[ERROR] Failed to include file: $($f.FullName) - $($_.Exception.Message)"
  8493:    106:         $errLine | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
  8494:    107:     }
  8495:    108: }
  8496:    109: 
  8497:    110: "Completed: $(Get-Date -Format o)" | Out-File -FilePath $OutFile -Encoding utf8 -Append
  8498:    111:

\"../utils/exec\";\r\nimport { resolvePaths, SERVICE_MAP } from \"../utils/paths\";\r\nimport { qflushOptions } from \"../chain/smartChain\";\r\nimport { resolvePackagePath, readPackageJson } from \"../utils/package\";\r\nimport { startProcess } from \"../supervisor\";\r\nimport { waitForService } from \"../utils/health\";\r\nimport { runCustomsCheck, hasBlockingIssues, ModuleDescriptor } from \"../utils/npz-customs\";\r\nimport npz from \"../utils/npz\";\r\n\r\nexport async function runStart(opts?: qflushOptions) {\r\n  logger.info(\"qflush: starting modules...\");\r\n  const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());\r\n  const paths = resolvePaths(detected);\r\n\r\n  const services = opts?.services && opts.services.length ? opts.services : Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);\r\n  const flags = opts?.flags || {};\r\n\r\n  const waitForStart = Boolean(flags[\"wait\"] || flags[\"--wait\"] || false);\r\n  const doRestart = Boolean(flags[\"restart\"] || flags[\"--restart\"] || flags[\"force\"] || false);\r\n  const maxRestarts = typeof flags[\"restartCount\"] === \"number\" ? (flags[\"restartCount\"] as number) : 3;\r\n\r\n  const procs: Promise<void>[] = [];\r\n\r\n  async function startWithCustoms(modName: string) {\r\n    const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[modName]) || paths[modName];\r\n    const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[modName] && SERVICE_MAP[modName].pkg;\r\n\r\n    const modDesc: ModuleDescriptor = { name: modName, pkg, cwd: p || process.cwd() };\r\n\r\n    // run customs\r\n    const report = await runCustomsCheck(modDesc);\r\n    if (hasBlockingIssues(report)) {\r\n      logger.warn(`supervisor: ${modName} blocked at customs, not starting.`);\r\n      return;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // if an explicit path is provided, prefer to run it directly\r\n    if (p) {\r\n      try {\r\n        const pkgJson = readPackageJson(p);\r\n        if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {\r\n          const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === \"string\" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];\r\n          const binPath = require(\"path\").join(p, binEntry);\r\n          const runCmd = pathExists(binPath) && binPath.endsWith('.js') ? { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: p } : { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: p };\r\n          logger.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(\" \")}`);\r\n          startProcess(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });\r\n          return;\r\n        }\r\n      } catch (e) {\r\n        logger.warn(`Failed to run local path for ${modName}: ${e}`);\r\n      }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // otherwise, use NPZ resolver as primary\r\n    if (pkg) {\r\n      const resolved = npz.npzResolve(pkg, { cwd: p || process.cwd() });\r\n      if (!resolved || resolved.gate === 'fail') {\r\n        logger.warn(`${modName} path and package not found or NPZ failed to resolve, skipping`);\r\n        return;\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (resolved.gate === 'dlx') {\r\n        const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);\r\n        if (!ok) {\r\n          logger.warn(`${modName} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);\r\n          return;\r\n        }\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      const runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd as string, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };\r\n      logger.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(\" \")}`);\r\n      startProcess(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });\r\n      return;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    logger.warn(`${modName} has no runnable entry, skipping`);\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  for (const mod of services) {\r\n    const promise = (async () => {\r\n      // Use enhanced master flow which handles missing local bins and robust spawn\r\n      const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[mod]) || paths[mod];\r\n      const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[mod] && SERVICE_MAP[mod].pkg;\r\n\r\n      // resolve package path (local node_modules or provided path)\r\n      let pkgPath = p;\r\n      if (!pkgPath && pkg) pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);\r\n\r\n      if (!pkgPath && pkg) {\r\n        const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);\r\n        if (!ok) {\r\n          logger.warn(`${mod} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);\r\n          return;\r\n        }\r\n        pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (!pkgPath) {\r\n        // fallback to customs+npz flow\r\n        await startWithCustoms(mod);\r\n        return;\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      const pkgJson = readPackageJson(pkgPath);\r\n\r\n      // choose how to run: package bin if present, else npz resolver\r\n      let runCmd: { cmd: string; args: string[]; cwd?: string } | null = null;\r\n      if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {\r\n        const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === \"string\" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];\r\n        const binPath = require(\"path\").join(pkgPath, binEntry);\r\n\r\n        // prefer running via node when bin is a JS file inside package\r\n        if (binPath.endsWith(\".js\") && pathExists(binPath)) {\r\n          runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };\r\n        } else if (pathExists(binPath)) {\r\n          runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: pkgPath };\r\n        } else {\r\n          logger.warn(`${mod} bin entry not found at ${binPath}. ${rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath)}`);\r\n          return;\r\n        }\r\n      } else if (pkg) {\r\n        // fallback to npz resolver\r\n        const resolved = npz.npzResolve(pkg, { cwd: pkgPath });\r\n        if (!resolved || resolved.gate === 'fail') {\r\n          logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);\r\n          return;\r\n        }\r\n        runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd as string, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (!runCmd) {\r\n        logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);\r\n        return;\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      const restarts = 0;\r\n\r\n      const spawnOnce = (): Promise<void> => {\r\n        return new Promise((resolve) => {\r\n          logger.info(`Launching ${mod} -> ${runCmd!.cmd} ${runCmd!.args.join(\" \")}`);\r\n\r\n          // use supervisor to manage and persist process\r\n          const child = startProcess(mod, runCmd!.cmd, runCmd!.args, { cwd: runCmd!.cwd });\r\n\r\n          if (waitForStart) {\r\n            // try to wait for a health endpoint if provided in flags\r\n            const svcUrl = flags[\"health-url\"] || flags[\"health\"];\r\n            const svcPort = flags[\"health-port\"] || undefined;\r\n            if (svcUrl) {\r\n              waitForService(svcUrl as string, svcPort as any).then((ok) => {\r\n                if (ok) logger.success(`${mod} passed health check`);\r\n                else logger.warn(`${mod} failed health check`);\r\n                resolve();\r\n              });\r\n            } else {\r\n              // wait for spawn via PID persistence\r\n              setTimeout(() => {\r\n                logger.info(`${mod} started (delayed wait).`);\r\n                resolve();\r\n              }, 2000);\r\n            }\r\n          } else {\r\n            resolve();\r\n          }\r\n\r\n          // child exit handled by supervisor\r\n        });\r\n      };\r\n\r\n      // start the first time and optionally wait\r\n      await spawnOnce();\r\n\r\n      // restart logic handled by supervisor-level events, keep simple here\r\n    })();\r\n    procs.push(promise);\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  await Promise.all(procs);\r\n\r\n  logger.success(\"qflush: start sequence initiated for selected modules\");\r\n}\r\n","usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\compose\\fclParser.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\compose\\parser.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\daemon\\qflushd.ts","messages":[{"ruleId":"@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars","severity":1,"message":"'removed' is assigned a value but never used.","line":124,"column":9,"nodeType":"Identifier","messageId":"unusedVar","endLine":124,"endColumn":16}],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":1,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"source":"import 'dotenv/config';\r\nconst express = require('express');\r\nconst fs = require('fs');\r\nconst path = require('path');\r\n\r\n// optional Redis support\r\nlet Redis: any = null;\r\nlet redisClient: any = null;\r\nconst REDIS_URL = process.env.REDIS_URL || process.env.QFLUSH_REDIS_URL || '';\r\nif (REDIS_URL) {\r\n  try {\r\n    // require lazily so repo doesn't force dependency\r\n    // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires\r\n    Redis = require('ioredis');\r\n    redisClient = new Redis(REDIS_URL);\r\n    // best-effort connect\r\n    redisClient.on('error', (err: any) => {\r\n      console.warn('qflush: redis error', String(err));\r\n      redisClient = null;\r\n    });\r\n  } catch (e) {\r\n    // ignore if ioredis not installed\r\n    redisClient = null;\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\n// try to import gumroad helper if present\r\nlet gumroad: any = null;\r\ntry {\r\n  // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires\r\n  gumroad = require('../utils/gumroad-license');\r\n} catch (e) {\r\n  // ignore if not available\r\n}\r\n\r\nconst PORT = process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : 4500;\r\nconst AUDIT_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');\r\nconst AUDIT_LOG = path.join(AUDIT_DIR, 'license-activations.log');\r\n\r\nfunction ensureAuditDir() {\r\n  try {\r\n    if (!fs.existsSync(AUDIT_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(AUDIT_DIR, { recursive: true });\r\n  } catch (e) {\r\n    // ignore\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction audit(line: any) {\r\n  try {\r\n    ensureAuditDir();\r\n    fs.appendFileSync(AUDIT_LOG, (typeof line === 'string' ? line : JSON.stringify(line)) + '\\n', 'utf8');\r\n  } catch (e) {\r\n    // ignore\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nconst app = express();\r\napp.use(express.json());\r\n\r\n// --- One-time checksum cache ---\r\n// If Redis is configured, use Redis keys with TTL and a sorted set index for listing. Otherwise fallback to in-memory Map.\r\nconst CHECKSUM_DEFAULT_TTL_MS = Number(process.env.QFLUSH_CHECKSUM_TTL_MS) || 60 * 1000; // 60 seconds default\r\n\r\n// in-memory fallback store\r\ntype ChecksumEntry = { checksum: string; expiresAt: number };\r\nconst checksumCache = new Map<string, ChecksumEntry>();\r\n\r\n// Redis key helpers\r\nconst REDIS_KEY_PREFIX = 'qflush:npz:checksum:';\r\nconst REDIS_INDEX_KEY = 'qflush:npz:checksum:ids';\r\n\r\nasync function redisStore(id: string, checksum: string, ttlMs: number) {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return false;\r\n  const key = REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id;\r\n  const expiresAt = Date.now() + ttlMs;\r\n  // set key with PX TTL\r\n  await redisClient.set(key, checksum, 'PX', ttlMs);\r\n  // add to sorted set with score = expiresAt\r\n  await redisClient.zadd(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, expiresAt, id);\r\n  return true;\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisGet(id: string) {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return null;\r\n  const key = REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id;\r\n  const val = await redisClient.get(key);\r\n  if (!val) return null;\r\n  // obtain TTL to compute expiresAt\r\n  const ttlMs = await redisClient.pttl(key);\r\n  const expiresAt = Date.now() + (ttlMs > 0 ? ttlMs : 0);\r\n  return { checksum: val, expiresAt };\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisDelete(id: string) {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return false;\r\n  const key = REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id;\r\n  await redisClient.del(key);\r\n  await redisClient.zrem(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, id);\r\n  return true;\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisList() {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return [] as { id: string; expiresAt: number }[];\r\n  // remove expired ids from index\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  await redisClient.zremrangebyscore(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, 0, now - 1);\r\n  const items = await redisClient.zrangebyscore(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, now, '+inf', 'WITHSCORES');\r\n  // zrangebyscore with WITHSCORES returns [id, score, id, score, ...]\r\n  const results: { id: string; expiresAt: number }[] = [];\r\n  for (let i = 0; i < items.length; i += 2) {\r\n    const id = items[i];\r\n    const score = Number(items[i + 1]);\r\n    results.push({ id, expiresAt: score });\r\n  }\r\n  return results;\r\n}\r\n\r\nasync function redisClear() {\r\n  if (!redisClient) return 0;\r\n  const ids = await redisClient.zrange(REDIS_INDEX_KEY, 0, -1);\r\n  if (ids.length === 0) return 0;\r\n  const keys = ids.map((id: string) => REDIS_KEY_PREFIX + id);\r\n  await redisClient.del(...keys);\r\n  const removed = await redisClient.del(REDIS_INDEX_KEY);\r\n  return ids.length;\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction cleanupChecksumCache() {\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  for (const [key, entry] of checksumCache.entries()) {\r\n    if (entry.expiresAt <= now) checksumCache.delete(key);\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n// run cleanup periodically for memory fallback\r\nsetInterval(cleanupChecksumCache, 30 * 1000).unref();\r\n\r\n// store checksum: POST /npz/checksum/store { id, checksum, ttlMs? }\r\napp.post('/npz/checksum/store', async (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  const { id, checksum, ttlMs } = req.body || {};\r\n  if (!id || !checksum) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' });\r\n  const ttl = typeof ttlMs === 'number' && ttlMs > 0 ? ttlMs : CHECKSUM_DEFAULT_TTL_MS;\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      await redisStore(String(id), String(checksum), ttl);\r\n      audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_stored_redis', id: String(id) });\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), ttlMs: ttl, backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback to in-memory\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  checksumCache.set(String(id), { checksum: String(checksum), expiresAt: Date.now() + ttl });\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_stored_mem', id: String(id) });\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), ttlMs: ttl, backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// verify checksum: POST /npz/checksum/verify { id, checksum }\r\n// if verified, remove from cache (one-time) and return success\r\napp.post('/npz/checksum/verify', async (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  const { id, checksum } = req.body || {};\r\n  if (!id || !checksum) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' });\r\n\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      const rec = await redisGet(String(id));\r\n      if (!rec) return res.status(404).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum not found or expired' });\r\n      if (rec.checksum !== String(checksum)) {\r\n        audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_mismatch_redis', id: String(id), provided: String(checksum), expected: rec.checksum });\r\n        return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum mismatch' });\r\n      }\r\n      await redisDelete(String(id));\r\n      audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_verified_redis', id: String(id) });\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback to memory\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  const entry = checksumCache.get(String(id));\r\n  if (!entry) return res.status(404).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum not found or expired' });\r\n  if (entry.checksum !== String(checksum)) {\r\n    audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_mismatch_mem', id: String(id), provided: String(checksum), expected: entry.checksum });\r\n    return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum mismatch' });\r\n  }\r\n  // match: remove and return success\r\n  checksumCache.delete(String(id));\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_verified_mem', id: String(id) });\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// list checksums: GET /npz/checksum/list\r\napp.get('/npz/checksum/list', async (_req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      const items = await redisList();\r\n      const now = Date.now();\r\n      const result = items.map((it: any) => ({ id: it.id, expiresInMs: Math.max(0, it.expiresAt - now) }));\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, count: result.length, items: result, backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  const results: { id: string; expiresInMs: number }[] = [];\r\n  for (const [id, entry] of checksumCache.entries()) {\r\n    results.push({ id, expiresInMs: Math.max(0, entry.expiresAt - now) });\r\n  }\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, count: results.length, items: results, backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// clear checksums: DELETE /npz/checksum/clear\r\napp.delete('/npz/checksum/clear', async (_req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  if (redisClient) {\r\n    try {\r\n      const cleared = await redisClear();\r\n      audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_cleared_redis', cleared });\r\n      return res.json({ success: true, cleared, backend: 'redis' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      // fallback\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  const cleared = checksumCache.size;\r\n  checksumCache.clear();\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_cleared_mem', cleared });\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, cleared, backend: 'memory' });\r\n});\r\n\r\napp.post('/license/activate', async (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  const { key, product_id } = req.body || {};\r\n  if (!key) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing key' });\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), action: 'activate_attempt', key: key.replace(/.(?=.{4})/g, '*'), product_id });\r\n\r\n  if (!gumroad || typeof gumroad.activateLicense !== 'function') {\r\n    return res.status(501).json({ success: false, error: 'gumroad helper not available on daemon' });\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  const token = process.env.GUMROAD_TOKEN || '';\r\n  const pid = product_id || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_ID || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_YEARLY || process.env.GUMROAD_PRODUCT_MONTHLY || '';\r\n\r\n  try {\r\n    const rec = await gumroad.activateLicense(pid, key, token);\r\n    audit({ t: Date.now(), action: 'activate_success', key: key.replace(/.(?=.{4})/g, '*'), product_id: pid });\r\n    return res.json({ success: true, license: rec });\r\n  } catch (err: any) {\r\n    audit({ t: Date.now(), action: 'activate_failed', err: String(err), product_id: pid });\r\n    return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: err && err.message ? err.message : String(err) });\r\n  }\r\n});\r\n\r\napp.get('/license/status', (_req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  if (!gumroad || typeof gumroad.loadLicense !== 'function') return res.json({ success: true, license: null });\r\n  const rec = gumroad.loadLicense();\r\n  return res.json({ success: true, license: rec, valid: rec ? gumroad.isLicenseValid(rec) : false });\r\n});\r\n\r\n// public webhook endpoint suggested: /qflush/license/webhook\r\napp.post('/qflush/license/webhook', (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n  const payload = req.body || {};\r\n  audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'gumroad_webhook', payload });\r\n\r\n  // inspect payload for refund/chargeback/subscription cancel\r\n  const purchase = payload.purchase || payload.data || null;\r\n  let shouldClear = false;\r\n\r\n  if (purchase) {\r\n    if (purchase.refunded || purchase.chargebacked) shouldClear = true;\r\n    if (purchase.subscription_cancelled_at || purchase.subscription_ended_at) shouldClear = true;\r\n  }\r\n\r\n  const ev = (payload.event || payload.type || '').toString().toLowerCase();\r\n  if (ev.includes('refund') || ev.includes('chargeback') || ev.includes('subscription_cancel')) shouldClear = true;\r\n\r\n  if (shouldClear && gumroad && typeof gumroad.clearLicense === 'function') {\r\n    try {\r\n      gumroad.clearLicense();\r\n      audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'license_cleared_via_webhook' });\r\n    } catch (e) {\r\n      audit({ t: pourparler = require('../utils/npz-pourparler');\r\n\r\n  app.post('/npz/pourparler', (req: any, res: any) => {\r\n    try {\r\n      const body = req.body || {};\r\n      const action = body.action || 'color'; // default action\r\n      const text = String(body.text || '');\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'encode') {\r\n        const enc = pourparler.encodeAscii4(text);\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, encoded: enc });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'color') {\r\n        const colored = pourparler.colorizeAscii4(text);\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, colored });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'start') {\r\n        const s = pourparler.startSession(body.systemPrompt || '');\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, session: s });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'send') {\r\n        if (!body.sessionId) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'sessionId missing' });\r\n        const m = pourparler.sendMessage(body.sessionId, body.role || 'user', String(body.text || ''));\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, message: m });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'history') {\r\n        if (!body.sessionId) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'sessionId missing' });\r\n        const h = pourparler.getHistory(body.sessionId);\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, history: h });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'end') {\r\n        if (!body.sessionId) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'sessionId missing' });\r\n        const ok = pourparler.endSession(body.sessionId);\r\n        return res.json({ success: true, ended: ok });\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      if (action === 'checksum') {\r\n        try {\r\n          const cssPath = path.join(process.cwd(), 'extensions', 'vscode-npz', 'pourparler-checksum.css');\r\n            if (fs.existsSync(cssPath)) {\r\n            const content = fs.readFileSync(cssPath, 'utf8');\r\n            // extract the checksum value\r\n            const m = content.match(/--npz-pourparler-checksum:\\s*'([a-f0-9]+)'/i);\r\n            const checksum = m ? m[1] : null;\r\n            return res.json({ success: true, checksum, path: cssPath });\r\n          }\r\n          return res.status(404).json({ success: false, error: 'css not found' });\r\n        } catch (err) {\r\n          return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(err) });\r\n        }\r\n      }\r\n\r\n      return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'unknown action' });\r\n    } catch (e: any) {\r\n      return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(e) });\r\n    }\r\n  });\r\n} catch (e) {\r\n  // ignore if module not present\r\n}\r\n\r\napp.listen(PORT, () => {\r\n  console.log(`qflush running on http://localhost:${PORT}`);\r\n});\r\n","usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\index.ts","messages":[{"ruleId":"@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars","severity":1,"message":"'m' is
