Utilities for Nezlephant color palette and helpers\r\n// Base color shorthand '0c8' -> #00cc88\r\n\r\nexport const NEZLEPHANT = {\r\n  baseHex: '#00cc88', // shorthand 0c8\r\n  jokerHex: '#ff00cc', // Joker accent (magenta-pink)\r\n  neutralHex: '#0f1724', // dark neutral\r\n  whiteHex: '#ffffff',\r\n  blackHex: '#000000',\r\n};\r\n\r\nfunction clamp(v: number, a = 0, b = 255) {\r\n  return Math.max(a, Math.min(b, Math.round(v)));\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function hexToRgb(hex: string): { r: number; g: number; b: number } {\r\n  const h = hex.replace('#', '');\r\n  if (h.length === 3) {\r\n    const r = parseInt(h[0] + h[0], 16);\r\n    const g = parseInt(h[1] + h[1], 16);\r\n    const b = parseInt(h[2] + h[2], 16);\r\n    return { r, g, b };\r\n  }\r\n  const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);\r\n  const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);\r\n  const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);\r\n  return { r, g, b };\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function rgbToHex(r: number, g: number, b: number): string {\r\n  return `#${[r, g, b].map((n) => clamp(n).toString(16).padStart(2, '0')).join('')}`;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function rgba(hex: string, alpha = 1): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  return `rgba(${r}, ${g}, ${b}, ${alpha})`;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function lighten(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  const nr = clamp(r + (255 - r) * percent);\r\n  const ng = clamp(g + (255 - g) * percent);\r\n  const nb = clamp(b + (255 - b) * percent);\r\n  return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function darken(hex: string, percent = 0.1): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  const nr = clamp(r * (1 - percent));\r\n  const ng = clamp(g * (1 - percent));\r\n  const nb = clamp(b * (1 - percent));\r\n  return rgbToHex(nr, ng, nb);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function relativeLuminance(hex: string): number {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  const srgb = [r / 255, g / 255, b / 255].map((c) => (c <= 0.03928 ? c / 12.92 : Math.pow((c + 0.055) / 1.055, 2.4)));\r\n  return 0.2126 * srgb[0] + 0.7152 * srgb[1] + 0.0722 * srgb[2];\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function contrastRatio(hexA: string, hexB: string): number {\r\n  const L1 = relativeLuminance(hexA) + 0.05;\r\n  const L2 = relativeLuminance(hexB) + 0.05;\r\n  return Math.max(L1, L2) / Math.min(L1, L2);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function readableTextColor(backgroundHex: string, prefer = NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex): string {\r\n  // return white or black depending on contrast\r\n  const whiteContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex);\r\n  const blackContrast = contrastRatio(backgroundHex, NEZLEPHANT.blackHex);\r\n  return whiteContrast >= blackContrast ? NEZLEPHANT.whiteHex : NEZLEPHANT.blackHex;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function cssVariables(prefix = 'nez') {\r\n  const base = NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;\r\n  const j = NEZLEPHANT.jokerHex;\r\n  return `:root {\\n  --${prefix}-base: ${base};\\n  --${prefix}-base-90: ${rgba(base, 0.9)};\\n  --${prefix}-base-80: ${rgba(base, 0.8)};\\n  --${prefix}-base-60: ${rgba(base, 0.6)};\\n  --${prefix}-base-30: ${rgba(base, 0.3)};\\n  --${prefix}-light: ${lighten(base, 0.18)};\\n  --${prefix}-dark: ${darken(base, 0.18)};\\n  --${prefix}-joker: ${j};\\n  --${prefix}-bg: ${NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex};\\n  --${prefix}-text: ${readableTextColor(NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex)};\\n}`;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// Terminal ANSI truecolor helpers (supports modern terminals)\r\nexport function ansiFg(hex: string): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  return `\\x1b[38;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;\r\n}\r\nexport function ansiBg(hex: string): string {\r\n  const { r, g, b } = hexToRgb(hex);\r\n  return `\\x1b[48;2;${r};${g};${b}m`;\r\n}\r\nexport const ansiReset = '\\x1b[0m';\r\n\r\n// Preset styled log helpers for Joker + Nezlephant\r\nexport function styledLog(title: string, msg: string, opts?: { accent?: 'joker' | 'base' | 'neutral' }) {\r\n  const accent = opts?.accent === 'joker' ? NEZLEPHANT.neutralHex : NEZLEPHANT.baseHex;\r\n  const bg = ansiBg(darken(accent, 0.15));\r\n  const fg = ansiFg(readableTextColor(darken(accent, 0.15)));\r\n  const accentFg = ansiFg(accent);\r\n  process.stdout.write(`${bg}${fg} [${title}] ${ansiReset} ${accentFg}${msg}${ansiReset}\\n`);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport default {\r\n  NEZLEPHANT,\r\n  hexToRgb,\r\n  rgbToHex,\r\n  rgba,\r\n  lighten,\r\n  darken,\r\n  readableTextColor,\r\n  cssVariables,\r\n  ansiFg,\r\n  ansiBg,\r\n  ansiReset,\r\n  styledLog,\r\n};\r\n","usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\detect.ts","messages":[{"ruleId":"@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars","severity":1,"message":"'err' is defined but never used. http from 'http';\r\nimport net from 'net';\r\nimport { logger } from './logger';\r\n\r\nexport async function httpProbe(url: string, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {\r\n  return new Promise((resolve) => {\r\n    const req = http.get(url, (res) => {\r\n      res.resume();\r\n      resolve(Boolean(res.statusCode && res.statusCode < 400));\r\n    });\r\n    req.on('error', () => resolve(false));\r\n    req.setTimeout(timeout, () => {\r\n      req.destroy();\r\n      resolve(false);\r\n    });\r\n  });\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport async function tcpProbe(host: string, port: number, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {\r\n  return new Promise((resolve) => {\r\n    const s = new net.Socket();\r\n    let done = false;\r\n    s.setTimeout(timeout);\r\n    s.on('connect', () => {\r\n      done = true;\r\n      s.destroy();\r\n      resolve(true);\r\n    });\r\n    s.on('error', () => { if (!done) { done = true; resolve(false); } });\r\n    s.on('timeout', () => { if (!done) { done = true; s.destroy(); resolve(false); } });\r\n    s.connect(port, host);\r\n  });\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport async function waitForService(urlOrHost: string, port?: number, timeout = 5000) {\r\n  const start = Date.now();\r\n  while (Date.now() - start < timeout) {\r\n    let ok = false;\r\n    if (typeof port === 'number') {\r\n      ok = await tcpProbe(urlOrHost, port, 1000);\r\n    } else if (urlOrHost.startsWith('http')) {\r\n      ok = await httpProbe(urlOrHost, 1000);\r\n    }\r\n    if (ok) return true;\r\n    await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 500));\r\n  }\r\n  return false;\r\n}\r\n","usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\license.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\logger.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz-admin.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz-config.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz-customs.ts","messages":[],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":0,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz-engine.ts","messages":[{"ruleId":"@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars","severity":1,"message":"'logger' is defined but never used.","line":4,"column":8,"nodeType":"Identifier","messageId":"unusedVar","endLine":4,"endColumn":14}],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":1,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"source":"import { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config';\r\nimport fs from 'fs';\r\nimport path from 'path';\r\nimport logger from './logger';\r\nimport { Lane } from './npz-router';\r\n\r\nconst NS = getNpzNamespace();\r\nconst ENGINE_FILE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', `${NS}-npz-engine.json`);\r\n\r\ntype ScoreRecord = {\r\n  laneId: number;\r\n  score: number; // lower is better\r\n  lastSuccess?: number;\r\n  lastFailure?: number;\r\n};\r\n\r\ntype EngineStore = Record<number, ScoreRecord>;\r\n\r\nlet store: EngineStore = {};\r\n\r\n// decay parameters\r\nconst DECAY_INTERVAL_MS = 60 * 1000; // every minute\r\nconst DECAY_FACTOR = 0.9; // multiply score by this every decay interval (towards 0)\r\n\r\nfunction ensureDir() {\r\n  const dir = path.dirname(ENGINE_FILE);\r\n  if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction load() {\r\n  try {\r\n    if (fs.existsSync(ENGINE_FILE)) {\r\n      const raw = fs.readFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, 'utf8');\r\n      store = JSON.parse(raw) as EngineStore;\r\n    }\r\n  } catch (e) {\r\n    store = {};\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction persist() {\r\n  try {\r\n    ensureDir();\r\n    fs.writeFileSync(ENGINE_FILE, JSON.stringify(store, null, 2), 'utf8');\r\n  } catch (e) {}\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction applyDecay() {\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  let changed = false;\r\n  for (const k of Object.keys(store)) {\r\n    const id = Number(k);\r\n    const rec = store[id];\r\n    if (!rec) continue;\r\n    // compute how many intervals since lastSuccess/lastFailure (use lastFailure as activity reference)\r\n    const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;\r\n    const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);\r\n    if (intervals <= 0) continue;\r\n    const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);\r\n    const newScore = rec.score * factor;\r\n    if (Math.abs(newScore - rec.score) > 1e-6) {\r\n      rec.score = newScore;\r\n      changed = true;\r\n    }\r\n  }\r\n  if (changed) persist();\r\n}\r\n\r\nload();\r\n\r\n// schedule periodic decay in-memory (best-effort)\r\nsetInterval(() => {\r\n  try { applyDecay(); } catch (e) {}\r\n}, DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);\r\n\r\n/**\r\n * Adjust lane score.\r\n * delta: positive increases penalty (worse), negative decreases (better).\r\n * latencyMs: optional latency observed to weight the delta.\r\n */\r\nexport function scoreLane(laneId: number, delta: number, latencyMs?: number) {\r\n  let rec = store[laneId];\r\n  if (!rec) rec = { laneId, score: 0 };\r\n  // weight delta by latency (if provided): normalized over 1000ms\r\n  let weight = 1;\r\n  if (latencyMs && latencyMs > 0) weight += Math.min(5, latencyMs / 1000); // cap weight\r\n  rec.score = (rec.score || 0) + delta * weight;\r\n  if (delta < 0) rec.lastSuccess = Date.now();\r\n  if (delta > 0) rec.lastFailure = Date.now();\r\n  store[laneId] = rec;\r\n  persist();\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getLaneScore(laneId: number) {\r\n  const rec = store[laneId];\r\n  if (!rec) return 0;\r\n  // apply decay relative to now on read (non-persistent)\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  const ref = rec.lastFailure || rec.lastSuccess || now;\r\n  const intervals = Math.floor((now - ref) / DECAY_INTERVAL_MS);\r\n  const factor = Math.pow(DECAY_FACTOR, intervals);\r\n  return rec.score * factor;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function orderLanesByScore(lanes: Lane[]) {\r\n  // return copy sorted by score asc\r\n  const out = lanes.slice();\r\n  out.sort((a, b) => getLaneScore(a.id) - getLaneScore(b.id));\r\n  return out;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function resetScores() {\r\n  store = {};\r\n  persist();\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getStore() {\r\n  return store;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport default { scoreLane, getLaneScore, orderLanesByScore, resetScores, getStore (req.headers['x-npz-id'] as string) || req.cookies?.['npz_id'] || uuidv4();\r\n      res.cookie('npz_id', npz_id, { maxAge: maxAge * 1000, httpOnly: true });\r\n      await npzRoute({ method: req.method, url: fullUrl, headers: req.headers as any, body: (req as any).body });\r\n\r\n      if (report && (report.status || report.body || report.error)) {\r\n        // update record with lane if stored via router\r\n        const rec = await npzStore.getRequestRecord(npz_id);\r\n        const lane = rec?.laneId;\r\n        if (lane !== undefined) {\r\n          res.cookie(cookieName, String(lane), { maxAge: maxAge * 1000 });\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        // metrics\r\n        const diff = process.hrtime(start);\r\n        const duration = diff[0] + diff[1] / 1e9;\r\n        const gate = (report as any).gate || 'unknown';\r\n        const laneId = (report as any).laneId !== undefined ? String((report as any).laneId) : String(lane || 'unknown');\r\n        requestDuration.labels(gate, laneId, npz_id, NS).observe(duration);\r\n\r\n        logger.nez('NPZ', `npz_id=${npz_id} gate=${gate} lane=${laneId} duration=${duration.toFixed(3)}s`);\r\n\r\n        if (report.status) res.status(report.status);\r\n        // set headers (careful with set-cookie)\r\n        if (report.headers) {\r\n          try {\r\n            for (const [k, v] of Object.entries(report.headers)) {\r\n              if (k.toLowerCase() === 'set-cookie') continue;\r\n              res.setHeader(k, v as any);\r\n            }\r\n          } catch (e) {}\r\n        }\r\n        res.send(report.body || (report.error ? crypto from 'crypto';\r\n\r\ntype Message = { id: string; role: 'user' | 'assistant' | 'system'; text: string; t: number };\r\n\r\ntype Session = { id: string; messages: Message[]; createdAt: number };\r\n\r\nconst SESSIONS: Map<string, Session> = new Map();\r\n\r\nfunction id() { return Math.random().toString(36).slice(2,10); }\r\n\r\nexport function startSession(systemPrompt = ''): Session {\r\n  const sid = 's_' + id();\r\n  const s: Session = { id: sid, messages: [], createdAt: Date.now() };\r\n  if (systemPrompt) s.messages.push({ id: 'm_' + id(), role: 'system', text: systemPrompt, t: Date.now() });\r\n  SESSIONS.set(sid, s);\r\n  return s;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function sendMessage(sessionId: string, role: 'user' | 'assistant' | 'system', text: string) {\r\n  const s = SESSIONS.get(sessionId);\r\n  if (!s) throw new Error('session not found');\r\n  const m: Message = { id: 'm_' + id(), role, text, t: Date.now() };\r\n  s.messages.push(m);\r\n  return m;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getHistory(sessionId: string) {\r\n  const s = SESSIONS.get(sessionId);\r\n  if (!s) return [] as Message[];\r\n  return s.messages.slice();\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function endSession(sessionId: string) {\r\n  return SESSIONS.delete(sessionId);\r\n}\r\n\r\n// --- New: ASCII 4-byte encoding + colorize helpers ---\r\n\r\nfunction md5First4BytesHex(ch: string): string {\r\n  // return first 4 bytes (8 hex chars) of md5 of the char\r\n  const h = crypto.createHash('md5').update(ch).digest('hex');\r\n  return h.slice(0, 8);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function encodeAscii4(text: string): { ch: string; hex4: string }[] {\r\n  const out: { ch: string; hex4: string }[] = [];\r\n  for (const ch of text) {\r\n    out.push({ ch, hex4: md5First4BytesHex(ch) });\r\n  }\r\n  return out;\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction hexToRgb(hex: string) {\r\n  const h = hex.replace('#', '');\r\n  const r = parseInt(h.slice(0, 2), 16);\r\n  const g = parseInt(h.slice(2, 4), 16);\r\n  const b = parseInt(h.slice(4, 6), 16);\r\n  return { r, g, b };\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction byteToColor(b: number) {\r\n  // map single byte [0..255] to a color by expanding into RGB via simple transform\r\n  const r = (b * 3) % 256;\r\n  const g = (b * 7) % 256;\r\n  const b2 = (b * 13) % 256;\r\n  return { r, g, b: b2 };\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function colorizeAscii4(text: string): string {\r\n  // returns ANSI colored string: for each char produce a colored block based on its 4-byte hex\r\n  const parts: string[] = [];\r\n  for (const ch of text) {\r\n    const hex4 = md5First4BytesHex(ch); // 8 hex chars\r\n    // split into 4 bytes\r\n    const bytes: number[] = [];\r\n    for (let i = 0; i < 8; i += 2) bytes.push(parseInt(hex4.slice(i, i+2), 16));\r\n    // pick a representative color from bytes\r\n    const col = byteToColor(bytes[0]);\r\n    const ansi = `\\x1b[48;2;${col.r};${col.g};${col.b}m\\x1b[38;2;0;0;0m ${ch} \\x1b[0m`;\r\n    parts.push(ansi);\r\n  }\r\n  return parts.join('');\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport default { startSession, sendMessage, getHistory, endSession, encodeAscii4, colorizeAscii4 };\r\n","usedDeprecatedRules":[]},{"filePath":"D:\\qflush\\src\\utils\\npz-router.ts","messages":[{"ruleId":"@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars","severity":1,"message":"'lanes' is assigned a value but used.","line":177,"column":49,"nodeType":"Identifier","messageId":"unusedVar","endLine":177,"endColumn":62}],"suppressedMessages":[],"errorCount":0,"fatalErrorCount":0,"warningCount":1,"fixableErrorCount":0,"fixableWarningCount":0,"source":"import fs from 'fs';\r\nimport path from 'path';\r\nimport { performance } from 'perf_hooks';\r\nimport logger from './logger';\r\nimport client from 'prom-client';\r\nimport { getNpzNamespace } from './npz-config';\r\nimport engine from './npz-engine';\r\n\r\nconst NS = getNpzNamespace();\r\n\r\nexport type Lane = { id: number; name: string; url: string };\r\n\r\nexport const DEFAULT_LANES: Lane[] = [\r\n  { id: 0, name: 'primary', url: 'https://api.primary.local' },\r\n  { id: 1, name: 'backup-fast', url: 'https://fast.api.local' },\r\n  { id: 2, name: 'backup-slow', url: 'https://slow.api.local' },\r\n];\r\n\r\nconst STORE_FILE = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', `${NS}-npz-lanes.json`);\r\nconst DEFAULT_TIMEOUT = 3000; // ms\r\nconst PREFERRED_TTL = 24 * 3600 * 1000; // 24h\r\n\r\n// Circuit breaker settings\r\nconst FAIL_THRESHOLD = 3; // failures\r\nconst FAIL_WINDOW_MS = 60 * 1000; // 1m\r\nconst COOLDOWN_MS = 5 * 60 * 1000; // 5m\r\n\r\ntype Store = Record<string, { laneId: number; ts: number }>;\r\n\r\ntype CircuitState = {\r\n  failures: number;\r\n  firstFailureTs?: number;\r\n  trippedUntil?: number;\r\n};\r\n\r\nconst circuit: Map<string, Map<number, CircuitState>> = new Map(); // host -> laneId -> state\r\n\r\n// Prometheus metrics\r\nconst laneSuccess = new client.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_success_total`, help: 'NPZ lane successes', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });\r\nconst laneFailure = new client.Counter({ name: `${NS}_lane_failure_total`, help: 'NPZ lane failures', labelNames: ['host', 'lane', 'namespace'] });\r\n\r\nfunction ensureStoreDir() {\r\n  const dir = path.dirname(STORE_FILE);\r\n  if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction readStore(): Store {\r\n  try {\r\n    if (!fs.existsSync(STORE_FILE)) return {};\r\n    const raw = fs.readFileSync(STORE_FILE, 'utf8');\r\n    return JSON.parse(raw) as Store;\r\n  } catch (err) {\r\n    logger.warn(`npz-router: failed to read store ${err}`);\r\n    return {};\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nfunction writeStore(s: Store) {\r\n  try {\r\n    ensureStoreDir();\r\n    fs.writeFileSync(STORE_FILE, JSON.stringify(s, null, 2), 'utf8');\r\n  } catch (err) {\r\n    logger.warn(`npz-router: failed to write store ${err}`);\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getPreferredLane(host: string): number | null {\r\n  const s = readStore();\r\n  const entry = s[host];\r\n  if (!entry) return null;\r\n  if (Date.now() - entry.ts > PREFERRED_TTL) return null;\r\n  return entry.laneId;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function setPreferredLane(host: string, laneId: number) {\r\n  const s = readStore();\r\n  s[host] = { laneId, ts: Date.now() };\r\n  writeStore(s);\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function lanesForHost(host: string, lanes: Lane[] = DEFAULT_LANES): Lane[] {\r\n  const pref = getPreferredLane(host);\r\n  // first let engine reorder by score\r\n  const ordered = engine.orderLanesByScore(lanes);\r\n  // then apply preferred lane override\r\n  if (pref === null) return ordered.slice();\r\n  const idx = ordered.findIndex((l) => l.id === pref);\r\n  if (idx <= 0) return ordered.slice();\r\n  const res = [ordered[idx], ...ordered.slice(0, idx), ...ordered.slice(idx + 1)];\r\n  return res;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// Circuit breaker helpers\r\nfunction getCircuitMapForHost(host: string) {\r\n  let m = circuit.get(host);\r\n  if (!m) {\r\n    m = new Map();\r\n    circuit.set(host, m);\r\n  }\r\n  return m;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function recordFailure(host: string, laneId: number, latencyMs?: number) {\r\n  const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);\r\n  const now = Date.now();\r\n  const st = m.get(laneId) || { failures: 0 };\r\n  if (!st.firstFailureTs || now - (st.firstFailureTs || 0) > FAIL_WINDOW_MS) {\r\n    st.failures = 1;\r\n    st.firstFailureTs = now;\r\n  } else {\r\n    st.failures = (st.failures || 0) + 1;\r\n  }\r\n  if (st.failures >= FAIL_THRESHOLD) {\r\n    st.trippedUntil = now + COOLDOWN_MS;\r\n    logger.warn(`npz-router: lane ${laneId} for ${host} tripped until ${new Date(st.trippedUntil)}`);\r\n  }\r\n  m.set(laneId, st);\r\n  try { laneFailure.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS } as any); } catch {}\r\n  try { engine.scoreLane(laneId, 1, latencyMs); } catch {}\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function recordSuccess(host: string, laneId: number, latencyMs?: number) {\r\n  const m = getCircuitMapForHost(host);\r\n  m.delete(laneId);\r\n  try { laneSuccess.inc({ host, lane: String(laneId), namespace: NS } as any); } catch {}\r\n  try { engine.scoreLane(laneId, -1, latencyMs); } catch {}\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function isLaneTripped(host: string, laneId: number): boolean {\r\n  const m = circuit.get(host);\r\n  if (!m) return false;\r\n  const st = m.get(laneId);\r\n  if (!st) return false;\r\n  if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() < st.trippedUntil) return true;\r\n  // cooldown passed\r\n  if (st.trippedUntil && Date.now() >= st.trippedUntil) {\r\n    m.delete(laneId);\r\n    return false;\r\n  }\r\n  return false;\r\n}\r\n\r\n// lightweight fetch wrapper that returns {status, headers, body, durationMs}\r\nasync function tryFetch(fullUrl: string, options: any = {}, timeout = DEFAULT_TIMEOUT) {\r\n  const controller = typeof AbortController !== 'undefined' ? new AbortController() : null;\r\n  const signalOpt = controller ? { signal: controller.signal } : {};\r\n  const opts = { method: options.method || 'GET', headers: options.headers || {}, body: options.body, ...signalOpt };\r\n  let timer: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;\r\n  const start = performance.now();\r\n  if (controller) timer = setTimeout(() => controller.abort(), timeout);\r\n  try {\r\n    // prefer global fetch\r\n    let ff: any = (globalThis as any).fetch;\r\n    if (!ff) {\r\n      try {\r\n        // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires\r\n        ff = require('undici').fetch;\r\n      } catch (e) {\r\n        throw new Error('No fetch available (install undici or use Node 18+)');\r\n      }\r\n    }\r\n    const res = await ff(fullUrl, opts);\r\n    const text = await res.text();\r\n    if (timer) clearTimeout(timer);\r\n    const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(performance.now() - start));\r\n    return { ok: true, status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: text, durationMs: duration };\r\n  } catch (err: any) {\r\n    if (timer) clearTimeout(timer);\r\n    const duration = Math.max(0, Math.round(performance.now() - start));\r\n    return { ok: false, error: err, durationMs: duration };\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport type NpzRequest = { method?: string; url: string; headers?: Record<string, string>; body?: any; timeout?: number };\r\nexport type NpzResponse = { status?: number; headers?: any; body?: string; error?: any; gate?: string; laneId?: number; durationMs?: number };\r\n\r\nexport async function npzRoute(req: NpzRequest, lanes: Lane[] = DEFAULT_LANES): Promise<NpzResponse> {\r\n  try {\r\n    const urlObj = new URL(req.url);\r\n    const host = urlObj.host;\r\n    const ordered = lanesForHost(host) as Lane[];\r\n\r\n    // attempt primary\r\n    const primary = ordered[0];\r\n    const primaryUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, primary.url);\r\n    const timeout = req.timeout || DEFAULT_TIMEOUT;\r\n\r\n    logger.nez('NPZ', `attempting primary lane ${primary.name} -> ${primaryUrl}`);\r\n    const t0 = await tryFetch(primaryUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);\r\n\r\n    if (t0.ok && t0.status && t0.status < 500) {\r\n      logger.nez('NPZ', `primary succeeded (${primary.name})`);\r\n      setPreferredLane(host, primary.id);\r\n      recordSuccess(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);\r\n      return { status: t0.status, headers: t0.headers, body: t0.body, gate: 'primary', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: t0.durationMs };\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // primary failed -> try fallback(s)\r\n    logger.warn(`[NPZ] primary failed for ${primary.name}, running fallbacks`);\r\n    recordFailure(host, primary.id, t0.durationMs);\r\n\r\n    for (let i = 1; i < ordered.length; i++) {\r\n      const lane = ordered[i];\r\n      const laneUrl = req.url.replace(urlObj.origin, lane.url);\r\n      logger.nez('NPZ', `trying fallback lane ${lane.name} -> ${laneUrl}`);\r\n      const res = await tryFetch(laneUrl, { method: req.method, headers: req.headers, body: req.body }, timeout);\r\n      if (res.ok && res.status && res.status < 500) {\r\n        logger.nez('NPZ', `fallback lane ${lane.name} succeeded`);\r\n        // set preferred to fallback for next time\r\n        setPreferredLane(host, lane.id);\r\n        recordSuccess(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);\r\n\r\n        // replay primary with an extra header (T2)\r\n        const replayHeaders = Object.assign({}, req.headers || {});\r\n        replayHeaders['X-NPZ-FALLBACK'] = '1';\r\n        const replayUrl = primaryUrl;\r\n        logger.nez('NPZ', `replaying primary (${primary.name}) with fallback header`);\r\n        const replay = await tryFetch(replayUrl, { method: req.method, headers: replayHeaders, body: req.body }, timeout);\r\n        if (replay.ok && replay.status && replay.status < 500) {\r\n          logger.nez('NPZ', `replayed primary succeeded after fallback`);\r\n          return { status: replay.status, headers: replay.headers, body: replay.body, gate: 'replay', laneId: primary.id, durationMs: replay.durationMs };\r\n        }\r\n\r\n        // if replay failed, return fallback result\r\n        return { status: res.status, headers: res.headers, body: res.body, gate: 'fallback', laneId: lane.id, durationMs: res.durationMs };\r\n      } else {\r\n        recordFailure(host, lane.id, res.durationMs);\r\n      }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // if all failed, return primary error or generic\r\n    logger.warn('[NPZ] all lanes failed');\r\n    if (t0 && !t0.ok) return { error: t0.error, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };\r\n    return { status: t0.status, body: t0.body, gate: 'fail', durationMs: t0.durationMs };\r\n  } catch (err) {\r\n    return { error: err, gate: 'error' };\r\n  }\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport function getCircuitState(host: string) {\r\n  const m = circuit.get(host);\r\n  if (!m) return {} as Record<number, CircuitState>;\r\n  const out: Record<number, CircuitState> = {};\r\n  for (const [k, v] of m.entries()) out[k] = v;\r\n  return out;\r\n}\r\n\r\nexport default { DEFAULT_LANES, npzRoute, getPreferredLane, setPreferredLane, lanesForHost, recordFailure, recordSuccess, isLaneTripped, getCircuitState   8580:      7:   "dependencies": {}
  8581:      8: }
  8582:      9: 
  8583: 
  8584: 
  8585: ============================
  8586: FILE: D:\qflush\examples\rome-workspace\README.md
  8587: ============================
  8588: ============================
  8589:      1: Minimal example workspace used by CI to satisfy tools that expect a workspace folder (Rome).
  8590:      2: 
  8591:      3: This folder intentionally contains an empty package.json and a simple lockfile to allow `npm ci` to succeed in CI runs that initialize workspaces.
  8592:      4: 
  8593:

 11235: 
 11236: 
 11237: ============================
 11238: FILE: D:\qflush\extensions\visual-studio-npz\README.md
 11239: ============================
 11240: ============================
 11241:      1: NPZ Visual - Visual Studio extension skeleton
 11242:      2: 
 11243:      3: This folder contains a minimal Visual Studio VSIX project that hosts a WebView2-powered Tool Window to display the NPZ panel (the same UI used by the VS Code extension).
 11244:      4: 
 11245:      5: How to build and install using Visual Studio (Community) on Windows:
 11246:      6: 
 11247:      7: 1. Open a Developer Command Prompt for VS 2022 or use the full devenv path.
 11248:      8: 2. Build the VSIX project via MSBuild or devenv.exe:
 11249:      9:    - Using devenv.exe:
 11250:     10:      "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\18\Community\Common7\IDE\devenv.exe" /build Release "extensions\visual-studio-npz\NPZVsix\NPZVsix.csproj"
 11251:     11:    - Or open the solution in Visual Studio and press F5 to debug/install.
 11252:     12: 3. The produced `.vsix` will be in the `bin\Release` folder. Install via Extensions -> Manage Extensions -> Install from VSIX.
 11253:     13: 
 11254:     14: Notes:
 11255:     15: - The Tool Window loads `resources\panel.html` by default. You can change it to point at `http://localhost:4500` (NPZ daemon) to fetch dynamic data.
 11256:     16: - WebView2 runtime may be required on the target machine.
 11257:     17: 
 11258:

 14761: 
 14762: ============================
 14763: FILE: D:\qflush\extensions\vscode-npz\README.md
 14764: ============================
 14765: ============================
 14766:      1: # Qflush  NPZ Visual
 14767:      2: 
 14768:      3: Qflush Visual est lextension officielle pour visualiser et contrler le moteur Qflush / NPZ depuis VS Code / VSCodium / Theia.
 14769:      4: 
 14770:      5: ## Fonctionnalits
 14771:      6: 
 14772:      7: - Visualisation des scores NPZ en temps rel
 14773:      8: - Panel HTML interactif
 14774:      9: - Commandes : `qflush.openPanel`, `qflush.showLicenseStatus`
 14775:     10: - Intgration avec le daemon Qflush local (`http://localhost:4500`)
 14776:     11: - Prparation pour activation licence Gumroad
 14777:     12: 
 14778:     13: ## Installation
 14779:     14: 
 14780:     15: - Installer Qflush (npm) :
 14781:     16: 
 14782:     17: ```sh
 14783:     18: npm i -g @funeste38/qflush
 14784:     19: ```
 14785:     20: 
 14786:     21: - Lancer le daemon :
 14787:     22: 
 14788:     23: ```
 14789:     24: qflush daemon
 14790:     25: ```
 14791:     26: 
 14792:     27: - Depuis VSCodium, installer lextension Qflush depuis Open VSX.
 14793:     28: 
 14794:     29: ## Commands
 14795:     30: 
 14796:     31: - `qflush.openPanel`  Ouvre le panneau NPZ Scores
 14797:     32: - `qflush.showLicenseStatus`  Affiche ltat de la licence
 14798:     33: 
 14799:     34: ## Licence
 14800:     35: MIT   Funesterie
 14801:     36:

 14853:     46: function isTrialExpired(context) {
 14854:     47:     const started = context.globalState.get('qflush.trialStarted');
 14855:     48:     if (!started)

 14865:     58: function postJson(urlStr, body) {
 14866:     59:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 14867:     60:         try {
 14868:     61:             const url = new URL(urlStr);
 14869:     62:             const data = JSON.stringify(body || {});
 14870:     63:             const opts = {
 14871:     64:                 hostname: url.hostname,
 14872:     65:                 port: url.port || (url.protocol === 'https:' ? 443 : 80),
 14873:     66:                 path: url.pathname + (url.search || ''),
 14874:     67:                 method: 'POST',
 14875:     68:                 headers: {
 14876:     69:                     'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 14877:     70:                     'Content-Length': Buffer.byteLength(data),
 14878:     71:                 },
 14879:     72:             };
 14880:     73:             const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
 14881:     74:             const req = lib.request(opts, (res) => {
 14882:     75:                 let raw = '';
 14883:     76:                 res.setEncoding('utf8');
 14884:     77:                 res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
 14885:     78:                 res.on('end', () => {
 14886:     79:                     try {
 14887:     80:                         const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
 14888:     81:                         if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300)
 14889:     82:                             resolve(parsed);
 14890:     83:                         else
 14891:     84:                             reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
 14892:     85:                     }
 14893:     86:                     catch (e) {
 14894:     87:                         reject(e);
 14895:     88:                     }
 14896:     89:                 });
 14897:     90:             });
 14898:     91:             req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
 14899:     92:             req.write(data);
 14900:     93:             req.end();
 14901:     94:         }
 14902:     95:         catch (e) {
 14903:     96:             reject(e);
 14904:     97:         }
 14905:     98:     });
 14906:     99: }
 14907:    100: function getJson(urlStr) {
 14908:    101:     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 14909:    102:         try {
 14910:    103:             const url = new URL(urlStr);
 14911:    104:             const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
 14912:    105:             const req = lib.get(urlStr, (res) => {
 14913:    106:                 let raw = '';
 14914:    107:                 res.setEncoding('utf8');
 14915:    108:                 res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
 14916:    109:                 res.on('end', () => {
 14917:    110:                     try {
 14918:    111:                         const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
 14919:    112:                         if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300)
 14920:    113:                             resolve(parsed);
 14921:    114:                         else
 14922:    115:                             reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
 14923:    116:                     }
 14924:    117:                     catch (e) {
 14925:    118:                         reject(e);
 14926:    119:                     }
 14927:    120:                 });
 14928:    121:             });
 14929:    122:             req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
 14930:    123:         }
 14931:    124:         catch (e) {
 14932:    125:             reject(e);
 14933:    126:         }
 14934:    127:     });
 14935:    128: }
 14936:    129: async function saveRomeIndexRecord(record) {
 14937:    130:     try {
 14938:    131:         const root = process.cwd();
 14939:    132:         const dir = path.join(root, '.qflush');
 14940:    133:         if (!fs.existsSync(dir))
 14941:    134:             fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 14942:    135:         const idxFile = path.join(dir, 'rome-index.json');
 14943:    136:         let idx = {};
 14944:    137:         if (fs.existsSync(idxFile)) {
 14945:    138:             try {
 14946:    139:                 idx = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxFile, 'utf8') || '{}');
 14947:    140:             }
 14948:    141:             catch {
 14949:    142:                 idx = {};
 14950:    143:             }
 14951:    144:         }
 14952:    145:         // normalize path and build canonical record using shared module
 14953:    146:         const relPath = (0, rome_tag_1.normalizeRomePath)(record.path);
 14954:    147:         const rec = (0, rome_tag_1.makeRomeTagRecord)({ type: record.type, path: relPath });
 14955:    148:         idx[rec.path] = rec;
 14956:    149:         fs.writeFileSync(idxFile, JSON.stringify(idx, null, 2), 'utf8');
 14957:    150:         return { success: true, record: idx[rec.path] };
 14958:    151:     }
 14959:    152:     catch (e) {
 14960:    153:         return { success: false, error: String(e) };
 14961:    154:     }
 14962:    155: }
 14963:    156: function activate(context) {
 14964:    157:     ensureTrialStarted(context);
 14965:    158:     const openDisposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPanel', () => {
 14966:    159:         if (isTrialExpired(context)) {
 14967:    160:             vscode.window.showInformationMessage('QFlush trial expired. Click to purchase a license.', 'Purchase', 'Enter Key').then((v) => {
 14968:    161:                 if (v === 'Purchase')
 14969:    162:                     vscode.env.openExternal(vscode.Uri.parse('https://gumroad.com/l/your-product'));
 14970:    163:                 if (v === 'Enter Key')
 14971:    164:                     vscode.commands.executeCommand('qflush.enterLicense');
 14972:    165:             });
 14973:    166:             return;
 14974:    167:         }
 14975:    168:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPanel', 'QFlush', vscode.ViewColumn.One, {
 14976:    169:             enableScripts: true,
 14977:    170:             localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))],
 14978:    171:         });
 14979:    172:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'panel.html');
 14980:    173:         let html = '';
 14981:    174:         try {
 14982:    175:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
 14983:    176:         }
 14984:    177:         catch (e) {
 14985:    178:             html = `<html><body><pre>panel.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
 14986:    179:         }
 14987:    180:         panel.webview.html = html;
 14988:    181:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 14989:    182:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 14990:    183:         const token = cfg.get('adminToken') || '';
 14991:    184:         // Send config to webview securely via postMessage
 14992:    185:         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'config', daemonUrl, token });
 14993:    186:         // Handle messages from the webview
 14994:    187:         panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (message) => {
 14995:    188:             if (message && message.type === 'saveConfig') {
 14996:    189:                 const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 14997:    190:                 await cfg.update('daemonUrl', message.daemonUrl, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
 14998:    191:                 await cfg.update('adminToken', message.token, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
 14999:    192:                 panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'saved', info: 'Configuration saved' });
 15000:    193:             }
 15001:    194:         }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
 15002:    195:     });
 15003:    196:     const openPourparler = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPourparler', () => {
 15004:    197:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPourparler', 'Pourparler', vscode.ViewColumn.One, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
 15005:    198:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'pourparler-web.html');
 15006:    199:         let html = '';
 15007:    200:         try {
 15008:    201:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
 15009:    202:         }
 15010:    203:         catch (e) {
 15011:    204:             html = `<html><body><pre>pourparler-web.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
 15012:    205:         }
 15013:    206:         panel.webview.html = html;
 15014:    207:         panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (msg) => {
 15015:    208:             try {
 15016:    209:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'export') {
 15017:    210:                     const destUri = await vscode.window.showSaveDialog({ defaultUri: vscode.Uri.file(path.join(process.cwd(), msg.filename)), filters: { 'Images': ['png', 'svg'] } });
 15018:    211:                     if (!destUri)
 15019:    212:                         return;
 15020:    213:                     if (msg.format === 'svg') {
 15021:    214:                         fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, msg.data, 'utf8');
 15022:    215:                     }
 15023:    216:                     else if (msg.format === 'png') {
 15024:    217:                         // data url -> binary
 15025:    218:                         const base64 = msg.data.split(',')[1];
 15026:    219:                         const buf = Buffer.from(base64, 'base64');
 15027:    220:                         fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, buf);
 15028:    221:                     }
 15029:    222:                     vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`Exported ${msg.filename}`);
 15030:    223:                 }
 15031:    224:                 // new messages from pourparler webview
 15032:    225:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzList') {
 15033:    226:                     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 15034:    227:                     const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 15035:    228:                     try {
 15036:    229:                         const data = await getJson(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
 15037:    230:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data });
 15038:    231:                     }
 15039:    232:                     catch (e) {
 15040:    233:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
 15041:    234:                     }
 15042:    235:                 }
 15043:    236:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzClear') {
 15044:    237:                     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 15045:    238:                     const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 15046:    239:                     try {
 15047:    240:                         const resp = await fetch(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
 15048:    241:                         const j = await resp.json();
 15049:    242:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: j });
 15050:    243:                     }
 15051:    244:                     catch (e) {
 15052:    245:                         panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
 15053:    246:                     }
 15054:    247:                 }
 15055:    248:                 if (msg && msg.type === 'npzIndexTag') {
 15056:    249:                     const rec = msg.payload;
 15057:    250:                     const r = await saveRomeIndexRecord({ path: rec.path, type: rec.type, tag: rec.tag });
 15058:    251:                     panel.webview.postMessage(Object.assign({ type: 'npzIndexTagResult' }, r));
 15059:    252:                 }
 15060:    253:             }
 15061:    254:             catch (e) {
 15062:    255:                 vscode.window.showErrorMessage('Extension message handler failed: ' + String(e));
 15063:    256:             }
 15064:    257:         }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
 15065:    258:     });
 15066:    259:     const enterLicense = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.enterLicense', async () => {
 15067:    260:         const key = await vscode.window.showInputBox({ prompt: 'Enter your QFlush license key' });
 15068:    261:         if (!key)
 15069:    262:             return;
 15070:    263:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 15071:    264:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 15072:    265:         const activateUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/activate`;
 15073:    266:         const progressOptions = { location: vscode.ProgressLocation.Notification, title: 'Activating QFlush license...', cancellable: false };
 15074:    267:         try {
 15075:    268:             await vscode.window.withProgress(progressOptions, async () => {
 15076:    269:                 const res = await postJson(activateUrl, { key });
 15077:    270:                 // store license info locally in extension globalState
 15078:    271:                 await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseKey', key);
 15079:    272:                 await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseInfo', res.license || res);
 15080:    273:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('License activated successfully. Thanks!');
 15081:    274:             });
 15082:    275:         }
 15083:    276:         catch (err) {
 15084:    277:             vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`License activation failed: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
 15085:    278:         }
 15086:    279:     });
 15087:    280:     const showStatus = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.showLicenseStatus', async () => {
 15088:    281:         const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 15089:    282:         const daemonUrl = cfg.get('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 15090:    283:         const statusUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/status`;
 15091:    284:         try {
 15092:    285:             const res = await getJson(statusUrl);
 15093:    286:             if (!res || !res.success) {
 15094:    287:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No license information available');
 15095:    288:                 return;
 15096:    289:             }
 15097:    290:             const lic = res.license;
 15098:    291:             if (!lic) {
 15099:    292:                 vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No local license installed');
 15100:    293:                 return;
 15101:    294:             }
 15102:    295:             const exp = lic.expiresAt ? new Date(lic.expiresAt).toLocaleString() : 'never (subscription)';
 15103:    296:             vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`License: ${lic.key} product=${lic.product_id} expires=${exp} valid=${res.valid}`);
 15104:    297:         }
 15105:    298:         catch (err) {
 15106:    299:             vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`Failed to fetch status: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
 15107:    300:         }
 15108:    301:     });
 15109:    302:     const openTelemetry = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openTelemetry', () => {
 15110:    303:         const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushTelemetry', 'QFlush Telemetry', vscode.ViewColumn.Two, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
 15111:    304:         const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'telemetry-view.html');
 15112:    305:         let html = '';
 15113:    306:         try {
 15114:    307:             html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
 15115:    308:         }
 15116:    309:         catch (e) {
 15117:    310:             html = `<html><body><pre>telemetry-view.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
 15118:    311:         }
 15119:    312:         panel.webview.html = html;
 15120:    313:     });
 15121:    314:     context.subscriptions.push(openDisposable, openPourparler, enterLicense, showStatus, openTelemetry);
 15122:    315: }
 15123:    316: function deactivate() { }
 15124:    317: 
 15125: 
 15126: 
 15127: ============================
 15128: FILE: D:\qflush\extensions\vscode-npz\src\extension.ts
 15129: ============================
 15130: ============================
 15131:      1: import * as vscode from 'vscode';
 15132:      2: import * as path from 'path';
 15133:      3: import * as fs from 'fs';
 15134:      4: import * as http from 'http';
 15135:      5: import * as https from 'https';
 15136:      6: 
 15137:      7: // import Rome tag utilities
 15138:      8: import { makeRomeTagRecord, RomeIndex, normalizeRomePath } from '@rome/rome-tag';
 15139:      9: 
 15140:     10: const TRIAL_DAYS = 14;
 15141:     11: 
 15142:     12: function isTrialExpired(context: vscode.ExtensionContext): boolean {
 15143:     13:   const started = context.globalState.get<number>('qflush.trialStarted');
 15144:     14:   if (!started) return false; // start on first use
 15145:     15:   const now = Date.now();
 15146:     16:   return now - started > TRIAL_DAYS * 24 * 3600 * 1000;
 15147:     17: }
 15148:     18: 
 15149:     19: function ensureTrialStarted(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
 15150:     20:   const started = context.globalState.get<number>('qflush.trialStarted');
 15151:     21:   if (!started) context.globalState.update('qflush.trialStarted', Date.now());
 15152:     22: }
 15153:     23: 
 15154:     24: function postJson(urlStr: string, body: any): Promise<any> {
 15155:     25:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 15156:     26:     try {
 15157:     27:       const url = new URL(urlStr);
 15158:     28:       const data = JSON.stringify(body || {});
 15159:     29:       const opts: any = {
 15160:     30:         hostname: url.hostname,
 15161:     31:         port: url.port || (url.protocol === 'https:' ? 443 : 80),
 15162:     32:         path: url.pathname + (url.search || ''),
 15163:     33:         method: 'POST',
 15164:     34:         headers: {
 15165:     35:           'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 15166:     36:           'Content-Length': Buffer.byteLength(data),
 15167:     37:         },
 15168:     38:       };
 15169:     39:       const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
 15170:     40:       const req = lib.request(opts, (res) => {
 15171:     41:         let raw = '';
 15172:     42:         res.setEncoding('utf8');
 15173:     43:         res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
 15174:     44:         res.on('end', () => {
 15175:     45:           try {
 15176:     46:             const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
 15177:     47:             if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300) resolve(parsed);
 15178:     48:             else reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
 15179:     49:           } catch (e) {
 15180:     50:             reject(e);
 15181:     51:           }
 15182:     52:         });
 15183:     53:       });
 15184:     54:       req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
 15185:     55:       req.write(data);
 15186:     56:       req.end();
 15187:     57:     } catch (e) {
 15188:     58:       reject(e);
 15189:     59:     }
 15190:     60:   });
 15191:     61: }
 15192:     62: 
 15193:     63: function getJson(urlStr: string): Promise<any> {
 15194:     64:   return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
 15195:     65:     try {
 15196:     66:       const url = new URL(urlStr);
 15197:     67:       const lib = url.protocol === 'https:' ? https : http;
 15198:     68:       const req = lib.get(urlStr, (res) => {
 15199:     69:         let raw = '';
 15200:     70:         res.setEncoding('utf8');
 15201:     71:         res.on('data', (chunk) => (raw += chunk));
 15202:     72:         res.on('end', () => {
 15203:     73:           try {
 15204:     74:             const parsed = raw ? JSON.parse(raw) : {};
 15205:     75:             if (res.statusCode && res.statusCode >= 200 && res.statusCode < 300) resolve(parsed);
 15206:     76:             else reject(new Error(parsed && parsed.error ? parsed.error : `HTTP ${res.statusCode}`));
 15207:     77:           } catch (e) {
 15208:     78:             reject(e);
 15209:     79:           }
 15210:     80:         });
 15211:     81:       });
 15212:     82:       req.on('error', (err) => reject(err));
 15213:     83:     } catch (e) {
 15214:     84:       reject(e);
 15215:     85:     }
 15216:     86:   });
 15217:     87: }
 15218:     88: 
 15219:     89: async function saveRomeIndexRecord(record: { path: string; type: string; tag?: string }) {
 15220:     90:   try {
 15221:     91:     const root = process.cwd();
 15222:     92:     const dir = path.join(root, '.qflush');
 15223:     93:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
 15224:     94:     const idxFile = path.join(dir, 'rome-index.json');
 15225:     95:     let idx: RomeIndex = {};
 15226:     96:     if (fs.existsSync(idxFile)) {
 15227:     97:       try { idx = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(idxFile, 'utf8') || '{}'); } catch { idx = {}; }
 15228:     98:     }
 15229:     99: 
 15230:    100:     // normalize path and build canonical record using shared module
 15231:    101:     const relPath = normalizeRomePath(record.path);
 15232:    102:     const rec = makeRomeTagRecord({ type: record.type, path: relPath });
 15233:    103:     idx[rec.path] = rec;
 15234:    104: 
 15235:    105:     fs.writeFileSync(idxFile, JSON.stringify(idx, null, 2), 'utf8');
 15236:    106:     return { success: true, record: idx[rec.path] };
 15237:    107:   } catch (e) {
 15238:    108:     return { success: false, error: String(e) };
 15239:    109:   }
 15240:    110: }
 15241:    111: 
 15242:    112: export function activate(context: vscode.ExtensionContext) {
 15243:    113:   ensureTrialStarted(context);
 15244:    114: 
 15245:    115:   const openDisposable = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPanel', () => {
 15246:    116:     if (isTrialExpired(context)) {
 15247:    117:       vscode.window.showInformationMessage('QFlush trial expired. Click to purchase a license.', 'Purchase', 'Enter Key').then((v) => {
 15248:    118:         if (v === 'Purchase') vscode.env.openExternal(vscode.Uri.parse('https://gumroad.com/l/your-product'));
 15249:    119:         if (v === 'Enter Key') vscode.commands.executeCommand('qflush.enterLicense');
 15250:    120:       });
 15251:    121:       return;
 15252:    122:     }
 15253:    123: 
 15254:    124:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel(
 15255:    125:       'qflushPanel',
 15256:    126:       'QFlush',
 15257:    127:       vscode.ViewColumn.One,
 15258:    128:       {
 15259:    129:         enableScripts: true,
 15260:    130:         localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))],
 15261:    131:       }
 15262:    132:     );
 15263:    133: 
 15264:    134:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'panel.html');
 15265:    135:     let html = '';
 15266:    136:     try {
 15267:    137:       html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8');
 15268:    138:     } catch (e) {
 15269:    139:       html = `<html><body><pre>panel.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`;
 15270:    140:     }
 15271:    141: 
 15272:    142:     panel.webview.html = html;
 15273:    143: 
 15274:    144:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 15275:    145:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 15276:    146:     const token = cfg.get<string>('adminToken') || '';
 15277:    147: 
 15278:    148:     // Send config to webview securely via postMessage
 15279:    149:     panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'config', daemonUrl, token });
 15280:    150: 
 15281:    151:     // Handle messages from the webview
 15282:    152:     panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(
 15283:    153:       async (message) => {
 15284:    154:         if (message && message.type === 'saveConfig') {
 15285:    155:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 15286:    156:           await cfg.update('daemonUrl', message.daemonUrl, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
 15287:    157:           await cfg.update('adminToken', message.token, vscode.ConfigurationTarget.Global);
 15288:    158:           panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'saved', info: 'Configuration saved' });
 15289:    159:         }
 15290:    160:       },
 15291:    161:       undefined,
 15292:    162:       context.subscriptions
 15293:    163:     );
 15294:    164:   });
 15295:    165: 
 15296:    166:   const openPourparler = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openPourparler', () => {
 15297:    167:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushPourparler', 'Pourparler', vscode.ViewColumn.One, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
 15298:    168:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'pourparler-web.html');
 15299:    169:     let html = '';
 15300:    170:     try { html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8'); } catch (e) { html = `<html><body><pre>pourparler-web.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`; }
 15301:    171:     panel.webview.html = html;
 15302:    172: 
 15303:    173:     panel.webview.onDidReceiveMessage(async (msg) => {
 15304:    174:       try {
 15305:    175:         if (msg && msg.type === 'export') {
 15306:    176:           const destUri = await vscode.window.showSaveDialog({ defaultUri: vscode.Uri.file(path.join(process.cwd(), msg.filename)), filters: { 'Images': ['png','svg'] } });
 15307:    177:           if (!destUri) return;
 15308:    178:           if (msg.format === 'svg') {
 15309:    179:             fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, msg.data, 'utf8');
 15310:    180:           } else if (msg.format === 'png') {
 15311:    181:             // data url -> binary
 15312:    182:             const base64 = msg.data.split(',')[1];
 15313:    183:             const buf = Buffer.from(base64, 'base64');
 15314:    184:             fs.writeFileSync(destUri.fsPath, buf);
 15315:    185:           }
 15316:    186:           vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`Exported ${msg.filename}`);
 15317:    187:         }
 15318:    188: 
 15319:    189:         // new messages from pourparler webview
 15320:    190:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzList') {
 15321:    191:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 15322:    192:           const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 15323:    193:           try {
 15324:    194:             const data = await getJson(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/list`);
 15325:    195:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data });
 15326:    196:           } catch (e) {
 15327:    197:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzListResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
 15328:    198:           }
 15329:    199:         }
 15330:    200: 
 15331:    201:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzClear') {
 15332:    202:           const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 15333:    203:           const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 15334:    204:           try {
 15335:    205:             const resp = await fetch(`${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/npz/checksum/clear`, { method: 'DELETE' });
 15336:    206:             const j = await resp.json();
 15337:    207:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: j });
 15338:    208:           } catch (e) {
 15339:    209:             panel.webview.postMessage({ type: 'npzClearResult', data: { success: false, error: String(e) } });
 15340:    210:           }
 15341:    211:         }
 15342:    212: 
 15343:    213:         if (msg && msg.type === 'npzIndexTag') {
 15344:    214:           const rec = msg.payload;
 15345:    215:           const r = await saveRomeIndexRecord({ path: rec.path, type: rec.type, tag: rec.tag });
 15346:    216:           panel.webview.postMessage(Object.assign({ type: 'npzIndexTagResult' }, r));
 15347:    217:         }
 15348:    218:       } catch (e) {
 15349:    219:         vscode.window.showErrorMessage('Extension message handler failed: ' + String(e));
 15350:    220:       }
 15351:    221:     }, undefined, context.subscriptions);
 15352:    222:   });
 15353:    223: 
 15354:    224:   const enterLicense = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.enterLicense', async () => {
 15355:    225:     const key = await vscode.window.showInputBox({ prompt: 'Enter your QFlush license key' });
 15356:    226:     if (!key) return;
 15357:    227: 
 15358:    228:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 15359:    229:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 15360:    230:     const activateUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/activate`;
 15361:    231: 
 15362:    232:     const progressOptions: vscode.ProgressOptions = { location: vscode.ProgressLocation.Notification, title: 'Activating QFlush license...', cancellable: false };
 15363:    233:     try {
 15364:    234:       await vscode.window.withProgress(progressOptions, async () => {
 15365:    235:         const res = await postJson(activateUrl, { key });
 15366:    236:         // store license info locally in extension globalState
 15367:    237:         await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseKey', key);
 15368:    238:         await context.globalState.update('qflush.licenseInfo', res.license || res);
 15369:    239:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('License activated successfully. Thanks!');
 15370:    240:       });
 15371:    241:     } catch (err: any) {
 15372:    242:         vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`License activation failed: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
 15373:    243:     }
 15374:    244:   });
 15375:    245: 
 15376:    246:   const showStatus = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.showLicenseStatus', async () => {
 15377:    247:     const cfg = vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('qflush');
 15378:    248:     const daemonUrl = cfg.get<string>('daemonUrl') || 'http://localhost:4500';
 15379:    249:     const statusUrl = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/license/status`;
 15380:    250:     try {
 15381:    251:       const res = await getJson(statusUrl);
 15382:    252:       if (!res || !res.success) {
 15383:    253:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No license information available');
 15384:    254:         return;
 15385:    255:       }
 15386:    256:       const lic = res.license;
 15387:    257:       if (!lic) {
 15388:    258:         vscode.window.showInformationMessage('No local license installed');
 15389:    259:         return;
 15390:    260:       }
 15391:    261:       const exp = lic.expiresAt ? new Date(lic.expiresAt).toLocaleString() : 'never (subscription)';
 15392:    262:       vscode.window.showInformationMessage(`License: ${lic.key} product=${lic.product_id} expires=${exp} valid=${res.valid}`);
 15393:    263:     } catch (err: any) {
 15394:    264:       vscode.window.showErrorMessage(`Failed to fetch status: ${err && err.message ? err.message : String(err)}`);
 15395:    265:     }
 15396:    266:   });
 15397:    267: 
 15398:    268:   const openTelemetry = vscode.commands.registerCommand('qflush.openTelemetry', () => {
 15399:    269:     const panel = vscode.window.createWebviewPanel('qflushTelemetry', 'QFlush Telemetry', vscode.ViewColumn.Two, { enableScripts: true, localResourceRoots: [vscode.Uri.file(path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src'))] });
 15400:    270:     const htmlPath = path.join(context.extensionPath, 'src', 'telemetry-view.html');
 15401:    271:     let html = '';
 15402:    272:     try { html = fs.readFileSync(htmlPath, 'utf8'); } catch (e) { html = `<html><body><pre>telemetry-view.html not found at ${htmlPath}</pre></body></html>`; }
 15403:    273:     panel.webview.html = html;
 15404:    274:   });
 15405:    275: 
 15406:    276:   context.subscriptions.push(openDisposable, openPourparler, enterLicense, showStatus, openTelemetry);
 15407:    277: }
 15408:    278: 
 15409:    279: export function deactivate() {}
 15410:    280:

 15422: ============================
 15423: FILE: D:\qflush\extensions\vscode-npz\src\polyfill-file.js
 15424: ============================
 15425: ============================
 15426:      1: // Polyfill minimal File/Blob for Node environments when libraries expect browser globals
 15427:      2: if (typeof globalThis.File === 'undefined') {
 15428:      3:   globalThis.File = class File extends Uint8Array {
 15429:      4:     constructor(parts = [], name = 'file', options = {}) {
 15430:      5:       // naive implementation: store data as concatenated string/Uint8Array
 15431:      6:       const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
 15432:      7:       const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
 15433:      8:       super(buf);
 15434:      9:       this.name = name;
 15435:     10:       this.lastModified = options.lastModified || Date.now();
 15436:     11:       this.size = buf.length;
 15437:     12:       this.type = options.type || '';
 15438:     13:     }
 15439:     14:     text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
 15440:     15:     arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
 15441:     16:     stream() { throw new Error('stream() not implemented'); }
 15442:     17:   };
 15443:     18: }
 15444:     19: if (typeof globalThis.Blob === 'undefined') {
 15445:     20:   globalThis.Blob = class Blob extends Uint8Array {
 15446:     21:     constructor(parts = [], options = {}) {
 15447:     22:       const chunks = parts.map(p => typeof p === 'string' ? Buffer.from(p) : Buffer.from(p));
 15448:     23:       const buf = Buffer.concat(chunks);
 15449:     24:       super(buf);
 15450:     25:       this.size = buf.length;
 15451:     26:       this.type = options.type || '';
 15452:     27:     }
 15453:     28:     text() { return Promise.resolve(Buffer.from(this).toString('utf8')); }
 15454:     29:     arrayBuffer() { return Promise.resolve(Uint8Array.from(this).buffer); }
 15455:     30:   };
 15456:     31: }

 15620: 
 15621: 
 15622: ============================
 15623: FILE: D:\qflush\FUNESTERIE-ARCHITECTURE.md
 15624: ============================
 15625: ============================
 15626:      1: FUNESTERIE  Architecture & Vision
 15627:      2: 
 15628:      3: Objectif
 15629:      4: --------
 15630:      5: Crer un cosystme modulaire et volutif o chaque couche a une responsabilit unique et communique via interfaces claires : QFLUSH (orchestrateur), ROME (moteur logique / indexeur), NPZ (router / admin), BAT (process manager), Nezlephant/OC8 (stockage cach), A11 (interface IA), SPYDER (futur moteur neuronal).
 15631:      6: 
 15632:      7: Sommaire des composants
 15633:      8: -----------------------
 15634:      9: 
 15635:     10: 1) QFLUSH  Orchestrateur
 15636:     11: - CLI + daemon HTTP.
 15637:     12: - Commandes principales : `start`, `kill`, `purge`, `inspect`, `config`, `daemon`.
 15638:     13: - Supervise les modules, expose NPZ/Rome endpoints, centralise la config et le SmartChain pipeline.
 15639:     14: 
 15640:     15: 2) BAT  Process Manager
 15641:     16: - Spawn / stop / restart / status.
 15642:     17: - Dtache les services (non bloquant), persiste tat dans `.qflush/services.json`, logs dans `.qflush/logs/`.
 15643:     18: - Strictement process management  pas de router ni logique.
 15644:     19: 
 15645:     20: 3) NPZ (Joker)  Router & Admin
 15646:     21: - Router et diagnostics pour les modules.
 15647:     22: - Endpoints exposs par le daemon : checksums, rome-index, rome-links, resolve, SSE stream.
 15648:     23: - CLI : `qflush npz:inspect`, `qflush npz:scores`.
 15649:     24: - Stockage : fallback mmoire/fichiers; Redis optionnel (optin via `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS`).
 15650:     25: 
 15651:     26: 4) ROME  Index, Engine, Logic, Linker
 15652:     27: - Indexation des sources annotes (`ROME-TAG`)  `.qflush/rome-index.json`.
 15653:     28: - Engine value lindex et met des actions (computeEngineActionsSafe).
 15654:     29: - Logic rules (dclaratives) dclenchent actions  la change.
 15655:     30: - Linker (v3.1): scan `[[token]]`, rsout cibles, gnre `.qflush/rome-links.json`, fournit rsolution HTTP et SSE.
 15656:     31: 
 15657:     32: 5) Nezlephant / OC8  Stockage cach RGBA
 15658:     33: - Encodage/dcodage de blobs (PNG / RGBA / OC8).
 15659:     34: - Usage pour secrets (`nez:<file>`), configs, payloads.
 15660:     35: - Intgration via `envapt-nezlephant`.
 15661:     36: 
 15662:     37: 6) A11  Interface IA (prvu)
 15663:     38: - Proxy/local LLM connector (Ollama/OpenAI/Gemini).
 15664:     39: - Orchestration dappels IA pour augmentation des rgles NPZ/ROME.
 15665:     40: 
 15666:     41: 7) SPYDER  Futur moteur neuronal
 15667:     42: - Architecture envisage : graph de  neurones  (.ner), snapshots, routage dtat  rponses.
 15668:     43: - Intgration future avec A11 et NPZ.
 15669:     44: 
 15670:     45: Le Mapping (principes)
 15671:     46: ----------------------
 15672:     47: - Ordre de priorit strict pour la rsolution des chemins :
 15673:     48:   1. Chemin explicite fourni
 15674:     49:   2. Chemin dtect (detectModules)
 15675:     50:   3. Chemin local candidate
 15676:     51:   4. Rsolution via node_modules/package
 15677:     52:   5. Fallback NPZ (optionnel)
 15678:     53: - Early-exit : si un chemin est valide  ne pas r-interprter.
 15679:     54: 
 15680:     55: Daemon (qflushd)
 15681:     56: -----------------
 15682:     57: - Expose les endpoints NPZ et Rome.
 15683:     58: - Supervise engineHistory et telemetry (Copilot Bridge).
 15684:     59: - SSE stream pour rome-links & telemetry.
 15685:     60: - Audit log, option Redis.
 15686:     61: 
 15687:     62: Copilot Bridge
 15688:     63: --------------
 15689:     64: - Envoie vnements/rgles/tlmetry vers lextension VS et services IA.
 15690:     65: - Fournit un canal bidirectionnel (notifications  actions).
 15691:     66: 
 15692:     67: Principes dexploitation & Dev
 15693:     68: ------------------------------
 15694:     69: - En dev : garder Redis dsactiv (fallback mmoire).
 15695:     70: - Activer mapping uniquement quand ncessaire (`QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING=1`).
 15696:     71: - Dmarrer le daemon dtach pour viter douvrir fichiers dans lIDE (`qflush daemon --detached`).
 15697:     72: 
 15698:     73: Fichiers utiles
 15699:     74: ---------------
 15700:     75: - `.qflush/rome-index.json`  Rome index
 15701:     76: - `.qflush/rome-links.json`  linker output
 15702:     77: - `.qflush/services.json` & `.qflush/logs/`  BAT state & logs
 15703:     78: 
 15704:     79: Next steps recommands
 15705:     80: ----------------------
 15706:     81: - Ajouter ce doc au README (done).
 15707:     82: - Gnrer un diagramme SVG/PNG et lajouter dans `docs/`.
 15708:     83: - Crer `copilot-context.md` (trs court) pour fournir le rsum  Copilot.
 15709:     84: - Intgrer tests unitaires pour NPZ encoder / checksum / linker.
 15710:     85: 
 15711:     86: Notes
 15712:     87: -----
 15713:     88: - SPYDER et A11 sont des objectifs long terme. Pour linstant conserver les noms est acceptable ; implmentations futures clarifieront les responsabilits.
 15714:     89: 
 15715:     90: 
 15716:     91: 
 15717: 
 15718:

 15724:      2:

 15726:      4: 2) Add remote locally:
 15727:      5:    git remote add origin git@github.com:<user>/<repo>.git
 15728:      6: 3) Push branch:
 15729:      7:    git push -u origin master
 15730:      8: 
 15731:      9: If you need an HTTPS remote:
 15732:     10:    git remote add origin https://github.com/<user>/<repo>.git
 15733:     11:    git push -u origin master
 15734:     12:
