 15808: FILE: D:\qflush\installers\funesterie_logo.png
 15809: ============================
 15810: ============================
 15811: [BINARY CONTENT - 3529444 bytes]
 15812: [ERROR] Failed to include file: D:\qflush\installers\funesterie_logo.png
 15813: Reason: Error formatting a string: Index (zero based) must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the size of the argument list..
 15814: 
 15815: 
 15816: ============================
 15817: FILE: D:\qflush\installers\install-qflush.ps1
 15818: ============================
 15819: ============================
 15820:      1: <#
 15821:      2: PowerShell installer for QFLUSH
 15822:      3: Supports:
 15823:      4:  - user install (default): copies package to %APPDATA% and adds to PATH for current user
 15824:      5:  - system install: copies package to C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush and adds to system PATH (requires elevation)
 15825:      6:  - npm global install: runs `npm install -g @funeste38/qflush` if package is published
 15826:      7: 
 15827:      8: Usage:
 15828:      9:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode user
 15829:     10:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode system
 15830:     11:  .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm
 15831:     12: #>
 15832:     13: param(
 15833:     14:     [ValidateSet('user','system','npm')]
 15834:     15:     [string]$Mode = 'user'
 15835:     16: )
 15836:     17: 
 15837:     18: function Add-PathUser {
 15838:     19:     param([string]$dir)
 15839:     20:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'User')
 15840:     21:     if ($current -notlike "*${dir}*") {
 15841:     22:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'User')
 15842:     23:         Write-Host "Added $dir to user PATH"
 15843:     24:     } else {
 15844:     25:         Write-Host "$dir already in user PATH"
 15845:     26:     }
 15846:     27: }
 15847:     28: 
 15848:     29: function Add-PathMachine {
 15849:     30:     param([string]$dir)
 15850:     31:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'Machine')
 15851:     32:     if ($current -notlike "*${dir}*") {
 15852:     33:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'Machine')
 15853:     34:         Write-Host "Added $dir to machine PATH"
 15854:     35:     } else {
 15855:     36:         Write-Host "$dir already in machine PATH"
 15856:     37:     }
 15857:     38: }
 15858:     39: 
 15859:     40: if ($Mode -eq 'npm') {
 15860:     41:     Write-Host "Installing via npm global..."
 15861:     42:     npm install -g @funeste38/qflush
 15862:     43:     exit $?
 15863:     44: }
 15864:     45: 
 15865:     46: # assume script run from repo root or from extracted package
 15866:     47: $scriptDir = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition
 15867:     48: $source = Join-Path $scriptDir '..' 'dist'
 15868:     49: 
 15869:     50: if ($Mode -eq 'user') {
 15870:     51:     $dest = Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'Funeste38\QFlush'
 15871:     52:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
 15872:     53:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
 15873:     54:     Add-PathUser -dir $dest
 15874:     55:     Write-Host "Installed QFLUSH to $dest (user)"
 15875:     56:     exit 0
 15876:     57: }
 15877:     58: 
 15878:     59: if ($Mode -eq 'system') {
 15879:     60:     if (-not ([Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal][Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()).IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) {
 15880:     61:         Write-Error "System install requires elevation. Run PowerShell as Administrator."
 15881:     62:         exit 1
 15882:     63:     }
 15883:     64:     $dest = 'C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush'
 15884:     65:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
 15885:     66:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
 15886:     67:     Add-PathMachine -dir $dest
 15887:     68:     Write-Host "Installed QFLUSH to $dest (system)"
 15888:     69:     exit 0
 15889:     70: }
 15890:     71: 
 15891: 
 15892: 
 15893: ============================
 15894: FILE: D:\qflush\installers\install-qflushd.ps1
 15895: ============================
 15896: ============================
 15897:      1: # PowerShell installer for qflushd (Windows service wrapper)
 15898:      2: # This is an example; for production use consider NSSM or sc.exe wrapper.
 15899:      3: 
 15900:      4: Write-Host "This script downloads qflush and registers qflushd as a scheduled task or service."
 15901:      5: Write-Host "Manual step: create a Windows service pointing to 'node dist/daemon/qflushd.js' using nssm or sc.exe."
 15902:      6: 
 15903:      7: # Example using nssm (assuming nssm.exe is available):
 15904:      8: # nssm install qflushd "C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe" "C:\path\to\qflush\dist\daemon\qflushd.js"
 15905:      9: 
 15906:     10: Write-Host "Install instructions provided."
 15907: 
 15908: 
 15909: ============================
 15910: FILE: D:\qflush\installers\NE-LINER.txt
 15911: ============================
 15912: ============================
 15913:      1: NE-LINER  Corrected oneliner & notes (FR)
 15914:      2: 
 15915:      3: But / Purpose
 15916:      4: -----------
 15917:      5: Court rappel et oneliner corrig pour installer / dmarrer `qflush` sans confusion avec `qflush`.
 15918:      6: 
 15919:      7: Oneliner PowerShell (installe et excute l'installateur officiel pour `qflush`):
 15920:      8: 
 15921:      9:   iwr -useb https://funeste38.org/install-qflush.ps1 | iex
 15922:     10: 
 15923:     11: Remarques importantes
 15924:     12: ---------------------
 15925:     13: - Nom correct du binaire : `qflush` (pas `qflush`).
 15926:     14: - Le shim `%APPDATA%\\npm\\qflush.cmd` / `qflush.ps1` doit appeler le wrapper JS ou `dist/index.js`.
 15927:     15:   - Pour la version, le shim doit appeler de faon sre :
 15928:     16:     node "<path-to-package>/package.json" via un petit wrapper JS ou `node -e "try{console.log(require('...').version)}catch(e){console.log('unknown')}"`.
 15929:     17:   - Prfrence: utiliser un `qflush-cli.js` wrapper (vite les problmes d'chappement avec `node -e`).
 15930:     18: 
 15931:     19: Vrifications aprs installation
 15932:     20: --------------------------------
 15933:     21: 1. Vrifier que le package global existe :
 15934:     22:    npm root -g
 15935:     23:    (cherchez `@funeste38/qflush` sous ce chemin)
 15936:     24: 
 15937:     25: 2. Vrifier que les shims sont prsents dans :
 15938:     26:    %APPDATA%\\npm
 15939:     27:    - qflush.cmd
 15940:     28:    - qflush.ps1
 15941:     29:    - qflush-cli.js (wrapper recommand)
 15942:     30: 
 15943:     31: 3. Vrifier le PATH utilisateur inclut `%APPDATA%\\npm` :
 15944:     32:    [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH','User')
 15945:     33:    Si absent : setx PATH "$([Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH','User'));%APPDATA%\\npm" puis fermer/rouvrir le shell.
 15946:     34: 
 15947:     35: 4. Tester :
 15948:     36:    & "%APPDATA%\\npm\\qflush.cmd" --version
 15949:     37:    qflush --version   (aprs rouverture du terminal)
 15950:     38: 
 15951:     39: Index / fichiers crits
 15952:     40: -----------------------
 15953:     41: - L'index Rome est lu depuis `.qflush/rome-index.json` dans la racine du workspace.
 15954:     42: - S'assurer que rien d'autre n'ouvre l'index automatiquement (mapping guarded by QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING or FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING).
 15955:     43: 
 15956:     44: Modifications appliques
 15957:     45: -----------------------
 15958:     46: J'ai corrig les scripts et docs suivants pour utiliser le nom `qflush` et chemins cohrents :
 15959:     47: - `installers/ONE-LINER.txt` (one-liner now references `install-qflush.ps1`)
 15960:     48: - `installers/install-all.ps1` (uses `QFlush` naming, destination folder `Funeste38\QFlush`)
 15961:     49: - `installers/install-qflush.ps1` (messages updated to `qflush`, package name `@funeste38/qflush`)
 15962:     50: - `installers/install-qflushd.ps1` (messages updated to `qflushd`)
 15963:     51: - Created wrapper/shims: `%APPDATA%\\npm\\qflush-cli.js`, `qflush.cmd`, `qflush.ps1` when repairing installation.
 15964:     52: 
 15965:     53: Notes pour devs
 15966:     54: ---------------
 15967:     55: - viter d'utiliser `node -e` avec des chemins Windows bruts dans les shims ; prfrer un wrapper JS.
 15968:     56: - Si un autre binaire `qflush` existe, dsinstallez le pour viter collision :
 15969:     57:   npm uninstall -g @funeste38/qflush
 15970:     58: 
 15971:     59: Si tu veux que je renomme physiquement les scripts `install-qflush.ps1`  `install-qflush.ps1` et `install-qflushd.ps1`  `install-qflushd.ps1`, disle et je le ferai (cela crera de nouveaux files and update references).
 15972:     60: 
 15973:     61: 
 15974:     62: 
 15975:

 15979: ============================
 15980: ============================
 15981:      1: PowerShell one-liner (example):
 15982:      2: 
 15983:      3: iwr -useb https://funeste38.org/install-qflush.ps1 | iex
 15984:      4: 
 15985:      5: (This would download and execute the installer script hosted at the provided URL.)

 15997: 
 15998: ============================
 15999: FILE: D:\qflush\installers\README-install.md
 16000: ============================
 16001: ============================
 16002:      1: # QFLUSH Installer
 16003:      2: 
 16004:      3: This folder contains a PowerShell installer `install-qflush.ps1` that can:
 16005:      4: 
 16006:      5: - Install QFLUSH for the current user (default) by copying compiled `dist` files to `%APPDATA%\Funeste38\QFlush` and adding the folder to user PATH.
 16007:      6: - Install QFLUSH system-wide (requires Administrator) by copying to `C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlush` and adding to machine PATH.
 16008:      7: - Install via npm global if the package is published: `install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm`.
 16009:      8: 
 16010:      9: Usage examples:
 16011:     10: 
 16012:     11: PowerShell (current user):
 16013:     12: PS> .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode user
 16014:     13: 
 16015:     14: PowerShell (system/admin):
 16016:     15: PS> Start-Process powershell -Verb runAs -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File "install-qflush.ps1" -Mode system'
 16017:     16: 
 16018:     17: NPM global install (requires published package):
 16019:     18: PS> .\install-qflush.ps1 -Mode npm
 16020:     19: 
 16021:     20: ## Notes
 16022:     21: 
 16023:     22: Use `qflush --help` after installation to list available commands.
 16024:     23: 
 16025:

 16339: ============================
 16340: FILE: D:\qflush\netlify\functions\gumroad-webhook.js
 16341: ============================
 16342: ============================
 16343:      1: const fetch = require('node-fetch');
 16344:      2: 
 16345:      3: exports.handler = async function(event, context) {
 16346:      4:   try {
 16347:      5:     const body = event.body ? JSON.parse(event.body) : {};
 16348:      6:     // optional: verify signature if you have one
 16349:      7:     // forward to the local daemon if DAEMON_URL is set, otherwise process here
 16350:      8:     const daemonUrl = process.env.DAEMON_URL || '';
 16351:      9:     if (daemonUrl) {
 16352:     10:       const url = `${daemonUrl.replace(/\/$/, '')}/qflush/license/webhook`;
 16353:     11:       await fetch(url, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(body) });
 16354:     12:       return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: true, forwarded: url }) };
 16355:     13:     }
 16356:     14:     // example local processing: check refund
 16357:     15:     const purchase = body.purchase || body.data || null;
 16358:     16:     let action = 'noop';
 16359:     17:     if (purchase) {
 16360:     18:       if (purchase.refunded || purchase.chargebacked) action = 'clear_license';
 16361:     19:       if (purchase.subscription_cancelled_at) action = 'cancel_subscription';
 16362:     20:     }
 16363:     21:     return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: true, action }) };
 16364:     22:   } catch (err) {
 16365:     23:     return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok: false, error: String(err) }) };
 16366:     24:   }
 16367:     25: };
 16368:     26: 
 16369: 
 16370: 
 16371: ============================
 16372: FILE: D:\qflush\netlify\functions\token-exchange.js
 16373: ============================
 16374: ============================
 16375:      1: const fetch = require('node-fetch');
 16376:      2: 
 16377:      3: exports.handler = async function(event, context) {
 16378:      4:   try {
 16379:      5:     const tokenUrl = process.env.TOKEN_URL;
 16380:      6:     const clientId = process.env.APP_ID;
 16381:      7:     const clientSecret = process.env.APP_SECRET;
 16382:      8:     if (!tokenUrl || !clientId || !clientSecret) return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:false, error:'missing config' }) };
 16383:      9: 
 16384:     10:     // perform client_credentials exchange
 16385:     11:     const params = new URLSearchParams();
 16386:     12:     params.append('grant_type', 'client_credentials');
 16387:     13: 
 16388:     14:     const res = await fetch(tokenUrl, {
 16389:     15:       method: 'POST',
 16390:     16:       headers: {
 16391:     17:         'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded',
 16392:     18:         'Authorization': 'Basic ' + Buffer.from(clientId + ':' + clientSecret).toString('base64')
 16393:     19:       },
 16394:     20:       body: params.toString()
 16395:     21:     });
 16396:     22:     const json = await res.json();
 16397:     23:     // optionally store token in Netlify env (not possible from function), so return it to caller
 16398:     24:     return { statusCode: 200, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:true, token: json }) };
 16399:     25:   } catch (err) {
 16400:     26:     return { statusCode: 500, body: JSON.stringify({ ok:false, error:String(err) }) };
 16401:     27:   }
 16402:     28: };
 16403:     29:

 22262: 
 22263: ============================
 22264: FILE: D:\qflush\PUBLISH.md
 22265: ============================
 22266: ============================
 22267:      1: # Publishing @qflush/qflush
 22268:      2: 
 22269:      3: This document explains how to publish the `@qflush/qflush` package to npm and includes recommended `package.json` fields.
 22270:      4: 
 22271:      5: NOTE: The public npm listing (package page) is currently under reconstruction. The package can still be published and installed via `npm install @qflush/qflush`, but the npm website display may be incomplete until the rebuild is finished.
 22272:      6: 
 22273:      7: Checklist before publishing:
 22274:      8: 
 22275:      9: - Bump `version` in `package.json` if republishing.
 22276:     10: - Ensure `dist/index.js` exists and starts with `#!/usr/bin/env node`.
 22277:     11: - Run `npm run build` and verify `dist` contains compiled JS and `.d.ts` files.
 22278:     12: - Run `node dist/index.js --help` to verify CLI runs.
 22279:     13: - Run `npm pack` to inspect the tarball contents before publishing.
 22280:     14: - Ensure `package.json` `bin` points to `dist/index.js`.
 22281:     15: - If using `.npmignore`, ensure it does not exclude `dist`.
 22282:     16: - Confirm `prepare` script in `package.json` is present to auto-build on publish.
 22283:     17: 
 22284:     18: Recommended package.json fields:
 22285:     19: 
 22286:     20: ```json
 22287:     21: {
 22288:     22:   "name": "@qflush/qflush",
 22289:     23:   "version": "0.0.0",
 22290:     24:   "description": "QFLUSH  The Funesterie Runtime System",
 22291:     25:   "main": "dist/index.js",
 22292:     26:   "bin": { "qflush": "dist/index.js" },
 22293:     27:   "files": ["dist", "README.md"],
 22294:     28:   "publishConfig": { "access": "public" }
 22295:     29: }
 22296:     30: ```
 22297:     31: 
 22298:     32: Publish steps:
 22299:     33: 
 22300:     34: 1. Login to npm: `npm login` (use account that owns `@qflush` scope)
 22301:     35: 2. From project root `cd qflush`
 22302:     36: 3. Build: `npm run build`
 22303:     37: 4. Publish: `npm publish --access public`
 22304:     38: 
 22305:     39: Testing globally without publishing:
 22306:     40: 
 22307:     41: - Link locally: `cd qflush && npm link`
 22308:     42: - Test: `qflush --help` or `qflush start` or `qflush checksum list`
 22309:     43: - Remove link: `npm unlink -g @qflush/qflush`
 22310:     44: 
 22311:     45: Notes on 2FA:
 22312:     46: 
 22313:     47: - If your npm account requires 2FA for publishing, you'll be prompted for the OTP.
 22314:     48: 
 22315:     49: Troubleshooting:
 22316:     50: 
 22317:     51: - If publish fails due to package name, ensure the scope `@qflush` exists and you have permission to publish under it.
 22318:     52: - If `dist` missing on publish, `prepare` should build, but check logs for errors.
 22319:     53: 
 22320:     54: 
 22321: 
 22322: 
 22323:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\docs\FCL_README.md
============================
============================
     1: Funesterie Config Language (FCL) - README
     2: 
     3: FCL is a small, human-friendly format to declare projects, services and pipelines for Funesterie.
     4: 
     5: Sections:
     6: - `@project` global metadata (name, owner, defaultEnv)
     7: - `@env <name>` environment variables and URLs
     8: - `@service <name>` description of a launchable service (path, start command, port)
     9: - `@pipeline <name>` ordered list of services to run together
    10: 
    11: Examples:
    12: 
    13: @project
    14:   name = my-stack
    15:   owner = alice
    16: 
    17: @env dev
    18:   url = http://localhost:3000
    19: 
    20: @service api
    21:   type = node
    22:   path = apps/api
    23:   start = pnpm dev:api
    24:   port = 3000
    25: 
    26: @pipeline dev-all
    27:   steps = ["api"]
    28: 
    29: Usage:
    30: - Place `funesterie.fcl` in the repo root.
    31: - `qflash compose up` will read `funesterie.fcl` if present and bring up declared services.
    32: 
    33: This README is minimal and the spec is intentionally small to keep portability.
    34: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\docs\FCL_SPEC.md
============================
============================
     1: Funesterie Config Language (FCL) - Short Spec
     2: 
     3: 1. File name: `funesterie.fcl`
     4: 2. Sections start with `@section` optionally followed by a name: `@service api` or `@env dev`.
     5: 3. Key-value syntax: `key = value` (strings or numbers).
     6: 4. Lists use `[]` with comma-separated values: `steps = ["api", "web"]`.
     7: 5. Comments start with `#` or `//` and extend to end-of-line.
     8: 6. Supported sections: `@project`, `@env`, `@service`, `@pipeline`.
     9: 7. `@service <name>` supports keys: `type`, `path`, `start`, `port`, `env`, `token`.
    10: 8. `@pipeline <name>` supports keys: `description`, `steps` (list of service names).
    11: 9. Values can be quoted strings or unquoted tokens (no complex expressions).
    12: 10. FCL is intentionally minimal and designed to be parsed without heavy dependencies.
    13: 
    14: Example:
    15: 
    16: @service api
    17:   type = node
    18:   path = apps/api
    19:   start = npm run dev
    20:   port = 3000
    21: 
    22: @pipeline dev-all
    23:   steps = ["api", "web"]
    24:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\installers\install-all.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: One-step web-style installer for Funesterie (downloads QFLASH and runs installer)
     3: This script assumes you host funeste38-qflash-<version>.tgz at a reachable URL.
     4: #>
     5: param(
     6:     [string]$PackageUrl = "https://example.com/funeste38-qflash-0.1.1.tgz",
     7:     [string]$Mode = 'user'
     8: )
     9: 
    10: $temp = Join-Path $env:TEMP "qflash_install.tgz"
    11: Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $PackageUrl -OutFile $temp
    12: 
    13: # extract to AppData
    14: $dest = Join-Path $env:APPDATA "Funeste38\QFlash"
    15: New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
    16: 
    17: Add-Type -AssemblyName System.IO.Compression.FileSystem
    18: [System.IO.Compression.ZipFile]::ExtractToDirectory($temp, $dest)
    19: 
    20: Write-Host "QFLASH extracted to $dest"
    21: 
    22: # add to user PATH
    23: $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'User')
    24: if ($current -notlike "*$dest*") {
    25:   [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dest", 'User')
    26:   Write-Host "Added $dest to user PATH"
    27: }
    28: 
    29: Write-Host "Installation complete. Open a new shell and run 'qflash --help'"
    30: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\installers\install-qflash.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: PowerShell installer for QFLASH
     3: Supports:
     4:  - user install (default): copies package to %APPDATA% and adds to PATH for current user
     5:  - system install: copies package to C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlash and adds to system PATH (requires elevation)
     6:  - npm global install: runs `npm install -g @funeste38/qflash` if package is published
     7: 
     8: Usage:
     9:  .\install-qflash.ps1 -Mode user
    10:  .\install-qflash.ps1 -Mode system
    11:  .\install-qflash.ps1 -Mode npm
    12: #>
    13: param(
    14:     [ValidateSet('user','system','npm')]
    15:     [string]$Mode = 'user'
    16: )
    17: 
    18: function Add-PathUser {
    19:     param([string]$dir)
    20:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'User')
    21:     if ($current -notlike "*$dir*") {
    22:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'User')
    23:         Write-Host "Added $dir to user PATH"
    24:     } else {
    25:         Write-Host "$dir already in user PATH"
    26:     }
    27: }
    28: 
    29: function Add-PathMachine {
    30:     param([string]$dir)
    31:     $current = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', 'Machine')
    32:     if ($current -notlike "*$dir*") {
    33:         [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('PATH', "$current;$dir", 'Machine')
    34:         Write-Host "Added $dir to machine PATH"
    35:     } else {
    36:         Write-Host "$dir already in machine PATH"
    37:     }
    38: }
    39: 
    40: if ($Mode -eq 'npm') {
    41:     Write-Host "Installing via npm global..."
    42:     npm install -g @funeste38/qflash
    43:     exit $?
    44: }
    45: 
    46: # assume script run from repo root or from extracted package
    47: $scriptDir = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Definition
    48: $source = Join-Path $scriptDir '..' 'dist'
    49: 
    50: if ($Mode -eq 'user') {
    51:     $dest = Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'Funeste38\QFlash'
    52:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
    53:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
    54:     Add-PathUser -dir $dest
    55:     Write-Host "Installed QFLASH to $dest (user)"
    56:     exit 0
    57: }
    58: 
    59: if ($Mode -eq 'system') {
    60:     if (-not ([Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal][Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()).IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) {
    61:         Write-Error "System install requires elevation. Run PowerShell as Administrator."
    62:         exit 1
    63:     }
    64:     $dest = 'C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlash'
    65:     New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dest -Force | Out-Null
    66:     Copy-Item -Path "$scriptDir\..\dist\*" -Destination $dest -Recurse -Force
    67:     Add-PathMachine -dir $dest
    68:     Write-Host "Installed QFLASH to $dest (system)"
    69:     exit 0
    70: }
    71: 


============================

     1: # PowerShell installer for qflashd (Windows service wrapper)

     6: 
     7: # Example using nssm (assuming nssm.exe is available):
     8: # nssm install qflashd "C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe" "C:\path\to\qflash\dist\daemon\qflashd.js"
     9: 
    10: Write-Host "Install instructions provided."
    11:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\installers\README-install.md
============================
============================
     1: # QFLASH Installer
     2: 
     3: This folder contains a PowerShell installer `install-qflash.ps1` that can:
     4: 
     5: - Install QFLASH for the current user (default) by copying compiled `dist` files to `%APPDATA%\Funeste38\QFlash` and adding the folder to user PATH.
     6: - Install QFLASH system-wide (requires Administrator) by copying to `C:\Program Files\Funesterie\QFlash` and adding to machine PATH.
     7: - Install via npm global if the package is published: `install-qflash.ps1 -Mode npm`.
     8: 
     9: Usage examples:
    10: 
    11: PowerShell (current user):
    12: PS> .\install-qflash.ps1 -Mode user
    13: 
    14: PowerShell (system/admin):
    15: PS> Start-Process powershell -Verb runAs -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File "install-qflash.ps1" -Mode system'
    16: 
    17: NPM global install (requires published package):
    18: PS> .\install-qflash.ps1 -Mode npm
    19: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\LICENSE-COMMERCIAL.md
============================
============================
     1: FUNESTERIE COMMERCIAL LICENSE (FCL-PRO 1.0)
     2: 
     3: A valid commercial license is required for:
     4: 
     5:  Using FCL inside a business or company
     6:  SaaS products, cloud tools, internal dev tools
     7:  Any paid product integrating FCL
     8:  Distributing commercial software using FCL
     9:  Hosting services that process FCL files
    10: 
    11: Pricing:
    12: - Indie developer:      39/year
    13: - Small startup (<10):  99/year per developer
    14: - Company:              299/year per developer
    15: - Enterprise:           custom contract
    16: 
    17: Benefits:
    18:  Unlimited commercial usage
    19:  Authorized FCL integration in products
    20:  Allowed redistribution inside your software
    21:  FCL Compatible badge usage
    22:  Priority support email
    23: 
    24: Prohibited:
    25:  Reselling FCL as a standalone tool
    26:  Publishing a competing FCL alternative
    27: 
    28: Contact: cellaurojeffrey@gmail.com
    29: 
    30: To purchase a commercial license for FCL:
    31: https://cellaurojeff.gumroad.com/l/jxktq
    32: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\LICENSE-FUNESTERIE.txt
============================
============================
     1: FUNESTERIE LICENSE AGREEMENT (FCL 1.0)
     2: Last updated: 2025
     3: 
     4: Copyright  Funesterie
     5: 
     6: FCL  Funesterie Config Language, including its syntax, grammar,
     7: structure, naming, examples, documentation, and all associated 
     8: materials, is proprietary software fully owned by Funesterie.
     9: 
    10: By using, copying, distributing or integrating FCL, you agree to the
    11: terms of this license.
    12: 
    13: 1. Definitions
    14: --------------
    15: FCL refers to the Funesterie Config Language, the syntax, the grammar,
    16: its specification, examples, reference documentation, and official tools.
    17: 
    18: Personal Use means individual usage for hobby, testing, learning, or
    19: non-commercial open-source projects, with no revenue involved.
    20: 
    21: Commercial Use includes any use within a business, company, paid app,
    22: SaaS product, or any revenue-generating activity.
    23: 
    24: 2. Rights granted
    25: -----------------
    26: Personal Use: free, unlimited, no registration required.
    27: 
    28: Commercial Use: requires an active Funesterie Commercial License.
    29: Without such license, all commercial usage is strictly prohibited.
    30: 
    31: 3. Restrictions
    32: ---------------
    33:  You may NOT fork, rename, copy, or rebrand the FCL format.
    34:  You may NOT create competing formats based on FCL.
    35:  You may NOT redistribute modified versions of FCL.
    36:  You may NOT remove or replace the Funesterie branding.
    37:  You may NOT reverse-engineer paid tools, SDKs or parsers.
    38:  You may NOT integrate FCL in commercial products without a license.
    39: 
    40: 4. Ownership
    41: ------------
    42: FCL remains the sole intellectual property of Funesterie. 
    43: No rights are transferred except those specified above.
    44: 
    45: 5. Termination
    46: --------------
    47: Any violation terminates all granted rights. 
    48: Funesterie may pursue legal action for unauthorized commercial use.
    49: 
    50: 6. Disclaimer
    51: -------------
    52: FCL is provided as is, without warranty of any kind.
    53: 
    54: This project includes third-party components under their own licenses.
    55: See THIRD_PARTY_LICENSES.txt for details.
    56: 
    57: For commercial licensing contact:
    58: cellaurojeffrey@gmail.com
    59:

============================

     1: FUNESTERIE NON-COMMERCIAL LICENSE (FCL-NC 1.0)
     2: 
     3: You may use FCL for personal, private or hobby projects at no cost.
     4: 
     5: Allowed:
     6:  Personal learning
     7:  Hobby projects
     8:  Free open-source projects
     9:  Tutorials, experiments, prototypes
    10: 
    11: Not allowed:
    12:  Use inside a company
    13:  Any revenue-generating product
    14:  SaaS integration
    15:  Paid applications
    16:  Commercial distribution
    17: 
    18: Commercial use requires a Funesterie Commercial License.
    19:

FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\PUBLISH.md
============================
============================
     1: # Publishing @funeste38/qflash
     2: 
     3: Checklist before publishing:
     4: 
     5: - Bump `version` in `package.json` if republishing.
     6: - Ensure `dist/index.js` exists and starts with `#!/usr/bin/env node`.
     7: - Run `npm run build` and verify `dist` contains compiled JS and `.d.ts` files.
     8: - Run `node dist/index.js --help` to verify CLI runs.
     9: - Run `npm pack` to inspect the tarball contents before publishing.
    10: - Ensure `package.json` `bin` points to `dist/index.js`.
    11: - If using `.npmignore`, ensure it does not exclude `dist`.
    12: - Confirm `prepare` script in `package.json` is present to auto-build on publish.
    13: 
    14: Publish steps:
    15: 
    16: 1. Login to npm: `npm login` (use account that owns `@funeste38` scope)
    17: 2. From project root `cd qflash`
    18: 3. Build: `npm run build`
    19: 4. Publish: `npm publish --access public`
    20: 
    21: Testing globally without publishing:
    22: 
    23: - Link locally: `cd qflash && npm link`
    24: - Test: `qflash --help` or `qflash start`
    25: - Remove link: `npm unlink -g @funeste38/qflash`
    26: 
    27: Notes on 2FA:
    28: - If your npm account requires 2FA for publishing, you'll be prompted for the OTP.
    29: 
    30: Troubleshooting:
    31: - If publish fails due to package name, ensure the scope `@funeste38` exists and you have permission.
    32: - If `dist` missing on publish, `prepare` should build, but check logs for errors.
    33: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\README-FCL.md
============================
============================
     1: # FCL  Funesterie Config Language
     2: Official Specification  Version 1.0
     3: 
     4: FCL is a human-friendly configuration language designed for orchestrators,
     5: multi-service stacks, automation pipelines and modern application tooling.
     6: 
     7: It is owned and maintained by Funesterie.
     8: 
     9: ### Quick Example
    10: 
    11: @project
    12:   name = my-project
    13:   version = 1.0
    14: 
    15: @service api
    16:   path = apps/api
    17:   start = "pnpm dev"
    18: 
    19: @pipeline dev
    20:   steps = ["api"]
    21: 
    22: ### Syntax Overview
    23: 
    24: - Blocks start with @keyword or @keyword name
    25: - Key-value syntax uses: key = value
    26: - Strings may use "quotes"
    27: - Lists use: [ item1, item2, item3 ]
    28: - Comments: # or //
    29: 
    30: ### Purpose
    31: 
    32: FCL is designed to be:
    33: - Lightweight
    34: - Easy to write
    35: - Easy to parse
    36: - Tool-agnostic
    37: - Human-readable
    38: 
    39: ### License
    40: 
    41: Personal usage is free.  
    42: Commercial usage requires a Funesterie Commercial License.
    43: 
    44: To purchase a commercial license for FCL:
    45: https://cellaurojeff.gumroad.com/l/jxktq
    46: 
    47: See:
    48: - LICENSE-FUNESTERIE.txt
    49: - LICENSE-NON-COMMERCIAL.md
    50: - LICENSE-COMMERCIAL.md
    51: - TRADEMARK.md
    52: 
    53: ### Badge (text)
    54: 
    55: [ FUNESTERIE LICENSED FORMAT ]
    56:        FCL  Official Format
    57: ---------------------------------
    58: This project uses the Funesterie
    59: config language under license.
    60: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\README.md
============================
============================
     1: # @funeste38/qflash 
     2: 
     3: QFLASH is the orchestrator of the Funesterie ecosystem.
     4: Start, stop, purge, inspect, and synchronize modules.
     5: 
     6: ## Release
     7: 
     8: Latest release: v0.1.4  https://github.com/jEFFLEZ/qflash/releases/tag/v0.1.4
     9: 
    10: ## Install
    11: 
    12: Global (recommended):
    13: 
    14: npm install -g @funeste38/qflash
    15: 
    16: PowerShell one-liner (if installer hosted):
    17: 
    18: ```powershell
    19: iwr -useb https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jEFFLEZ/qflash/main/installers/install-qflash.ps1 | iex
    20: ```
    21: 
    22: ## Commercial license
    23: 
    24: To purchase a commercial license for FCL:
    25: https://cellaurojeff.gumroad.com/l/jxktq
    26: 
    27: ## Commands
    28: 
    29: - `qflash start`       launch ecosystem (rome, nezlephant, envaptex, freeland, bat)
    30: - `qflash kill`        kill all processes cleanly
    31: - `qflash purge`       flush caches + logs + sessions
    32: - `qflash inspect`     display status and active ports
    33: - `qflash config`      generate default .env/config files
    34: 
    35: ## Examples and templates
    36: 
    37: Example compose files are provided in `examples/`:
    38: 
    39: - `examples/funesterie.yml`  YAML compose example
    40: - `examples/funesterie.fcl`  Funesterie Config Language (FCL) example
    41: 
    42: Use `qflash compose up` to bring up the example stack.
    43: 
    44: ## Flags and advanced options
    45: 
    46: Global flags (examples):
    47: - `--dev`            Enable developer mode (may change logging/behavior)
    48: - `--fresh`          Implicitly purge before starting (maps to `purge` -> `start`)
    49: - `--force`          Force restart semantics (may add `kill` when starting)
    50: - `--proxy=NAME`     Proxy selection, forwarded to modules
    51: 
    52: Service targeting:
    53: - `--service <name>` Select a service to target (examples: `rome`, `nezlephant`, `envaptex`, `freeland`, `bat`).
    54: - `--path <path>`    Assign a path for the most recent `--service` declared.
    55: - `--token <token>`  Assign a token for the most recent `--service` declared.
    56: 
    57: Examples:
    58: 
    59: ```
    60: qflash start --service rome --path D:/rome --token ABC123
    61: qflash start --service nezlephant --service freeland
    62: qflash start --service nezlephant --service freeland --fresh
    63: qflash config --service freeland
    64: qflash purge --fresh
    65: ```
    66: 
    67: ## Migration guide (meta-package)
    68: 
    69: If you currently depend on individual Funesterie packages like `@funeste38/rome`, `@funeste38/nezlephant`, `@funeste38/freeland`, `@funeste38/bat`, prefer to switch to the meta-package `@funeste38/qflash` which re-exports them.
    70: 
    71: Quick steps:
    72: 
    73: 1. Add the meta-package in your app:
    74: 
    75: ```bash
    76: npm install @funeste38/qflash
    77: ```
    78: 
    79: 2. Replace imports in your codebase (example):
    80: 
    81: Before:
    82: ```js
    83: import { run } from '@funeste38/rome'
    84: import { encode } from '@funeste38/nezlephant'
    85: ```
    86: 
    87: After:
    88: ```js
    89: import { Rome, Nez, Freeland, Bat } from '@funeste38/qflash'
    90: Rome.run(...)
    91: Nez.encode(...)
    92: ```
    93: 
    94: 3. In `package.json` of the app, keep only the dependency on `@funeste38/qflash` and remove the older individual packages.
    95: 
    96: 4. For branch migration: prefer creating new branches from `main` (which contains `@funeste38/qflash`). For older branches, replace imports during the merge.
    97: 
    98: ## One-liner installer
    99: 
   100: Example PowerShell one-liner (host your installer script raw on GitHub or your CDN):
   101: 
   102: ```powershell
   103: iwr -useb https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jEFFLEZ/qflash/main/installers/install-qflash.ps1 | iex
   104: ```
   105: 
   106: ## Future
   107: 
   108: Future improvements will focus on better detection, richer SmartChain rules and optional integrations.
   109: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\chain\smartChain.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     2: import { runDetect } from "../commands/detect";
     3: import { runConfig } from "../commands/config";
     4: import { runPurge } from "../commands/purge";
     5: import { runKill } from "../commands/kill";
     6: import { runStart } from "../commands/start";
     7: import { runExodia } from "../commands/exodia";
     8: 
     9: const ORDER = ["detect", "config", "purge", "kill", "start", "exodia"];
    10: 
    11: export type QFlashOptions = {
    12:   global?: Record<string, any>;
    13:   modulePaths?: Record<string, string>;
    14:   tokens?: Record<string, string>;
    15:   flags?: Record<string, boolean | string>;
    16:   detected?: Record<string, any>;
    17:   services?: string[];
    18: };
    19: 
    20: function parseArgs(argv: string[]) {
    21:   const cmds: string[] = [];
    22:   const flags: Record<string, boolean | string> = {};
    23:   const modulePaths: Record<string, string> = {};
    24:   const tokens: Record<string, string> = {};
    25:   const services: string[] = [];
    26: 
    27:   let currentService: string | undefined;
    28:   let i = 0;
    29:   while (i < argv.length) {
    30:     const a = argv[i];
    31:     if (!a.startsWith("-")) {
    32:       cmds.push(a.toLowerCase());
    33:       i++;
    34:       continue;
    35:     }
    36:     const clean = a.replace(/^--?/, "");
    37: 
    38:     if (clean === "service" || clean === "s") {
    39:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    40:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    41:         currentService = next.toLowerCase();
    42:         services.push(currentService);
    43:         i += 2;
    44:         continue;
    45:       } else {
    46:         i++;
    47:         continue;
    48:       }
    49:     }
    50: 
    51:     if (clean === "path") {
    52:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    53:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    54:         if (currentService) modulePaths[currentService] = next;
    55:         i += 2;
    56:         continue;
    57:       }
    58:       i++;
    59:       continue;
    60:     }
    61: 
    62:     if (clean === "token") {
    63:       const next = argv[i + 1];
    64:       if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    65:         if (currentService) tokens[currentService] = next;
    66:         i += 2;
    67:         continue;
    68:       }
    69:       i++;
    70:       continue;
    71:     }
    72: 
    73:     const kv = clean.split("=");
    74:     if (kv.length === 2) {
    75:       flags[kv[0]] = kv[1];
    76:       i++;
    77:       continue;
    78:     }
    79: 
    80:     const next = argv[i + 1];
    81:     if (next && !next.startsWith("-")) {
    82:       flags[clean] = next;
    83:       i += 2;
    84:       continue;
    85:     }
    86:     flags[clean] = true;
    87:     i++;
    88:   }
    89: 
    90:   return { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
    91: }
    92: 
    93: export function buildPipeline(argv: string[]) {
    94:   const { cmds, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services } = parseArgs(argv);
    95:   const unique = Array.from(new Set(cmds));
    96:   const known = unique.filter((c) => ORDER.includes(c));
    97: 
    98:   if (known.length === 0)
    99:     return {
   100:       pipeline: ["detect", "config", "start"],
   101:       options: { flags, modulePaths, tokens, global: {} as any, services },
   102:     };
   103: 
   104:   // build set with dependencies
   105:   const set = new Set<string>(known);
   106:   // dependencies mapping
   107:   const deps: Record<string, string[]> = {
   108:     start: ["config"],
   109:     config: ["detect"],
   110:     purge: ["detect"],
   111:   };
   112: 
   113:   // add dependencies recursively
   114:   function addDeps(cmd: string) {
   115:     const ds = deps[cmd] || [];
   116:     for (const d of ds) {
   117:       if (!set.has(d)) {
   118:         set.add(d);
   119:         addDeps(d);
   120:       }
   121:     }
   122:   }
   123:   for (const k of Array.from(set)) addDeps(k);
   124: 
   125:   let final: string[] = [];
   126: 
   127:   // Flag-driven transformations
   128:   if (flags["fresh"]) {
   129:     set.add("purge");
   130:     // ensure purge runs before start
   131:   }
   132:   if (flags["force"]) {
   133:     // make sure kill runs before start
   134:     set.add("kill");
   135:   }
   136: 
   137:   const requestedKill = known.includes("kill");
   138: 
   139:   if (requestedKill) {
   140:     // put kill first if user explicitly requested it
   141:     final.push("kill");
   142:     for (const k of ORDER) {
   143:       if (k === "kill") continue;
   144:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
   145:     }
   146:   } else {
   147:     for (const k of ORDER) {
   148:       if (set.has(k)) final.push(k);
   149:     }
   150:   }
   151: 
   152:   // remove duplicates and preserve order
   153:   final = final.filter((v, i) => final.indexOf(v) === i);
   154: 
   155:   logger.info(`SmartChain built pipeline: ${final.join(" -> ")}`);
   156:   const options: QFlashOptions = { global: {}, flags, modulePaths, tokens, services };
   157:   return { pipeline: final, options };
   158: }
   159: 
   160: export async function executePipeline(pipeline: string[], options: QFlashOptions) {
   161:   for (const step of pipeline) {
   162:     logger.info(`Executing pipeline step: ${step}`);
   163:     switch (step) {
   164:       case "detect": {
   165:         const detected = await runDetect(options);
   166:         options.detected = detected || {};
   167:         if (detected && typeof detected === "object") {
   168:           options.modulePaths = { ...(options.modulePaths || {}), ...(detected.paths || {}) };
   169:         }
   170:         break;
   171:       }
   172:       case "config":
   173:         await runConfig(options);
   174:         break;
   175:       case "purge":
   176:         await runPurge(options);
   177:         break;
   178:       case "kill":
   179:         await runKill(options);
   180:         break;
   181:       case "start":
   182:         await runStart(options);
   183:         break;
   184:       case "exodia":
   185:         await runExodia(options);
   186:         break;
   187:       default:
   188:         logger.warn(`Unknown pipeline step: ${step}`);
   189:     }
   190:   }
   191: }
   192: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\cli\help.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     2: 
     3: export function showHelp() {
     4:   logger.info(`qflash - Funesterie orchestrator`);
     5:   console.log(`
     6: Usage:
     7:   qflash [command] [options]
     8: 
     9: Commands:
    10:   start        Launch selected services (default: detect  config  start)
    11:   kill         Kill running services
    12:   purge        Clear caches, logs and sessions
    13:   inspect      Show running services and ports
    14:   config       Generate missing .env/config files
    15: 
    16: Options (examples):
    17:   --service rome --path D:/rome --token ABC123     Target a specific service and give path/token
    18:   --service nezlephant --service freeland          Target multiple services
    19:   --dev --fresh                                    Global flags (dev mode, fresh start)
    20:   --force                                          Force restart semantics (implies kill before start)
    21: 
    22: Examples:
    23:   qflash start --service rome --path D:/rome
    24:   qflash start --service nezlephant --service freeland --fresh
    25:   qflash config --service freeland
    26:   qflash purge --fresh
    27: 
    28: `);
    29: }
    30: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\commands\compose.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { readCompose } from '../compose/parser';
     2: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
     3: import { runStart } from './start';
     4: import { startProcess, listRunning } from '../supervisor';
     5: import { runPurge } from './purge';
     6: import fs from 'fs';
     7: import { Tail } from 'tail';
     8: 
     9: export async function runCompose(argv: string[]) {
    10:   const sub = argv[0];
    11:   const compose = readCompose();
    12:   if (!compose) {
    13:     logger.error('No funesterie.yml or funesterie.fcl found');
    14:     return;
    15:   }
    16:   if (sub === 'up') {
    17:     // support --background flag
    18:     const bg = argv.includes('--background') || argv.includes('-b');
    19:     const modules = Object.keys(compose.modules);
    20:     for (const m of modules) {
    21:       const def = compose.modules[m];
    22:       logger.info(`Bringing up ${m} from ${def.path || 'package'}`);
    23:       if (bg) {
    24:         // start in background using supervisor
    25:         const logPath = `${process.cwd()}/.qflash/logs/${m}.log`;
    26:         startProcess(m, def.path || m, [], { cwd: def.path || process.cwd(), detached: true, logPath });
    27:       } else {
    28:         await runStart({ services: [m], modulePaths: { [m]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
    29:       }
    30:     }
    31:     return;
    32:   }
    33:   if (sub === 'down') {
    34:     logger.info('Bringing down all modules');
    35:     await runPurge();
    36:     return;
    37:   }
    38:   if (sub === 'restart') {
    39:     const name = argv[1];
    40:     if (!name) {
    41:       logger.info('Specify module to restart');
    42:       return;
    43:     }
    44:     // naive: stop and start
    45:     const running = listRunning();
    46:     if (running.find(r => r.name === name)) {
    47:       // stop
    48:       await import('../supervisor').then(s => s.stopProcess(name));
    49:     }
    50:     const def = compose.modules[name];
    51:     if (!def) { logger.info('Unknown module'); return; }
    52:     await runStart({ services: [name], modulePaths: { [name]: def.path }, flags: {} } as any);
    53:     return;
    54:   }
    55:   if (sub === 'logs') {
    56:     const name = argv[1];
    57:     if (!name) { logger.info('Specify module name'); return; }
    58:     const logFile = `${process.cwd()}/.qflash/logs/${name}.log`;
    59:     if (!fs.existsSync(logFile)) { logger.info('No log file found'); return; }
    60:     const t = new Tail(logFile, { fromBeginning: false, retry: true });
    61:     t.on('line', (data: any) => console.log(data));
    62:     t.on('error', (err: any) => console.error(err));
    63:     return;
    64:   }
    65:   logger.info('Usage: qflash compose [up|down|restart|logs]');
    66: }
    67:

FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\commands\config.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { promises as fs } from "fs";
     2: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     3: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths";
     4: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     5: 
     6: export async function runConfig(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
     7:   logger.info("qflash: generating default configs...");
     8:   const detected = opts?.detected || {};
     9:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
    10:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
    11:     const p = paths[key];
    12:     if (!p) continue;
    13:     const envFile = `${p}/.env`;
    14:     try {
    15:       await fs.access(envFile);
    16:       logger.info(`${key}: .env already exists`);
    17:     } catch {
    18:       const content = `# ${key} default env\nPORT=3000\nTOKEN=changeme\n`;
    19:       await fs.mkdir(p, { recursive: true });
    20:       await fs.writeFile(envFile, content, { encoding: "utf8" });
    21:       logger.success(`Created ${envFile}`);
    22:     }
    23:   }
    24: }
    25:

FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\commands\detect.ts

     1: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
     2: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     3: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     4: 
     5: export async function runDetect(_opts?: QFlashOptions) {
     6:   logger.info("qflash: detecting modules...");
     7:   const detected = await detectModules();
     8:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
     9:     const v = detected[k];
    10:     logger.info(`${k}: ${v.running ? 'running' : 'stopped'}`);
    11:   }
    12:   // return a normalized object
    13:   return { detected, paths: {} };
    14: }

FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\commands\doctor.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
     2: import { detectModules } from '../utils/detect';
     3: import { httpProbe } from '../utils/health';
     4: import { SERVICE_MAP } from '../utils/paths';
     5: import { ensurePackageInstalled } from '../utils/exec';
     6: 
     7: export async function runDoctor(argv: string[] = []) {
     8:   const fix = argv.includes('--fix') || argv.includes('-f');
     9: 
    10:   logger.info('qflash: running doctor checks...');
    11:   const detected = await detectModules();
    12:   for (const k of Object.keys(detected)) {
    13:     const v = detected[k];
    14:     logger.info(`${k}: installed=${v.installed} running=${v.running} path=${v.path || 'n/a'}`);
    15:     if (v.bin && v.path) {
    16:       logger.info(`  bin: ${v.bin}`);
    17:     }
    18:   }
    19: 
    20:   // check node version
    21:   logger.info(`Node version: ${process.version}`);
    22: 
    23:   // simple http check example
    24:   const httpOk = await httpProbe('http://localhost:80', 500);
    25:   logger.info(`HTTP localhost:80 reachable: ${httpOk}`);
    26: 
    27:   if (fix) {
    28:     logger.info('Doctor fix: attempting to install missing Funeste38 packages...');
    29:     for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    30:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg;
    31:       const detectedInfo = detected[name];
    32:       if (!detectedInfo || !detectedInfo.installed) {
    33:         logger.info(`Installing ${pkg} for service ${name}...`);
    34:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
    35:         if (ok) logger.success(`Installed ${pkg}`);
    36:         else logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkg}`);
    37:       } else {
    38:         logger.info(`${pkg} already installed`);
    39:       }
    40:     }
    41:   }
    42: 
    43:   logger.info('Doctor checks complete');
    44: }
    45:

FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\commands\inspect.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     2: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
     3: import { listRunning } from "../supervisor";
     4: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     5: 
     6: export async function runInspect(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
     7:   logger.info("qflash: inspecting ecosystem...");
     8:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
     9:   for (const key of Object.keys(detected)) {
    10:     const v = detected[key];
    11:     logger.info(`${key}: ${v.running ? `running (pid=${v.pid || 'unknown'})` : 'stopped'}`);
    12:     if (v.port) logger.info(`  port: ${v.port}`);
    13:     if (v.installed) logger.info(`  installed: true`);
    14:   }
    15:   const running = listRunning();
    16:   if (running.length) {
    17:     logger.info("Supervisor running processes:");
    18:     for (const r of running) logger.info(`  ${r.name}: pid=${r.pid} cmd=${r.cmd}`);
    19:   }
    20: }

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\commands\purge.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     2: import { resolvePaths } from "../utils/paths";
     3: import { rimrafSync } from "../utils/exec";
     4: import { clearState } from "../supervisor";
     5: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     6: 
     7: export async function runPurge(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
     8:   logger.info("qflash: purging caches, logs, sessions and supervisor state...");
     9:   const paths = resolvePaths(opts?.detected || {});
    10:   const targets = [] as string[];
    11:   for (const key of Object.keys(paths)) {
    12:     const p = paths[key];
    13:     if (!p) continue;
    14:     targets.push(`${p}/.cache`);
    15:     targets.push(`${p}/logs`);
    16:     targets.push(`${p}/tmp`);
    17:     targets.push(`${p}/sessions`);
    18:   }
    19:   for (const t of targets) {
    20:     try {
    21:       rimrafSync(t);
    22:       logger.success(`Removed ${t}`);
    23:     } catch (err) {
    24:       logger.warn(`Failed to remove ${t}: ${err}`);
    25:     }
    26:   }
    27:   // clear supervisor state
    28:   clearState();
    29:   logger.info("Purge complete.");
    30: }
    31: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\commands\start.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
     2: import { logger } from "../utils/logger";
     3: import { spawnSafe, ensurePackageInstalled, pathExists, rebuildInstructionsFor } from "../utils/exec";
     4: import { resolvePaths, SERVICE_MAP } from "../utils/paths";
     5: import { QFlashOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     6: import { resolvePackagePath, readPackageJson } from "../utils/package";
     7: import { startProcess } from "../supervisor";
     8: import { waitForService } from "../utils/health";
     9: 
    10: export async function runStart(opts?: QFlashOptions) {
    11:   logger.info("qflash: starting modules...");
    12:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
    13:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
    14: 
    15:   const services = opts?.services && opts.services.length ? opts.services : Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
    16:   const flags = opts?.flags || {};
    17: 
    18:   const waitForStart = Boolean(flags["wait"] || flags["--wait"] || false);
    19:   const doRestart = Boolean(flags["restart"] || flags["--restart"] || flags["force"] || false);
    20:   const maxRestarts = typeof flags["restartCount"] === "number" ? (flags["restartCount"] as number) : 3;
    21: 
    22:   const procs: Promise<void>[] = [];
    23: 
    24:   for (const mod of services) {
    25:     const promise = (async () => {
    26:       const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[mod]) || paths[mod];
    27:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[mod] && SERVICE_MAP[mod].pkg;
    28: 
    29:       // resolve package path (local node_modules or provided path)
    30:       let pkgPath = p;
    31:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
    32: 
    33:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) {
    34:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
    35:         if (!ok) {
    36:           logger.warn(`${mod} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);
    37:           return;
    38:         }
    39:         pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
    40:       }
    41: 
    42:       if (!pkgPath) {
    43:         logger.warn(`${mod} path and package not found, skipping`);
    44:         return;
    45:       }
    46: 
    47:       const pkgJson = readPackageJson(pkgPath);
    48: 
    49:       // choose how to run: package bin if present, else npx <pkg>
    50:       let runCmd: { cmd: string; args: string[]; cwd?: string } | null = null;
    51:       if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
    52:         const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === "string" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
    53:         const binPath = require("path").join(pkgPath, binEntry);
    54: 
    55:         // prefer running via node when bin is a JS file inside package
    56:         if (binPath.endsWith(".js") && pathExists(binPath)) {
    57:           runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };
    58:         } else if (pathExists(binPath)) {
    59:           runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: pkgPath };
    60:         } else {
    61:           logger.warn(`${mod} bin entry not found at ${binPath}. ${rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath)}`);
    62:           return;
    63:         }
    64:       } else if (pkg) {
    65:         // fallback to npx but warn about potential npx execution failures
    66:         logger.warn(`${mod} has no local bin; will run via npx which may fail if package not globally installed.`);
    67:         runCmd = { cmd: "npx", args: [pkg], cwd: process.cwd() };
    68:       }
    69: 
    70:       if (!runCmd) {
    71:         logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
    72:         return;
    73:       }
    74: 
    75:       let restarts = 0;
    76: 
    77:       const spawnOnce = (): Promise<void> => {
    78:         return new Promise((resolve) => {
    79:           logger.info(`Launching ${mod} -> ${runCmd!.cmd} ${runCmd!.args.join(" ")}`);
    80: 
    81:           // use supervisor to manage and persist process
    82:           const child = startProcess(mod, runCmd!.cmd, runCmd!.args, { cwd: runCmd!.cwd });
    83: 
    84:           if (waitForStart) {
    85:             // try to wait for a health endpoint if provided in flags
    86:             const svcUrl = flags["health-url"] || flags["health"];
    87:             const svcPort = flags["health-port"] || undefined;
    88:             if (svcUrl) {
    89:               waitForService(svcUrl as string, svcPort as any).then((ok) => {
    90:                 if (ok) logger.success(`${mod} passed health check`);
    91:                 else logger.warn(`${mod} failed health check`);
    92:                 resolve();
    93:               });
    94:             } else {
    95:               // wait for spawn via PID persistence
    96:               setTimeout(() => {
    97:                 logger.info(`${mod} started (delayed wait).`);
    98:                 resolve();
    99:               }, 2000);
   100:             }
   101:           } else {
   102:             resolve();
   103:           }
   104: 
   105:           // child exit handled by supervisor
   106:         });
   107:       };
   108: 
   109:       // start the first time and optionally wait
   110:       await spawnOnce();
   111: 
   112:       // restart logic handled by supervisor-level events, keep simple here
   113:     })();
   114: 
   115:     procs.push(promise);
   116:   }
   117: 
   118:   await Promise.all(procs);
   119: 
   120:   logger.success("qflash: start sequence initiated for selected modules");
   121: }
   122: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\compose\fclParser.ts
============================
============================
     1: import fs from 'fs';
     2: 
     3: function parseValue(raw: string): any {
     4:   const v = raw.trim();
     5:   if (v.startsWith('[') && v.endsWith(']')) {
     6:     // simple list parser
     7:     const inside = v.slice(1, -1).trim();
     8:     if (!inside) return [];
     9:     return inside.split(',').map(x => x.trim().replace(/^"|"$/g, ''));
    10:   }
    11:   if (/^\d+$/.test(v)) return Number(v);
    12:   return v.replace(/^"|"$/g, '');
    13: }
    14: 
    15: export function readFCL(file = 'funesterie.fcl') {
    16:   try {
    17:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
    18:     const lines = raw.split(/\r?\n/);
    19:     const out: any = { project: {}, env: {}, service: {}, pipeline: {} };
    20:     let current: { section?: string, name?: string } = {};
    21:     for (let line of lines) {
    22:       line = line.trim();
    23:       if (!line || line.startsWith('#') || line.startsWith('//')) continue;
    24:       if (line.startsWith('@')) {
    25:         const parts = line.split(/	|\s+/).filter(Boolean);
    26:         const sec = parts[0].slice(1);
    27:         const name = parts[1] || undefined;
    28:         current = { section: sec, name };
    29:         if (name) {
    30:           if (!out[sec]) out[sec] = {};
    31:           out[sec][name] = out[sec][name] || {};
    32:         }
    33:         continue;
    34:       }
    35:       const eq = line.indexOf('=');
    36:       if (eq === -1) continue;
    37:       const key = line.slice(0, eq).trim();
    38:       const val = parseValue(line.slice(eq + 1));
    39:       if (current.section) {
    40:         if (current.name) {
    41:           out[current.section][current.name][key] = val;
    42:         } else {
    43:           out[current.section][key] = val;
    44:         }
    45:       }
    46:     }
    47:     return out;
    48:   } catch (err) {
    49:     return null;
    50:   }
    51: }
    52: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\compose\parser.ts
============================
============================
     1: import fs from 'fs';
     2: import yaml from 'js-yaml';
     3: import { readFCL } from './fclParser';
     4: 
     5: export type ModuleDef = {
     6:   path?: string;
     7:   port?: number;
     8:   token?: string;
     9:   env?: Record<string,string>;
    10: };
    11: 
    12: export type ComposeFile = {
    13:   modules: Record<string, ModuleDef>;
    14: };
    15: 
    16: export function readCompose(file = 'funesterie.yml'): ComposeFile | null {
    17:   try {
    18:     if (fs.existsSync('funesterie.fcl')) {
    19:       const fcl = readFCL('funesterie.fcl');
    20:       if (fcl && fcl.service) {
    21:         const modules: Record<string, ModuleDef> = {};
    22:         for (const k of Object.keys(fcl.service)) {
    23:           const s = fcl.service[k];
    24:           modules[k] = { path: s.path, port: s.port, token: s.token, env: s.env };
    25:         }
    26:         return { modules };
    27:       }
    28:     }
    29:     if (!fs.existsSync(file)) return null;
    30:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
    31:     const doc = yaml.load(raw) as any;
    32:     if (!doc || !doc.modules) return null;
    33:     return { modules: doc.modules } as ComposeFile;
    34:   } catch (err) {
    35:     return null;
    36:   }
    37: }
    38:

FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\daemon\qflashd.ts
============================
============================
     1: import http from 'http';
     2: import { listRunning, startProcess, stopProcess, stopAll } from '../supervisor';
     3: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
     4: 
     5: const PORT = process.env.QFLASHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLASHD_PORT) : 4500;
     6: 
     7: const server = http.createServer(async (req, res) => {
     8:   res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'application/json');
     9:   if (req.url === '/status') {
    10:     const running = listRunning();
    11:     res.end(JSON.stringify({ running }));
    12:     return;
    13:   }
    14:   if (req.url && req.url.startsWith('/stop')) {
    15:     const name = req.url.split('/')[2];
    16:     if (name) {
    17:       const ok = stopProcess(name);
    18:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ ok }));
    19:       return;
    20:     }
    21:     stopAll();
    22:     res.end(JSON.stringify({ ok: true }));
    23:     return;
    24:   }
    25:   res.statusCode = 404;
    26:   res.end(JSON.stringify({ error: 'not found' }));
    27: });
    28: 
    29: server.listen(PORT, () => logger.success(`qflashd running on http://localhost:${PORT}`));
    30:

FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\index.ts
============================

     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: import { buildPipeline, executePipeline } from "./chain/smartChain";
     3: import { showHelp } from "./cli/help";
     4: import { runCompose } from "./commands/compose";
     5: import { runDoctor } from "./commands/doctor";
     6: 
     7: const argv = process.argv.slice(2);
     8: if (argv.includes("--help") || argv.includes("-h")) {
     9:   showHelp();
    10:   process.exit(0);
    11: }
    12: 
    13: const first = argv[0];
    14: if (first === 'compose') {
    15:   void runCompose(argv.slice(1));
    16:   process.exit(0);
    17: }
    18: if (first === 'doctor') {
    19:   void runDoctor(argv.slice(1));
    20:   process.exit(0);
    21: }
    22: if (first === 'daemon') {
    23:   // start qflashd in-process
    24:   void import('./daemon/qflashd').then((m) => {
    25:     // module starts itself and logs
    26:   }).catch((err) => { console.error('failed to start daemon', err); process.exit(1); });
    27:   process.exit(0);
    28: }
    29: 
    30: const { pipeline, options } = buildPipeline(argv);
    31: 
    32: executePipeline(pipeline, options).catch((err) => {
    33:   console.error("qflash: fatal", err);
    34:   process.exit(1);
    35: });
    36:

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\supervisor\index.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
     2: import { writeFileSync, existsSync, mkdirSync, readFileSync, unlinkSync, createWriteStream } from 'fs';
     3: import { join } from 'path';
     4: import { logger } from '../utils/logger';
     5: 
     6: type ProcRecord = {
     7:   name: string;
     8:   pid: number;
     9:   cmd: string;
    10:   args: string[];
    11:   cwd?: string;
    12:   log?: string;
    13:   detached?: boolean;
    14: };
    15: 
    16: const STATE_DIR = join(process.cwd(), '.qflash');
    17: const LOGS_DIR = join(STATE_DIR, 'logs');
    18: const STATE_FILE = join(STATE_DIR, 'services.json');
    19: let procs: Record<string, ProcRecord> = {};
    20: 
    21: function ensureStateDir() {
    22:   if (!existsSync(STATE_DIR)) mkdirSync(STATE_DIR, { recursive: true });
    23:   if (!existsSync(LOGS_DIR)) mkdirSync(LOGS_DIR, { recursive: true });
    24: }
    25: 
    26: function persist() {
    27:   try {
    28:     ensureStateDir();
    29:     writeFileSync(STATE_FILE, JSON.stringify(procs, null, 2), 'utf8');
    30:   } catch (err) {
    31:     logger.warn(`Failed to persist supervisor state: ${err}`);
    32:   }
    33: }
    34: 
    35: function load() {
    36:   try {
    37:     if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) {
    38:       const raw = readFileSync(STATE_FILE, 'utf8');
    39:       procs = JSON.parse(raw);
    40:     }
    41:   } catch (err) {
    42:     logger.warn(`Failed to load supervisor state: ${err}`);
    43:   }
    44: }
    45: 
    46: load();
    47: 
    48: export function listRunning() {
    49:   return Object.values(procs);
    50: }
    51: 
    52: export function startProcess(name: string, cmd: string, args: string[] = [], opts: any = {}) {
    53:   ensureStateDir();
    54:   logger.info(`supervisor: starting ${name} -> ${cmd} ${args.join(' ')}`);
    55: 
    56:   const logFile = opts.logPath || join(LOGS_DIR, `${name}.log`);
    57:   const outStream = createWriteStream(logFile, { flags: 'a' });
    58: 
    59:   const spawnOpts: any = { cwd: opts.cwd || process.cwd(), shell: true };
    60: 
    61:   // decide stdio based on detached/background
    62:   if (opts.detached) {
    63:     spawnOpts.detached = true;
    64:     // ignore stdin, pipe stdout/stderr to log
    65:     spawnOpts.stdio = ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'];
    66:   } else {
    67:     spawnOpts.stdio = ['ignore', 'pipe', 'pipe'];
    68:   }
    69: 
    70:   const child = spawn(cmd, args, spawnOpts);
    71: 
    72:   if (child.stdout) child.stdout.pipe(outStream);
    73:   if (child.stderr) child.stderr.pipe(outStream);
    74: 
    75:   child.on('error', (err) => logger.error(`supervisor: ${name} process error ${err.message}`));
    76:   child.on('exit', (code) => {
    77:     logger.warn(`supervisor: ${name} exited with ${code}`);
    78:     if (procs[name]) delete procs[name];
    79:     persist();
    80:   });
    81: 
    82:   // if detached, allow process to continue after this parent exits
    83:   if (spawnOpts.detached) {
    84:     try { child.unref(); } catch {}
    85:   }
    86: 
    87:   procs[name] = { name, pid: child.pid || -1, cmd, args, cwd: opts.cwd, log: logFile, detached: !!spawnOpts.detached };
    88:   persist();
    89:   return child;
    90: }
    91: 
    92: export function stopProcess(name: string) {
    93:   const entry = procs[name];
    94:   if (!entry) return false;
    95:   try {
    96:     process.kill(entry.pid, 'SIGTERM');
    97:     try { delete procs[name]; persist(); } catch {}
    98:     return true;
    99:   } catch (err) {
   100:     logger.warn(`supervisor: failed to kill ${name} pid=${entry.pid} (${err})`);
   101:     return false;
   102:   }
   103: }
   104: 
   105: export function stopAll() {
   106:   const names = Object.keys(procs);
   107:   for (const n of names) {
   108:     stopProcess(n);
   109:   }
   110:   try {
   111:     if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) unlinkSync(STATE_FILE);
   112:   } catch {}
   113: }
   114: 
   115: export function clearState() {
   116:   procs = {};
   117:   try { if (existsSync(STATE_FILE)) unlinkSync(STATE_FILE); } catch {}
   118: }
   119:

     3: function assertEqual(a: any, b: any, msg?: string) {
     4:   if (JSON.stringify(a) !== JSON.stringify(b)) throw new Error(msg || `Assertion failed: ${JSON.stringify(a)} !== ${JSON.stringify(b)}`);
     5: }
     6: 
     7: function runTests() {
     8:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start"]);
     9:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["kill","start"]).pipeline, ["kill","detect","config","start"]);
    10:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["purge","start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","purge","start"]);
    11:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["config","start","detect"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start"]);
    12:   assertEqual(buildPipeline(["exodia","start"]).pipeline, ["detect","config","start","exodia"]);
    13:   console.log("SmartChain tests passed");
    14: }

FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\utils\detect.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { exec } from "child_process";
     2: import { logger } from "./logger";
     3: import { SERVICE_MAP } from "./paths";
     4: import { resolvePackagePath } from "./package";
     5: 
     6: export async function detectModules() {
     7:   const out: Record<string, any> = {};
     8:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP))
     9:     out[name] = { running: false, installed: false, path: undefined, bin: undefined };
    10: 
    11:   for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    12:     try {
    13:       const pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(SERVICE_MAP[name].pkg);
    14:       if (pkgPath) {
    15:         out[name].installed = true;
    16:         out[name].path = pkgPath;
    17:         try {
    18:           const pkgJson = require(require('path').join(pkgPath, 'package.json'));
    19:           if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
    20:             out[name].bin = typeof pkgJson.bin === 'string' ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
    21:           }
    22:         } catch {}
    23:       }
    24:     } catch {}
    25:   }
    26: 
    27:   await new Promise<void>((resolve) => {
    28:     exec(process.platform === "win32" ? "tasklist" : "ps aux", (err, stdout) => {
    29:       if (err) {
    30:         logger.warn(`Failed to list processes: ${err.message}`);
    31:         return resolve();
    32:       }
    33:       const s = stdout.toString();
    34:       for (const name of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    35:         const regex = new RegExp(name, "i");
    36:         if (regex.test(s)) {
    37:           out[name].running = true;
    38:         }
    39:       }
    40:       resolve();
    41:     });
    42:   });
    43:   return out;
    44: }
    45: 
    46: export async function findAndKill() {
    47:   const names = Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
    48:   const killed: number[] = [];
    49:   for (const n of names) {
    50:     try {
    51:       if (process.platform === "win32") {
    52:         exec(`taskkill /IM ${n}.exe /F`, (err) => {});
    53:       } else {
    54:         exec(`pkill -f ${n}`, (err) => {});
    55:       }
    56:     } catch (err) {
    57:       // ignore
    58:     }
    59:   }
    60:   return killed;
    61: }
    62: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\utils\exec.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { spawn } from "child_process";
     2: import { logger } from "./logger";
     3: import { unlinkSync, existsSync, rmSync } from "fs";
     4: import { execSync } from "child_process";
     5: 
     6: export function spawnSafe(command: string, args: string[] = [], opts: any = {}) {
     7:   try {
     8:     const proc = spawn(command, args, { stdio: "inherit", shell: true, ...opts });
     9:     proc.on("error", (err) => logger.error(`Process error: ${err.message}`));
    10:     return proc;
    11:   } catch (err: any) {
    12:     logger.error(`Failed to spawn ${command}: ${err.message}`);
    13:     throw err;
    14:   }
    15: }
    16: 
    17: export function rimrafSync(path: string) {
    18:   if (!path) return;
    19:   if (!existsSync(path)) return;
    20:   try {
    21:     rmSync(path, { recursive: true, force: true });
    22:   } catch (err) {
    23:     // fallback
    24:     try {
    25:       unlinkSync(path);
    26:     } catch {}
    27:   }
    28: }
    29: 
    30: export function isPackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
    31:   try {
    32:     execSync(`npm ls ${pkgName} --depth=0`, { stdio: "ignore" });
    33:     return true;
    34:   } catch {
    35:     return false;
    36:   }
    37: }
    38: 
    39: export function ensurePackageInstalled(pkgName: string) {
    40:   if (isPackageInstalled(pkgName)) return true;
    41:   logger.info(`Installing missing package ${pkgName}...`);
    42:   try {
    43:     execSync(`npm install -g ${pkgName}`, { stdio: "inherit" });
    44:     return true;
    45:   } catch (err: any) {
    46:     logger.warn(`Failed to install ${pkgName}: ${err.message}`);
    47:     return false;
    48:   }
    49: }
    50: 
    51: // Helpers for CLI pre-launch checks
    52: export function pathExists(pathStr: string) {
    53:   return !!pathStr && existsSync(pathStr);
    54: }
    55: 
    56: export function rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath?: string) {
    57:   if (!pkgPath) return `Rebuild the package (cd <pkg> && npm install && npm run build && npm install -g .)`;
    58:   return `Rebuild the package:\n  cd ${pkgPath}\n  npm install\n  npm run build\n  npm install -g .`;
    59: }
    60:

FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\utils\health.ts
============================
============================
     1: import http from 'http';
     2: import net from 'net';
     3: import { logger } from './logger';
     4: 
     5: export async function httpProbe(url: string, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
     6:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
     7:     const req = http.get(url, (res) => {
     8:       res.resume();
     9:       resolve(Boolean(res.statusCode && res.statusCode < 400));
    10:     });
    11:     req.on('error', () => resolve(false));
    12:     req.setTimeout(timeout, () => {
    13:       req.destroy();
    14:       resolve(false);
    15:     });
    16:   });
    17: }
    18: 
    19: export async function tcpProbe(host: string, port: number, timeout = 2000): Promise<boolean> {
    20:   return new Promise((resolve) => {
    21:     const s = new net.Socket();
    22:     let done = false;
    23:     s.setTimeout(timeout);
    24:     s.on('connect', () => {
    25:       done = true;
    26:       s.destroy();
    27:       resolve(true);
    28:     });
    29:     s.on('error', () => { if (!done) { done = true; resolve(false); } });
    30:     s.on('timeout', () => { if (!done) { done = true; s.destroy(); resolve(false); } });
    31:     s.connect(port, host);
    32:   });
    33: }
    34: 
    35: export async function waitForService(urlOrHost: string, port?: number, timeout = 5000) {
    36:   const start = Date.now();
    37:   while (Date.now() - start < timeout) {
    38:     let ok = false;
    39:     if (typeof port === 'number') {
    40:       ok = await tcpProbe(urlOrHost, port, 1000);
    41:     } else if (urlOrHost.startsWith('http')) {
    42:       ok = await httpProbe(urlOrHost, 1000);
    43:     }
    44:     if (ok) return true;
    45:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 500));
    46:   }
    47:   return false;
    48: }
    49:

     1: export const logger = {
     2:   info: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[36m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     3:   warn: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[33m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     4:   error: (msg: string) => console.error(`\x1b[31m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     5:   success: (msg: string) => console.log(`\x1b[32m[QFLASH]\x1b[0m ${msg}`),
     6: };
     7:
