FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\utils\package.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { join } from "path";
     2: import { existsSync } from "fs";
     3: import { readFileSync } from "fs";
     4: 
     5: export function resolvePackagePath(pkgName: string) {
     6:   try {
     7:     const resolved = require.resolve(pkgName);
     8:     // walk up to package root
     9:     let dir = resolved;
    10:     while (dir && !existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) {
    11:       const p = require("path").dirname(dir);
    12:       if (p === dir) break;
    13:       dir = p;
    14:     }
    15:     if (existsSync(join(dir, "package.json"))) return dir;
    16:   } catch {}
    17:   // fallback: node_modules path
    18:   const guess = join(process.cwd(), "node_modules", pkgName);
    19:   if (existsSync(join(guess, "package.json"))) return guess;
    20:   return undefined;
    21: }
    22: 
    23: export function readPackageJson(pkgPath: string) {
    24:   try {
    25:     const content = readFileSync(join(pkgPath, "package.json"), "utf8");
    26:     return JSON.parse(content);
    27:   } catch {
    28:     return null;
    29:   }
    30: }
    31: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\utils\paths.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { existsSync } from "fs";
     2: import { join } from "path";
     3: 
     4: // Map service names to npm package names and local folder candidates
     5: export const SERVICE_MAP: Record<string, { pkg: string; candidates: string[] }> = {
     6:   rome: { pkg: "@funeste38/rome", candidates: ["./rome", "./Rome"] },
     7:   nezlephant: { pkg: "@funeste38/nezlephant", candidates: ["./nezlephant", "./Nezlephant"] },
     8:   envaptex: { pkg: "@funeste38/envaptex", candidates: ["./envaptex", "./Envaptex"] },
     9:   freeland: { pkg: "@funeste38/freeland", candidates: ["./freeland", "./Freeland"] },
    10:   bat: { pkg: "@funeste38/bat", candidates: ["./bat", "./BAT"] },
    11: };
    12: 
    13: export function resolvePaths(detected: any = {}) {
    14:   const out: Record<string, string | undefined> = {};
    15:   for (const key of Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP)) {
    16:     if (detected && detected[key] && detected[key].path) {
    17:       out[key] = detected[key].path;
    18:       continue;
    19:     }
    20:     const tries = SERVICE_MAP[key].candidates;
    21:     for (const t of tries) {
    22:       const p = join(process.cwd(), t);
    23:       if (existsSync(p)) {
    24:         out[key] = p;
    25:         break;
    26:       }
    27:     }
    28:   }
    29:   return out;
    30: }
    31: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\qflush\src\utils\tokens.ts
============================
============================
     1: import { randomBytes } from "crypto";
     2: 
     3: export function generateToken(len = 24) {
     4:   return randomBytes(len).toString("hex");
     5: }
     6: 
     7: export function resolveTokens(existing: Record<string, any> = {}) {
     8:   const out: Record<string, string> = {};
     9:   for (const name of ["A-11", "SPYDER", "BAT", "KEYKEY", "NEZLEPHANT"]) {
    10:     out[name] = existing[name] || generateToken(12);
    11:   }
    12:   return out;
    13: }
    14:

     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: const fs = require('fs');
     3: const path = require('path');
     4: const pkgPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', 'package.json');
     5: if (!fs.existsSync(pkgPath)) {
     6:   console.error('package.json not found');
     7:   process.exit(2);
     8: }
     9: const pkg = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(pkgPath, 'utf8'));
    10: const bin = pkg.bin && (typeof pkg.bin === 'string' ? pkg.bin : Object.values(pkg.bin)[0]);
    11: if (!bin) {
    12:   console.error('No bin entry in package.json');
    13:   process.exit(2);
    14: }
    15: const binPath = path.join(__dirname, '..', bin);
    16: if (!fs.existsSync(binPath)) {
    17:   console.error(`CLI entry missing: ${binPath}`);
    18:   console.error('Rparez en reconstruisant le paquet localement:');
    19:   console.error('  cd qflash');
    20:   console.error('  npm install');
    21:   console.error('  npm run build');
    22:   console.error('  npm install -g .');
    23:   process.exit(2);
    24: }
    25: console.log('CLI check OK:', binPath);
    26: process.exit(0);
    27:

FILE: D:\qflush\README-FCL.md
============================
============================
     1: # FCL  Funesterie Config Language
     2: Official Specification  Version 1.0
     3: 
     4: FCL is a human-friendly configuration language designed for orchestrators,
     5: multi-service stacks, automation pipelines and modern application tooling.
     6: 
     7: It is owned and maintained by Funesterie.
     8: 
     9: ### Quick Example
    10: 
    11: @project
    12:   name = my-project
    13:   version = 1.0
    14: 
    15: @service api
    16:   path = apps/api
    17:   start = "pnpm dev"
    18: 
    19: @pipeline dev
    20:   steps = ["api"]
    21: 
    22: ### Syntax Overview
    23: 
    24: - Blocks start with @keyword or @keyword name
    25: - Key-value syntax uses: key = value
    26: - Strings may use "quotes"
    27: - Lists use: [ item1, item2, item3 ]
    28: - Comments: # or //
    29: 
    30: ### Purpose
    31: 
    32: FCL is designed to be:
    33: - Lightweight
    34: - Easy to write
    35: - Easy to parse
    36: - Tool-agnostic
    37: - Human-readable
    38: 
    39: ### License
    40: 
    41: Personal usage is free.  
    42: Commercial usage requires a Funesterie Commercial License.
    43: 
    44: To purchase a commercial license for FCL:
    45: https://cellaurojeff.gumroad.com/l/jxktq
    46: 
    47: See:
    48: - LICENSE-FUNESTERIE.txt
    49: - LICENSE-NON-COMMERCIAL.md
    50: - LICENSE-COMMERCIAL.md
    51: - TRADEMARK.md
    52: 
    53: ### Badge (text)
    54: 
    55: [ FUNESTERIE LICENSED FORMAT ]
    56:        FCL  Official Format
    57: ---------------------------------
    58: This project uses the Funesterie
    59: config language under license.
    60: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\README.md
============================
============================
     1: # qflush  Aperu et guide dveloppeur
     2: 
     3: Rsum rapide
     4: - qflush est l'orchestrateur (CLI + daemon) principal du projet Funesterie. Le coeur se trouve dans `src/` et la sortie build dans `dist/`.
     5: 
     6: Architecture (big picture)
     7: - Entres principales:
     8:   - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts` : serveur HTTP (endpoints admin & NPZ).
     9:   - `src/rome/*` : moteur d'indexation, linker et logique ( rgles, excution d'actions ).
    10:   - `src/commands/*` : implmentation des commandes CLI exposes dans `package.json`.
    11:   - `src/utils/*` : helpers (redis, secrets, fetch, hmac, etc.).
    12: 
    13: - Flux de donnes : le daemon expose des endpoints `/npz/*` pour checksum, rome-index et rome-links ; le moteur Rome parcourt et value des rgles qui dclenchent des actions (ex : `daemon.reload`, `start-service`).
    14: 
    15: Convention de build / pige courant
    16: - TypeScript : `tsconfig.json` doit avoir `rootDir: "src"` et `include: ["src/**/*"]`  cela permet  `tsc` de gnrer `dist/daemon/qflushd.js` (les scripts CI s'attendent  `dist/daemon/*`).
    17: 
    18: Commandes utiles
    19: - Installer dpendances : `npm ci --no-audit --no-fund`
    20: - Builder : `npm run build` (excute `tsc -p .`).
    21: - Lancer le daemon compil : `node dist/daemon/qflushd.js` ou `npm start`.
    22: - Tests : `npm test` (Vitest). En CI/Vitest le bootstrap dmarre automatiquement la version compile du daemon via `vitest.setup.js`.
    23: 
    24: Comportements runtime & variables d'environnement importants
    25: - `QFLUSHD_PORT` : port du daemon (dfaut 4500 ou 43421 selon scripts). Tests/CI attendent parfois `4500`.
    26: - `QFLUSH_ENABLE_REDIS` : contrle l'utilisation de Redis (0 = in-memory fallback).
    27: - `QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT` / `QFLUSH_TELEMETRY` : dsactiver la passerelle copilot/telemetry en runtime.
    28: - `VITEST` : si dfini, `vitest.setup.js` tente de require et dmarrer `dist/daemon/qflushd`.
    29: 
    30: Points d'intgration et tests
    31: - CI (workflow `CI`) : installe deps, compile (`npx tsc`) et dmarre le daemon, puis excute les tests. Les tests d'intgration vrifient les endpoints `/npz/checksum/*` et `/npz/rome-index`.
    32: - Si vous rencontrez des erreurs de type `dist/daemon/qflushd.js missing` : vrifier `tsconfig.json` (rootDir/include) puis `npm run build`.
    33: 
    34: O regarder en priorit
    35: - `src/daemon/qflushd.ts`  comportement du serveur et endpoints.
    36: - `src/rome/`  logique d'indexation et excution d'actions.
    37: - `src/commands/`  exemples d'utilisation du moteur via la CLI.
    38: - `package.json`  scripts exposs (build, test, start, daemon:spawn, etc.).
    39: 
    40: Proposition pour la suite
    41: - Voulez-vous que je :
    42:   1) Nettoie le repo pour retirer `dist/` du commit (si vous prfrez viter d'avoir des artefacts de build dans la PR),
    43:   2) Ajoute des extraits d'exemples d'API pour `/npz/*` dans `docs/quick-start.md`,
    44:   3) Ou merge la PR maintenant et continuer l'amlioration de la documentation ?
    45: 
    46: ---
    47: Pour feedback ou dtails supplmentaires, dites-moi quelle partie vous voulez dvelopper en priorit.
    48: # QFLUSH  Funesterie Orchestrator 
    49: 
    50: QFLUSH est l'orchestrateur local de la Funesterie : un CLI + daemon pour dmarrer, arrter, purger, inspecter et synchroniser des modules et flux de travail dans un workspace. Il fournit des endpoints NPZ pour checksum, index Rome et liens, des utilitaires de build et des scripts d'intgration.
    51: 
    52: Principales capacits
    53: - Orchestration de services (detect  config  start/kill)
    54: - Store NPZ checksum (store/verify/list/clear)
    55: - Intgration Rome (index / liens / SSE)
    56: - CLI ergonomique (`qflush`) et daemon `qflushd`
    57: - Mode dveloppement sans dpendances externes (Redis/Copilot dsactivs par dfaut)
    58: 
    59: Pourquoi utiliser QFLUSH ?
    60: - Dmarrage rapide d'une stack locale sans surprises
    61: - Outils pour tester et valider les artefacts NPZ
    62: - Scripts scuriss pour grer secrets localement (DPAPI sur Windows)
    63: 
    64: Quickstart (rapide)
    65: 1) Copier l'exemple d'env :
    66:    - PowerShell: `Copy-Item .env.example .env; notepad .env`
    67:    - Bash: `cp .env.example .env && ${EDITOR:-nano} .env`
    68: 2) Installer et builder :
    69:    `npm ci --no-audit --no-fund && npm run build`
    70: 3) Lancer les tests :
    71:    `npm test`
    72: 4) Lancer le daemon en dev :
    73:    `qflush daemon` (ou `qflush safe-run --detach daemon`)
    74: 
    75: O aller ensuite
    76: - Voir `docs/quick-start.md` pour plus de dtails.
    77: - Scripts utiles : `scripts/import-env-to-secrets.ps1` (Windows DPAPI), `scripts/set-secrets.ps1`.
    78: 
    79: Si tu veux, je peux :
    80: - enrichir ce README avec des exemples d'API (curl),
    81: - ajouter des badges CI/coverage,
    82: - ou pousser ces changements et ouvrir une PR (`push+pr`).
    83: 
    84: Exemples d'API (endpoints NPZ)
    85: 
    86: - Store checksum
    87: 
    88: ```bash
    89: curl -X POST "http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/store" \
    90:    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    91:    -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc","ttlMs":60000}'
    92: ```
    93: 
    94: - List checksums
    95: 
    96: ```bash
    97: curl "http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/list"
    98: ```
    99: 
   100: - Verify checksum (mismatch returns non-200)
   101: 
   102: ```bash
   103: curl -X POST "http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/verify" \
   104:    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
   105:    -d '{"id":"t1","checksum":"abc"}'
   106: ```
   107: 
   108: - Clear checksums
   109: 
   110: ```bash
   111: curl -X DELETE "http://localhost:4500/npz/checksum/clear"
   112: ```
   113: 
   114: - Fetch Rome index
   115: 
   116: ```bash
   117: curl "http://localhost:4500/npz/rome-index"
   118: ```
   119: 
   120: Notes:
   121: - En local, la variable `QFLUSHD_PORT` peut tre utilise pour changer le port (ex: `QFLUSHD_PORT=43421`).
   122: - Les tests d'intgration supposent que le daemon compil expose ces endpoints (via `dist/daemon/qflushd.js`).
   123: 
   124: ## Optional integration: A-11 (local AI service)
   125: 
   126: FR
   127: -----
   128: qflush peut piloter un serveur IA local nomm "A-11" (ex: backend Node + Ollama). Cette intgration est entirement optionnelle : si A-11 n'est pas install ou activ, qflush l'ignore et continue d'orchestrer les autres services.
   129: 
   130: Exemple de configuration (dans `.qflush/a11.config.json`):
   131: 
   132: ```json
   133: {
   134:   "enabled": true,
   135:   "path": "D:/projects/a11",
   136:   "startCommand": "pwsh -File start-a11-system.ps1",
   137:   "healthUrl": "http://127.0.0.1:3000/health",
   138:   "pidFile": ".qflush/a11.pid"
   139: }
   140: ```
   141: 
   142: Commandes utiles:
   143: - `qflush start a11`  dmarre A-11 si `enabled` et si `startCommand` est dfini.
   144: - `qflush stop a11`  arrte A-11 si un `pidFile` a t cr lors du dmarrage.
   145: - `qflush a11:status`  vrifie le endpoint `healthUrl` ou la prsence du processus.
   146: 
   147: Comportement:
   148: - Si `enabled` = false ou le fichier de config manque, qflush n'essaie pas d'installer ni de lancer A-11.
   149: - En cas d'chec de dmarrage, qflush loggue une erreur et continue les autres modules.
   150: 
   151: EN
   152: -----
   153: qflush can orchestrate an optional local AI service named "A-11" (for example a Node + Ollama backend). This integration is optional: if A-11 is not installed or enabled, qflush will ignore it and continue orchestrating other services.
   154: 
   155: Example configuration (put into `.qflush/a11.config.json`):
   156: 
   157: ```json
   158: {
   159:   "enabled": true,
   160:   "path": "D:/projects/a11",
   161:   "startCommand": "pwsh -File start-a11-system.ps1",
   162:   "healthUrl": "http://127.0.0.1:3000/health",
   163:   "pidFile": ".qflush/a11.pid"
   164: }
   165: ```
   166: 
   167: Useful commands:
   168: - `qflush start a11`  starts A-11 when `enabled` and `startCommand` provided.
   169: - `qflush stop a11`  stops A-11 if a `pidFile` was recorded on start.
   170: - `qflush a11:status`  checks `healthUrl` or process presence.
   171: 
   172: Behavior notes:
   173: - If `enabled` is false or config file is absent, qflush will not try to install or start A-11.
   174: - On start failure qflush logs a clear message and continues with other services.
   175: 
   176: ---
   177:

FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\auto-setup-secrets.sh
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env bash
     2: # Auto-generate and install common secrets for qflush
     3: # Usage: ./scripts/auto-setup-secrets.sh [owner/repo]
     4: 
     5: set -euo pipefail
     6: REPO=${1:-}
     7: if [ -z "$REPO" ]; then
     8:   if git remote get-url github >/dev/null 2>&1; then
     9:     REPO=$(git remote get-url github | sed -E 's#.*/([^/]+/[^/]+)(\.git)?$#\1#')
    10:   else
    11:     REPO=$(git remote get-url origin 2>/dev/null | sed -E 's#.*/([^/]+/[^/]+)(\.git)?$#\1#' || true)
    12:   fi
    13: fi
    14: if [ -z "$REPO" ]; then
    15:   echo "ERROR: cannot detect repo owner/name. Pass as first argument owner/repo" >&2
    16:   exit 2
    17: fi
    18: 
    19: # generate token function
    20: gen_hex() {
    21:   if command -v openssl >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    22:     openssl rand -hex 32
    23:   else
    24:     node -e "console.log(require('crypto').randomBytes(32).toString('hex'))"
    25:   fi
    26: }
    27: 
    28: echo "Repo: $REPO"
    29: 
    30: QFLUSH_TOKEN=$(gen_hex)
    31: echo "Generated QFLUSH_TOKEN: $QFLUSH_TOKEN"
    32: 
    33: # prompt for other values
    34: read -r -p "Provide NPM_TOKEN (leave empty to skip): " NPM_TOKEN
    35: read -r -p "Provide GUMROAD_TOKEN (leave empty to skip): " GUMROAD_TOKEN
    36: read -r -p "Provide GUM_LICENSE_KEY (leave empty to skip): " GUM_LICENSE_KEY
    37: read -r -p "Provide GUMROAD_APP_ID (leave empty to skip): " GUMROAD_APP_ID
    38: read -r -p "Provide GUMROAD_APP_SECRET (leave empty to skip): " GUMROAD_APP_SECRET
    39: read -r -p "Provide VSCE_TOKEN (leave empty to skip): " VSCE_TOKEN
    40: read -r -p "Provide AZURE_CREDENTIALS file path (leave empty to skip): " AZ_JSON_PATH
    41: 
    42: # prepare env for set-secrets script
    43: export REPO
    44: export QFLUSH_TOKEN
    45: export NPM_TOKEN
    46: export GUMROAD_TOKEN
    47: export GUM_LICENSE_KEY
    48: export GUMROAD_APP_ID
    49: export GUMROAD_APP_SECRET
    50: export VSCE_TOKEN
    51: 
    52: # prefer gh if available
    53: if command -v gh >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    54:   echo "Using gh to set secrets on $REPO"
    55:   gh secret set QFLUSH_TOKEN --body "$QFLUSH_TOKEN" --repo "$REPO"
    56:   if [ -n "$NPM_TOKEN" ]; then gh secret set NPM_TOKEN --body "$NPM_TOKEN" --repo "$REPO"; fi
    57:   if [ -n "$GUMROAD_TOKEN" ]; then gh secret set GUMROAD_TOKEN --body "$GUMROAD_TOKEN" --repo "$REPO"; fi
    58:   if [ -n "$GUM_LICENSE_KEY" ]; then gh secret set GUM_LICENSE_KEY --body "$GUM_LICENSE_KEY" --repo "$REPO"; fi
    59:   if [ -n "$GUMROAD_APP_ID" ]; then gh secret set GUMROAD_APP_ID --body "$GUMROAD_APP_ID" --repo "$REPO"; fi
    60:   if [ -n "$GUMROAD_APP_SECRET" ]; then gh secret set GUMROAD_APP_SECRET --body "$GUMROAD_APP_SECRET" --repo "$REPO"; fi
    61:   if [ -n "$VSCE_TOKEN" ]; then gh secret set VSCE_TOKEN --body "$VSCE_TOKEN" --repo "$REPO"; fi
    62:   if [ -n "$AZ_JSON_PATH" ] && [ -f "$AZ_JSON_PATH" ]; then gh secret set AZURE_CREDENTIALS --body "$(cat "$AZ_JSON_PATH")" --repo "$REPO"; fi
    63:   echo "Secrets set via gh for $REPO"
    64: else
    65:   echo "gh CLI not found  writing to .env.local"
    66:   touch .env.local
    67:   grep -v -E '^QFLUSH_TOKEN=' .env.local 2>/dev/null > .env.local.tmp || true
    68:   echo "QFLUSH_TOKEN=$QFLUSH_TOKEN" >> .env.local.tmp
    69:   if [ -n "$NPM_TOKEN" ]; then echo "NPM_TOKEN=$NPM_TOKEN" >> .env.local.tmp; fi
    70:   if [ -n "$GUMROAD_TOKEN" ]; then echo "GUMROAD_TOKEN=$GUMROAD_TOKEN" >> .env.local.tmp; fi
    71:   if [ -n "$GUM_LICENSE_KEY" ]; then echo "GUM_LICENSE_KEY=$GUM_LICENSE_KEY" >> .env.local.tmp; fi
    72:   if [ -n "$GUMROAD_APP_ID" ]; then echo "GUMROAD_APP_ID=$GUMROAD_APP_ID" >> .env.local.tmp; fi
    73:   if [ -n "$GUMROAD_APP_SECRET" ]; then echo "GUMROAD_APP_SECRET=$GUMROAD_APP_SECRET" >> .env.local.tmp; fi
    74:   if [ -n "$VSCE_TOKEN" ]; then echo "VSCE_TOKEN=$VSCE_TOKEN" >> .env.local.tmp; fi
    75:   mv .env.local.tmp .env.local
    76:   echo "Wrote .env.local (not committed)."
    77: fi
    78: 
    79: echo "Done. QFLUSH_TOKEN set. Keep it secret." 
    80: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\cleanup-actions.ps1
============================
============================
     1: # cleanup-actions.ps1
     2: # Cancel in-progress/queued workflow runs and close PRs from a feature branch
     3: Param(
     4:   [string]$Repo = 'jEFFLEZ/qflush',
     5:   [string]$FeatureBranch = 'feat/tools-encoders'
     6: )
     7: 
     8: if (-not $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN) {
     9:   Write-Output 'NO_TOKEN'
    10:   exit 2
    11: }
    12: 
    13: $headers = @{ Authorization = 'Bearer ' + $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN; Accept = 'application/vnd.github+json'; 'User-Agent' = 'cleanup-script' }
    14: 
    15: try {
    16:   Write-Output "Listing workflow runs for repo $Repo..."
    17:   $url = "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/actions/runs?per_page=200"
    18:   $resp = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $url -Headers $headers -Method Get -ErrorAction Stop
    19:   $runs = $resp.workflow_runs
    20:   $toCancel = $runs | Where-Object { $_.status -in @('in_progress','queued') }
    21:   if ($toCancel.Count -eq 0) { Write-Output 'No in_progress/queued runs to cancel.' } else {
    22:     foreach ($r in $toCancel) {
    23:       Write-Output "Cancelling run id=$($r.id) name='$($r.name)' branch=$($r.head_branch)"
    24:       Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/actions/runs/$($r.id)/cancel" -Method Post -Headers $headers -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
    25:     }
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   Write-Output "Checking PRs with head=$Repo.Split('/')[0]:$FeatureBranch..."
    29:   $owner = $Repo.Split('/')[0]
    30:   $prsUrl = "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/pulls?head=$owner`:$FeatureBranch"
    31:   $prs = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $prsUrl -Headers $headers -Method Get -ErrorAction Stop
    32:   if ($prs.Count -eq 0) { Write-Output 'No PRs found for feature branch.' } else {
    33:     foreach ($p in $prs) {
    34:       Write-Output "Closing PR #$($p.number): $($p.title)"
    35:       Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/pulls/$($p.number)" -Method Patch -Headers $headers -Body (@{ state='closed' } | ConvertTo-Json) -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
    36:       # optional: delete remote branch ref
    37:       try {
    38:         Write-Output "Deleting remote ref heads/$FeatureBranch"
    39:         Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "https://api.github.com/repos/$Repo/git/refs/heads/$FeatureBranch" -Method Delete -Headers $headers -ErrorAction Stop
    40:       } catch {
    41:         Write-Output "Failed to delete remote ref (maybe already deleted): $($_.Exception.Message)"
    42:       }
    43:     }
    44:   }
    45: 
    46:   Write-Output 'Done. Summary:'
    47:   $remaining = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $url -Headers $headers -Method Get
    48:   $remaining.workflow_runs | Where-Object { $_.status -in @('in_progress','queued') } | Select-Object id,name,status,head_branch | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 3
    49: 
    50: } catch {
    51:   Write-Error "Error during cleanup: $($_.Exception.Message)"
    52:   if ($_.Exception.Response) {
    53:     try { $txt = $_.Exception.Response.GetResponseStream() | New-Object System.IO.StreamReader | ForEach-Object { $_.ReadToEnd() }; Write-Output $txt } catch {}
    54:   }
    55:   exit 1
    56: }
    57: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\cleanup-qflush.ps1
============================
============================
     1: # Cleanup script to replace remaining `qflush` references with `qflush`
     2: # Usage: run from repo root: powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File .\scripts\cleanup-qflush.ps1
     3: $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'
     4: 
     5: Write-Output "Running cleanup-qflush.ps1"
     6: $root = Get-Location
     7: Write-Output "Repo root: $root"
     8: 
     9: # Files/dirs to ignore (substring match) and file patterns
    10: $ignoreDirs = @('.git','node_modules','.venv','.vscode','dist','out','release','.release')
    11: $ignoreExts = @('\.log$','\.tgz$','\.zip$','\.vsix$','\.png$','\.jpg$','\.jpeg$','\.gif$','\.bin$','\.exe$')
    12: $ignorePattern = (($ignoreDirs | ForEach-Object { [regex]::Escape($_) }) + $ignoreExts) -join '|'
    13: 
    14: # Collect files (exclude ignored dirs and file patterns)
    15: Write-Output "Scanning files..."
    16: $files = Get-ChildItem -Path $root -Recurse -File -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object { $_.FullName -notmatch $ignorePattern }
    17: $changed = 0
    18: $renamed = 0
    19: 
    20: foreach ($f in $files) {
    21:     try {
    22:         $text = Get-Content -Raw -LiteralPath $f.FullName -ErrorAction Stop
    23:     } catch {
    24:         # cannot read file as text (binary or locked), skip
    25:         continue
    26:     }
    27:     if ($null -eq $text -or $text -eq '') { continue }
    28:     try {
    29:         # case-insensitive replacement
    30:         $new = [regex]::Replace($text, 'qflush', 'qflush', 'IgnoreCase')
    31:     } catch {
    32:         # regex failed for this content, skip
    33:         continue
    34:     }
    35:     if ($new -ne $text) {
    36:         try { Set-Content -LiteralPath $f.FullName -Value $new -Encoding UTF8 -ErrorAction Stop } catch { Write-Output "Failed to write file: $($f.FullName) : $_"; continue }
    37:         Write-Output "Patched: $($f.FullName)"
    38:         $changed++
    39:     }
    40: }
    41: 
    42: # rename files/dirs containing qflush (case-insensitive)
    43: Write-Output "Renaming files/dirs containing 'qflush' in name..."
    44: $items = Get-ChildItem -Path $root -Recurse -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | Where-Object { $_.Name -match '(?i)qflush' -and ($_.FullName -notmatch $ignorePattern) } | Sort-Object -Property FullName -Descending
    45: foreach ($it in $items) {
    46:     $old = $it.FullName
    47:     $parent = Split-Path $old -Parent
    48:     $newName = $it.Name -replace '(?i)qflush','qflush'
    49:     $newPath = Join-Path $parent $newName
    50:     if ($old -ieq $newPath) { continue }
    51:     try {
    52:         Rename-Item -LiteralPath $old -NewName $newName -ErrorAction Stop
    53:         Write-Output "Renamed: $old -> $newPath"
    54:         $renamed++
    55:     } catch {
    56:         Write-Output "Failed to rename: $old -> $newPath : $_"
    57:     }
    58: }
    59: 
    60: if ($changed -gt 0 -or $renamed -gt 0) {
    61:     Write-Output "Staging changes and committing..."
    62:     try {
    63:         git add -A
    64:         git commit -m "chore(repo): replace qflush -> qflush and normalize names"
    65:     } catch {
    66:         Write-Output "git commit returned non-zero or nothing to commit: $_"
    67:     }
    68:     # push if upstream configured
    69:     try {
    70:         git rev-parse --abbrev-ref --symbolic-full-name '@{u}' > $null 2>&1
    71:         try { git push } catch { Write-Output 'git push failed, please push manually.' }
    72:     } catch {
    73:         Write-Output 'No upstream configured for current branch; please push manually.'
    74:     }
    75: }
    76: 
    77: Write-Output "Done. Files patched: $changed, renamed: $renamed"
    78: 
    79: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\create-pr.ps1
============================
============================
     1: Param(
     2:   [string]$HeadBranch = 'feat/tools-encoders',
     3:   [string]$BaseBranch = 'main',
     4:   [string]$Title = 'feat(tools): add encoders and css encoder/decoder',
     5:   [string]$Body = 'Add tools: tools/rgba_brotli_oc8.py, tools/css_encode.js, tools/css_decode.js.'
     6: )
     7: 
     8: if (-not $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN) {
     9:   Write-Error 'ACTIONS_TOKEN environment variable not set.'
    10:   exit 2
    11: }
    12: 
    13: $token = $env:ACTIONS_TOKEN
    14: $payload = @{ title = $Title; head = $HeadBranch; base = $BaseBranch; body = $Body } | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6
    15: 
    16: $headers = @{ Authorization = "Bearer $token"; Accept = 'application/vnd.github+json'; 'User-Agent' = 'qflush-bot' }
    17: 
    18: try {
    19:   $resp = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri 'https://api.github.com/repos/jEFFLEZ/qflush/pulls' -Method Post -Headers $headers -Body $payload -ContentType 'application/json' -ErrorAction Stop
    20:   Write-Output "PR created: $($resp.html_url)"
    21: } catch {
    22:   Write-Error "Failed to create PR: $($_.Exception.Message)"
    23:   if ($_.Exception.Response) {
    24:     try { $text = $_.Exception.Response.GetResponseStream() | New-Object System.IO.StreamReader | ForEach-Object { $_.ReadToEnd() }; Write-Output $text } catch {}
    25:   }
    26:   exit 1
    27: }
    28: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\detach.js
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: // Spawn the given command detached and unref it.
     3: const { spawn } = require('child_process');
     4: const args = process.argv.slice(2);
     5: let quiet = false;
     6: if (args[0] === '--quiet' || args.includes('--quiet')) {
     7:   quiet = true;
     8:   // remove the flag
     9:   const idx = args.indexOf('--quiet');
    10:   if (idx >= 0) args.splice(idx, 1);
    11: }
    12: if (args.length === 0) {
    13:   if (!quiet) console.error('Usage: node scripts/detach.js <command> [args...]');
    14:   process.exit(1);
    15: }
    16: const cmd = args[0];
    17: const cmdArgs = args.slice(1);
    18: const child = spawn(cmd, cmdArgs, { detached: true, stdio: 'ignore' });
    19: child.unref();
    20: if (!quiet) console.log(`detached pid=${child.pid}`);
    21: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\fix-install-qflush.ps1
============================
============================
     1: # Fix + (re)install @funeste38/qflush v3.1.2 and create working shims
     2: # Usage: excuter dans un PowerShell lanc en Administrateur depuis la racine du repo
     3: $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'
     4: 
     5: # 0) check admin
     6: $principal = [Security.Principal.WindowsPrincipal][Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity]::GetCurrent()
     7: if (-not $principal.IsInRole([Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole]::Administrator)) {
     8:   Write-Error "Excutez ce script en tant qu'administrateur."
     9:   exit 1
    10: }
    11: 
    12: # 1) variables
    13: $repoRoot = (Get-Location).Path      # utilise rpertoire courant
    14: $pkgName = '@funeste38/qflush'
    15: $githubTag = 'github:jEFFLEZ/qflush#v3.1.2'
    16: $appNpm = Join-Path $env:APPDATA 'npm'
    17: $groot = (& npm root -g).Trim()
    18: 
    19: # 2) cleanup anciens shims / paquets
    20: Write-Output "Removing old global packages and shims (if any)..."
    21: try { npm uninstall -g $pkgName @funeste38/qflush 2>$null } catch {}
    22: Get-ChildItem $appNpm -Filter 'qflush*' -File -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue | ForEach-Object { Remove-Item $_.FullName -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }
    23: 
    24: # 3) if repo present, build & pack
    25: $tgzToInstall = $null
    26: if (Test-Path $repoRoot) {
    27:   Write-Output "Repo found at $repoRoot  building..."
    28:   Push-Location $repoRoot
    29:   try {
    30:     npm ci
    31:     npm run build
    32:     npm pack | Out-Null
    33:     $tgz = Get-ChildItem -Path $repoRoot -Filter '*.tgz' -File | Sort-Object LastWriteTime -Descending | Select-Object -First 1
    34:     if ($tgz) { $tgzToInstall = $tgz.FullName; Write-Output "Packed TGZ: $tgzToInstall" }
    35:   } finally { Pop-Location }
    36: }
    37: 
    38: # 4) install (prefer local tgz if present)
    39: if ($tgzToInstall) {
    40:   Write-Output "Installing from local tgz..."
    41:   npm install -g $tgzToInstall
    42: } else {
    43:   Write-Output "Installing from GitHub tag $githubTag..."
    44:   npm install -g $githubTag
    45: }
    46: 
    47: # 5) determine dist and package.json paths (prefer global package, fallback local repo)
    48: $pkgGlobalDir = Join-Path $groot ('@funeste38\qflush')
    49: $distPath = $null; $pkgJson = $null
    50: if (Test-Path (Join-Path $pkgGlobalDir 'dist\index.js')) {
    51:   $distPath = Join-Path $pkgGlobalDir 'dist\index.js'
    52:   $pkgJson  = Join-Path $pkgGlobalDir 'package.json'
    53:   Write-Output "Using global package dist: $distPath"
    54: } elseif (Test-Path (Join-Path $repoRoot 'dist\index.js')) {
    55:   $distPath = Join-Path $repoRoot 'dist\index.js'
    56:   $pkgJson  = Join-Path $repoRoot 'package.json'
    57:   Write-Output "Using local repo dist: $distPath"
    58: } else {
    59:   Write-Error "Impossible de trouver dist/index.js ni global ni local. Assurez-vous que build a russi."
    60:   exit 2
    61: }
    62: 
    63: # 6) prepare paths for require() inside node -e -> use forward slashes to avoid JS escape issues
    64: $pkgJsonForRequire = ($pkgJson -replace '\\','/')
    65: 
    66: # 7) ensure appNpm exists and is in PATH for session
    67: if (-not (Test-Path $appNpm)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $appNpm | Out-Null }
    68: if ((($env:PATH) -split ';') -notcontains $appNpm) {
    69:   $env:PATH = "$appNpm;$env:PATH"
    70:   Write-Output "Added $appNpm to PATH for this session."
    71: }
    72: 
    73: # 8) write robust shims (cmd + powershell) and wrapper
    74: $cmdPath = Join-Path $appNpm 'qflush.cmd'
    75: $ps1Path = Join-Path $appNpm 'qflush.ps1'
    76: $wrapperPath = Join-Path $appNpm 'qflush-cli.js'
    77: 
    78: # wrapper JS content
    79: $wrapperContent = @'
    80: const fs = require("fs");
    81: const path = require("path");
    82: const { spawn } = require("child_process");
    83: 
    84: function exists(p){ try { return p && fs.existsSync(p); } catch { return false; } }
    85: 
    86: const candidates = [
    87:   path.join(process.env.APPDATA || "", "npm", "node_modules", "@funeste38", "qflush"),
    88:   path.join(__dirname, "node_modules", "@funeste38", "qflush"),
    89:   path.join(process.cwd(), "node_modules", "@funeste38", "qflush"),
    90:   path.join(process.cwd())
    91: ];
    92: 
    93: let pkgDir = null;
    94: for (const c of candidates) {
    95:   if (exists(c)) { pkgDir = c; break; }
    96: }
    97: 
    98: let pkgJsonPath = pkgDir ? path.join(pkgDir, "package.json") : null;
    99: let distPath = pkgDir ? path.join(pkgDir, "dist", "index.js") : null;
   100: if (!pkgJsonPath || !exists(pkgJsonPath)) pkgJsonPath = path.join(process.cwd(), "package.json");
   101: if (!distPath || !exists(distPath)) {
   102:   const localDist = path.join(process.cwd(), "dist", "index.js");
   103:   if (exists(localDist)) distPath = localDist;
   104: }
   105: 
   106: const argv = process.argv.slice(2);
   107: if (argv[0] === "--version" || argv[0] === "-v") {
   108:   try {
   109:     const pkg = require(pkgJsonPath);
   110:     console.log(pkg && pkg.version ? pkg.version : "unknown");
   111:   } catch (e) {
   112:     console.log("unknown");
   113:   }
   114:   process.exit(0);
   115: }
   116: 
   117: if (!distPath || !exists(distPath)) {
   118:   console.error('qflush: dist not found. Run `npm run build` in the repo or install the package globally.');
   119:   process.exit(1);
   120: }
   121: 
   122: const child = spawn(process.execPath, [distPath, ...argv], { stdio: 'inherit' });
   123: child.on('exit', (code) => process.exit(code));
   124: '@
   125: 
   126: Set-Content -Path $wrapperPath -Value $wrapperContent -Encoding UTF8 -Force
   127: 
   128: $cmdContent = @"
   129: @echo off
   130: if "%1"=="--version" goto version
   131: if "%1"=="-v" goto version
   132: node "%APPDATA%\npm\qflush-cli.js" %*
   133: goto end
   134: :version
   135: node "%APPDATA%\npm\qflush-cli.js" --version
   136: :end
   137: "@
   138: 
   139: $ps1Content = @"
   140: param([Parameter(ValueFromRemainingArguments=`$true)] `$args)
   141: `$first = if (`$args.Length -gt 0) { `$args[0] } else { '' }
   142: if (`$first -eq '--version' -or `$first -eq '-v') {
   143:   node `"$env:APPDATA\npm\qflush-cli.js`" --version
   144:   exit 0
   145: }
   146: & node `"$env:APPDATA\npm\qflush-cli.js`" @args
   147: "@
   148: 
   149: Set-Content -Path $cmdPath -Value $cmdContent -Encoding ASCII -Force
   150: Set-Content -Path $ps1Path -Value $ps1Content -Encoding UTF8 -Force
   151: 
   152: Write-Output "Shims written:"
   153: Write-Output " - $cmdPath"
   154: Write-Output " - $ps1Path"
   155: Write-Output " - $wrapperPath"
   156: 
   157: # 9) final checks
   158: Write-Output "`nContents of $appNpm (qflush*):"
   159: Get-ChildItem $appNpm -Filter 'qflush*' -File | Select-Object Name,FullName | Format-Table
   160: 
   161: Write-Output "`nAttempting to run: qflush --version (same session)"
   162: try { qflush --version | Write-Output } catch { Write-Output 'qflush not recognized in this session  rouvrir le shell si ncessaire' }
   163: 
   164: Write-Output "`nIf qflush n'est toujours pas trouv: fermez puis rouvrez PowerShell (Developer PowerShell) et excutez `qflush --version`."
   165: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\import-env-to-secrets.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: Import .env file and store secrets encrypted under %USERPROFILE%\.qflush\secrets.json using DPAPI (Windows)
     3: Usage:
     4:   pwsh -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File .\scripts\import-env-to-secrets.ps1 -EnvPath "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop\.env" [-Quiet]
     5: 
     6: This script detects common secret variable names (NPM_TOKEN, GUMROAD_TOKEN, COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET, REDIS_URL, etc.) and stores only those values encrypted.
     7: #>
     8: param(
     9:   [string]$EnvPath = "$env:USERPROFILE\Desktop\.env",
    10:   [switch]$RestrictFileAcl,
    11:   [switch]$Quiet
    12: )
    13: 
    14: function Log([string]$msg) {
    15:   if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose $msg } else { Write-Host $msg }
    16: }
    17: 
    18: if (-not (Test-Path $EnvPath)) {
    19:   Write-Error "Env file not found: $EnvPath"
    20:   exit 2
    21: }
    22: 
    23: # canonical secret keys we care about
    24: $canonical = @{
    25:   'NPM_TOKEN' = 'NPM_TOKEN'
    26:   'GUMROAD_TOKEN' = 'GUMROAD_TOKEN'
    27:   'QFLUSH_TOKEN' = 'QFLUSH_TOKEN'
    28:   'REDIS_URL' = 'REDIS_URL'
    29:   'COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET' = 'COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET'
    30:   'COPILOT_WEBHOOK_URL' = 'WEBHOOK_URL'
    31:   'COPILOT_BRIDGE_URL' = 'COPILOT_BRIDGE_URL'
    32:   'GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE' = 'GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE'
    33: }
    34: 
    35: function NormalizeKey([string]$k) {
    36:   if (-not $k) { return $null }
    37:   $u = $k.Trim().ToUpper()
    38:   if ($canonical.ContainsKey($u)) { return $canonical[$u] }
    39:   # common heuristics
    40:   if ($u -match '(^|_)NPM(_|$|TOKEN)') { return 'NPM_TOKEN' }
    41:   if ($u -match 'GUMROAD') { return 'GUMROAD_TOKEN' }
    42:   if ($u -match 'COPILOT' -and $u -match 'HMAC|SECRET|KEY') { return 'COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET' }
    43:   if ($u -match 'COPILOT' -and $u -match 'WEBHOOK') { return 'WEBHOOK_URL' }
    44:   if ($u -match 'REDIS') { return 'REDIS_URL' }
    45:   if ($u -match 'QFLUSH' -and $u -match 'TOKEN') { return 'QFLUSH_TOKEN' }
    46:   # if the key contains TOKEN or SECRET, treat as secret
    47:   if ($u -match 'TOKEN|SECRET|KEY|PASSWORD|PASS') { return $u }
    48:   return $null
    49: }
    50: 
    51: # read lines robustly
    52: $all = Get-Content -Path $EnvPath -ErrorAction Stop
    53: $map = @{}
    54: 
    55: foreach ($line in $all) {
    56:   $trim = $line.Trim()
    57:   if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($trim)) { continue }
    58:   if ($trim.StartsWith('#')) { continue }
    59:   # support KEY=VALUE and export KEY=VALUE
    60:   if ($trim -match '^(?:export\s+)?([A-Za-z_][A-Za-z0-9_]*)\s*=\s*(.*)$') {
    61:     $key = $matches[1]
    62:     $val = $matches[2]
    63:     # strip optional surrounding quotes
    64:     if ($val.Length -ge 2 -and (($val.StartsWith('"') -and $val.EndsWith('"')) -or ($val.StartsWith("'") -and $val.EndsWith("'")))) {
    65:       $val = $val.Substring(1, $val.Length-2)
    66:     }
    67:     $canon = NormalizeKey $key
    68:     if (-not $canon) { continue } # skip non-secret vars
    69:     # skip boolean flags and numeric ports
    70:     if ($val -match '^(?:0|1|true|false)$' -or $val -match '^[0-9]+$') { continue }
    71:     try {
    72:       $secure = ConvertTo-SecureString $val -AsPlainText -Force
    73:       $enc = $secure | ConvertFrom-SecureString
    74:       $map[$canon] = $enc
    75:       Log "Queued secret: $canon"
    76:     } catch {
    77:       $err = ($_ | Out-String).Trim()
    78:       if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose ("Failed to encrypt {0}: {1}" -f $key, $err) } else { Write-Warning ("Failed to encrypt {0}: {1}" -f $key, $err) }
    79:     }
    80:   }
    81: }
    82: 
    83: if ($map.Count -eq 0) {
    84:   Log 'No secrets detected in the .env file.'
    85:   exit 0
    86: }
    87: 
    88: $dir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE '.qflush'
    89: if (-not (Test-Path $dir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dir | Out-Null }
    90: $file = Join-Path $dir 'secrets.json'
    91: try {
    92:   $existing = @{}
    93:   if (Test-Path $file) {
    94:     try {
    95:       $raw = Get-Content $file -Raw -ErrorAction Stop
    96:       $parsed = $raw | ConvertFrom-Json -ErrorAction Stop
    97:       if ($parsed -ne $null) {
    98:         foreach ($p in $parsed.PSObject.Properties) { $existing[$p.Name] = $p.Value }
    99:       }
   100:     } catch {
   101:       $existing = @{}
   102:     }
   103:   }
   104: 
   105:   foreach ($k in $map.Keys) { $existing[$k] = $map[$k] }
   106: 
   107:   $outObj = [ordered]@{}
   108:   foreach ($name in $existing.Keys) { $outObj[$name] = $existing[$name] }
   109: 
   110:   $outObj | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 5 | Set-Content -Path $file -Encoding UTF8
   111:   Log "Saved encrypted secrets to $file"
   112:   if ($RestrictFileAcl) {
   113:     try {
   114:       icacls $file /inheritance:r /grant:r "$env:USERNAME:(R,W)" | Out-Null
   115:       Log "Restricted ACL on $file to user $env:USERNAME"
   116:     } catch {
   117:       $err2 = ($_ | Out-String).Trim()
   118:       if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose ("Failed to set ACL: {0}" -f $err2) } else { Write-Warning ("Failed to set ACL: {0}" -f $err2) }
   119:     }
   120:   }
   121: } catch {
   122:   $err3 = ($_ | Out-String).Trim()
   123:   if ($Quiet) { Write-Verbose ("Failed to write secrets file: {0}" -f $err3) } else { Write-Error ("Failed to write secrets file: {0}" -f $err3) }
   124:   exit 3
   125: }
   126: 
   127: Log 'Done.'
   128: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\install-and-publish.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: PowerShell helper to install qflush locally and build + publish the VS Code extension to Azure Marketplace.
     3: Usage (run as Administrator PowerShell) from repo root (D:\qflush):
     4: 
     5: Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned
     6: .\scripts\install-and-publish.ps1
     7: 
     8: The script will:
     9:  - install node deps and build the project
    10:  - install the CLI globally (npm install -g .)
    11:  - build the VS Code extension
    12:  - package the VSIX and publish it to Azure DevOps Marketplace using tfx (prompts for PAT)
    13: 
    14: You will be prompted for a Personal Access Token (PAT). Do not paste it here.
    15: #>
    16: 
    17: function To-UnsecureString([securestring] $s) {
    18:   $bstr = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($s)
    19:   try { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR($bstr) } finally { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::ZeroFreeBSTR($bstr) }
    20: }
    21: 
    22: Write-Host "Installing project dependencies and building..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    23: npm install --no-audit --no-fund
    24: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm install failed"; exit 1 }
    25: 
    26: npm run build
    27: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm run build failed"; exit 1 }
    28: 
    29: Write-Host "Installing qflush CLI globally (requires admin)..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    30: npm install -g .
    31: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm install -g . failed"; exit 1 }
    32: 
    33: Write-Host "Building VS Code extension..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    34: Push-Location extensions/vscode-npz
    35: npm ci --no-audit --no-fund
    36: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "npm ci failed in extension"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    37: 
    38: npm run build
    39: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "Extension build failed"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    40: 
    41: # ensure tfx is installed
    42: Write-Host "Ensuring tfx-cli is installed..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    43: npm install -g tfx-cli@0.7.0
    44: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "Failed to install tfx-cli"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    45: 
    46: # create vsix
    47: Write-Host "Packaging VSIX..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    48: try {
    49:   tfx extension create --manifest-globs vss-extension.json --output-path .. | Write-Host
    50: } catch {
    51:   Write-Warning "tfx extension create returned non-zero but will continue if vsix exists"
    52: }
    53: 
    54: # find vsix
    55: $vsix = Get-ChildItem -Path .. -Filter *.vsix | Sort-Object LastWriteTime -Descending | Select-Object -First 1
    56: if (-not $vsix) { Write-Error "VSIX not found in repo root"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    57: 
    58: Write-Host "VSIX packaged: $($vsix.Name)" -ForegroundColor Green
    59: 
    60: # prompt for PAT
    61: $patSec = Read-Host -AsSecureString "Enter Azure DevOps PAT (will not echo)"
    62: $pat = To-UnsecureString $patSec
    63: 
    64: if (-not $pat) { Write-Error "No PAT provided"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    65: 
    66: # publish
    67: $publisher = 'funesterie'
    68: Write-Host "Publishing $($vsix.Name) to Marketplace as publisher $publisher..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    69: $cmd = "tfx extension publish --manifest-globs vss-extension.json --publisher $publisher --token $pat --service-url https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/"
    70: Write-Host $cmd
    71: Invoke-Expression $cmd
    72: 
    73: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-Error "tfx publish failed"; Pop-Location; exit 1 }
    74: 
    75: Write-Host "Publish command finished. Check Marketplace publisher and pipeline for status." -ForegroundColor Green
    76: 
    77: Pop-Location
    78: # zero the token variable
    79: $pat = $null
    80: [System.GC]::Collect()
    81: [System.GC]::WaitForPendingFinalizers()
    82: Write-Host "Done." -ForegroundColor Green
    83: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\migrate-to-qflush.ps1
============================
============================
     1: param([string]$ProjectPath = '.')
     2: Set-Location $ProjectPath
     3: 
     4: Write-Host "Installing @funeste38/qflush..."
     5: npm install @funeste38/qflush --save
     6: 
     7: Get-ChildItem -Path . -Recurse -Include *.ts,*.js,*.tsx,*.jsx | ForEach-Object {
     8:   (Get-Content $_.FullName) -replace "from '@funeste38/rome'", "from '@funeste38/qflush'" | Set-Content $_.FullName
     9: }
    10: Write-Host "Migration done. Please review and run tests."
    11: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\migrate-to-qflush.sh
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env bash
     2: # Usage: ./migrate-to-qflush.sh /path/to/project
     3: set -e
     4: PROJ=${1:-.}
     5: cd "$PROJ"
     6: 
     7: echo "Installing @funeste38/qflush..."
     8: npm install @funeste38/qflush --save
     9: 
    10: # Replace imports (simple sed replace) - backup first
    11: find . -type f \( -name "*.js" -o -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.jsx" -o -name "*.tsx" \) -print0 | xargs -0 sed -i.bak "s/from '@funeste38\/rome'/from '@funeste38\/qflush'/g"
    12: find . -type f -name "*.bak" -delete
    13: 
    14: echo "Migration done. Please review and run tests."
    15:

FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\open-copilot-cli.ps1

     1: # Open the official GitHub Copilot CLI repository in the default browser
     2: # Usage: .\scripts\open-copilot-cli.ps1
     3: 
     4: $repoUrl = "https://github.com/github/copilot-cli"
     5: try {
     6:   Start-Process -FilePath $repoUrl -ErrorAction Stop | Out-Null
     7: } catch {
     8:   Write-Host "Open this URL in your browser: $repoUrl"
     9: }
    10: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\open-copilot-cli.sh
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env bash
     2: # Open the official GitHub Copilot CLI repository in the default browser
     3: # Usage: ./scripts/open-copilot-cli.sh
     4: 
     5: REPO_URL="https://github.com/github/copilot-cli"
     6: 
     7: if command -v xdg-open >/dev/null 2>&1; then
     8:   xdg-open "$REPO_URL" >/dev/null 2>&1 &
     9:   exit 0
    10: fi
    11: 
    12: if command -v open >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    13:   open "$REPO_URL"
    14:   exit 0
    15: fi
    16: 
    17: # Fallback to echoing the URL
    18: echo "Open this URL in your browser: $REPO_URL"
    19: exit 0
    20: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\prepare-and-run-token-windows.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: PowerShell helper to convert a private key to unencrypted PEM, upload it to GitHub Actions secrets
     3: and run the `get-installation-token.yml` workflow, then download the artifact.
     4: 
     5: Usage (PowerShell):
     6:   .\scripts\prepare-and-run-token-windows.ps1 -KeyPath 'D:\keys\private.pem' -AppId 2326697 -InstallationId 95833021 -Repo 'jEFFLEZ/qflush'
     7: 
     8: Requirements:
     9:  - gh CLI authenticated (gh auth login)
    10:  - ssh-keygen / openssl available in PATH (Git for Windows provides ssh-keygen)
    11:  - The script will fail if the private key is encrypted and cannot be converted without the passphrase.
    12: #>
    13: [CmdletBinding()]
    14: param(
    15:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)] [string] $KeyPath,
    16:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)] [string] $AppId,
    17:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)] [string] $InstallationId,
    18:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$false)] [string] $Repo = 'jEFFLEZ/qflush',
    19:   [switch] $DryRun
    20: )
    21: 
    22: function Write-ErrAndExit($msg){ Write-Error $msg; exit 1 }
    23: 
    24: if (-not (Test-Path $KeyPath)) { Write-ErrAndExit "Key file not found: $KeyPath" }
    25: 
    26: $work = Join-Path -Path (Get-Location) -ChildPath "tmp-pem"
    27: if (Test-Path $work) { Remove-Item -Recurse -Force $work }
    28: New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $work | Out-Null
    29: 
    30: $dest = Join-Path $work 'private-unencrypted.pem'
    31: Copy-Item -Path $KeyPath -Destination $dest -Force
    32: 
    33: # Detect header
    34: $head = ((Get-Content -Raw $dest) -split "\r?\n" | Select-Object -First 2) -join "`n"
    35: Write-Host "Key header: $head"
    36: 
    37: # If OPENSSH header, try conversion using ssh-keygen
    38: if ($head -match 'BEGIN OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY') {
    39:   Write-Host "Converting OpenSSH key to PEM via ssh-keygen..."
    40:   $conv = & ssh-keygen -p -f $dest -m PEM -N "" 2>&1
    41:   if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) {
    42:     Write-Host $conv
    43:     Write-ErrAndExit "ssh-keygen conversion failed or key is encrypted. Convert locally with passphrase or produce an unencrypted PEM."
    44:   }
    45: }
    46: 
    47: # Check for ENCRYPTED marker
    48: $contents = Get-Content -Raw $dest
    49: if ($contents -match 'ENCRYPTED' -or $contents -match 'Proc-Type: 4,ENCRYPTED') {
    50:   Write-ErrAndExit "Private key appears encrypted. You must supply an unencrypted PEM. Use openssl/ssh-keygen locally to decrypt."
    51: }
    52: 
    53: # Validate PEM header
    54: if (-not ($contents -match '-----BEGIN (RSA |)PRIVATE KEY-----')) {
    55:   Write-ErrAndExit "Resulting key does not appear to be a PEM private key. Inspect $dest"
    56: }
    57: 
    58: if ($DryRun) { Write-Host "Dry run: prepared key is at $dest"; exit 0 }
    59: 
    60: # Set secrets via gh
    61: Write-Host "Setting repository secrets (APP_ID, INSTALLATION_ID, PRIVATE_KEY_PEM) for $Repo"
    62: $pk = Get-Content -Raw $dest
    63: # Use gh secret set
    64: gh secret set APP_ID --body $AppId --repo $Repo
    65: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to set APP_ID secret" }
    66: gh secret set INSTALLATION_ID --body $InstallationId --repo $Repo
    67: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to set INSTALLATION_ID secret" }
    68: # PRIVATE_KEY_PEM: ensure newlines preserved
    69: # Use temporary file approach
    70: $tempFile = [System.IO.Path]::GetTempFileName()
    71: Set-Content -Path $tempFile -Value $pk -NoNewline
    72: gh secret set PRIVATE_KEY_PEM --body (Get-Content -Raw $tempFile) --repo $Repo
    73: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to set PRIVATE_KEY_PEM secret" }
    74: Remove-Item $tempFile -Force
    75: 
    76: Write-Host "Secrets set. Triggering workflow..."
    77: $run = gh workflow run get-installation-token.yml --repo $Repo
    78: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to trigger workflow" }
    79: 
    80: # List latest runs and pick one for the workflow
    81: Start-Sleep -Seconds 3
    82: # get most recent run id (databaseId)
    83: $runId = gh run list --workflow="get-installation-token.yml" --repo $Repo --limit 1 --json databaseId --jq '.[0].databaseId' 2>$null
    84: if (-not $runId) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to get run id" }
    85: Write-Host "Triggered run id: $runId"
    86: 
    87: # Poll run status until completed or timeout
    88: $timeoutMinutes = 5
    89: $waitSeconds = 5
    90: $elapsed = 0
    91: $maxSeconds = $timeoutMinutes * 60
    92: while ($elapsed -lt $maxSeconds) {
    93:   $status = gh run view $runId --repo $Repo --json status,conclusion --jq '.status' 2>$null
    94:   if ($status -eq 'completed') { break }
    95:   Start-Sleep -Seconds $waitSeconds
    96:   $elapsed += $waitSeconds
    97: }
    98: 
    99: $status = gh run view $runId --repo $Repo --json status,conclusion --jq '.status' 2>$null
   100: $conclusion = gh run view $runId --repo $Repo --json status,conclusion --jq '.conclusion' 2>$null
   101: Write-Host "Run status: $status conclusion: $conclusion"
   102: 
   103: if ($status -ne 'completed') { Write-ErrAndExit "Run did not complete in time (timeout $timeoutMinutes minutes)" }
   104: if ($conclusion -ne 'success') { Write-ErrAndExit "Run completed but not successful: $conclusion" }
   105: 
   106: # Download artifact to D:\keys
   107: $destDir = 'D:\keys'
   108: if (-not (Test-Path $destDir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $destDir | Out-Null }
   109: Write-Host "Downloading artifact installation-token to $destDir"
   110: # remove existing extracted folder to avoid zip extraction conflicts
   111: $extractedDir = Join-Path $destDir 'installation-token'
   112: if (Test-Path $extractedDir) {
   113:   Write-Host "Removing existing artifact extraction folder $extractedDir"
   114:   Remove-Item -Recurse -Force $extractedDir
   115: }
   116: # remove existing root token file to avoid gh extraction error
   117: $rootTokenPath = Join-Path $destDir 'token.txt'
   118: if (Test-Path $rootTokenPath) {
   119:   Write-Host "Removing existing token file $rootTokenPath to allow artifact extraction"
   120:   Remove-Item -Force $rootTokenPath
   121: }
   122: # remove existing installation-repos.json to avoid gh extraction error
   123: $rootReposPath = Join-Path $destDir 'installation-repos.json'
   124: if (Test-Path $rootReposPath) {
   125:   Write-Host "Removing existing API result file $rootReposPath to allow artifact extraction"
   126:   Remove-Item -Force $rootReposPath
   127: }
   128: 
   129: gh run download $runId --repo $Repo --name installation-token --dir $destDir
   130: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) { Write-ErrAndExit "Failed to download artifact" }
   131: 
   132: # artifact may be extracted into $destDir\\installation-token\\token.txt or token may already exist at $destDir\\token.txt
   133: $artifactTokenPath = Join-Path $extractedDir 'token.txt'
   134: $rootTokenPath = Join-Path $destDir 'token.txt'
   135: if (Test-Path $artifactTokenPath) {
   136:   Copy-Item -Path $artifactTokenPath -Destination $rootTokenPath -Force
   137:   Write-Host "Token saved to $rootTokenPath"
   138: } elseif (Test-Path $rootTokenPath) {
   139:   Write-Host "Token already present at $rootTokenPath"
   140: } else {
   141:   Write-ErrAndExit "Token file not found at $artifactTokenPath or $rootTokenPath"
   142: }
   143: 
   144: # also copy installation-repos.json to D:\\keys if present (either in extractedDir or root)
   145: $artifactReposPath = Join-Path $extractedDir 'installation-repos.json'
   146: $rootReposPath = Join-Path $destDir 'installation-repos.json'
   147: if (Test-Path $artifactReposPath) {
   148:   Copy-Item -Path $artifactReposPath -Destination $rootReposPath -Force
   149:   Write-Host "API result saved to $rootReposPath"
   150: } elseif (Test-Path $rootReposPath) {
   151:   Write-Host "API result already present at $rootReposPath"
   152: } else {
   153:   Write-Host "installation-repos.json not found in artifact."
   154: }
   155: 
   156: Write-Host "Done."
   157: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\run-with-timeout.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: PowerShell wrapper: run a command with a timeout.
     3: Usage:
     4:   pwsh ./scripts/run-with-timeout.ps1 -Cmd "node dist/index.js start" -TimeoutSec 12
     5: Options:
     6:   -Quiet (default)  -> do not write to host
     7:   -Noisy            -> enable console output
     8:   -LogFile <path>   -> append logs to file
     9: #>
    10: param(
    11:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)][string]$Cmd,
    12:   [int]$TimeoutSec = 10,
    13:   [switch]$Noisy,
    14:   [string]$LogFile = ''
    15: )
    16: 
    17: # By default be quiet to avoid spamming UIs (unless -Noisy provided)
    18: $Quiet = -not $Noisy
    19: 
    20: function Log([string]$msg) {
    21:   if ($LogFile -and $LogFile.Trim()) {
    22:     try { Add-Content -Path $LogFile -Value ("$(Get-Date -Format o) ``: ``" + $msg) -Encoding UTF8 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch { }
    23:   }
    24:   if (-not $Quiet) { Write-Host $msg }
    25:   else { Write-Verbose $msg }
    26: }
    27: 
    28: Log "[run-with-timeout] starting command: $Cmd"
    29: $process = Start-Process pwsh -ArgumentList "-NoProfile","-NoLogo","-Command",$Cmd -PassThru -WindowStyle Hidden
    30: 
    31: Start-Sleep -Seconds $TimeoutSec
    32: 
    33: if (-not $process.HasExited) {
    34:     Log "[run-with-timeout] timeout reached ($TimeoutSec s) -> attempting graceful stop (Ctrl+C equivalent)"
    35:     try {
    36:         $null = $process.CloseMainWindow()
    37:     } catch {}
    38:     Start-Sleep -Seconds 1
    39:     if (-not $process.HasExited) {
    40:         Log "[run-with-timeout] still running -> forcing kill"
    41:         try { Stop-Process -Id $process.Id -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } catch {}
    42:     }
    43: }
    44: 
    45: # return exit code if available
    46: if ($process -and $process.HasExited) { exit $process.ExitCode } else { exit 0 }
    47: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\run-with-timeout.sh
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env bash
     2: # Run a command with a timeout (POSIX)
     3: # Usage: ./scripts/run-with-timeout.sh 10 node dist/index.js start
     4: 
     5: if [ $# -lt 2 ]; then
     6:   echo "usage: $0 <timeout-sec> <cmd> [args...]"
     7:   exit 2
     8: fi
     9: TIMEOUT=$1
    10: shift
    11: 
    12: "$@" &
    13: PID=$!
    14: 
    15: (sleep $TIMEOUT; kill -INT $PID >/dev/null 2>&1 || true; sleep 2; kill -TERM $PID >/dev/null 2>&1 || true) &
    16: WATCHER=$!
    17: 
    18: wait $PID 2>/dev/null
    19: EXIT=$?
    20: kill $WATCHER >/dev/null 2>&1 || true
    21: exit $EXIT
    22: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\save-secret-node.js
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: // Small helper to persist secrets encrypted to %USERPROFILE%/.qflush/secrets.json on Windows
     3: // Uses Windows DPAPI via PowerShell ConvertFrom-SecureString. For cross-platform, store plain .env.local (user responsibility).
     4: 
     5: const { execSync } = require('child_process');
     6: const fs = require('fs');
     7: const path = require('path');
     8: 
     9: function saveSecret(key, value) {
    10:   const dir = path.join(process.env.USERPROFILE || process.env.HOME || '.', '.qflush');
    11:   if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    12:   const file = path.join(dir, 'secrets.json');
    13:   // use PowerShell to ConvertFrom-SecureString
    14:   try {
    15:     const cmd = `powershell -NoProfile -Command "$s=(ConvertTo-SecureString '${value.replace(/'/g, "''")}' -AsPlainText -Force); $s | ConvertFrom-SecureString"`;
    16:     const enc = execSync(cmd, { encoding: 'utf8' }).trim();
    17:     let obj = {};
    18:     if (fs.existsSync(file)) obj = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8') || '{}');
    19:     obj[key] = enc;
    20:     fs.writeFileSync(file, JSON.stringify(obj, null, 2), 'utf8');
    21:     console.log(`Saved ${key} to ${file}`);
    22:   } catch (e) {
    23:     console.error('Failed to save secret via PowerShell DPAPI, falling back to .env.local');
    24:     fs.appendFileSync('.env.local', `${key}=${value}\n`, 'utf8');
    25:   }
    26: }
    27: 
    28: if (process.argv.length < 4) {
    29:   console.error('Usage: node scripts/save-secret-node.js KEY VALUE');
    30:   process.exit(2);
    31: }
    32: saveSecret(process.argv[2], process.argv[3]);
    33: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\set-secrets.ps1
============================
============================
     1: param(
     2:   [string]$Repo = '',
     3:   [switch]$PersistLocal,
     4:   [switch]$Quiet,
     5:   [switch]$NoPrompt
     6: )
     7: 
     8: # PowerShell script to set secrets using gh CLI or write to .env.local
     9: # If -PersistLocal is set, secrets are also stored encrypted under $env:USERPROFILE\.qflush\secrets.json
    10: # Usage: .\scripts\set-secrets.ps1 -Repo 'owner/repo' -PersistLocal
    11: 
    12: $VerbosePreference = 'SilentlyContinue'
    13: if (-not $Quiet) { $VerbosePreference = 'Continue' }
    14: 
    15: if (-not $Repo) {
    16:   try { $u = git remote get-url github 2>$null } catch { $u = $null }
    17:   if (-not $u) { try { $u = git remote get-url origin 2>$null } catch { $u = $null } }
    18:   if ($u) { $Repo = ($u -replace '.*?/([^/]+/[^/]+)(\.git)?$','$1') }
    19: }
    20: if (-not $Repo) { Write-Error 'Repo not provided and could not be detected. Provide -Repo owner/repo.'; exit 2 }
    21: 
    22: $secrets = @('NPM_TOKEN','GUMROAD_TOKEN','QFLUSH_TOKEN','REDIS_URL','COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET','WEBHOOK_URL','GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE')
    23: 
    24: $gh = Get-Command gh -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
    25: if ($gh) { $useGh = $true } else { $useGh = $false }
    26: 
    27: # helper: persist encrypted secret locally
    28: function Save-LocalSecret([string]$key, [string]$val) {
    29:   try {
    30:     $dir = Join-Path $env:USERPROFILE '.qflush'
    31:     if (-not (Test-Path $dir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dir | Out-Null }
    32:     $file = Join-Path $dir 'secrets.json'
    33:     $enc = (ConvertTo-SecureString $val -AsPlainText -Force | ConvertFrom-SecureString)
    34:     $obj = @{}
    35:     if (Test-Path $file) {
    36:       try { $obj = Get-Content $file -Raw | ConvertFrom-Json } catch { $obj = @{} }
    37:     }
    38:     $obj.$key = $enc
    39:     $obj | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 5 | Set-Content -Path $file -Encoding UTF8
    40:     Write-Verbose "Saved ${key} to ${file} (encrypted)"
    41:   } catch {
    42:     Write-Warning "Failed to save local secret ${key}: $_"
    43:   }
    44: }
    45: 
    46: foreach ($key in $secrets) {
    47:   # dynamic env var read
    48:   try { $val = [System.Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable($key) } catch { $val = $null }
    49:   if (-not $val) {
    50:     if ($NoPrompt) { Write-Verbose "Skipping ${key} (no prompt)"; continue }
    51:     $val = Read-Host "Provide value for ${key} (leave empty to skip)"
    52:   }
    53:   if (-not $val) { Write-Verbose "Skipping ${key}"; continue }
    54:   if ($useGh) {
    55:     try {
    56:       gh secret set $key --body $val --repo $Repo
    57:       Write-Verbose "Set ${key} as GitHub secret in ${Repo}"
    58:     } catch {
    59:       Write-Warning "gh secret set failed for ${key}: $_ - falling back to local file"
    60:       # fallback to local
    61:       if (-not (Test-Path '.env.local')) { New-Item -ItemType File -Path '.env.local' | Out-Null }
    62:       # remove any existing line for the key
    63:       (Get-Content .env.local) -replace "^${key}=.*$","" | Set-Content .env.local
    64:       Add-Content .env.local "${key}=${val}"
    65:     }
    66:   } else {
    67:     Write-Verbose "gh not available  writing ${key} to .env.local"
    68:     if (-not (Test-Path .env.local)) { New-Item -ItemType File -Path '.env.local' | Out-Null }
    69:     # remove any existing line for the key
    70:     (Get-Content .env.local) -replace "^${key}=.*$","" | Set-Content .env.local
    71:     Add-Content .env.local "${key}=${val}"
    72:   }
    73: 
    74:   if ($PersistLocal) {
    75:     Save-LocalSecret -key $key -val $val
    76:   } else {
    77:     if ($NoPrompt) { Write-Verbose "NoPersist set, skipping Save-LocalSecret for ${key}"; continue }
    78:     # Ask user whether to persist locally
    79:     $yn = Read-Host "Persist ${key} locally encrypted under %USERPROFILE%\\.qflush? (y/N)"
    80:     if ($yn -and $yn.ToLower().StartsWith('y')) {
    81:       Save-LocalSecret -key $key -val $val
    82:     }
    83:   }
    84: }
    85: 
    86: Write-Verbose 'Done.'
    87: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\set-secrets.sh
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env bash
     2: # Set repository secrets using GitHub CLI (gh) or write to local .env.local when gh is not available.
     3: # Usage:
     4: #   export REPO=jEFFLEZ/qflush
     5: #   export NPM_TOKEN=...
     6: #   ./scripts/set-secrets.sh
     7: 
     8: set -euo pipefail
     9: REPO=${REPO:-}
    10: if [ -z "$REPO" ]; then
    11:   # try to detect from git remote (github remote preferred)
    12:   if git remote get-url github >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    13:     REPO=$(git remote get-url github | sed -E 's#.*/([^/]+/[^/]+)(\.git)?$#\1#')
    14:   else
    15:     REPO=$(git remote get-url origin 2>/dev/null | sed -E 's#.*/([^/]+/[^/]+)(\.git)?$#\1#' || true)
    16:   fi
    17: fi
    18: if [ -z "$REPO" ]; then
    19:   echo "ERROR: REPO not set and could not be detected. Set REPO=owner/repo or configure git remote 'github' or 'origin'." >&2
    20:   exit 2
    21: fi
    22: 
    23: SECRETS=(NPM_TOKEN GUMROAD_TOKEN QFLUSH_TOKEN REDIS_URL COPILOT_HMAC_SECRET WEBHOOK_URL GUMROAD_TOKEN_FILE)
    24: 
    25: GH_AVAILABLE=false
    26: if command -v gh >/dev/null 2>&1; then
    27:   GH_AVAILABLE=true
    28: fi
    29: 
    30: for key in "${SECRETS[@]}"; do
    31:   # prefer environment variable
    32:   val=""
    33:   if [ ! -z "${!key:-}" ] 2>/dev/null; then
    34:     val="${!key}"
    35:   else
    36:     # prompt user interactively
    37:     read -r -p "Provide value for $key (empty to skip): " input
    38:     val="$input"
    39:   fi
    40: 
    41:   if [ -z "$val" ]; then
    42:     echo "Skipping $key"
    43:     continue
    44:   fi
    45: 
    46:   if $GH_AVAILABLE; then
    47:     echo "Setting secret $key in GitHub repo $REPO"
    48:     gh secret set "$key" --body "$val" --repo "$REPO"
    49:   else
    50:     echo "gh CLI not available  writing $key to .env.local (ensure this file is in .gitignore)"
    51:     touch .env.local
    52:     # avoid duplicating key
    53:     grep -v -E "^${key}=" .env.local 2>/dev/null > .env.local.tmp || true
    54:     echo "${key}=${val}" >> .env.local.tmp
    55:     mv .env.local.tmp .env.local
    56:   fi
    57: done
    58: 
    59: echo "Done."
    60: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\setup-windows-agent.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: PowerShell helper to download and configure an Azure DevOps self-hosted agent on Windows.
     3: Usage (run as Administrator PowerShell):
     4:   PS> .\setup-windows-agent.ps1 -OrganizationUrl "https://dev.azure.com/funesterie" -Pool "self-hosted" -AgentName "qflush-agent"
     5: 
     6: You will be prompted for a PAT if not provided via -PatSecure.
     7: #>
     8: param(
     9:   [string]$OrganizationUrl = "https://dev.azure.com/funesterie",
    10:   [string]$Pool = "self-hosted",
    11:   [string]$AgentName = "qflush-agent",
    12:   [securestring]$PatSecure = $null,
    13:   [string]$AgentPackageUrl = "https://vstsagentpackage.azureedge.net/agent/2.220.1/vsts-agent-win-x64-2.220.1.zip",
    14:   [string]$InstallDir = "C:\azagent"
    15: )
    16: 
    17: function To-UnsecureString([securestring] $s) {
    18:   $bstr = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($s)
    19:   try { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringBSTR($bstr) } finally { [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::ZeroFreeBSTR($bstr) }
    20: }
    21: 
    22: if (-not $PatSecure) {
    23:   Write-Host "Enter a Personal Access Token (PAT) with 'Marketplace (publish)' and 'Agent Pools (read & manage)' scopes:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    24:   $PatSecure = Read-Host -AsSecureString "PAT"
    25: }
    26: 
    27: $Pat = To-UnsecureString $PatSecure
    28: 
    29: if (-not (Test-Path $InstallDir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $InstallDir | Out-Null }
    30: Push-Location $InstallDir
    31: 
    32: $zip = Join-Path $InstallDir "agent.zip"
    33: Write-Host "Downloading agent package from $AgentPackageUrl ..."
    34: Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $AgentPackageUrl -OutFile $zip -UseBasicParsing
    35: 
    36: Write-Host "Extracting package..."
    37: Expand-Archive -Path $zip -DestinationPath $InstallDir -Force
    38: Remove-Item $zip -Force
    39: 
    40: # Find the agent folder (the zip extracts into the current folder files)
    41: $agentExe = Join-Path $InstallDir 'config.cmd'
    42: if (-not (Test-Path $agentExe)) {
    43:   Write-Host "Could not find config.cmd in $InstallDir. Listing files:" -ForegroundColor Red
    44:   Get-ChildItem -Path $InstallDir -Recurse | Select-Object -First 50 | Format-List
    45:   Pop-Location
    46:   exit 1
    47: }
    48: 
    49: Write-Host "Configuring agent (unattended)..."
    50: $argList = "--unattended --url `"$OrganizationUrl`" --auth pat --token `"$Pat`" --pool `"$Pool`" --agent `"$AgentName`" --acceptTeeEula"
    51: Write-Host ".\config.cmd $argList"
    52: 
    53: # Run config.cmd
    54: & .\config.cmd --unattended --url $OrganizationUrl --auth pat --token $Pat --pool $Pool --agent $AgentName --acceptTeeEula
    55: 
    56: if ($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0) {
    57:   Write-Host "Agent configuration failed (exit $LASTEXITCODE). Check output above." -ForegroundColor Red
    58:   Pop-Location
    59:   exit $LASTEXITCODE
    60: }
    61: 
    62: Write-Host "Agent configured. Test run interactively with: .\run.cmd" -ForegroundColor Green
    63: Write-Host "To install as a service (recommended), follow the Azure DevOps agent pool UI instructions or run the service install script from this folder (if provided)." -ForegroundColor Yellow
    64: 
    65: Pop-Location
    66: Write-Host "Done. Agent should appear in Azure DevOps Agent Pools as online." -ForegroundColor Green
    67: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\scripts\store-secret.ps1
============================
============================
     1: <#
     2: store-secret.ps1
     3: Securely read a token from terminal and store it as a GitHub Actions repository secret using gh CLI.
     4: Requirements:
     5:  - GitHub CLI (`gh`) installed and authenticated (run `gh auth login` first)
     6:  - You must have admin permissions on the target repository
     7: Usage:
     8:   PowerShell> .\scripts\store-secret.ps1 -Repo "owner/repo" -Name "ACTIONS_TOKEN"
     9: 
    10: This script reads the token securely (no echo), writes to a tempfile, calls `gh secret set` with the file
    11: and removes the tempfile immediately.
    12: #>
    13: param(
    14:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
    15:   [string]$Repo,
    16:   [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
    17:   [string]$Name
    18: )
    19: 
    20: if (-not (Get-Command gh -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue)) {
    21:   Write-Error "gh CLI not found. Install and authenticate with 'gh auth login' before running this script."
    22:   exit 2
    23: }
    24: 
    25: try {
    26:   $secure = Read-Host -AsSecureString -Prompt "Paste secret value (input hidden)"
    27:   $plain = [System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::PtrToStringAuto([System.Runtime.InteropServices.Marshal]::SecureStringToBSTR($secure))
    28:   $tmp = Join-Path -Path $env:TEMP -ChildPath ([System.Guid]::NewGuid().ToString() + '.secret')
    29:   Set-Content -Path $tmp -Value $plain -NoNewline -Force
    30:   # Use gh to set the secret from file
    31:   $cmd = "gh secret set $Name --repo $Repo --body-file $tmp"
    32:   Write-Host "Setting secret '$Name' in repo '$Repo'..."
    33:   $res = & gh secret set $Name --repo $Repo --body-file $tmp 2>&1
    34:   Write-Host $res
    35: } finally {
    36:   if (Test-Path $tmp) { Remove-Item -Force $tmp }
    37:   if ($null -ne $plain) { $plain = $null }
    38: }
    39: 
    40: Write-Host "Done. Secret stored (or an error was printed above)."

============================
FILE: D:\qflush\spyder\apps\spyder-core\README.md
============================
============================
     1: SPYDER Core
     2: 
     3: Simple MVP that listens on TCP port 4000 and forwards TYPE=1 packets to a local A-11 bridge at http://localhost:5000/ask. Stores messages in RAM/cache and snapshots to dead memory.
     4: 
     5: Run:
     6: 
     7: - npm install
     8: - npm run start
     9: 


============================

     2:   "root": true,
     3:   "formatter": { "enabled": true },
     4:   "linter": { "enabled": true }
     5: }
     6:

FILE: D:\qflush\spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\admin\server.ts
============================
============================
     1: import http from 'http';
     2: import { Collector } from '../utils/collector';
     3: import { listDecoders } from '../protocol/decoder';
     4: 
     5: export function createAdminServer(port: number, collector: Collector, getState: () => any) {
     6:   const server = http.createServer((req: http.IncomingMessage, res: http.ServerResponse) => {
     7:     if (!req.url) {
     8:       res.writeHead(400);
     9:       res.end('bad request');
    10:       return;
    11:     }
    12: 
    13:     if (req.url === '/metrics') {
    14:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    15:       res.end(JSON.stringify(collector.snapshot()));
    16:       return;
    17:     }
    18: 
    19:     if (req.url === '/memory') {
    20:       const state = getState();
    21:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    22:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ ram: state.ram.records, cache: state.cache.records, dead: state.dead.snapshots }));
    23:       return;
    24:     }
    25: 
    26:     if (req.url === '/graph') {
    27:       const state = getState();
    28:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    29:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ nodes: Array.from(state.web.nodes.entries()), edges: state.web.edges }));
    30:       return;
    31:     }
    32: 
    33:     if (req.url === '/decoders') {
    34:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    35:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ decoders: listDecoders() }));
    36:       return;
    37:     }
    38: 
    39:     if (req.url === '/status') {
    40:       res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
    41:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ ok: true }));
    42:       return;
    43:     }
    44: 
    45:     res.writeHead(404);
    46:     res.end('not found');
    47:   });
    48: 
    49:   server.listen(port, '127.0.0.1');
    50:   return server;
    51: }
    52: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\analyze\score.ts
============================
============================
     1: export interface ScoreContext {
     2:   checksumOk: boolean;
     3:   decodeOk: boolean;
     4:   responseOk: boolean;
     5: }
     6: 
     7: export function computeScore(ctx: ScoreContext): number {
     8:   let s = 0;
     9:   if (ctx.checksumOk) s += 1;
    10:   if (ctx.decodeOk) s += 1;
    11:   if (ctx.responseOk) s += 1;
    12:   return s;
    13: }
    14:

FILE: D:\qflush\spyder\apps\spyder-core\src\cli.ts
============================
============================
     1: #!/usr/bin/env node
     2: import { nlToProlog } from './parser/semantic.js';
     3: import { PrologEngine } from './logic/prologEngine.js';
     4: 
     5: const engine = new PrologEngine();
     6: 
     7: const input = process.argv.slice(2).join(' ');
     8: if (!input) {
     9:   console.log('Usage: spyder-cli "some sentence"');
    10:   process.exit(1);
    11: }
    12: 
    13: const fact = nlToProlog(input);
    14: console.log('Prolog fact:', fact);
    15: engine.assert(fact);
    16: console.log('Query back exists?', engine.query(fact));
    17:

     1: {
     2:   "tcpPort": 4000,

     5:   "checksum": "xor",
     6:   "scoreThreshold": 2,
     7:   "snapshotIntervalMs": 60000,
     8:   "a11Endpoint": "http://127.0.0.1:3000/v1/chat/completions",
     9:   "echoTimeoutMs": 2000,
    10:   "longRequestThresholdMs": 1000,
    11:   "maxRetries": 1,
    12:   "plugins": ["@funeste38/bat"],
    13:   "allowInternet": true,
    14:   "httpProxy": "",
    15:   "languages": ["en","fr","es","zh","ru"]
    16: }
