     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xF73710
     2: 
     3: import { detectModules } from "../utils/detect";
     4: import logger from "../utils/logger";
     5: import { spawnSafe, ensurePackageInstalled, pathExists, rebuildInstructionsFor } from "../utils/exec";
     6: import { resolvePaths, SERVICE_MAP } from "../utils/paths";
     7: import { qflushOptions } from "../chain/smartChain";
     8: import { resolvePackagePath, readPackageJson } from "../utils/package";
     9: import { startProcess } from "../supervisor";
    10: import { waitForService } from "../utils/health";
    11: import { runCustomsCheck, hasBlockingIssues, ModuleDescriptor } from "../utils/npz-customs";
    12: import npz from "../utils/npz";
    13: import { resolveMerged } from "../supervisor/merged-resolver";
    14: import * as fs from 'fs';
    15: import { spawnSync } from 'child_process';
    16: import { startService } from '../services';
    17: 
    18: export async function runStart(opts?: qflushOptions) {
    19:   logger.info("qflush: starting modules...");
    20: 
    21:   // Respect CI/dev flag to disable supervisor starting external services
    22:   const disableSupervisor = process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR === '1' || String(process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR).toLowerCase() === 'true';
    23:   if (disableSupervisor) {
    24:     logger.warn('QFLUSH supervisor disabled via QFLUSH_DISABLE_SUPERVISOR, skipping start of external modules');
    25:     return;
    26:   }
    27: 
    28:   const detected = opts?.detected || (await detectModules());
    29:   const paths = resolvePaths(detected);
    30: 
    31:   const services = opts?.services && opts.services.length ? opts.services : Object.keys(SERVICE_MAP);
    32:   const flags = opts?.flags || {};
    33: 
    34:   const waitForStart = Boolean(flags["wait"] || flags["--wait"] || false);
    35:   const doRestart = Boolean(flags["restart"] || flags["--restart"] || flags["force"] || false);
    36:   const maxRestarts = typeof flags["restartCount"] === "number" ? (flags["restartCount"] as number) : 3;
    37: 
    38:   const procs: Promise<void>[] = [];
    39: 
    40:   async function ensureBuiltIfNeeded(prefixPath: string) {
    41:     try {
    42:       const pathJoin = require('path').join;
    43:       const candidates = [
    44:         prefixPath,
    45:         pathJoin(prefixPath, 'spyder'),
    46:         pathJoin(prefixPath, 'apps', 'spyder-core')
    47:       ];
    48: 
    49:       for (const cand of candidates) {
    50:         const distEntry = require('path').join(cand, 'dist', 'index.js');
    51:         if (fs.existsSync(distEntry)) {
    52:           return true;
    53:         }
    54:       }
    55: 
    56:       // Try to build candidates that have a build script
    57:       for (const cand of candidates) {
    58:         try {
    59:           const pkgJsonPath = require('path').join(cand, 'package.json');
    60:           if (!fs.existsSync(pkgJsonPath)) continue;
    61:           const pj = readPackageJson(cand);
    62:           if (!pj || !pj.scripts || !pj.scripts.build) continue;
    63: 
    64:           logger.info(`Local package at ${cand} missing dist; running build...`);
    65:           const r = spawnSync('npm', ['--prefix', cand, 'run', 'build'], { stdio: 'inherit' });
    66:           if (r.status === 0) {
    67:             const distEntry = require('path').join(cand, 'dist', 'index.js');
    68:             if (fs.existsSync(distEntry)) return true;
    69:           }
    70:         } catch (e) {
    71:           // continue trying other candidates
    72:         }
    73:       }
    74: 
    75:       logger.warn(`No build artifact found under ${prefixPath} or subpackages`);
    76:       return false;
    77:     } catch (e) {
    78:       logger.warn(`ensureBuiltIfNeeded failed: ${e}`);
    79:       return false;
    80:     }
    81:   }
    82: 
    83:   async function startWithCustoms(modName: string) {
    84:     const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[modName]) || paths[modName];
    85:     const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[modName] && SERVICE_MAP[modName].pkg;
    86: 
    87:     const modDesc: ModuleDescriptor = { name: modName, pkg, cwd: p || process.cwd() };
    88: 
    89:     // run customs
    90:     const report = await runCustomsCheck(modDesc);
    91:     if (hasBlockingIssues(report)) {
    92:       logger.warn(`supervisor: ${modName} blocked at customs, not starting.`);
    93:       return;
    94:     }
    95: 
    96:     // if an explicit path is provided, prefer to run it directly
    97:     if (p) {
    98:       try {
    99:         const pkgJson = readPackageJson(p);
   100:         if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
   101:           const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === "string" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
   102:           const binPath = require("path").join(p, binEntry);
   103: 
   104:           // if bin exists and is a JS file, run via node; otherwise try to run directly but fallback to node if not executable
   105:           let runCmd = null as any;
   106:           if (pathExists(binPath) && binPath.endsWith('.js')) {
   107:             runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: p };
   108:           } else if (pathExists(binPath)) {
   109:             // check executable bit on POSIX; on Windows assume runnable
   110:             let isExec = true;
   111:             try {
   112:               if (process.platform !== 'win32') {
   113:                 const st = fs.statSync(binPath);
   114:                 isExec = !!(st.mode & 0o111);
   115:               }
   116:             } catch (e) { isExec = false; }
   117: 
   118:             if (isExec) {
   119:               runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: p };
   120:             } else {
   121:               // fallback: attempt to run with node
   122:               runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: p };
   123:             }
   124:           }
   125: 
   126:           // if no bin but there is a start script, prefer npm --prefix <p> run start
   127:           if (!runCmd && pkgJson && pkgJson.scripts && pkgJson.scripts.start) {
   128:             runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', p, 'run', 'start'], cwd: p };
   129:           }
   130: 
   131:           // If runCmd still not set or dist missing, try common subpackage locations
   132:           if (!runCmd) {
   133:             const subCandidates = ['spyder', 'apps/spyder-core'];
   134:             for (const sub of subCandidates) {
   135:               try {
   136:                 const subPkg = require('path').join(p, sub);
   137:                 const subPkgJsonPath = require('path').join(subPkg, 'package.json');
   138:                 if (fs.existsSync(subPkgJsonPath)) {
   139:                   const subPkgJson = readPackageJson(subPkg);
   140:                   if (subPkgJson && subPkgJson.scripts && subPkgJson.scripts.start) {
   141:                     runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', subPkg, 'run', 'start'], cwd: subPkg };
   142:                     break;
   143:                   }
   144:                 }
   145:               } catch (_) {}
   146:             }
   147:           }
   148: 
   149:           if (runCmd) {
   150:             // if runCmd is npm start with prefix, ensure build exists
   151:             if (runCmd.cmd === 'npm' && runCmd.args.includes('run') && runCmd.args.includes('start')) {
   152:               const ok = await ensureBuiltIfNeeded(p);
   153:               if (!ok) return;
   154:             }
   155: 
   156:             logger.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(" ")}`);
   157:             startProcess(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });
   158:             return;
   159:           }
   160:         }
   161:       } catch (e) {
   162:         logger.warn(`Failed to run local path for ${modName}: ${e}`);
   163:       }
   164:     }
   165: 
   166:     // otherwise, use merged resolver (supervisor + NPZ) as primary
   167:     if (pkg) {
   168:       const resolved = await resolveMerged(pkg, { cwd: p || process.cwd() });
   169:       if (!resolved) {
   170:         logger.warn(`${modName} path and package not found or merged resolver failed to resolve, skipping`);
   171:         return;
   172:       }
   173: 
   174:       if (resolved.gate === 'dlx') {
   175:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
   176:         if (!ok) {
   177:           logger.warn(`${modName} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);
   178:           return;
   179:         }
   180:       }
   181: 
   182:       const runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd as string, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };
   183:       logger.info(`Launching ${modName} -> ${runCmd.cmd} ${runCmd.args.join(" ")}`);
   184:       startProcess(modName, runCmd.cmd, runCmd.args, { cwd: runCmd.cwd });
   185:       return;
   186:     }
   187: 
   188:     logger.warn(`${modName} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
   189:   }
   190: 
   191:   for (const mod of services) {
   192:     const promise = (async () => {
   193:       // If embed mode is enabled, use startService
   194:       const embed = process.env.QFLUSH_EMBED_SERVICES === '1';
   195:       if (embed) {
   196:         try {
   197:           await startService(mod, { flags });
   198:           return;
   199:         } catch (e) {
   200:           logger.warn(`embedded start failed for ${mod}: ${e}`);
   201:           return;
   202:         }
   203:       }
   204: 
   205:       // Use enhanced master flow which handles missing local bins and robust spawn
   206:       const p = (opts?.modulePaths && opts.modulePaths[mod]) || paths[mod];
   207:       const pkg = SERVICE_MAP[mod] && SERVICE_MAP[mod].pkg;
   208: 
   209:       // resolve package path (local node_modules or provided path)
   210:       let pkgPath = p;
   211:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
   212: 
   213:       if (!pkgPath && pkg) {
   214:         const ok = ensurePackageInstalled(pkg);
   215:         if (!ok) {
   216:           logger.warn(`${mod} not found and failed to install ${pkg}, skipping`);
   217:           return;
   218:         }
   219:         pkgPath = resolvePackagePath(pkg);
   220:       }
   221: 
   222:       if (!pkgPath) {
   223:         // fallback to customs+merged-resolver flow
   224:         await startWithCustoms(mod);
   225:         return;
   226:       }
   227: 
   228:       const pkgJson = readPackageJson(pkgPath);
   229: 
   230:       // choose how to run: package bin if present, else merged resolver
   231:       let runCmd: { cmd: string; args: string[]; cwd?: string } | null = null;
   232: 
   233:       // 1) package bin entry
   234:       if (pkgJson && pkgJson.bin) {
   235:         const binEntry = typeof pkgJson.bin === "string" ? pkgJson.bin : Object.values(pkgJson.bin)[0];
   236:         const binPath = require("path").join(pkgPath, binEntry);
   237:         if (binPath.endsWith(".js") && pathExists(binPath)) {
   238:           runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };
   239:         } else if (pathExists(binPath)) {
   240:           let isExec = true;
   241:           try {
   242:             if (process.platform !== 'win32') {
   243:               const st = fs.statSync(binPath);
   244:               isExec = !!(st.mode & 0o111);
   245:             }
   246:           } catch (e) { isExec = false; }
   247:           if (isExec) runCmd = { cmd: binPath, args: [], cwd: pkgPath };
   248:           else runCmd = { cmd: process.execPath, args: [binPath], cwd: pkgPath };
   249:         } else {
   250:           logger.warn(`${mod} bin entry not found at ${binPath}. ${rebuildInstructionsFor(pkgPath)}`);
   251:         }
   252:       }
   253: 
   254:       // 2) package start script
   255:       if (!runCmd && pkgJson && pkgJson.scripts && pkgJson.scripts.start) {
   256:         runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', pkgPath, 'run', 'start'], cwd: pkgPath };
   257:       }
   258: 
   259:       // 3) try common subpackage locations
   260:       if (!runCmd) {
   261:         const subCandidates = ['spyder', 'apps/spyder-core'];
   262:         for (const sub of subCandidates) {
   263:           try {
   264:             const subPkg = require('path').join(pkgPath, sub);
   265:             const subPkgJsonPath = require('path').join(subPkg, 'package.json');
   266:             if (fs.existsSync(subPkgJsonPath)) {
   267:               const subPkgJson = readPackageJson(subPkg);
   268:               if (subPkgJson && subPkgJson.scripts && subPkgJson.scripts.start) {
   269:                 runCmd = { cmd: 'npm', args: ['--prefix', subPkg, 'run', 'start'], cwd: subPkg };
   270:                 break;
   271:               }
   272:             }
   273:           } catch (_) {}
   274:         }
   275:       }
   276: 
   277:       // 4) fallback to merged resolver if still not found
   278:       if (!runCmd && pkg) {
   279:         const resolved = await resolveMerged(pkg, { cwd: pkgPath });
   280:         if (!resolved || resolved.gate === 'fail') {
   281:           logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
   282:           return;
   283:         }
   284:         runCmd = { cmd: resolved.cmd as string, args: resolved.args || [], cwd: resolved.cwd };
   285:       }
   286: 
   287:       if (!runCmd) {
   288:         logger.warn(`${mod} has no runnable entry, skipping`);
   289:         return;
   290:       }
   291: 
   292:       // if runCmd is npm start with prefix, ensure built
   293:       if (runCmd.cmd === 'npm' && runCmd.args.includes('run') && runCmd.args.includes('start')) {
   294:         const prefixIdx = runCmd.args.indexOf('--prefix');
   295:         const prefixPath = prefixIdx !== -1 ? runCmd.args[prefixIdx + 1] : runCmd.cwd || pkgPath;
   296:         const ok = await ensureBuiltIfNeeded(prefixPath as string);
   297:         if (!ok) return;
   298:       }
   299: 
   300:       const restarts = 0;
   301: 
   302:       const spawnOnce = (): Promise<void> => {
   303:         return new Promise((resolve) => {
   304:           logger.info(`Launching ${mod} -> ${runCmd!.cmd} ${runCmd!.args.join(" ")}`);
   305: 
   306:           // use supervisor to manage and persist process
   307:           const child = startProcess(mod, runCmd!.cmd, runCmd!.args, { cwd: runCmd!.cwd });
   308: 
   309:           if (waitForStart) {
   310:             // try to wait for a health endpoint if provided in flags
   311:             const svcUrl = flags["health-url"] || flags["health"];
   312:             const svcPort = flags["health-port"] || undefined;
   313:             if (svcUrl) {
   314:               waitForService(svcUrl as string, svcPort as any).then((ok) => {
   315:                 if (ok) logger.success(`${mod} passed health check`);
   316:                 else logger.warn(`${mod} failed health check`);
   317:                 resolve();
   318:               });
   319:             } else {
   320:               // wait for spawn via PID persistence
   321:               setTimeout(() => {
   322:                 logger.info(`${mod} started (delayed wait).`);
   323:                 resolve();
   324:               }, 2000);
   325:             }
   326:           } else {
   327:             resolve();
   328:           }
   329: 
   330:           // child exit handled by supervisor
   331:         });
   332:       };
   333: 
   334:       // start the first time and optionally wait
   335:       await spawnOnce();
   336: 
   337:       // restart logic handled by supervisor-level events, keep simple here
   338:     })();
   339:     procs.push(promise);
   340:   }
   341: 
   342:   await Promise.all(procs);
   343: 
   344:   logger.success("qflush: start sequence initiated for selected modules");
   345: }
   346: 
   347: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\src\compose\fclParser.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x5D80DC
     2: 
     3: import fs from 'fs';
     4: 
     5: function parseValue(raw: string): any {
     6:   const v = raw.trim();
     7:   if (v.startsWith('[') && v.endsWith(']')) {
     8:     // simple list parser
     9:     const inside = v.slice(1, -1).trim();
    10:     if (!inside) return [];
    11:     return inside.split(',').map(x => x.trim().replace(/^"|"$/g, ''));
    12:   }
    13:   if (/^\d+$/.test(v)) return Number(v);
    14:   return v.replace(/^"|"$/g, '');
    15: }
    16: 
    17: export function readFCL(file = 'funesterie.fcl') {
    18:   try {
    19:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
    20:     const lines = raw.split(/\r?\n/);
    21:     const out: any = { project: {}, env: {}, service: {}, pipeline: {} };
    22:     let current: { section?: string, name?: string } = {};
    23:     for (let line of lines) {
    24:       line = line.trim();
    25:       if (!line || line.startsWith('#') || line.startsWith('//')) continue;
    26:       if (line.startsWith('@')) {
    27:         const parts = line.split(/	|\s+/).filter(Boolean);
    28:         const sec = parts[0].slice(1);
    29:         const name = parts[1] || undefined;
    30:         current = { section: sec, name };
    31:         if (name) {
    32:           if (!out[sec]) out[sec] = {};
    33:           out[sec][name] = out[sec][name] || {};
    34:         }
    35:         continue;
    36:       }
    37:       const eq = line.indexOf('=');
    38:       if (eq === -1) continue;
    39:       const key = line.slice(0, eq).trim();
    40:       const val = parseValue(line.slice(eq + 1));
    41:       if (current.section) {
    42:         if (current.name) {
    43:           out[current.section][current.name][key] = val;
    44:         } else {
    45:           out[current.section][key] = val;
    46:         }
    47:       }
    48:     }
    49:     return out;
    50:   } catch (err) {
    51:     return null;
    52:   }
    53: }
    54: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\src\compose\parser.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x15FDE1
     2: 
     3: import fs from 'fs';
     4: import yaml from 'js-yaml';
     5: import { readFCL } from './fclParser';
     6: 
     7: export type ModuleDef = {
     8:   path?: string;
     9:   port?: number;
    10:   token?: string;
    11:   env?: Record<string,string>;
    12: };
    13: 
    14: export type ComposeFile = {
    15:   modules: Record<string, ModuleDef>;
    16: };
    17: 
    18: export function readCompose(file = 'funesterie.yml'): ComposeFile | null {
    19:   try {
    20:     if (fs.existsSync('funesterie.fcl')) {
    21:       const fcl = readFCL('funesterie.fcl');
    22:       if (fcl && fcl.service) {
    23:         const modules: Record<string, ModuleDef> = {};
    24:         for (const k of Object.keys(fcl.service)) {
    25:           const s = fcl.service[k];
    26:           modules[k] = { path: s.path, port: s.port, token: s.token, env: s.env };
    27:         }
    28:         return { modules };
    29:       }
    30:     }
    31:     if (!fs.existsSync(file)) return null;
    32:     const raw = fs.readFileSync(file, 'utf8');
    33:     const doc = yaml.load(raw) as any;
    34:     if (!doc || !doc.modules) return null;
    35:     return { modules: doc.modules } as ComposeFile;
    36:   } catch (err) {
    37:     return null;
    38:   }
    39: }
    40: 


============================
FILE: D:\qflush\src\daemon\auth-middleware.ts
============================
============================
     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x92EED4
     2: 
     3: import { Request, Response, NextFunction } from 'express';
     4: 
     5: export function requireQflushToken(req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) {
     6:   const token = process.env.QFLUSH_TOKEN || '';
     7:   if (!token) return res.status(401).json({ success: false, error: 'QFLUSH_TOKEN not configured on server' });
     8:   const header = req.headers['x-qflush-token'] as string | undefined;
     9:   if (!header || header !== token) return res.status(403).json({ success: false, error: 'invalid token' });
    10:   return next();
    11: }
    12:

     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x2037A4
     2: 
     3: // Lightweight daemon reload handler
     4: let reloadHandler: (() => void) | null = null;
     5: 
     6: export function setReloadHandler(fn: () => void) {
     7:   reloadHandler = fn;
     8: }
     9: 
    10: export function triggerReload() {
    11:   if (reloadHandler) reloadHandler();
    12: }
    13:

     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xA1EC50
     2: 
     3: import 'dotenv/config';
     4: const express = require('express');
     5: import http from 'http';
     6: import net from 'net';
     7: const fs = require('fs');
     8: const path = require('path');
     9: const { join } = path;
    10: 
    11: // embedded service manager functions for NPZ endpoints
    12: import { enterSleepMode, exitSleepMode, jokerWipe } from '../services';
    13: 
    14: // Optional Redis  create client via helper (returns null when disabled or no URL)
    15: import { createRedisClient } from '../utils/redis';
    16: const redisClient = createRedisClient();
    17: if (!redisClient) {
    18:   console.log('Redis client not created; using in-memory fallback');
    19: }
    20: 
    21: // try to import gumroad helper if present
    22: let gumroad: any = null;
    23: try {
    24:    
    25:   gumroad = require('../utils/gumroad-license');
    26: } catch (e) {
    27:   // ignore if not available
    28: }
    29: 
    30: const PORT = process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT ? Number(process.env.QFLUSHD_PORT) : 4500;
    31: const AUDIT_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush');
    32: const AUDIT_LOG = path.join(AUDIT_DIR, 'license-activations.log');
    33: 
    34: function ensureAuditDir() {
    35:   try {
    36:     if (!fs.existsSync(AUDIT_DIR)) fs.mkdirSync(AUDIT_DIR, { recursive: true });
    37:   } catch (e) {
    38:     // ignore
    39:   }
    40: }
    41: 
    42: function audit(line: any) {
    43:   try {
    44:     ensureAuditDir();
    45:     fs.appendFileSync(AUDIT_LOG, (typeof line === 'string' ? line : JSON.stringify(line)) + '\n', 'utf8');
    46:   } catch (e) {
    47:     // ignore
    48:   }
    49: }
    50: 
    51: const app = express();
    52: app.use(express.json());
    53: 
    54: // auth middleware
    55: import { requireQflushToken } from './auth-middleware';
    56: // daemon control import
    57: import { setReloadHandler } from './daemon-control';
    58: 
    59: // load Rome index from .qflush/rome-index.json (if present)
    60: import { loadRomeIndexFromDisk, getCachedRomeIndex, startRomeIndexAutoRefresh, onRomeIndexUpdated } from '../rome/index-loader';
    61: import { evaluateIndex, computeEngineActionsSafe } from '../rome/engine';
    62: import { loadLogicRules, evaluateAllRules, getRules } from '../rome/logic-loader';
    63: import { executeAction } from '../rome/executor';
    64: import { getEmitter, startIndexWatcher } from '../rome/events';
    65: import { initCopilotBridge as _initCopilotBridge, emitEngineState as _emitEngineState, emitRuleEvent as _emitRuleEvent, emitDiagnostic as _emitDiagnostic, getConfig as _getCopilotConfig } from '../rome/copilot-bridge';
    66: 
    67: // Respect environment to disable copilot bridge at runtime
    68: const DISABLE_COPILOT = process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT === '1' || String(process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT).toLowerCase() === 'true' || process.env.QFLUSH_TELEMETRY === '0';
    69: const ENABLE_COPILOT = !DISABLE_COPILOT;
    70: 
    71: // Provide safe wrappers (no-op when disabled)
    72: const initCopilotBridge: any = ENABLE_COPILOT ? _initCopilotBridge : async () => {};
    73: const emitEngineState: any = ENABLE_COPILOT ? _emitEngineState : () => {};
    74: const emitRuleEvent: any = ENABLE_COPILOT ? _emitRuleEvent : () => {};
    75: const emitDiagnostic: any = ENABLE_COPILOT ? _emitDiagnostic : () => {};
    76: const getCopilotConfig: any = ENABLE_COPILOT ? _getCopilotConfig : () => ({ enabled: false });
    77: 
    78: // linker
    79: import { computeRomeLinksForFiles, computeRomeLinks, mergeAndWrite, readExistingLinks, resolveRomeToken, romeLinksEmitter } from '../rome/linker';
    80: 
    81: // in-memory engine history buffer (fallback)
    82: const engineHistory: any[] = [];
    83: 
    84: // mapping is OFF by default; can be forced on with QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING=1
    85: const FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING = true; // set to true to permanently disable automatic mapping in this build
    86: const ENABLE_MAPPING = !FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING && (process.env.QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING === '1' || String(process.env.QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING).toLowerCase() === 'true');
    87: 
    88: if (FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING) {
    89:   console.log('Rome mapping permanently disabled in this build (FORCE_DISABLE_MAPPING=true)');
    90: } else if (!ENABLE_MAPPING) {
    91:   console.log('Rome mapping is disabled by default. Set QFLUSH_ENABLE_MAPPING=1 to enable automatic mapping and index refresh.');
    92: }
    93: 
    94: // start Rome index auto refresh only when mapping enabled and not running under tests
    95: if (!process.env.VITEST && ENABLE_MAPPING) {
    96:   startRomeIndexAutoRefresh(15 * 1000); // refresh every 15s
    97: }
    98: 
    99: // Evaluate engine at startup and on refresh (guarded) - only when mapping enabled
   100: if (!process.env.VITEST && ENABLE_MAPPING) {
   101:   // call the safe compute function from engine
   102:   computeEngineActionsSafe();
   103: }
   104: 
   105: // listen to rome.index.updated events only when mapping enabled
   106: if (ENABLE_MAPPING) {
   107:   onRomeIndexUpdated(async (payload) => {
   108:     try {
   109:       if (process.env.VITEST) return;
   110:       const { oldIndex, newIndex, changedPaths } = payload;
   111:       console.log('rome.index.updated event, changedPaths=', changedPaths);
   112:       loadLogicRules();
   113: 
   114:       // recompute logic actions
   115:       const idx = getCachedRomeIndex();
   116:       const matches = evaluateAllRules(idx, changedPaths || []);
   117:       if (matches && matches.length) {
   118:         for (const m of matches) {
   119:           for (const act of m.actions) {
   120:             console.log('Executing action for', m.path, act);
   121:             const res = await executeAction(act, { path: m.path });
   122:             console.log('action result', res);
   123:             engineHistory.push({ t: Date.now(), path: m.path, action: act, result: res });
   124:             try { emitRuleEvent({ rule: 'unknown', path: m.path, matchContext: {}, actions: m.actions, result: res }); } catch (e) {}
   125:           }
   126:         }
   127:       }
   128: 
   129:       // incremental recompute of rome-links for changed files
   130:       try {
   131:         const projectRoot = process.cwd();
   132:         const absFiles = (changedPaths || []).map((p: string) => join(projectRoot, p));
   133:         const newLinks = computeRomeLinksForFiles(projectRoot, absFiles);
   134:         mergeAndWrite(projectRoot, newLinks);
   135:         console.log('rome-links: updated for', absFiles.length, 'files');
   136:       } catch (e) {
   137:         console.warn('rome-links incremental update failed', String(e));
   138:       }
   139: 
   140:       if (matches && matches.length) {
   141:         for (const m of matches) {
   142:           for (const act of m.actions) {
   143:             // already handled above
   144:           }
   145:         }
   146:       }
   147:     } catch (e) { console.warn('onRomeIndexUpdated handler failed', String(e)); }
   148:   });
   149: } else {
   150:   // mapping disabled
   151: }
   152: 
   153: // also start index watcher only when mapping enabled
   154: if (!process.env.VITEST && ENABLE_MAPPING) {
   155:   startIndexWatcher(3000);
   156: } else if (!ENABLE_MAPPING) {
   157:   // no-op
   158: }
   159: 
   160: // --- One-time checksum cache ---
   161: // Redis removed: use in-memory Map only
   162: const CHECKSUM_DEFAULT_TTL_MS = Number(process.env.QFLUSH_CHECKSUM_TTL_MS) || 60 * 1000; // 60 seconds default
   163: 
   164: // in-memory fallback store
   165: type ChecksumEntry = { checksum: string; expiresAt: number };
   166: const checksumCache = new Map<string, ChecksumEntry>();
   167: 
   168: // Insert checksum handlers here (before pourparler endpoints)
   169: app.post('/npz/checksum/store', async (req: any, res: any) => {
   170:   const { id, checksum, ttlMs } = req.body || {};
   171:   console.log('/npz/checksum/store called with', req.body);
   172:   if (!id || !checksum) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' });
   173:   const ttl = typeof ttlMs === 'number' && ttlMs > 0 ? ttlMs : CHECKSUM_DEFAULT_TTL_MS;
   174: 
   175:   checksumCache.set(String(id), { checksum: String(checksum), expiresAt: Date.now() + ttl });
   176:   audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_stored_mem', id: String(id) });
   177:   console.log('stored in memory', id);
   178:   return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), ttlMs: ttl, backend: 'memory' });
   179: });
   180: 
   181: app.post('/npz/checksum/verify', async (req: any, res: any) => {
   182:   const { id, checksum } = req.body || {};
   183:   if (!id || !checksum) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing id or checksum' });
   184: 
   185:   const entry = checksumCache.get(String(id));
   186:   if (!entry) return res.status(404).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum not found or expired' });
   187:   if (entry.checksum !== String(checksum)) {
   188:     audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_mismatch_mem', id: String(id), provided: String(checksum), expected: entry.checksum });
   189:     return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'checksum mismatch' });
   190:   }
   191:   // match: remove and return success
   192:   checksumCache.delete(String(id));
   193:   audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_verified_mem', id: String(id) });
   194:   return res.json({ success: true, id: String(id), backend: 'memory' });
   195: });
   196: 
   197: app.get('/npz/checksum/list', async (_req: any, res: any) => {
   198:   const now = Date.now();
   199:   const results: { id: string; expiresInMs: number }[] = [];
   200:   for (const [id, entry] of checksumCache.entries()) {
   201:     results.push({ id, expiresInMs: Math.max(0, entry.expiresAt - now) });
   202:   }
   203:   return res.json({ success: true, count: results.length, items: results, backend: 'memory' });
   204: });
   205: 
   206: // clear checksums: DELETE /npz/checksum/clear
   207: app.delete('/npz/checksum/clear', async (_req: any, res: any) => {
   208:   const cleared = checksumCache.size;
   209:   checksumCache.clear();
   210:   audit({ t: Date.now(), event: 'checksum_cleared_mem', cleared });
   211:   return res.json({ success: true, cleared, backend: 'memory' });
   212: });
   213: 
   214: // expose a simple Rome index HTTP endpoint for admin/clients
   215: app.get('/npz/rome-index', (_req: any, res: any) => {
   216:   try {
   217:     // ensure index is loaded from disk
   218:     const idx = getCachedRomeIndex() || loadRomeIndexFromDisk();
   219:     const all = Object.values(idx || {});
   220:     const q = (_req.query && String(_req.query.type)) || null;
   221:     const items = q ? all.filter((it: any) => it && it.type === q) : all;
   222:     return res.json({ success: true, count: items.length, items });
   223:   } catch (e) {
   224:     return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(e) });
   225:   }
   226: });
   227: 
   228: // new endpoints for rome-links: list and regenerate
   229: app.get('/npz/rome-links', (_req: any, res: any) => {
   230:   try {
   231:     const projectRoot = process.cwd();
   232:     const existing = readExistingLinks(projectRoot);
   233:     return res.json({ success: true, count: existing.length, refs: existing });
   234:   } catch (e) {
   235:     return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(e) });
   236:   }
   237: });
   238: 
   239: app.post('/npz/rome-links/regenerate', async (_req: any, res: any) => {
   240:   try {
   241:     const projectRoot = process.cwd();
   242:     const links = computeRomeLinks(projectRoot);
   243:     mergeAndWrite(projectRoot, links);
   244:     return res.json({ success: true, count: links.length });
   245:   } catch (e) {
   246:     return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(e) });
   247:   }
   248: });
   249: 
   250: // resolve a specific token
   251: app.get('/npz/rome-links/resolve', (_req: any, res: any) => {
   252:   try {
   253:     const projectRoot = process.cwd();
   254:     const from = _req.query && typeof _req.query.from === 'string' ? String(_req.query.from) : '';
   255:     const token = _req.query && typeof _req.query.token === 'string' ? String(_req.query.token) : '';
   256:     if (!token) return res.status(400).json({ success: false, error: 'missing token' });
   257:     const resolved = resolveRomeToken(projectRoot, from, token);
   258:     return res.json({ success: true, path: resolved.path, score: resolved.score });
   259:   } catch (e) {
   260:     return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(e) });
   261:   }
   262: });
   263: 
   264: // Server-Sent Events stream for rome-links updates
   265: app.get('/npz/rome-links/stream', (req: any, res: any) => {
   266:   try {
   267:     // set SSE headers
   268:     res.writeHead(200, {
   269:       Connection: 'keep-alive',
   270:       'Cache-Control': 'no-cache',
   271:       'Content-Type': 'text/event-stream',
   272:       'Access-Control-Allow-Origin': '*',
   273:     });
   274: 
   275:     // send initial data
   276:     const projectRoot = process.cwd();
   277:     const existing = readExistingLinks(projectRoot);
   278:     res.write(`event: initial\ndata: ${JSON.stringify({ refs: existing })}\n\n`);
   279: 
   280:     const handler = (updated: any) => {
   281:       try {
   282:         res.write(`event: updated\ndata: ${JSON.stringify({ refs: updated })}\n\n`);
   283:       } catch (e) {
   284:         // ignore
   285:       }
   286:     };
   287:     romeLinksEmitter.on('updated', handler);
   288: 
   289:     // cleanup on client close
   290:     req.on('close', () => {
   291:       try { romeLinksEmitter.removeListener('updated', handler); } catch (e) {}
   292:     });
   293:   } catch (e) {
   294:     return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(e) });
   295:   }
   296: });
   297: 
   298: // remove duplicated checksum block at end
   299: // NPZ control endpoints for BAT modes (protected)
   300: app.post('/npz/sleep', requireQflushToken, async (_req: any, res: any) => {
   301:   try {
   302:     enterSleepMode();
   303:     return res.json({ success: true, mode: 'sleep' });
   304:   } catch (e) {
   305:     return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(e) });
   306:   }
   307: });
   308: 
   309: app.post('/npz/wake', requireQflushToken, async (_req: any, res: any) => {
   310:   try {
   311:     exitSleepMode();
   312:     return res.json({ success: true, mode: 'normal' });
   313:   } catch (e) {
   314:     return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(e) });
   315:   }
   316: });
   317: 
   318: app.post('/npz/joker-wipe', requireQflushToken, async (_req: any, res: any) => {
   319:   try {
   320:     // jokerWipe will attempt cleanup and then exit the process (skipped in test)
   321:     jokerWipe();
   322:     return res.json({ success: true, mode: 'joker' });
   323:   } catch (e) {
   324:     return res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: String(e) });
   325:   }
   326: });
   327: 
   328: // fallthrough 404 handler (JSON)
   329: app.use((req: any, res: any) => {
   330:   res.status(404).json({ success: false, error: 'not_found', path: req.path });
   331: });
   332: 
   333: // error handler
   334: app.use((err: any, _req: any, res: any, _next: any) => {
   335:   console.error('unhandled error in express:', err && err.stack ? err.stack : String(err));
   336:   res.status(500).json({ success: false, error: 'internal_error', message: String(err) });
   337: });
   338: 
   339: let server: any = null;
   340: let auxServer: any = null;
   341: 
   342: async function startAuxServer() {
   343:   try {
   344:     // quick check: is 4500 already serving? try to connect first and skip if occupied
   345:     const probe = new Promise<boolean>((resolve) => {
   346:       const c = net.createConnection({ port: 4500, host: '127.0.0.1' }, () => {
   347:         try { c.end(); } catch (e) {}
   348:         resolve(true);
   349:       });
   350:       c.on('error', () => resolve(false));
   351:       // fallback timeout
   352:       setTimeout(() => { try { c.destroy(); } catch (e) {} ; resolve(false); }, 250);
   353:     });
   354:     const occupied = await probe;
   355:     if (occupied) {
   356:       console.log('[QFLUSH] auxiliary server port 4500 already in use, skipping auxiliary server');
   357:       return;
   358:     }
   359: 
   360:     auxServer = http.createServer(async (req, res) => {
   361:       try {
   362:         if (req.url && req.url.startsWith('/npz/rome-index')) {
   363:           const idx = getCachedRomeIndex() || loadRomeIndexFromDisk();
   364:           const all = Object.values(idx || {});
   365:           const q = (req.url && req.url.includes('?') && new URL('http://localhost' + req.url).searchParams.get('type')) || null;
   366:           const items = q ? all.filter((it: any) => it && it.type === q) : all;
   367:           const body = JSON.stringify({ success: true, count: items.length, items });
   368:           res.writeHead(200, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   369:           res.end(body);
   370:           return;
   371:         }
   372:       } catch (e) {
   373:         res.writeHead(500, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   374:         res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: String(e) }));
   375:         return;
   376:       }
   377:       res.writeHead(404, { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' });
   378:       res.end(JSON.stringify({ success: false, error: 'not_found', path: req.url }));
   379:     });
   380:     auxServer.on('error', (err: any) => {
   381:       console.warn('auxiliary server error', String(err));
   382:       try { auxServer.close(); } catch (e) {}
   383:       auxServer = null;
   384:     });
   385:     auxServer.listen(4500, () => {
   386:       console.log('[QFLUSH] auxiliary test server on :4500 ready');
   387:     });
   388:   } catch (e) {
   389:     console.warn('failed to start auxiliary server on :4500', String(e));
   390:   }
   391: }
   392: 
   393: function stopAuxServer() {
   394:   try {
   395:     if (auxServer) {
   396:       auxServer.close();
   397:       auxServer = null;
   398:     }
   399:   } catch (e) {
   400:     // ignore
   401:   }
   402: }
   403: export function startServer(port?: number) {
   404:   const p = port || PORT;
   405:   server = app.listen(p, () => {
   406:     console.log(`qflush running on http://localhost:${p}`);
   407:   });
   408:   // start auxiliary test server only when daemon uses port 4500
   409:   try { if (p === 4500) startAuxServer(); } catch (e) {}
   410:   return server;
   411: }
   412: 
   413: export function stopServer() {
   414:   try {
   415:     if (server) {
   416:       server.close();
   417:       server = null;
   418:     }
   419:     try { stopAuxServer(); } catch (e) {}
   420:   } catch (e) {
   421:     // ignore
   422:   }
   423: }
   424: 
   425: // register reload handler to stop/start server (placed after start/stop definitions)
   426: import { setReloadHandler as __setReloadHandler } from './daemon-control';
   427: __setReloadHandler(async () => {
   428:   console.log('daemon reload requested');
   429:   try {
   430:     stopServer();
   431:     await new Promise((r) => setTimeout(r, 200));
   432:     startServer();
   433:     console.log('daemon reloaded');
   434:   } catch (e) {
   435:     console.warn('daemon reload failed', String(e));
   436:   }
   437: });
   438: 
   439: // if the module is run directly, start the server
   440: if (require.main === module) {
   441:   startServer();
   442: }
   443:

FILE: D:\qflush\src\index.ts

     1: // ROME-TAG: 0x2A0018
     2: 
     3: // Register global error handlers early to avoid the CLI crashing on unhandled errors (redis, etc.)
     4: process.on('unhandledRejection', (reason) => {
     5:   try { console.warn('Unhandled Rejection:', reason && (reason as any).stack ? (reason as any).stack : String(reason)); } catch { /* ignore */ }
     6: });
     7: process.on('uncaughtException', (err) => {
     8:   try { console.error('Uncaught Exception:', err && (err as any).stack ? (err as any).stack : String(err)); } catch { /* ignore */ }
     9: });
    10: 
    11: // Early exit for version/about flags to avoid importing modules with side-effects.
    12: const _argv = process.argv.slice(2);
    13: if (_argv.includes('--version') || _argv.includes('-v')) {
    14:   try {
    15:     // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
    16:     const pkg = require('../package.json');
    17:     if (pkg && pkg.version) console.log(pkg.version);
    18:     else console.log('unknown');
    19:   } catch (e) { console.log('unknown'); }
    20:   process.exit(0);
    21: }
    22: if (_argv.includes('--about') || _argv.includes('-a')) {
    23:   try {
    24:     const pkg = require('../package.json');
    25:     console.log(`${pkg.name} - ${pkg.description}\nversion ${pkg.version}`);
    26:   } catch (e) { console.log('qflush - Funesterie orchestrator'); }
    27:   process.exit(0);
    28: }
    29: if (_argv.includes('--upgrade')) {
    30:   // simple upgrade helper: attempt to npm install -g the same package name
    31:   console.log('Attempting upgrade...');
    32:   const { spawnSync } = require('child_process');
    33:   const res = spawnSync('npm', ['install', '-g', '@funeste38/qflush@latest'], { stdio: 'inherit' });
    34:   process.exit(res.status ?? 0);
    35: }
    36: 
    37: import { buildPipeline, executePipeline } from "./chain/smartChain";
    38: import { showHelp } from "./cli/help";
    39: import { runCompose } from "./commands/compose";
    40: import { runDoctor } from "./commands/doctor";
    41: import runNpzInspect from "./commands/npz-inspect";
    42: import runNpzScores from "./commands/npz-scores";
    43: import { runLicense } from "./commands/license";
    44: import runChecksum from "./commands/checksum";
    45: import runEngine from "./commands/engine";
    46: import runLogic from "./commands/logic";
    47: import runCopilot from "./commands/copilot";
    48: import runCopilotBridge from "./commands/copilot-bridge";
    49: import runRomeLinks from "./commands/rome-links";
    50: import runA11 from "./commands/a11";
    51: import runSpyder from "./commands/spyder";
    52: import { spawn } from 'child_process';
    53: import { enterSleepMode, exitSleepMode, jokerWipe } from './services';
    54: 
    55: // Only run the CLI dispatch when this module is the entrypoint
    56: declare const require: any;
    57: if (typeof require !== 'undefined' && require.main === module) {
    58:   const argv = process.argv.slice(2);
    59:   if (argv.includes("--help") || argv.includes("-h")) {
    60:     showHelp();
    61:     process.exit(0);
    62:   }
    63: 
    64:   const first = argv[0];
    65:   // CLI aliases for embedded BAT modes
    66:   if (first === 'bat:sleep') {
    67:     try {
    68:       enterSleepMode();
    69:       console.log('BAT: sleep mode engaged');
    70:       process.exit(0);
    71:     } catch (e) {
    72:       console.error('failed to enter sleep mode', e);
    73:       process.exit(1);
    74:     }
    75:   }
    76:   if (first === 'bat:wake') {
    77:     try {
    78:       exitSleepMode();
    79:       console.log('BAT: exited sleep mode');
    80:       process.exit(0);
    81:     } catch (e) {
    82:       console.error('failed to exit sleep mode', e);
    83:       process.exit(1);
    84:     }
    85:   }
    86:   if (first === 'bat:joker') {
    87:     try {
    88:       // call and return; jokerWipe may exit process
    89:       jokerWipe();
    90:       // give it a moment
    91:       setTimeout(() => process.exit(0), 1000);
    92:     } catch (e) {
    93:       console.error('failed to perform joker wipe', e);
    94:       process.exit(1);
    95:     }
    96:   }
    97: 
    98:   if (first === "compose") {
    99:     void runCompose(argv.slice(1));
   100:     process.exit(0);
   101:   }
   102:   if (first === "doctor") {
   103:     void runDoctor(argv.slice(1));
   104:     process.exit(0);
   105:   }
   106:   if (first === "daemon") {
   107:     // Default to detached mode to avoid launching heavy in-process work (opens files, scanners).
   108:     // Pass `--no-detach` to run in-process explicitly.
   109:     const detached = argv.includes('--detached') || !argv.includes('--no-detach');
   110:     if (!argv.includes('--detached') && !argv.includes('--no-detach')) {
   111:       console.log('qflush: starting daemon in detached mode by default (use --no-detach to run in-process)');
   112:     }
   113:     if (detached) {
   114:       try {
   115:         // attempt to use @funeste38/bat to spawn detached
   116:         // eslint-disable-next-line @typescript-eslint/no-var-requires
   117:         const bat = require('@funeste38/bat');
   118:         if (bat && typeof bat.spawn === 'function') {
   119:           bat.spawn('qflushd', process.execPath, ['dist/daemon/qflushd.js']);
   120:           console.log('qflushd spawned detached via bat');
   121:           process.exit(0);
   122:         }
   123:       } catch (e) {
   124:         // fallback to detached child process
   125:         try {
   126:           const child = spawn(process.execPath, ['dist/daemon/qflushd.js'], { detached: true, stdio: 'ignore' });
   127:           child.unref();
   128:           console.log('qflushd spawned detached (fallback)');
   129:           process.exit(0);
   130:         } catch (err) {
   131:           console.error('failed to spawn detached daemon', err);
   132:           process.exit(1);
   133:         }
   134:       }
   135:     }
   136:     // start qflushd in-process
   137:     void import("./daemon/qflushd.js").then(() => {
   138:       // module starts itself and logs
   139:     }).catch((err) => {
   140:       console.error("failed to start daemon", err);
   141:       process.exit(1);
   142:     });
   143:     process.exit(0);
   144:   }
   145: 
   146:   if (first === 'a11' || first === 'a11:status') {
   147:     (async () => {
   148:       const code = await runA11(argv.slice(1));
   149:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   150:     })();
   151:   }
   152: 
   153:   if (first === 'spyder' || first === 'spyder:status' || first === 'spyder:mem') {
   154:     (async () => {
   155:       const code = await runSpyder(argv.slice(1));
   156:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   157:     })();
   158:   }
   159: 
   160:   if (first === 'engine' ) {
   161:     (async () => {
   162:       const code = await runEngine(argv.slice(1));
   163:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   164:     })();
   165:   }
   166: 
   167:   if (first === 'logic' ) {
   168:     (async () => {
   169:       const code = await runLogic(argv.slice(1));
   170:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   171:     })();
   172:   }
   173: 
   174:   if (first === 'copilot' ) {
   175:     (async () => {
   176:       const code = await runCopilot(argv.slice(1));
   177:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   178:     })();
   179:   }
   180: 
   181:   if (first === 'copilot-bridge' ) {
   182:     (async () => {
   183:       const code = await runCopilotBridge(argv.slice(1));
   184:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   185:     })();
   186:   }
   187: 
   188:   if (first === 'license' || (first === 'lic' && argv[1] === 'activate')) {
   189:     (async () => {
   190:       const code = await runLicense(argv.slice(1));
   191:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   192:     })();
   193:   }
   194: 
   195:   if (first === 'checksum' && argv[1]) {
   196:     (async () => {
   197:       const code = await runChecksum(argv.slice(1));
   198:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   199:     })();
   200:   }
   201: 
   202:   if (first === 'rome:links' || (first === 'rome' && argv[1] === 'links')) {
   203:     (async () => {
   204:       const code = await runRomeLinks(argv.slice(1));
   205:       process.exit(code ?? 0);
   206:     })();
   207:   }
   208: 
   209:   // NPZ inspect command: `qflush npz:inspect <id>` or `qflush npz inspect <id>`
   210:   if (first === "npz:inspect" || (first === "npz" && argv[1] === "inspect")) {
   211:     const id = first === "npz:inspect" ? argv[1] : argv[2];
   212:     if (!id) {
   213:       console.error("usage: qflush npz:inspect <npz_id>");
   214:       process.exit(1);
   215:     }
   216:     // run and exit with returned code
   217:     (async () => {
   218:       try {
   219:         const code = await runNpzInspect(id);
   220:         process.exit(code ?? 0);
   221:       } catch (err) {
   222:         console.error("npz inspect failed", err);
   223:         process.exit(1);
   224:       }
   225:     })();
   226:   }
   227: 
   228:   if (first === "npz:scores" || (first === "npz" && argv[1] === "scores")) {
   229:     (async () => {
   230:       try {
   231:         const args = first === "npz:scores" ? argv.slice(1) : argv.slice(2);
   232:         const code = await runNpzScores(args);
   233:         process.exit(code ?? 0);
   234:       } catch (err) {
   235:         console.error("npz scores failed", err);
   236:         process.exit(1);
   237:       }
   238:     })();
   239:   }
   240: 
   241:   if (first === "npz:scores:reset" || (first === "npz" && argv[1] === "scores:reset")) {
   242:     (async () => {
   243:       try {
   244:         const code = await runNpzScores(["--reset"]);
   245:         process.exit(code ?? 0);
   246:       } catch (err) {
   247:         console.error("npz scores reset failed", err);
   248:         process.exit(1);
   249:       }
   250:     })();
   251:   }
   252: 
   253:   const { pipeline, options } = buildPipeline(argv);
   254: 
   255:   executePipeline(pipeline, options).catch((err) => {
   256:     console.error("qflush: fatal", err);
   257:     process.exit(1);
   258:   });
   259: }
   260:

FILE: D:\qflush\src\rome\copilot-bridge.ts
============================

     1: // ROME-TAG: 0xF2B208
     2: 
     3: import * as fs from 'fs';
     4: import * as path from 'path';
     5: import crypto from 'crypto';
     6: import fetch from 'node-fetch';
     7: import { EventEmitter } from 'events';
     8: import { CopilotConfig, TelemetryEvent, EngineState, RuleEvent, Diagnostic } from './copilot-types';
     9: import { saveTelemetryEvent } from './storage';
    10: 
    11: const DEFAULT_CONFIG: CopilotConfig = {
    12:   enabled: false,
    13:   telemetryVersion: 1,
    14:   transports: ['file'],
    15:   filePath: '.qflush/telemetry.json',
    16:   allowedData: ['engineState','ruleEvent','diagnostic','contextSnapshot'],
    17:   samplingRate: 1.0,
    18:   maxPayloadSize: 200000
    19: };
    20: 
    21: let cfg: CopilotConfig = DEFAULT_CONFIG;
    22: const emitter = new EventEmitter();
    23: 
    24: // Respect environment flags to forcibly disable Copilot/telemetry
    25: const ENV_DISABLE_COPILOT =
    26:   process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT === '1' ||
    27:   String(process.env.QFLUSH_DISABLE_COPILOT).toLowerCase() === 'true' ||
    28:   process.env.QFLUSH_TELEMETRY === '0';
    29: 
    30: function loadCfg() {
    31:   try {
    32:     const p = path.join(process.cwd(), '.qflush', 'copilot.json');
    33:     if (fs.existsSync(p)) {
    34:       const raw = fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8');
    35:       cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG, JSON.parse(raw));
    36:     } else {
    37:       cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG);
    38:     }
    39:   } catch (e) {
    40:     cfg = Object.assign({}, DEFAULT_CONFIG);
    41:   }
    42: 
    43:   if (ENV_DISABLE_COPILOT) {
    44:     cfg.enabled = false;
    45:   }
    46: }
    47: 
    48: function signPayload(payload: string): string | null {
    49:   try {
    50:     if (!cfg.hmacSecretEnv) return null;
    51:     const secret = process.env[cfg.hmacSecretEnv || ''];
    52:     if (!secret) return null;
    53:     const h = crypto.createHmac('sha256', secret).update(payload).digest('hex');
    54:     return h;
    55:   } catch (e) { return null; }
    56: }
    57: 
    58: async function sendWebhook(event: TelemetryEvent) {
    59:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
    60:   if (!cfg.webhookUrl) return;
    61:   try {
    62:     const payload = JSON.stringify(event);
    63:     const headers: any = { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' };
    64:     const sig = signPayload(payload);
    65:     if (sig) headers['X-Copilot-Signature'] = `sha256=${sig}`;
    66:     await fetch(cfg.webhookUrl, { method: 'POST', body: payload, headers });
    67:   } catch (e) {
    68:     // best-effort
    69:   }
    70: }
    71: 
    72: function writeFileEvent(event: TelemetryEvent) {
    73:   try {
    74:     if (!cfg.enabled) return;
    75:     const p = path.join(process.cwd(), cfg.filePath || '.qflush/telemetry.json');
    76:     const dir = path.dirname(p);
    77:     if (!fs.existsSync(dir)) fs.mkdirSync(dir, { recursive: true });
    78:     const tmp = p + '.tmp';
    79:     const arr = fs.existsSync(p) ? JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(p, 'utf8') || '[]') : [];
    80:     arr.push(event);
    81:     fs.writeFileSync(tmp, JSON.stringify(arr, null, 2), 'utf8');
    82:     fs.renameSync(tmp, p);
    83:   } catch (e) {
    84:     // ignore
    85:   }
    86: }
    87: 
    88: export function initCopilotBridge() {
    89:   loadCfg();
    90:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
    91: }
    92: 
    93: export async function emitEngineState(state: EngineState) {
    94:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
    95:   const ev: TelemetryEvent = { type: 'engine_state', telemetryVersion: cfg.telemetryVersion, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), payload: state };
    96:   if (cfg.transports.includes('webhook')) await sendWebhook(ev);
    97:   if (cfg.transports.includes('file')) writeFileEvent(ev);
    98:   try { saveTelemetryEvent('engine-'+Date.now(), 'engine_state', Date.now(), state); } catch (e) {}
    99:   emitter.emit('telemetry', ev);
   100: }
   101: 
   102: export async function emitRuleEvent(ev: RuleEvent) {
   103:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
   104:   const event: TelemetryEvent = { type: 'rule_event', telemetryVersion: cfg.telemetryVersion, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), payload: ev };
   105:   if (cfg.transports.includes('webhook')) await sendWebhook(event);
   106:   if (cfg.transports.includes('file')) writeFileEvent(event);
   107:   try { saveTelemetryEvent('rule-'+Date.now(), 'rule_event', Date.now(), ev); } catch (e) {}
   108:   emitter.emit('telemetry', event);
   109: }
   110: 
   111: export async function emitDiagnostic(diag: Diagnostic) {
   112:   if (!cfg.enabled) return;
   113:   const event: TelemetryEvent = { type: 'diagnostic', telemetryVersion: cfg.telemetryVersion, timestamp: new Date().toISOString(), payload: diag };
   114:   if (cfg.transports.includes('webhook')) await sendWebhook(event);
   115:   if (cfg.transports.includes('file')) writeFileEvent(event);
   116:   try { saveTelemetryEvent('diag-'+Date.now(), 'diagnostic', Date.now(), diag); } catch (e) {}
   117:   emitter.emit('telemetry', event);
   118: }
   119: 
   120: export function _signPayloadForTest(payload: string, secret: string) {
   121:   try {
   122:     const h = crypto.createHmac('sha256', secret).update(payload).digest('hex');
   123:     return h;
   124:   } catch (e) { return null; }
   125: }
   126: 
   127: export function onTelemetry(cb: (ev: TelemetryEvent)=>void) { emitter.on('telemetry', cb); }
   128: 
   129: export function shutdownCopilotBridge() { /* placeholder for flush */ }
   130: 
   131: export function getConfig() { return cfg; }
   132:

     7: }
